rows.label: PeopleName_17

rows.label: PeopleName_18
rows.name: Female Nopon

rows.label: PeopleName_22
rows.name: Zaruboggan

rows.label: TownInfo001_1
rows.name:
It's been two months since the White Whale
landed here. I know people are scared,
but it's time we all started adapting to
our new home.

rows.label: TownInfo001_2
rows.name:
I expected Nightglow Forest to be something like the
Amazon jungle back on Earth, but its size
puts it on a whole different scale. I mean,
that puppy is HUUUUUGE!

rows.label: TownInfo001_3
rows.name:
You know those pods we were all packed
into? They're all in one big row right
behind that door.

rows.label: TownInfo001_4
rows.name:
A BLADE I know just went out to survey
Nightglow Forest. I know that's all part of the job,
but I can't help but worry.

rows.label: TownInfo001_5
rows.name:
My friend surveying Nightglow Forest found a
virago nest in the deepest part of
Rockmole's Burrow but was too scared
to get anywhere near the thing.

rows.label: TownInfo002_1
rows.name:
Welcome to the industrial district, where we
laborers work ourselves to the bone building
NLA for everyone else to enjoy!
...Sorry. Did that sound grumpy?

rows.label: TownInfo002_2
rows.name:
Did you know there's a whole 'nother continent
north of NLA? They say there's these giant
petrified-tree things all over the place there,
and that they sometimes have stuff inside...

rows.label: TownInfo002_3
rows.name:
Sounds like the exploration of Mira is
proceeding apace. We're gonna need to
upgrade the infrastructure of this whole
district to keep up!

rows.label: TownInfo002_4
rows.name:
Still no luck finding the Lifepoint?
Come on! Without that, all the blood, sweat,
and tears we've spent building NLA
won't mean squat!

rows.label: TownInfo002_5
rows.name:
I've been on this planet long enough that it's
actually starting to feel like home. I don't even
miss Earth so much anymore.

rows.label: TownInfo003_1
rows.name:
Yeah, this gate's outta commission at the
moment. Busted servos or...something.
Anyway, if you've got business on the
other side, it's gonna have to wait.

rows.label: TownInfo003_2
rows.name:
Even when you're right outside NLA,
you gotta stay vigilant. We've had multiple
reports of aggressive blattas appearing
after nightfall.

rows.label: TownInfo003_3
rows.name:
I blasted six evellos out here a little earlier!
I feel like I'm finally gettin' the hang of this
job. Might be a fat promotion in my future...

rows.label: TownInfo003_4
rows.name:
We haven't had as many problems with 
evellos trying to get into NLA lately.
You think that's all thanks to me? Or do the
Interceptors have something to do with it?

rows.label: TownInfo003_5
rows.name:
No lousy evello is gonna make it through
the west gate while I'm on duty. Know why?
'Cause my kill count just hit 400!
In your face, native lifeforms!

rows.label: TownInfo004_1
rows.name:
For the sake of our BLADE operatives heading
out into the world, please be vigilant about
performing your checks. Those brave men and
women are fighting for our future.

rows.label: TownInfo004_2
rows.name:
I never imagined there would be xenoforms on
this planet. We'll do everything we can to help
BLADE wipe them out for good.

rows.label: TownInfo004_3
rows.name:
We all need to step up and show those
grousing Ma-non who's really in charge here.
The strength and technological prowess of
humanity are second to none!

rows.label: TownInfo004_4
rows.name:
Some people seem to believe that we
humans should treat the xenos as equals.
It's...a weird idea, but I suppose I'm open
to hearing more about it.

rows.label: TownInfo004_5
rows.name:
Not all xenoforms are like the Growth,
you know? In this new age, it's essential that
we forge cordial relationships with friendly
xenos so that we can all work together.

rows.label: TownInfo005_1
rows.name:
This package was meant to go to BLADE
Tower. It's only the biggest building in town,
so I don't know how you could mess that up.

rows.label: TownInfo005_2
rows.name:
Take this package to the Arms test hangar,
okay? It's that giant building in the southern
part of this district.

rows.label: TownInfo005_3
rows.name:
You know that huge broken ring in Valley of Oblivion?
I hear BLADE sent out a team to retrieve
a nest of indigens nearby, but the
expedition ended in failure.

rows.label: TownInfo005_4
rows.name:
Those Bias are crazy strong! Even with our
Blue Bloods, we couldn't lift a full ton the
way they do.

rows.label: TownInfo005_5
rows.name:
A little while ago, I saw a Bias pick up three
of these containers and start juggling them!
Can you believe that? They're so strong!
...Although no one likes a show-off.

rows.label: TownInfo006_1
rows.name:
There's this great little place called the
Sunshine Café in the commercial district.
You wanna grab a bite with me there
sometime? I'm buying!

rows.label: TownInfo006_2
rows.name:
I'm never setting foot in Army Pizza again!
Next time, I'll go someplace where I won't
get hassled by xenos.

rows.label: TownInfo006_3
rows.name:
I hope they clean up that wrecked Growth
Doll on top of the Arms test hangar soon.
It's creeping out my dates and torpedoing
my social life!

rows.label: TownInfo006_4
rows.name:
I'm so sorry—I never imagined that drunk
in the diner would come sit with us.
But at least he paid for our meals, right?
That was nice!

rows.label: TownInfo006_5
rows.name:
There isn't a single good make-out spot in
this entire city! When we get our real bodies
back, I'll make sure we build a lovers' lane
or something.

rows.label: TownInfo007_1
rows.name:
I wonder what duty's been assigned to
Irina's team this time? They better watch
her back, or they'll have to answer to me!

rows.label: TownInfo007_2
rows.name:
Irina's really nice. She's busy as all heck
but still takes time out of her schedule to give
advice to fellow BLADEs almost every night!

rows.label: TownInfo007_3
rows.name:
Bias women are terrifying. They're fearless,
stubborn, pushy, and terrifically violent.
They make Irina look like a pussycat
in comparison.

rows.label: TownInfo007_4
rows.name:
I'd love to ride in a flying Doll one day!
But I don't have a license, so I'll just have to
ride in the palm of one piloted by Irina...

rows.label: TownInfo009_1
rows.name:
They say if you were to cross the mountains
north of NLA, you'd find another
continent to the north of that!
I wonder what it's like...

rows.label: TownInfo009_2
rows.name:
Did you see how beat up that Doll was after
visiting Cauldros? It's hell on Earth!
...Or hell on Mira, I guess.

rows.label: TownInfo009_3
rows.name:
Have you heard about that Milsaadi named
Sharnaak the Technician? He appears at night
on Mount M'gando in Cauldros, then lays
waste to all with these horrible weapons!

rows.label: TownInfo009_4
rows.name:
Cauldros is apparently crawling with Growth
scum, yet somehow we keep making progress
on our surveys there. Gotta tip my hat to the
BLADEs on that one.

rows.label: TownInfo009_5
rows.name:
Sounds like they've nearly finished surveying
Cauldros. Even as Blue Bloods, it seems we
humans haven't lost our insatiable passion
for exploration.

rows.label: TownInfo010_1
rows.name:
Hauling cargo to the administrative district is
a total drag. It'd be better if we had a train
or something, but right now all we have are
trucks and transports.

rows.label: TownInfo010_2
rows.name:
The Ma-non may be brilliant engineers,
but they're terrible laborers. Maybe they
should invent a tiny crane or something
to help speed things along.

rows.label: TownInfo010_3
rows.name:
Look, just listen to what I'm saying and try not
to get angry, okay? I don't care how light you
think they are—you are NOT ALLOWED TO
THROW THE CONTAINERS!

rows.label: TownInfo010_4
rows.name:
You know a guy from the industrial district
named Horonalderon? Apparently he was
attacked by the Growth outside the city,
but some weird squad came to his rescue.

rows.label: TownInfo010_5
rows.name:
Hope was saying that you always gotta keep
a level head. It's the best way to reduce
problems in the workplace and ensure the
job goes smoothly. Makes sense, right?

rows.label: TownInfo011_1
rows.name:
I work with data probes, and they STILL blow
my mind. Can you believe those little sticks are
gonna find the Lifepoint for us? It's amazing
technology. I am technically amazed!

rows.label: TownInfo011_2
rows.name:
So FrontierNet isn't just for exploration,
you know? If you switch out the data probes,
you can also use it to rack up sweet credits!

rows.label: TownInfo011_3
rows.name:
I've heard that FrontierNet can even be used
to help you in battle now. I don't know the
details, but the person who was testing it out
is around here somewhere.

rows.label: TownInfo011_4
rows.name:
There's a strange woman hanging out in the
residential-district park. And when I say
strange, I mean TOOOOTALLY WEIRD.
She might not even be from Earth.

rows.label: TownInfo011_5
rows.name:
I'm hearing so much talk about love and
marriage all of a sudden! Everyone must be
feeling a little more secure these days.

rows.label: TownInfo012_1
rows.name:
I went to the Sunshine Café for an espresso,
but they couldn't make me one! I guess the
machine's broken or something? Anyway,
it pretty much ruined my whole day.

rows.label: TownInfo012_2
rows.name:
I finally got to have an espresso at the
Sunshine Café, and let me tell you, I waited
a really long time for some highly mediocre
coffee. ...The barista was great, though.

rows.label: TownInfo012_3
rows.name:
It would be a real boon for the construction
work if we could get a few more Dolls here.
But I guess they don't have the capacity to
keep up with demand just yet.

rows.label: TownInfo012_4
rows.name:
They finally produced flight-capable Dolls!
That'll get these construction projects moving.
...Or I mean it WOULD, except that BLADE
will take them all for fighting and junk.

rows.label: TownInfo012_5
rows.name:
Looks like fighting's done for the foreseeable
future. Maybe NOW we can get some of
those combat Dolls to help with our
construction projects!

rows.label: TownInfo013_1
rows.name:
I sure hope they find the Lifepoint soon!
I mean, it's kind of tough to focus on work
with all these worries in my head.

rows.label: TownInfo013_2
rows.name:
We should go out and do something on
our next day off! Maybe the park in the
residential district, or Barista Court in the
commercial district?

rows.label: TownInfo013_3
rows.name:
You think our leaders have seemed a little
anxious lately? I wonder if they're nervous
about not finding the Lifepoint yet. 'Cause if
they're not, they should be! I know I am...

rows.label: TownInfo013_4
rows.name:
With the Lifepoint still missing, we're poised at
the brink of human extinction. And yet, I keep
punching the clock and working every day.
Wonder what that says about me...

rows.label: TownInfo013_5
rows.name:
I've gotten pretty burned out on this job.
As soon as NLA is finished, I'm gonna
transfer out of here, get a nice white-collar
career, embezzle funds... Uh, never mind.

rows.label: TownInfo014_1
rows.name:
I heard the Testamenters found wreckage from 
the White Whale at the entrance to Valley of Oblivion.
They haven't done any actual reclaiming yet,
but hopefully they find something useful.

rows.label: TownInfo014_2
rows.name:
My Testamenter friend said that when they
go to secure White Whale wreckage,
they sometimes find dead bodies inside.
...It's terrible to think that could have been us.

rows.label: TownInfo014_3
rows.name:
Why are we even at war with the Growth?
If we're able to communicate with each other,
we should be able to work out our differences.

rows.label: TownInfo014_4
rows.name:
I guess war with the Growth is how it has
to be. I wish we could have been friends,
but they've gone and killed people I know,
and I can't ever forgive them for that.

rows.label: TownInfo014_5
rows.name:
It sure is weird how time changes everything.
I don't know when exactly I started to feel at
home on this planet, but I suddenly can't
imagine living anywhere else.

rows.label: TownInfo015_1
rows.name:
Without a ship, we won't be leaving this
world anytime soon. So I guess this is where
I'll have to make my fortune! Hmm...
Now I just need some kind of idea...

rows.label: TownInfo015_2
rows.name:
I wonder if I could go find leaves or the like
in Primordia that I could sell for cash.
Meh, probably not worth risking my life for.

rows.label: TownInfo015_3
rows.name:
Think I could make money selling Nopon-
themed traveler's charms? I bet BLADE folk
would go nuts for 'em! ...Unless that ended
up with me being charged for fraud.

rows.label: TownInfo015_4
rows.name:
A female BLADE just went into the back alley
with two scary-looking dudes. You think she's
okay? She didn't look all that tough, and it's
pretty dark back there...

rows.label: TownInfo015_5
rows.name:
NLA is still under construction, and there
aren't enough houses to go around, right?
So maybe I could sell old shipping containers
as temporary housing! It's GENIUS!

rows.label: TownInfo016_1
rows.name:
I never wanted to be a manual laborer.
I wanted to work at Sakuraba Industries
and develop new weapons!

rows.label: TownInfo016_2
rows.name:
You see that Ma-non-made ground gear?
They can adapt their protective wear to human
proportions in no time. It's impressive tech.

rows.label: TownInfo016_3
rows.name:
Those Meredith weapons look pretty good,
huh? The company may be run by humans,
but they've learned an awful lot during their
time here on Mira.

rows.label: TownInfo016_4
rows.name:
I hear aggressive aetrygons in Sylvalum are
driving people away from Xanadu Overlook.
You know, there ain't nothing you can't send
flying with a weapon from Grenada GG!

rows.label: TownInfo016_5
rows.name:
Seems like there are new arms manufacturers
popping up every day. This could be my
chance to get a new job supporting BLADE
as a big-time weapons developer!

rows.label: TownInfo017_1
rows.name:
That Lin is as adorable as she is brilliant.
Imagine designing flying Dolls at her age!
I mean, sure they've all crashed...and there
were the fires and the screaming...but still!

rows.label: TownInfo017_2
rows.name:
Wendy up in Ishmael Hills was complaining
that some Nopon salesman won't leave her
alone. Poor thing!

rows.label: TownInfo017_3
rows.name:
You know how sometimes you see a really
cool paint job on a Doll? Apparently, pilots
can change their colors at the consoles in
the BLADE Home.

rows.label: TownInfo017_4
rows.name:
Lin's like a modern-day version of the Wright
Brothers, or at least one of 'em. Perfecting her
research while still working as a BLADE?
Gotta be awfully strong-willed to pull that off!

rows.label: TownInfo017_5
rows.name:
Now that she's created the flying Doll,
I can't wait to see what Lin invents next!
Maybe she'll start working on a spacecraft?

rows.label: TownInfo018_1
rows.name:
Hey, you should be proud of yourself!
Not everyone got chosen to join the crew
of the White Whale, after all. I mean,
just look how gung-ho everyone is!

rows.label: TownInfo018_2
rows.name:
Look, I know you miss Earth, but we're never
going back. You just gotta suck it up and
start a new life here on Mira.

rows.label: TownInfo018_3
rows.name:
We're all a piece of something greater here.
Without BLADEs, or mechanics, or chefs,
or whatever, it would all just fall apart.
That's what it means to be part of a team.

rows.label: TownInfo018_4
rows.name:
Apparently a levitath has been spotted at the
Sea Unknown Ring in the sea south of Valley of Oblivion.
It seems to be biologically different from the
ones in other places...

rows.label: TownInfo018_5
rows.name:
How can five continents so close to each other
have such completely different ecosystems?
I mean, Sylvalum and Cauldros are
practically different planets! So weird.

rows.label: TownInfo019_1
rows.name:
At this point, even a single screw is a priceless
resource for us here. You get that?

rows.label: TownInfo019_2
rows.name:
The Landbankers are always gathering precious
resources for us. It's thanks to them that we're
able to continue expanding the city and
strengthening BLADE. And don't you forget it!

rows.label: TownInfo019_3
rows.name:
Technological progress is constantly advancing.
For example, it turns out this boiled-egg ore
from Valley of Oblivion is well-suited for composite
materials. Isn't that great?

rows.label: TownInfo019_4
rows.name:
We may be using temporary bodies, but if
we die, that's it. Without the Lifepoint, we
won't be getting any new ones. So don't
do anything stupid, got it?!

rows.label: TownInfo019_5
rows.name:
Now we can finally get serious about building
NLA. BLADE had their chance to shine,
but now it's our turn!

rows.label: TownInfo020_1
rows.name:
We blue-collar workers can be just as flashy
dressers as those commercial district folk...
You might have to brush away a few layers
of dust to see what we're wearing, though.

rows.label: TownInfo020_2
rows.name:
Look, I appreciate that the Ma-non have 
incredible technology, but that doesn't 
mean I want to be eating lunch with 'em,
you know?

rows.label: TownInfo020_3
rows.name:
I bought a bracelet from one of them furballs
the other day. When I gave it a closer look,
I saw it was made out of bugs! Seriously!
They're like savages, I swear.

rows.label: TownInfo020_4
rows.name:
There's a woman over at the cathedral in the
residential district who's always preaching that
xenos and humans are equal. No thanks, pal!
Keep me far, far away from that wacko.

rows.label: TownInfo020_5
rows.name:
We finally found the Lifepoint, so the threat
to humanity is over. I hear it's thanks to us
workin' hand in hand with the xenos.
Guess I actually owe 'em one...

rows.label: TownInfo021_1
rows.name:
You got to be scrupulous about maintenance.
We need those transports to get raw materials
into the city, and if you let one crash, the
director general will tear you a new one!

rows.label: TownInfo021_2
rows.name:
Transports don't have any mounted weapons.
That's why the BLADEs use helicopters when
they leave the city.

rows.label: TownInfo021_3
rows.name:
I'm still hearing stories of BLADEs being killed
by indigens just a few yards away from NLA!
Everyone thinks we're safe as houses here,
but it couldn't be further from the truth.

rows.label: TownInfo021_4
rows.name:
They've detected multiple heat signals in the
northern part of Primordia's Bedrock Hold.
They think it's likely a petramand nest,
so we need to take precautions.

rows.label: TownInfo021_5
TownInfo022_1
rows.name:
We have to keep the industrial district tightly
controlled. We can't let misplaced resources
slow down progress—and that counts double
for human resources!

rows.label: TownInfo022_2
rows.name:
Saw Elma on a lunch break recently. She was
talking to a mechanic, and seemed worked
up about something. I was gonna ask her for
an autograph, but it looked like a bad time.

rows.label: TownInfo022_3
rows.name:
The Ma-non are such a peaceful race.
Apparently, they've never built a single
weapon, even though they possess all
that crazy technology!

rows.label: TownInfo022_4
rows.name:
No one can replace their Blue Blood until
we find the Lifepoint, so I'm glad to see you
survived the attack!

rows.label: TownInfo022_5
rows.name:
I went to see that guy Yardley and changed
up my image a bit. What do you think?
I was...kinda hoping you'd...like it.

rows.label: TownInfo023_1
rows.name:
At night, I often see Hope waiting for
someone outside of a building in the
commercial district. Helping out yet
another poor soul in need, most likely.

rows.label: TownInfo024_1
rows.name:
Even animals can't seem to get enough of
Hope. I saw a dog playing with her in the
parking lot by the tennis court. It certainly
looked like it was having fun.

rows.label: TownInfo025_1
rows.name:
You know that Larsian guy Zo Langra?
Well, I saw him running panicked through the
commercial district! I'm no psychic, but I know
folks don't run like that unless there's trouble.

rows.label: TownInfo026_1
rows.name:
The outer walls of NLA are nearly 100
meters tall. There's no way any indigen is
climbing over that!

rows.label: TownInfo026_2
rows.name:
Apparently, there have been Nopon sightings
all across Mira. We better put FrontierNet
to good use and claim some territory of our
own before we fall any further behind.

rows.label: TownInfo026_3
rows.name:
I can't believe we let the Growth attack
our home like that! Still, it's a good thing
we evacuated when we did, or it might
have been a hell of a lot worse.

rows.label: TownInfo026_4
rows.name:
I saw a gigantic Vasalt standing atop a
spire in Primordia's Grieving Plains. If that
thing ever found its way into NLA,
we'd all be dead [ST:gender p1=men! p2=men! Er, and women. ]

rows.label: TownInfo026_5
rows.name:
Our BLADEs seem to be getting sharper
every day. Even the mightiest indigen
is barely a match for them now!

rows.label: TownInfo027_1
rows.name:
We're all eager to see NLA completed,
so we're gonna work fast, but safe.
No undue haste, no undue harm. Got it?

rows.label: TownInfo027_2
rows.name:
Once we find the Lifepoint, the city's gonna
be in for one heck of a population boom.
The harder we work now, the easier that
day will be.

rows.label: TownInfo027_3
rows.name:
As the survey of Mira proceeds, maybe we'll
meet some xenos who are willing to help us.
If nothing else, we gotta remain hopeful.

rows.label: TownInfo027_4
rows.name:
It don't matter what's happening out there—
we got a job to do here! You think BLADEs
turn tail when the going gets tough? No!
And we don't either!

rows.label: TownInfo027_5
rows.name:
We're all eager to see NLA completed,
so we're gonna work fast, but safe.
No undue haste, no undue harm. Got it?

rows.label: TownInfo028_1
rows.name:
If you find any collectibles, register 'em in
your Collepedia. You'll even earn prizes
as you fill it up!

rows.label: TownInfo028_2
rows.name:
A lady named Rosie was screaming about
something over by the water-purification plant.
Poor thing must be at the end of her rope.
...Or crazy. Could be that, too.

rows.label: TownInfo028_3
rows.name:
I heard about the incident at the Biahno
water-purification plant. What a nightmare!
But we need to keep it running for the sake
of NLA.

rows.label: TownInfo028_4
rows.name:
The Orphe have really tightened defenses
around the Biahno water-purification plant.
How quickly our enemies become such
trusted friends!

rows.label: TownInfo028_5
rows.name:
I feel like I kinda get the "Ovah" the Orphe
use. It's like a sixth sense or a collective
unconscious, right? Kinda like when I know
I'm going to lose at poker but play anyway.

rows.label: TownInfo029_1
rows.name:
The plant is operating at 74.8 percent
efficiency. That's a big improvement compared
to how it was running two months ago!

rows.label: TownInfo029_2
rows.name:
Holy wow. Did you see Elma at the
water-purification plant that night?!
No, I... I shouldn't say anything more.
I don't want her to get angry at me!

rows.label: TownInfo029_3
rows.name:
The plant produces provisions as well as
textiles and other raw materials. We have to
make sure to keep it running, no matter what!

rows.label: TownInfo029_4
rows.name:
Ever since the xenos arrived, the plant's been
running at full capacity. We're so busy trying
to make enough provisions, our production of
building materials is starting to decline.

rows.label: TownInfo029_5
rows.name:
With help from the Ma-non, we've been able
to upgrade the plant dramatically. Our output
is up 220 percent! You hear that? TWO!
HUNDRED! AND! TWENTY! PERCENT!

rows.label: TownInfo030_1
rows.name:
Don't ever slack on your inspections!
If Liza catches you, she'll chew you up
one side and down the other!

rows.label: TownInfo030_2
rows.name:
You can usually find Frye behind the diner at
night, drunk out of his mind. And he's one
of those mean drunks, so don't get close!

rows.label: TownInfo030_3
rows.name:
This job blows. It'd be a lot more fun if
they put Frye in charge instead of Liza!
...Ah, but then there's that whole mortal-
danger thing. So, yeah, let's stick with Liza.

rows.label: TownInfo030_4
rows.name:
You've seen that giant xeno, right?
Always watching me with those beady eyes...
I think he's trying to figure out if I'd taste
good with mustard, which I would NOT!

rows.label: TownInfo030_5
rows.name:
Rock's kinda like a big brother to me now.
I just say the word, and he lifts me right up
onto this waste-processing unit!

rows.label: TownInfo031_1
rows.name:
The air of Mira is so refreshing! They say
the concentration of carbon dioxide in the
atmosphere is only 65 percent of what it
was on Earth. Let's keep it that way!

rows.label: TownInfo031_2
rows.name:
It's a lot easier to get a Doll license for
construction use than it is for BLADE use.
Course, they won't let you strap a cannon
to your construction Doll, either...

rows.label: TownInfo031_3
rows.name:
The Candid & Credible lady's wear is
SO cute, but I might be a little too old
to pull it off. ...Okay, a LOT old.
...Oh God, I'm so old.

rows.label: TownInfo031_4
rows.name:
They say that at nights in Cauldros, a giant
blatta emerges near the Forgotten Mining
Frigates. Crazy, right?

rows.label: TownInfo031_5
rows.name:
Sounds like there's evidence that another
civilization inhabited Cauldros before the
Growth arrived. I wonder what became
of them?

rows.label: TownInfo032_1
rows.name:
When I went to the Ma-non ship, there was
a buglike xeno called Nan'celeg that was
constantly mumbling to itself. I am going to
have nightmares about that for WEEKS.

rows.label: TownInfo033_1
rows.name:
Have you seen the wrecked vehicle just outside
NLA's east gate? That belonged to a friend
of mine.

rows.label: TownInfo033_2
rows.name:
Every BLADE seems to be loyal to a favorite
arms manufacturer. I guess that makes sense—
survival could depend on your familiarity with
weapons and armor.

rows.label: TownInfo033_3
rows.name:
Fortunately, the extent of the Growth bases
in Primordia seems to be pretty limited.
Otherwise, they probably would have called
on us mechanics to help fight them off too.

rows.label: TownInfo033_4
rows.name:
According to our survey data, there are
six caves in Primordia. However, I've
heard that we need flight capabilities
to fully explore them.

rows.label: TownInfo033_5
rows.name:
The survey of Primordia is complete!
I never imagined I'd live to see it completely
finished. Hats off to BLADE—that's some
great work right there.

rows.label: TownInfo034_1
rows.name:
Every passenger of the White Whale excels
at some field, but that doesn't necessarily
mean they're all decent human beings.
We've had a few...bad apples.

rows.label: TownInfo034_2
rows.name:
A good friend of mine died in Valley of Oblivion.
His wife is completely devastated, and I just
don't know what to say to her.

rows.label: TownInfo034_3
rows.name:
Some xeno has opened a store in Armory
Alley, right in the same storefront my deceased
friend used to own. I guess he'd be happy
someone took it over, but still...

rows.label: TownInfo034_4
rows.name:
Pets sure are incredible! I saw one cranky
lady in the residential district go from super
angry to totally calm, thanks to a pet.
I wonder if the little fella is still there?

rows.label: TownInfo034_5
rows.name:
I saw a pair of depressed-looking ladies
sharing a drink, so I decided to say hi and
see if it cheered them up. They responded
by kicking me right in the shins!

rows.label: TownInfo035_1
rows.name:
We get a lot of folks from the Arms
down here. We're always helping them test
out new weaponry and the like.

rows.label: TownInfo035_2
rows.name:
Take that new shipment from Sakuraba over
to the administrative district. I can't wait to
see what these weapons are capable of!

rows.label: TownInfo035_3
rows.name:
Old and unsold weapons and armaments are
brought down here for recycling. It's a little
sad to see, but they become nice new things
soon enough!

rows.label: TownInfo035_4
rows.name:
I hear there's this Larsian on the Ma-non
ship who was saying something about
an apprentice gathering steel for him?
I couldn't really make heads or tails of it.

rows.label: TownInfo035_5
rows.name:
I hear that De Zing fellow makes some
wickedly sharp swords. There aren't any
human blacksmiths left, so I'd kinda like
to check his work out for myself.

rows.label: TownInfo036_1
rows.name:
The rain that falls on this city seems a lot
more pure than the stuff that fell on Earth.
But I've heard there's a place on this planet
where poison rains from the sky...

rows.label: TownInfo036_2
rows.name:
It's a kill or be killed world out there for sure.
But I worry that if we kill too many creatures,
we might drive them to extinction...

rows.label: TownInfo036_3
rows.name:
The survey of Sylvalum seems to be going
quickly. Makes me wonder if we're going
to end up polluting this planet and destroying
its natural order the way we did on Earth.

rows.label: TownInfo036_4
rows.name:
Apparently, artifacts from an alien culture have
been discovered at Lake Ciel in Sylvalum.
It's a pretty enormous lake, so I guess it's
no wonder we hadn't found them before...

rows.label: TownInfo036_5
rows.name:
We mustn't ever let ourselves forget that it was
cooperation between humans and xenoforms
which led to this outcome. I hope that these
friendships last for all time.

rows.label: TownInfo037_1
rows.name:
I hear a Doll was destroyed by a primordial
creature in the Elephant's Trunk area of
Nightglow Forest. No one was killed, thankfully,
but what a tragic waste of a critical resource.

rows.label: TownInfo037_2
rows.name:
The more miranium we can supply the arms
manufacturers, the more new weapons they
can make—AND the cheaper they'll be!

rows.label: TownInfo037_3
rows.name:
The arms manufacturers are going to need
a lot of miranium to expand. Growing
FrontierNet should be our first step.

rows.label: TownInfo037_4
rows.name:
Word on the street is that Eleonora has been
spotted coming in and out of the restricted
hangar. She's just an office worker—what
would she even be doing in there?

rows.label: TownInfo037_5
rows.name:
We may have found the Lifepoint and defeated
the Growth, but we can't be complacent.
This world remains rife with danger!

rows.label: TownInfo038_1
rows.name:
Let's do everything we can to turn NLA
into a city as good as anything on Earth.
That way we'll never forget where we're from.

rows.label: TownInfo038_2
rows.name:
After this, I'm going to make my report to
the provisional government. If there are any
problems at the test hangar, contact me
at once!

rows.label: TownInfo038_3
rows.name:
Secretary Nagi is coming to inspect the
Arms test hangar! It'll be early,
but I expect you to be bright eyed
and bushy tailed, you hear?

rows.label: TownInfo038_4
rows.name:
I always get so stressed out when I have to
talk to Secretary Nagi. I mean, he was the
captain of the White Whale, and I'm just
some nobody!

rows.label: TownInfo038_5
rows.name:
The city's a lot cleaner with the Zaruboggan
around. Maybe the government should set up
a support program for them or something.

rows.label: TownInfo039_1
rows.name:
I'm too distracted to focus on my work...
We're on an unknown planet! With unknown
dangers! How can a man pull a nine-to-five
with that kind of pressure, huh?

rows.label: TownInfo039_2
rows.name:
Commander Vandham got angry when he
caught me staring at the huge display on top
of BLADE Tower. He said everyone in NLA
has a duty to work, not to daydream.

rows.label: TownInfo039_3
rows.name:
Life on this crappy planet is like a bad dream.
Are we sure that if NLA is destroyed,
we won't all wake up in our own beds
back on Earth?

rows.label: TownInfo039_4
rows.name:
Everyone wonders who that crazy bomber is,
but I don't much care. Anyone who wants to
destroy this wretched world has my full
and unwavering support!

rows.label: TownInfo039_5
rows.name:
There's no justifying what the Blood Lobster
did. We've all seen more than enough loved
ones die—it's time we all started working
to make the world a better place!

rows.label: TownInfo040_1
rows.name:
The outside world is a harsh and unforgiving
place, yet being in NLA feels just like
being back on Earth. BLADE has done a
fantastic job of keeping us safe.

rows.label: TownInfo040_2
rows.name:
I recently got the ground gear I ordered from
Meredith & Co. It's made with Growth tech,
you know? Really high-quality stuff!

rows.label: TownInfo040_3
rows.name:
They brought something really big into the
restricted hangar in the administrative district.
They're keeping it real hush-hush, so it's hard
not to wonder...

rows.label: TownInfo040_4
rows.name:
Did you hear? That Doll they'd been hiding
in the restricted hangar was stolen by the
Growth. I wonder if that was the Growth's
real objective when they attacked us...

rows.label: TownInfo040_5
rows.name:
Whatever happens, we have to trust in the
judgment of Secretary Nagi and Director
General Chausson. I know those two have
humanity's best interests at heart.

rows.label: TownInfo041_1
rows.name:
I got a coaletri from H.B. that's totes adorbs!
It's also a collectible, so I have to remember
to register it in my Collepedia.

rows.label: TownInfo041_2
rows.name:
I kept bugging H.B. for a grosium core,
and he FINALLY gave me one!
I flipped it right away, of course—you
wouldn't believe how much I got for it!

rows.label: TownInfo041_3
rows.name:
So H.B. told me that the king of all duoguills
lives in the pond near Roof Rock! I was like,
whoa! And then I was like, what's a duoguill?

rows.label: TownInfo041_4
rows.name:
So there's this professor person or whatever
who lives at the end of the industrial district?
And when it comes to tech, he's crazy smart.
Like, Ma-non smart. For seriously!

rows.label: TownInfo041_5
rows.name:
Now that the xenos are starting businesses,
it's creating all sorts of new opportunities.
I don't think anyone imagined Mira would
end up with such a flourishing economy!

rows.label: TownInfo042_1
rows.name:
Weapons tests are conducted here all the
time, and they don't always...go so well.
In fact, they usually go really, really badly.
It's a serious downer.

rows.label: TownInfo042_2
rows.name:
I heard there's a Ma-non repairman in the
lower level of the administrative district. He's 
supposed to be really talented, but he doesn't
seem to be enjoying his success much.

rows.label: TownInfo042_3
rows.name:
My car broke down a while ago, so I brought
it to Sostenasa. He returned it to me in better
shape than the day I bought it! That is one
talented Ma-non, let me tell you.

rows.label: TownInfo042_4
rows.name:
Candid & Credible's weapons are utterly
incomprehensible. Even after I took one apart,
I still have no idea how the damn thing works.

rows.label: TownInfo042_5
rows.name:
Once you master any of the final classes, you
will be able to use that class's weapons even
when you switch to other classes as well! Of
course, few BLADEs have achieved such a feat.

rows.label: TownInfo043_1
rows.name:
Have you seen the new weapons from
Sakuraba Industries? Take it from me—
they'll get you ready to KILL!
...Er, but only bad things, of course.

rows.label: TownInfo043_2
rows.name:
Someone said they saw an eerie, shimmering
creature at the entrance to Sylvalum, but that
it disappeared right in front of them. You
know what that means? GHOSTS! EEEEK!

rows.label: TownInfo043_3
rows.name:
Lately I've been pretty into the ground gear
from Grenada Galactic. Everything feels so
high-tech and powerful!

rows.label: TownInfo043_4
rows.name:
They were testing a new Doll design here
earlier, and you would not BELIEVE how
powerful it was. It was like a full generation
beyond current Doll technology!

rows.label: TownInfo043_5
rows.name:
I hear they won't be able to mass-produce
the Prog Ares. If we had a few more of those,
we'd finally be a match for those bastards
who attacked Earth!

rows.label: TownInfo044_1
rows.name:
You need a license before you can pilot a
Doll—which makes sense. Those things are
way too precious to risk letting some amateur
hot-rodder wrap one around a tree.

rows.label: TownInfo044_2
rows.name:
Not everyone is able to get the license to pilot
a Doll. But if you're lucky, your commanding
officer might let you try out for one soon.

rows.label: TownInfo044_3
rows.name:
Those Ma-non sure are passionate about
learning! Quiquat has been asking all sorts
of questions about FrontierNet over near one
of the commercial district's storage areas.

rows.label: TownInfo044_4
rows.name:
Dolls come equipped with one of a variety of
different Overclocks—it seems to depend
on the model. But not being a pilot myself,
I wouldn't know the difference.

rows.label: TownInfo044_5
rows.name:
Between the arms manufacturers and the
Arms, Doll technology has been advancing
rapidly. I don't think we have much to fear
from the Growth anymore.

rows.label: TownInfo045_1
rows.name:
What does that huge number at the top
of BLADE Tower mean? No one seems to
know anything about it. How weird is that?

rows.label: TownInfo045_2
rows.name:
...Oh hey. So that number displayed at the
top of BLADE Tower? Turns out that's the
remaining power in the Lifepoint's battery.
I'm almost sorry I asked...

rows.label: TownInfo045_3
rows.name:
I saw Elma eyeing cars in the commercial
district... Could she be on a mission to protect
someone? Or maybe she's on a stakeout to
find a criminal?!

rows.label: TownInfo045_4
rows.name:
I have faith that Elma's team will find the
Lifepoint. They have a particular set of skills,
and I know the defense secretary and
commander both have high expectations.

rows.label: TownInfo045_5
rows.name:
Our battle with the Growth may be over,
but the surveying of Mira must continue until
FrontierNet reports that the job is 100 percent
complete!

rows.label: TownInfo046_1
rows.name:
I never imagined the White Whale would
crash. I guess we have no choice but to revise
the goals of the Earthlife Colonization Project
It makes me more than a little uneasy...

rows.label: TownInfo046_2
rows.name:
I certainly didn't expect we'd find xenoforms
on this planet! Although after that attack on
Earth, I probably shouldn't have been
surprised.

rows.label: TownInfo046_3
rows.name:
Secretary Nagi and Director General Chausson
were wise to establish BLADE. All eight of its
Unions are doing excellent work.

rows.label: TownInfo046_4
rows.name:
The colonization of Mira seems to be
proceeding apace, although I worry it's cost
the lives of too many BLADEs. If we all support
each other, however, I know we'll make it.

rows.label: TownInfo046_5
rows.name:
I worry about the fate of the other ECP ships.
Apparently we haven't been able to make
contact with them since landing here.

rows.label: TownInfo047_1
rows.name:
Thank heaven for Dolls! I don't know how we
could have faced some of these larger
primordial creatures without them.

rows.label: TownInfo047_2
rows.name:
Apparently the Bias war with each other like
humans do. How tragic that their children are
dragged into wars that were started thousands
of years before they were born.

rows.label: TownInfo047_3
rows.name:
I couldn't believe it—some of the xenoforms
were three times the size of your husband!
I bet they can pick up Dolls and carry them
around if they want.

rows.label: TownInfo047_4
rows.name:
There's a rumor going around that a giant
ape has been climbing the tower of the
Arms test hangar at night! And that he's
holding a damsel in his oversized hand!

rows.label: TownInfo047_5
rows.name:
I guess the giant ape and captured damsel on
the tower of the Arms test hangar turned
out to be Rock and Celica in the end. I bet it's
one heck of a location for stargazing, though.

rows.label: TownInfo048_1
rows.name:
It feels good to be back. I've been on a survey
mission in Nightglow Forest, northwest of the city.
That place has more amazing sights than the
old Amazon rain forest back on Earth!

rows.label: TownInfo048_2
rows.name:
There's a continent called Valley of Oblivion to the far
east of NLA. It's a rough and savage land
with very little water.

rows.label: TownInfo048_3
rows.name:
We've found Growth outposts in Valley of Oblivion.
They're pretty sizable, so be very careful
when exploring that continent.

rows.label: TownInfo048_4
rows.name:
We finally found the trail of the team that
went ahead of us into the depths of Nightglow Forest.
Seems they nearly made it to the heart of the
forest, but all that was left of them was debris.

rows.label: TownInfo048_5
rows.name:
Have you heard about the red tree at the
heart of Nightglow Forest? Well, here's a tip—don't
go anywhere NEAR that thing! No one who's
approached it has ever come back alive!

rows.label: TownInfo049_1
rows.name:
I understand that you're upset, but you need
to calm down. This is no time to be fighting
over petty things!

rows.label: TownInfo049_2
rows.name:
For shame! You need to think of someone
besides yourselves for once in your lives!
How long are you planning to keep this
feud going?!

rows.label: TownInfo049_3
rows.name:
Enough! Quit this fighting right now!
The Companions do not exist solely to manage
your pathetic squabbles!

rows.label: TownInfo049_4
rows.name:
Do you brain surgeons get that precious ECP
funds are being wasted on your stupid spat?!
Shut up, move on, and then do some serious
soul searching!

rows.label: TownInfo049_5
rows.name:
Yes! Finally! You finally get it! We can't be
fighting each other if we want to survive on
this planet. We must learn to work together!

rows.label: TownInfo050_1
rows.name:
You wanna come join me for some yoga or
Zen meditation? The world outside the city
gates is full of dangers, so it wouldn't hurt to
relax a little.

rows.label: TownInfo050_2
rows.name:
When you need a midday breather, you can't
beat benches—red ones in particular! They're,
like, economical or something, so you can sit
for a long time without getting sore.

rows.label: TownInfo050_3
rows.name:
I just met Kirsty, the big cheese for all of
FrontierNet! Sounds like she's aiming for
Valley of Oblivion next. I love that passion!

rows.label: TownInfo050_4
rows.name:
A Ma-non invited me over for a pizza party
the other day. His room was barely the size
of a rabbit hutch, but it was a ton of fun!
...Guy sure did love his pizza.

rows.label: TownInfo050_5
rows.name:
I'm practicing voice training in my spare
time. When the city is finished, maybe
I'll become a famous opera singer or do
commercial jingles or something.

rows.label: TownInfo051_1
rows.name:
You can't find any more collectibles? Then you
need to get out of your rut and start searching
someplace totally new! Like, inside a cave.
Or on the sea. ...Stuff like that.

rows.label: TownInfo051_2
rows.name:
If you end up with extra collectibles, you can
always sell them. My friend says he makes a
lot of extra pocket money that way.
Lucky guy...

rows.label: TownInfo051_3
rows.name:
Do you ever wonder what folks look like
outside of their Blue Bloods? I mean, my
real body weighs like 200 pounds!

rows.label: TownInfo051_4
rows.name:
My friend at the Arms test hangar is
furious. I guess she has to go give Irina
another talking-to.

rows.label: TownInfo051_5
rows.name:
Irina may be passionate, but she's not very
reliable. Nonetheless, everyone really likes her,
so she has no shortage of people looking after
her—or looking the other way.

rows.label: TownInfo052_1
rows.name:
The BLADEs have set up camps outside the
city that they're using as bases of operations.
It can't be fun sleeping outdoors with all those
indigens running around.

rows.label: TownInfo052_2
rows.name:
In addition to the BLADE base camps, there
are also Nopon caravans outside the city
walls. Wonder if I could slip out for a quick
visit to see one of them...

rows.label: TownInfo052_3
rows.name:
I can't help but tremble a little every time I see
a Bias. They must eat Nopon like they're
crunching candy, right? And I bet they'd love
to snack on a human!

rows.label: TownInfo052_4
rows.name:
I've heard the enemy's giant mechs don't see
people who are traveling on foot. As long as
you're not in a Doll, I think you can walk
right past them. ...Not that I'M going to try it.

rows.label: TownInfo052_5
rows.name:
I guess the Bias aren't all bad. I just saw
two of them carrying a wrecked car from an
accident site over to the industrial district.
That was nice of them!

rows.label: TownInfo053_1
rows.name:
Companions basically act as NLA's police
force. They keep the whole city safe 24/7.

rows.label: TownInfo053_2
rows.name:
This morning I saw this big, buff BLADE guy
giving a fellow mechanic detailed instructions
about something. He really seemed like he
knew what he was talking about.

rows.label: TownInfo053_3
rows.name:
Have you seen how ripped those Avalancher guys
are? They must need to pump iron every day
to wield those heavy guns! ...Wait. Can 
Blue Bloods even GROW bigger muscles?

rows.label: TownInfo053_4
rows.name:
I went to BLADE Tower the other day and
saw Secretary Nagi practicing with a sword.
His form was incredible! He must be a
grandmaster of fencing or something!

rows.label: TownInfo053_5
rows.name:
Have you heard the rumors about that
new Doll Lao stole? Apparently it was
actually based on a previous model.
...Also, screw him for stealing it!

rows.label: TownInfo054_1
rows.name:
My little brother just joined the Landbankers.
He's been a civilian until now, so I'm worried
about whether he'll be able to handle all the
duties of a BLADE.

rows.label: TownInfo054_2
rows.name:
My little brother went to the Silent Mire and
barely escaped alive. He said there's no sun
and it's crawling with adseculas even during
the day. I knew he'd get in over his head!

rows.label: TownInfo054_3
rows.name:
My little brother? Well, being a Landbanker
isn't easy. But he's really proud of his work as
a BLADE, and it seems to be making a man
out of him, so I won't complain.

rows.label: TownInfo054_4
rows.name:
They say you can make more money if you set
up your research data probes right. My little
bro was bragging about it when he took me
out drinking. That smug little...

rows.label: TownInfo054_5
rows.name:
I never imagined my little brother would die in
the final battle. But it's only a matter of time
before he gets a new body, right?

rows.label: TownInfo055_1
rows.name:
The longer you're with someone, the deeper
your bonding for each other grows. And the
more you fight together, the stronger your
bond will be.

rows.label: TownInfo055_2
rows.name:
Frye is great. He buys my drinks all the time!
Hey, you wanna come with me next time we
go out? C'mon! It'll deepen our bonding!

rows.label: TownInfo055_3
rows.name:
I bought drinks for some Zaruboggan once.
They stared for a second, then purified 'em
with their vol-whatevers and turned 'em into
plain old water! Man, what a waste...

rows.label: TownInfo055_4
rows.name:
Every now and then, Frye abstains from
drinking for a night. Then he goes to the top
of the bridge and looks out on NLA.
What's up with that?

rows.label: TownInfo055_5
rows.name:
Frye's quit going up to the bridge to brood.
He's now taking his drinks in moderation and
seems to be enjoying his BLADE duties as well.
Good for him!

rows.label: TownInfo056_1
rows.name:
Day and night don't mean nothing around
here! Get back to work, and don't let me
catch you slacking again!

rows.label: TownInfo056_2
rows.name:
Have you slackers forgotten that you CHOSE
to work here? Stop letting the BLADEs make
you look like cowards, and start putting your
life on the line for your work!

rows.label: TownInfo056_3
rows.name:
How can you veterans let a bunch of newbies
outhustle you?! You have Blue Bloods now,
and I expect you to work 'em until they break!

rows.label: TownInfo056_4
rows.name:
There's a Zaruboggan around here who keeps
searching for...something. I hope it's not
anything weird or dangerous.

rows.label: TownInfo056_5
rows.name:
I don't care that we found the Lifepoint!
Until NLA is finished, you still have to
work! That is OUR war, soldiers!

rows.label: TownInfo057_1
rows.name:
Next time, let's check out that shop where
Jo's working. I'm curious to see if she really
slaves away as much as she claims.

rows.label: TownInfo057_2
rows.name:
We're forging an alliance with the xenos?
I mean, yeah, I get that it's necessary, but is
it really gonna be okay? I don't want 'em
messing up the city or anything.

rows.label: TownInfo057_3
rows.name:
I heard a Doll was shot down near Sylvalum's
North Cinderdunes. I sure hope they're able
to recover it...

rows.label: TownInfo057_4
rows.name:
When I asked one of the Ma-non how their
ship stays afloat, she looked at me like I was
the village idiot and said, "Pizzas."
...She wasn't being serious, right?

rows.label: TownInfo057_5
rows.name:
Is anything better than a nice arrabbiata
made with amidresian tomatoes and charged
cayenne? And yet, he'd rather have a plain
ol' pizza!

rows.label: TownInfo058_1
rows.name:
The Avalanchers Union has the highest number
of casualties. That's all the proof you need
that they're fighting hard against threats to
this city.

rows.label: TownInfo058_2
rows.name:
Growth outposts are popping up all over the
place. It's really worrisome how much faster
they are at claiming territory than us.

rows.label: TownInfo058_3
rows.name:
Watch out for Gesserith the Wileworm.
If she sees you fighting sabulas near the
Samuel Incline base camp, she'll probably
come after you!

rows.label: TownInfo058_4
rows.name:
So we do have SOMETHING in common
with the Growth—we're both a mishmash
of various alien races. But we don't seek to
strengthen ourselves by subjugating others!

rows.label: TownInfo058_5
rows.name:
It would be great to see an old-fashioned
action movie again! Not an old one from
Earth, but a new one filmed here on Mira.
It could even have an epic Doll chase scene!

rows.label: TownInfo059_1
rows.name:
I love the night. It's when you get to meet all
the fascinating weirdos who don't come out
during the day.

rows.label: TownInfo059_2
rows.name:
You know what I don't get? There's no
place to grow corn here in NLA, right?
So how the hell am I able to drink bourbon
every single day?

rows.label: TownInfo059_3
rows.name:
Hey, you! Liza seems to be having trouble
dealing with all the garbage over at the plant.
Go help her with that! Go on! Move it!

rows.label: TownInfo059_4
rows.name:
Turns out the bourbon I've been drinking
comes from the plant. They say it's made from
recycled materials. Recycled... Wait a sec.
Do they mean...poo? Please tell me they don't.

rows.label: TownInfo059_5
rows.name:
The White Whale soared through space for
years without any help, so you know we
humans are pros at recycling! We might even
give those Zaruboggan a run for their money!

rows.label: TownInfo060_1
rows.name:
Seems those bastards are still causing trouble
in the back alleys of the commercial district.
They just never learn...

rows.label: TownInfo060_2
rows.name:
I heard they were making fun of some dopey
BLADE when a [ST:gender p1=hero p2=heroine ] showed up and gave
'em a taste of rough justice. What a bunch
of saps!

rows.label: TownInfo060_3
rows.name:
If everyone had a license to drive a car, we'd
have constant traffic jams. Guess that's why
the government doles 'em out like they do for
Doll licenses, yeah?

rows.label: TownInfo060_4
rows.name:
I heard they found a Lifepod in the southern
part of Cauldros. If I could recover that,
I'd get a huge reward! Huge, I tell you!
Probably enough to buy a car!

rows.label: TownInfo060_5
rows.name:
That treasure I was talking about earlier?
Yeah, someone beat me to it. And here I'd
been dreaming about a new car, too.
I was gonna name it Lenny.

rows.label: TownInfo061_1
rows.name:
When you encounter a powerful indigen, don't
engage it! Just quietly walk away instead.
Most creatures around here will leave you
alone if you do the same for them.

rows.label: TownInfo061_2
rows.name:
We found wreckage from an alien civilization
north of Janpath Lake in Primordia. I bet we
could learn so much if we could excavate it!

rows.label: TownInfo061_3
rows.name:
Personally, I love dinosaurs. So coming to this
planet and getting to see a millesaur was
honestly one of the highlights of my life.

rows.label: TownInfo061_4
rows.name:
My right leg was bitten off by a millesaur,
but the maintenance center was able to fix me
right up. Now everything's back to normal!

rows.label: TownInfo061_5
rows.name:
I've made up my mind—I'm gonna transfer to
the Interceptors, travel around Mira,
and defeat one of every single indigen!

rows.label: TownInfo062_1
rows.name:
Our xeno representative should be intelligent
and able to fully understand the benefits of
cooperation. Orpheans are highly analytical,
so they might be perfect for the job.

rows.label: TownInfo063_1
rows.name:
The xeno representative should be an
Orphean. Preferably one who's willing to listen
to the opinions of all the other xenoforms.

rows.label: TownInfo064_1
rows.name:
The woman fled toward the diner, but it was
so quick, I couldn't see her face. I have to
stay here, so I'll leave the pursuit to you!

rows.label: TownInfo065_1
rows.name:
A female BLADE operative just ran toward the
administrative district. She seemed really
panicked about something, so I hope
everything's all right...

rows.label: TownInfo066_1
rows.name:
Are you chasing someone? A woman from the
Arms Union just went down to the lower
level. She looked super calm, though.

rows.label: TownInfo067_1
rows.name:
If you're looking to make a lot of food on the
battlefield, you can't beat a hot pot.
Throw in meat, herbs, mushrooms, whatever,
and BAM! You've got a meal!

rows.label: TownInfo068_1
rows.name:
The Ma-non seem to have established a new
company called Candid & Credible that sells
equipment to humans. Friendly xenos like that
are always welcome in NLA!

rows.label: TownInfo069_1
rows.name:
The xeno girl went towards the commercial
district! But she was moving with a purpose,
so it wouldn't surprise me if her real
destination was the administrative district.

rows.label: TownInfo070_1
rows.name:
Nightglow Forest sounds like a terrifying place!
They say any tree or rock could be a
camouflaged indigen, so you'll need sharp
powers of observation to survive.

rows.label: TownInfo070_2
rows.name:
I was attacked by a rubidium oc-serv while
surveying the Suncatch Ravine. I thought it was
just debris until I got too close for my own
good. Scared the living daylights out of me.

rows.label: TownInfo070_3
rows.name:
I've heard talk of xenos domesticating simius.
Apparently you can see some at the Ensconced
Citadel in Nightglow Forest. Tame simius!
Can you imagine?!

rows.label: TownInfo070_4
rows.name:
Apparently traces of past intelligent life remain
in Valley of Oblivion. But what about Nightglow Forest?

rows.label: TownInfo070_5
rows.name:
I've never seen the Ruler of Fates myself,
but he's certainly a mystery. I suppose we
must have his blessing if we're still here.

rows.label: TownInfo071_1
rows.name:
Explorers who went out ahead of us can be
found scattered throughout Mira. If you talk
to them, I'm sure they'll be happy to give
you a hand.

rows.label: TownInfo071_2
rows.name:
We went out to deliver materials to base
camp earlier. That place is scary—there are so
many indigens roaming around I can't even
THINK about sleeping!

rows.label: TownInfo071_3
rows.name:
The Nopon and Ma-non have one thing in
common—they'll both be useless in a fight!
I wish humanity had some big, burly xeno
allies on our side...

rows.label: TownInfo071_4
rows.name:
I saw a new type of xenoform in front of
BLADE Tower. He said he was a Larsian,
I think? Then he mumbled something about
this place being useless for training.

rows.label: TownInfo071_5
rows.name:
I know we can count on the Larsians—every
one of them is a proud and valiant warrior.
I hope we're BFFs forever!

rows.label: TownInfo072_1
rows.name:
Exploring an uncharted planet is no easy task.
For the sake of efficiency, it's important that
each Union performs its own assigned duty.

rows.label: TownInfo072_2
rows.name:
Apparently you can now use the information-
collection functions of data probes to re-create
past battles. We have GOT to try that when
we get back to the Home!

rows.label: TownInfo072_3
rows.name:
Are you using research data probes? If you're
looking to make money, you definitely should!
Those Dolls ain't cheap, you know?

rows.label: TownInfo072_4
rows.name:
Apparently Kirsty was looking for someone in
Cauldros, or found someone, or...something?
I can never understand what she's babbling
about when she gets excited.

rows.label: TownInfo072_5
rows.name:
It's a good thing we have FrontierNet.
If we didn't, I can't even imagine how long
it would take us to explore this planet!

rows.label: TownInfo101_1
rows.name:
There's a whole other continent far to the
north of this city. Did you know that?
I can't stop thinking about it!
What do you think is over there?!

rows.label: TownInfo101_2
rows.name:
The research data probes help us understand
the world outside the city. For example, they
let me appreciate how beautiful Sylvalum is.

rows.label: TownInfo101_3
rows.name:
Looks like there's some sort of sarcophagus in
Sylvalum. It doesn't match what we know of
Growth culture, so I'm wondering if it's
older. Maybe much, much older...

rows.label: TownInfo101_4
rows.name:
I've spent a lot of time looking at the research
data probes, and I found a strange petrified
tree stump in the north of Sylvalum. I wonder
if I should report it to BLADE?

rows.label: TownInfo101_5
rows.name:
So the Growth menace has truly passed?
Maybe that means I can finally take that
Sylvalum vacation I've been thinking about.

rows.label: TownInfo102_1
rows.name:
It's true that everyone needs private time.
But talking to your companions during their
personal time can also provide an opportunity
to get to know them better.

rows.label: TownInfo102_2
rows.name:
I saw Lao playing with a dog in Deliverance
Park early one morning. But the weird thing is
that he had this absolutely miserable
expression on his face the whole time.

rows.label: TownInfo102_3
rows.name:
Lao's Team Belisarda is one of the most skilled
teams in all of BLADE. I hear one of them is
pretty cute, too!

rows.label: TownInfo102_4
rows.name:
I haven't seen Lao lately. He hasn't fallen in
the line of duty, has he? ...No, of course not.
That would have been on the news for sure.

rows.label: TownInfo102_5
rows.name:
The price was heavy, but it seems we've
achieved peace for the moment. I'd like to
buy a drink for each and every BLADE I see!

rows.label: TownInfo103_1
rows.name:
They don't sell guns in the commercial district.
You'll have to hit up Armory Alley in the
administrative district. ...Er, but WHY do
you need a Gatling gun, exactly?

rows.label: TownInfo103_2
rows.name:
Look, I was 100 percent wrong, and I'll never
do it again, okay? Trust me—there's no need
to buy a sniper rifle from Armory Alley in the
administrative district. None whatsoever!

rows.label: TownInfo103_3
rows.name:
You don't have enough firepower, so you're
going to use an augment? What are you
talking about? And what problem are you
trying to solve with a psycho launcher?!

rows.label: TownInfo103_4
rows.name:
You say you can improve that old assault rifle
of yours if you go to Lu's shop? And it'll save
us money over buying a new one? Sure. Then
you can use the savings to buy me a drink...

rows.label: TownInfo103_5
rows.name:
...Actually you haven't been "hiding" the fact
that you're a gun nut from me. I've known it
all along. Especially the "nut" part.
Still, we lasted this long...

rows.label: TownInfo104_1
rows.name:
When the White Whale was being shot down,
I assumed we were all goners. The fact we're
still alive today is a testament to how hard the
army fought for us.

rows.label: TownInfo104_2
rows.name:
I don't get what a lot of these BLADE Unions
are even for. I mean, I know the Companions
pretty well, but what the heck do Landbankers
actually do?

rows.label: TownInfo104_3
rows.name:
I heard an Orphean broke into Caroline's
house and trashed her yard. It's all anyone's
talking about in the residential district.

rows.label: TownInfo104_4
rows.name:
Have you ever had a canapé made with
dobobora broccoli and godmelon? It's
incredible! But they're both rare ingredients,
so it's a luxury for sure.

rows.label: TownInfo104_5
rows.name:
We crashed here after a Growth attack,
yet the Growth appear to have arrived on
this planet long before we did.
Doesn't that seem strange to you?

rows.label: TownInfo105_1
rows.name:
An Overed has been sighted east of NLA.
It can fly, so we need to be ready for it.

rows.label: TownInfo105_2
rows.name:
When a battle isn't going your way, team up
with your comrades and activate your Dolls'
Overclocks! That's the best way to turn the tide
of battle.

rows.label: TownInfo105_3
rows.name:
There are a few strong-hearted Ma-non who
talked about becoming BLADEs, but this one
doesn't seem brave—he just seems bereft of
common sense!

rows.label: TownInfo105_4
rows.name:
The treaty of friendship we forged with the
Orphe is hugely important. The information
they might provide about the Growth could
be critical to our survival!

rows.label: TownInfo105_5
rows.name:
I'm glad we were able to forge a pact with
the Larsians. They remind me of Earth's
samurai, in that they're all skilled and strong-
hearted warriors with a sense of honor.

rows.label: TownInfo106_1
rows.name:
It sure feels good coming back to this city.
No more camping out, no more danger, and
best of all, you're here. I love NLA!
I LOVE IT! ...Hey, that should be a song.

rows.label: TownInfo106_2
rows.name:
I'm gonna find a goddess's kiss on my
next deployment for you. It's a really
rare stone found only at Northpointe Beach!

rows.label: TownInfo106_3
rows.name:
I promise to pick you a muranadium as your
next present. It's a rare flower you can find
only around Mount M'gando in Cauldros.

rows.label: TownInfo106_4
rows.name:
We found wreckage from an alien civilization
west of Mount M'gando in Cauldros.
With the reward I get for excavating it,
I'm gonna buy you something really special!

rows.label: TownInfo106_5
rows.name:
You're breaking up with me? After all the
collectibles I gave you? Unbelievable!
You're meaner than the Growth!

rows.label: TownInfo107_1
rows.name:
I gotta admit I'm pretty excited about this.
Just like our ancestors who founded America,
we'll be colonizing a whole new world!

rows.label: TownInfo107_2
rows.name:
Were you Ma-non just zooming around in
space until you arrived here? I'd love to hear
what that was like!

rows.label: TownInfo107_3
rows.name:
I heard the Orphe's former planet was so
full of giant creatures that you all pretty much
became snacks. How did any of you manage
to survive?

rows.label: TownInfo107_4
rows.name:
Why are the Growth coming after us so
much when we aren't even as technologically
advanced as the Ma-non? Hell, they already
destroyed Earth! It makes no sense!

rows.label: TownInfo107_5
rows.name:
We must seem like really strange creatures
from your perspective. Especially the way
we're all part of the same species, and yet
we continually fight amongst ourselves.

rows.label: TownInfo108_1
rows.name:
I'd stay out of the back alleys at night if I 
were you. Nothing good's ever come of that.
...Unless you like beatings. Or robbery.
Or maybe running into some old trash cans.

rows.label: TownInfo108_2
rows.name:
Civilians can't open those BLADE supply boxes
placed in every district of the city, right?
So what are we supposed to do if something
happens? Just run for our damn lives?

rows.label: TownInfo108_3
rows.name:
There are BLADE supply boxes in every district,
but if the Growth attack, they'll be beyond
useless. People will be way too focused on
running and screaming to open a box!

rows.label: TownInfo108_4
rows.name:
I just want to watch football and cut loose,
you know? All they're broadcasting now is
reruns of old games, but I'm hoping we put
some new teams together soon!

rows.label: TownInfo108_5
rows.name:
I can't get enough of that Larsian curry.
It's a traditional recipe that's survived
unchanged for over a thousand years.
Plus, it's so hot it makes your tongue numb!

rows.label: TownInfo109_1
rows.name:
How nice that Nopon get to drink such
amazing beverage. Fruits of alliance are
sweet indeed!

rows.label: TownInfo109_2
rows.name:
Ma-non not listen to word Nopon say.
Maybe they confuse Nopon with take-out
meal!

rows.label: TownInfo109_3
rows.name:
Whaaaaat?! There are Bias in city?
Friend must be ready to protect all Nopon if
they are being eaten!

rows.label: TownInfo109_4
rows.name:
Ma-non ship is very nice. But Nopon are
maybe only one year away from learning how
to make same nice ship!

rows.label: TownInfo109_5
rows.name:
Nopon birthrate has been going down lately,
so it is good see young heroes like Tatsu and
Tora with strong future potential. All must
continue to support such heroic Nopon!

rows.label: TownInfo110_1
rows.name:
All BLADEs carry both melee and ranged
weapons. This helps them react to any
combat situation.

rows.label: TownInfo110_2
rows.name:
The all-purpose plug is a handy part that can
be fitted into a wide variety of machines.
Apparently the Galdr out in Sylvalum
drop them pretty frequently.

rows.label: TownInfo110_3
rows.name:
On the Seabird's Beak of Sylvalum, I saw a
visigel that was significantly stronger than
all of the others. If I'd gotten any closer,
I probably wouldn't be alive to tell the tale!

rows.label: TownInfo110_4
rows.name:
Small caves dot the cliff walls in Sylvalum,
but unless you can fly, I don't see any way to
enter them.

rows.label: TownInfo110_5
rows.name:
There's evidence that every continent on this
planet was once inhabited, but what's strange
is that each was home to a different culture.
What could that possibly mean?

rows.label: TownInfo111_1
rows.name:
The best way to kill time is with a nap.
Even if you're outside the city, you can always
return to a base camp for a little shut-eye.
In fact, I think I might...just... Zzzzzz...

rows.label: TownInfo111_2
rows.name:
Since we've switched our bodies for
Blue Bloods, we no longer need to worry
about aging. But we can't have kids either,
whiiich kind of sucks.

rows.label: TownInfo111_3
rows.name:
The Bias are divided into two tribes that are
constantly warring, right? Wouldn't it be great
if we could intervene and settle the dispute
peacefully?

rows.label: TownInfo111_4
rows.name:
Sounds like the Bias are gearing up for a
wedding! Aw, that's great. We all could use
some happy news in these trying times.

rows.label: TownInfo111_5
rows.name:
One of the Bias women is teaching me how
to cook. We stewed charupa leaves and
gyulali in a wine sauce. It's...interesting,
but also pretty healthy.

rows.label: TownInfo112_1
rows.name:
I hear a Pathfinder team was wiped out in the
southern Torhogne Plain in Valley of Oblivion. I guess
even a Doll is no guarantee of safety.

rows.label: TownInfo112_2
rows.name:
You've heard about the giant canyon in
Valley of Oblivion that's so deep you can't even see the
bottom? No way, man! At that depth, you'd
die of starvation before you hit the ground.

rows.label: TownInfo112_3
rows.name:
Valley of Oblivion is basically Mira's very own Grand
Canyon. I'm not a BLADE, so I haven't seen it
myself, but if it's ever safe to travel there,
I'd sure like to.

rows.label: TownInfo112_4
rows.name:
Is it true that if you look down from the sky
at a certain point in Valley of Oblivion, it looks like a
drawing? I heard that from a BLADE, but he
might have been messing with me.

rows.label: TownInfo112_5
rows.name:
You know that giant ring in Valley of Oblivion?
Well, now that the war with Growth is over,
they're gonna do sightseeing tours! Let's go!

rows.label: TownInfo113_1
rows.name:
Don't they sell salad shakers anywhere?
I guess it's not a very popular item, but I
really miss mine. I've had to shake my salads
in an old boot, which is pretty gross.

rows.label: TownInfo113_2
rows.name:
The city sure has been bustling since the
Ma-non arrived. I bet the shops are booming!

rows.label: TownInfo113_3
rows.name:
I'm hearing that sales are way up since the
Bias arrived. It seems basic human tools and
appliances are fantastic inventions to them.

rows.label: TownInfo113_4
rows.name:
The men of the Tree Clan were just running
around in a tizzy! It's some cultural thing,
but believe me, you do NOT want to see
things that big and strong in a tizzy.

rows.label: TownInfo113_5
rows.name:
Our military power has advanced significantly
since we landed on Mira, but our daily life
has barely changed at all. I'm expecting big
things now that we're at peace.

rows.label: TownInfo114_1
rows.name:
I'm so glad they found those new crew 
members. Those must have been some
well-built Lifepods to keep them alive for
two whole months like that!

rows.label: TownInfo114_2
rows.name:
If I were a BLADE, I think I'd join the
Testamenters. Searching for lost treasure that's
been scattered all over the planet sounds like
a total blast!

rows.label: TownInfo115_1
rows.name:
Each of the eight Unions has a specialty,
but it's not like that's all they do. Even an
Interceptor can help expand FrontierNet,
for example.

rows.label: TownInfo115_2
rows.name:
The most secure places in the city are BLADE
Tower and the hangars beneath it.
They're the core of NLA, and we can't
allow anything to happen to them.

rows.label: TownInfo115_3
rows.name:
The mech recovered from Nightglow Forest must
have been pretty important to the Growth.
And we let it slip through our fingers! Damn!

rows.label: TownInfo115_4
rows.name:
The Lifepoint's almost at its limit. If we can't
get it secured, us humans are going to go
extinct! I guess all we can do now is have
faith in BLADE...

rows.label: TownInfo115_5
rows.name:
I don't know where we'd be now if they
hadn't formed BLADE. As much faith as I had
that they'd see us through this, it still feels like
it's all a dream.

rows.label: TownInfo116_1
rows.name:
When we first landed on Mira, we didn't have
running water or electricity. And even THAT
wasn't half as bad as the incessant, blood-
curdling howls of the creatures all around us.

rows.label: TownInfo116_2
rows.name:
The news was saying something about how
slowly the FrontierNet survey is progressing.
We need to find the Lifepoint before it's too
late, man! It's IMPORTANT!

rows.label: TownInfo116_3
rows.name:
A buddy of mine who went to Cauldros saw
an electromagnetic storm by the Forgotten
Mining Frigates. He said there was a super-
strong scintimure there veiled in lightning!

rows.label: TownInfo116_4
rows.name:
Cauldros sounds like the deadliest place on
Mira. A BLADE friend of mine was actually
crying as he told me about it. And he's
tough, too!

rows.label: TownInfo116_5
rows.name:
I heard they finished the survey of Cauldros.
Must have been a damn nightmare with the
main Growth base there and everything.
What an achievement!

rows.label: TownInfo117_1
rows.name:
There aren't any shops that really cater to
BLADEs in the commercial district, right?
Maybe we should start targeting that
demographic.

rows.label: TownInfo117_2
rows.name:
The government is telling everyone to treat the
Ma-non just like we treat humans, but what if
they come trash my shop or something?
I don't know about this...

rows.label: TownInfo117_3
rows.name:
If we can expand FrontierNet, we might be
able to find new xenoforms that are willing to
cooperate with us. They could be just like our
new Ma-non friends!

rows.label: TownInfo117_4
rows.name:
It's been a little noisier than usual lately,
but the Ma-non are always good customers.
I love how happy they seem to be when
they're looking over my stock.

rows.label: TownInfo117_5
rows.name:
There are huge, scary monsters in Nightglow Forest
as well, right? Maaaan, I sure hope they
never come anywhere near the city...

rows.label: TownInfo118_1
rows.name:
Have you noticed how certain people seem to
bristle at Companions? Guess some folks just
haven't learned to respect authority.

rows.label: TownInfo118_2
rows.name:
Lao and Doug came to visit our store earlier!
...Huh? Do you not know who they are?
They're BLADEs! Really famous BLADEs!

rows.label: TownInfo118_3
rows.name:
I never imagined Lao would betray us like
that. Still, I guess he always did have a kind
of glum look about him...

rows.label: TownInfo118_4
rows.name:
I wonder what happens to the property of
fallen BLADE operatives? I'm sure Doug
would know, but I haven't seen him around
for a while.

rows.label: TownInfo118_5
rows.name:
Night shift again... Another dark and dismal
stretch of slinging suds for hardworking
ruffians.

rows.label: TownInfo119_1
rows.name:
I just saw a man getting into a tangle with a
bunch of dangerous thugs across the way.
I wonder if he's okay. Not like there's
anything we can do about it, but still...

rows.label: TownInfo119_2
rows.name:
Thankfully, that BLADE operative made it out
of that tangle with those thugs safely.
Still, I'm not sure he has what it takes to be
a Companion...

rows.label: TownInfo119_3
rows.name:
Is it really true that the whole interior of
the Ma-non ship is made of gold and
shimmers with divine light? That ship's
like a miracle from heaven...

rows.label: TownInfo119_4
rows.name:
During the attack, the Ma-non let me take
refuge on their ship. It was a really strange
experience, especially since the whole place
smelled like pizza.

rows.label: TownInfo119_5
rows.name:
We can all breathe a sigh of relief now that
the Lifepoint has been secured. Now if we can
just find a way to communicate with the other
Earth ships, we'll REALLY be able to celebrate!

rows.label: TownInfo120_1
rows.name:
The collectibles you can find vary considerably
from area to area. Even in, say, Primordia,
you'll find completely different items in the east
than you would in the west.

rows.label: TownInfo120_2
rows.name:
The toppings used in this pizzeria sure taste
different. You don't think their salami is made
from suids or some other indigens, do you?

rows.label: TownInfo120_3
rows.name:
Are you doing your part with segment recon?
The search for the Lifepoint is vital, but
exploring the planet is also an important role
of BLADE.

rows.label: TownInfo120_4
rows.name:
I've heard Commander Vandham sometimes
visits a café near here. Never seen Director
General Chausson there, though.

rows.label: TownInfo120_5
rows.name:
Wow, Army Pizza has really changed up
their menu. It's like everything is geared
toward Ma-non tastes now.

rows.label: TownInfo121_1
rows.name:
People's behavior always has an effect on
their comrades, and a single choice can make
them like or hate you. Hey, no one ever said
life was simple.

rows.label: TownInfo121_2
rows.name:
It's hard behaving in a way that will make
everyone like you. That's to be expected,
though—everyone has different values and
opinions.

rows.label: TownInfo121_3
rows.name:
I don't mind sharing the city with xenoforms.
Heck, there's a wide variety of different people
within our own species—is a xeno really all
that different from a human stranger?

rows.label: TownInfo121_4
rows.name:
The Zaruboggan worship a god named
Golbogga. I learned that from someone
named Feloran up on the Ma-non ship.

rows.label: TownInfo121_5
rows.name:
We're lucky this planet has the mystical power
to translate a being's will. Without being able
to communicate with the different xenoforms,
cooperation would've been impossible.

rows.label: TownInfo122_1
rows.name:
I can't help you on your assignments myself,
but if you're looking for a duty partner, you
can always use the BLADE Scout Console in
the administrative district.

rows.label: TownInfo122_2
rows.name:
Providing security within NLA is one of the
Companions' duties. Outside the city, that role
falls to the Interceptors.

rows.label: TownInfo122_3
rows.name:
I'm heading out to Nightglow Forest with a fellow
Avalancher soon. I've done it lots of times before,
but outside deployments still make me nervous.

rows.label: TownInfo122_4
rows.name:
I just paid my first visit to Sylvalum.
We found a container from an alien
civilization at the South Cinderdunes,
but we couldn't open it.

rows.label: TownInfo122_5
rows.name:
Doing guard duty here suits me. Oh, there's
plenty of trouble, but it's not like being out
there flirting with death every single day.

rows.label: TownInfo123_1
rows.name:
It isn't easy for a civilian to become a BLADE.
You have to master all sorts of skills,
from target shooting to wilderness survival.

rows.label: TownInfo123_2
rows.name:
The mountainous area past the river in Valley of Oblivion
sounds really dangerous. Apparently the
indigens there are a lot more aggressive
than the ones around here.

rows.label: TownInfo123_3
rows.name:
The desert around Big Arch in Valley of Oblivion is
apparently home to a nest of violent sabulas
who try to swallow intruders whole.

rows.label: TownInfo123_4
rows.name:
So the Growth have a large-scale base
in Valley of Oblivion? We sure are lucky the Habitat
landed in Primordia instead...

rows.label: TownInfo123_5
rows.name:
It sounds like there are lots of places in
Valley of Oblivion that can only be reached by air.
So that means there's still more to explore!

rows.label: TownInfo124_1
rows.name:
Dolls have even been deployed inside the city
in case of emergencies. Of course, they
couldn't exactly plunk one down in the middle
of the commercial district.

rows.label: TownInfo124_2
rows.name:
When you deepen bonds with your comrades,
sometimes they show you an unexpected side
of themselves. The first step is simply sharing
your free time with them.

rows.label: TownInfo124_3
rows.name:
One trick to deepening friendships is speaking
and behaving in ways that match your friends'
preferences. But the best way is simply sharing
the hardships of combat.

rows.label: TownInfo124_4
rows.name:
Gwin's always following Irina around.
He even waits on the bridge in the afternoons
while she's going shopping! That's...pathetic.

rows.label: TownInfo124_5
rows.name:
I found a boy who has even more potential
than Gwin! His name is Mathias, and while he
can be a little flaky, I love how simple and
innocent he seems.

rows.label: TownInfo125_1
rows.name:
When using some Arts, you can gain bonuses
based on your positioning. So move to where
the Art will be most effective when you want a
big impact.

rows.label: TownInfo125_2
rows.name:
I'm thinking of changing Unions. I feel like
working as a Pathfinder may be more my
speed...

rows.label: TownInfo125_3
rows.name:
What's your common room in the BLADE
Home like? Mine is completely covered in
pink. So cute! But my fellow team members
say it hurts their eyes...

rows.label: TownInfo125_4
rows.name:
Sometimes I see Lu out here in the middle of
the night with a big smirk on his face.
I always figure he's getting his kicks by selling
strange new inventions again.

rows.label: TownInfo125_5
rows.name:
The more I think about it, the more I realize
what a strange guy Lu is. He isn't a Nopon,
and he doesn't seem to be a Bias, but what
the heck IS he?

rows.label: TownInfo126_1
rows.name:
Like all true intellectuals, I enjoy drinking tea
and criticizing the government. There's no
better use of one's free time, says I!

rows.label: TownInfo126_2
rows.name:
We should forge a stronger pact with the
Ma-non. Imagine how much more powerful
BLADE would be if we could use Ma-non
tech in our Dolls!

rows.label: TownInfo126_3
rows.name:
If we want to fight the Growth effectively,
we need to learn more about them.
Perhaps we can detect some vulnerability
in their culture or technology.

rows.label: TownInfo126_4
rows.name:
Sajif Scoppio was just here asking me 
about military tactics. It was surprising—
I'd never known a Bias to be so full of
intellectual curiosity before.

rows.label: TownInfo126_5
rows.name:
Sajif Scoppio's diligence might be a game
