changer for the Tree Clan. With his wisdom,
the clan can only grow stronger.

rows.label: TownInfo127_1
rows.name:
To get to the residential district, follow the
road that runs along the office buildings,
then cross through the administrative district.

rows.label: TownInfo127_2
rows.name:
Army Pizza is on the west side of Melville
Street. Although if you want my opinion,
Rosemoss across the street is way better.
That Army Pizza tastes like tainted meat!

rows.label: TownInfo127_3
rows.name:
Do I want to go to Sally Baxter Café
or Lincoln Baker Coffee? Hmm...
Hey, how about Moore's Café?

rows.label: TownInfo127_4
rows.name:
Why does everyone come to me for advice
and directions? Well, if you're looking for
stationery, try a shop called Méliès 321 on
North Founders Street.

rows.label: TownInfo127_5
rows.name:
Well, I've made up my mind—I'm becoming
the official city guide of NLA! At least then
I can be of some use to the xenoforms.

rows.label: TownInfo128_1
rows.name:
There's all sorts of treasure scattered around
Mira. And if we could scoop all that up before
anyone else, we'd be the richest people ON
the planet!

rows.label: TownInfo128_2
rows.name:
If you set up a bunch of research data probes
within FrontierNet, you can make big money
somehow. So let's ride those babies all the
way to BIG MONEYTOWN!

rows.label: TownInfo128_3
rows.name:
I taught my get-rich-quick scheme to a BLADE
operative who was going to Cauldros. He's
going to let me wet my beak on that action,
so drinks are on me!

rows.label: TownInfo128_4
rows.name:
My BLADE friend said he chanced upon a
Milsaadi that controls insects at the Forgotten
Mining Frigates in Cauldros. He also said that
she appears at night and is one tough cookie!

rows.label: TownInfo128_5
rows.name:
Serving as a BLADE operative is like walking
with death. I never gave it much thought
before, but man, did they ever fight hard
for us.

rows.label: TownInfo129_1
rows.name:
You can do anything with one of these
comm devices. Even BLADEs use them to
access FrontierNet and manage their
assignments.

rows.label: TownInfo129_3
rows.name:
We humans are used to using comm devices
as part of our daily lives, but it turns out
Nopon do as well—except theirs look like
lollipops! Man, I want one...

rows.label: TownInfo129_4
rows.name:
There's an extraordinarily odd Nopon in the
residential district who seems to be casting
some sort of spell. You don't think it's black
magic, do you? Or...blood magic? Eeeep!

rows.label: TownInfo129_5
rows.name:
Late at night, I saw a faint shimmer in the
administrative district. Don't tell me that was
some sort of ghost? Eeeeeeeep!

rows.label: TownInfo130_1
rows.name:
We're lucky we were able to perform a land
survey and analysis of Mira before the White
Whale crashed. That's how we know exactly
where to plant the data probes.

rows.label: TownInfo130_2
rows.name:
A patrol copter sent to Nightglow Forest was lost near
Elephant's Trunk. I hope the crew is safe, but
with all the indigens out there, it's hard to
be optimistic.

rows.label: TownInfo130_3
rows.name:
Apparently the Lifepoint Archive in Nightglow Forest
was destroyed. That's a tragedy, but we're
just lucky that it wasn't the Central Life.

rows.label: TownInfo130_4
rows.name:
The survey of Nightglow Forest seems to be making
good progress, but we need better data on its
ecosystem. It seems similar to Earth jungles,
but that's almost all we know.

rows.label: TownInfo130_5
rows.name:
My friend said you can scavenge joadtanks
near the Divine Roost in Nightglow Forest.
They're extremely precious!

rows.label: TownInfo131_1
rows.name:
I hear you can travel northeast through
Primordia to reach Valley of Oblivion. I wonder what
it's like over there. Hopefully it's safer than
it is around here...

rows.label: TownInfo131_2
rows.name:
Valley of Oblivion is home to numerous Bias outposts.
I've heard the area is littered with the bodies
of BLADEs who failed to approach carefully.

rows.label: TownInfo131_3
rows.name:
I've heard rumors of creepy flowers blooming
around Valley of Oblivion's Balance Rock base camp.
I don't think anyone's really studied them yet,
though.

rows.label: TownInfo131_4
rows.name:
Have you heard what BLADEs like to do in
Valley of Oblivion? They jump down King's Falls! Wooo!
I bet that feels great on a hot day.

rows.label: TownInfo131_5
rows.name:
So I guess there was only the one Lifepoint
Archive in Valley of Oblivion after all. What a shame—
it could have been a big help to us if they'd
found more.

rows.label: TownInfo132_1
rows.name:
As soon as we landed on this planet, a bunch
of military types went out to explore the area
in patrol copters. Less than half of them
returned...

rows.label: TownInfo132_2
rows.name:
The director general is doing a great job;
he's really kept morale high since we got
here. But it does make me suspect that
he's not telling us something...

rows.label: TownInfo132_3
rows.name:
Lara Nara invited me out for a drink earlier.
But I didn't know what to say, so...
I just ran away. I'm such an idiot.

rows.label: TownInfo132_4
rows.name:
Debris from the White Whale has been found
near Headwater Summit. It's weird how we
hadn't explored that area yet, despite it being
so close.

rows.label: TownInfo132_5
rows.name:
I wonder what the highest point is on all of
Mira. Maybe Talon Rock? Or the Delusian
Mountains? Or it could be the Divine Roost...

rows.label: TownInfo133_1
rows.name:
I never imagined we could live such an Earth-
like existence after landing on an uncharted
planet like Mira. But it seems as if the Earthlife
Colonization Project thought of everything.

rows.label: TownInfo133_2
rows.name:
I heard Frye's been spotted in the hangars at
night engaging in some kind of real serious
conversation. Frankly, I'm shocked he stayed
sober long enough to converse with anyone!

rows.label: TownInfo133_3
rows.name:
Isn't there something we can do about the
Ma-non? They're frolicking around the city
while my son lies dead! He was killed in the
line of duty!

rows.label: TownInfo133_4
rows.name:
I know the Tree Clan aren't the ones who
killed my son, but sometimes it's hard to
make that distinction. I just... I miss him.

rows.label: TownInfo133_5
rows.name:
Now that we've found the Lifepoint, I only need
to hang on for a little while longer before my
son receives his new body. Oh, I just can't
wait to see him again!

rows.label: TownInfo134_1
rows.name:
Man, I just love BLADEs. Every single one!
Yeah, even the weird ones. And the ones who
talk too much. And the ones who smell funny.
They're all heroes to me.

rows.label: TownInfo134_2
rows.name:
The assignments that BLADE operatives perform
seem exhausting, and I hear they typically take
some time off to heal mind and body when
they return to NLA.

rows.label: TownInfo134_3
rows.name:
I tried one of those rations that BLADEs eat,
and it was unbelievably...GOOD! SO GOOD!
I could eat a pile of those every day.
No joke. A literal pile. From the floor.

rows.label: TownInfo134_4
rows.name:
Lately, Miia always seems to have something
she needs to do late at night. Maybe she's
working in the commercial district again?
Man, she shouldn't be overdoing it like that.

rows.label: TownInfo134_5
rows.name:
If Miia can become a respected BLADE,
then I'm gonna become a respected engineer.
Then I can design new weapons just for her!

rows.label: TownInfo135_1
rows.name:
The number displayed at the top of BLADE
Tower is getting smaller, right? That's not just
me? So...what happens when it reaches zero?

rows.label: TownInfo135_2
rows.name:
The Ma-non are way better with technology
than us, right? So if they wanted to betray us,
they could pretty much wipe out all of
humanity in 10 seconds flat.

rows.label: TownInfo135_3
rows.name:
I don't ever want to talk to a Nopon again!
One of them convinced me to buy a strange
black rock for 5,000 credits, but the damn
thing isn't even a decent paperweight!

rows.label: TownInfo135_4
rows.name:
And now the number on BLADE Tower is
down to a single digit. This is terrible.
I mean, can BLADE even find the Lifepoint in
time? I can't sleep with all this stress!

rows.label: TownInfo135_5
rows.name:
We found the Lifepoint thanks to that black
stone I purchased from the Nopon! It was
magic or a miracle or something, but I've
been praying on it every day!

rows.label: TownInfo136_1
rows.name:
You walked back after your Doll was
destroyed by a suid near Shadow Rise?
You are lucky to be alive at all!

rows.label: TownInfo136_2
rows.name:
Please go to Armory Alley in the administrative
district and get suited up properly. If you go
outside in your everyday clothes, you're going
to get yourself dead.

rows.label: TownInfo136_3
rows.name:
Sayram Lake may be just north of the city,
but that doesn't mean it isn't dangerous.
So don't go holding any picnics there, okay?

rows.label: TownInfo136_4
rows.name:
You fell down the cliff just north of Biahno
Hill? And that's how you found that cave?
...Huh. I guess it is better to be lucky than
smart.

rows.label: TownInfo136_5
rows.name:
I know how reckless you've been, so please try
to be more careful when you explore Mira.
After all, I'd be terribly sad if I couldn't hear
more tales of your adventures.

rows.label: TownInfo137_1
rows.name:
Look at that awesome new car! I wish I
owned a ride like that, instead of having to
use these lousy BLADE loaners.

rows.label: TownInfo137_2
rows.name:
If I keep accepting basic missions and
diligently work to complete them, I might
soon earn enough in rewards to buy a car.
A big one. With tail fins. And a moonroof!

rows.label: TownInfo137_3
rows.name:
I see Doug working out at the sports complex
when he has time off. I don't see the point
since Blue Bloods don't atrophy, but he sure
is passionate about it.

rows.label: TownInfo137_4
rows.name:
I went on a mission with Doug recently.
Guy can get a little grim, but he always
watches my back. I learned a lot from him.

rows.label: TownInfo137_5
rows.name:
NLA should be finished soon, and all the
roads linked up. Then I'll be able to drive this
car anywhere I want to go!

rows.label: TownInfo138_1
rows.name:
When all's said and done, a BLADE's job is
basically just to expand FrontierNet by 
planting data probes all over the place.

rows.label: TownInfo138_2
rows.name:
The fact that a Lifepoint Archive fell into
the forests of Nightglow Forest suggests that others
may have fallen elsewhere on the planet.

rows.label: TownInfo138_3
rows.name:
I can't believe the Growth attacked us here,
but I'm glad we survived it. It's all thanks to
those BLADEs who defended NLA so selflessly.

rows.label: TownInfo138_4
rows.name:
I saw a massive xenoform doing hard labor
in the industrial district. There was a cute girl
right beside him, but I still couldn't peel my
eyes away from him.

rows.label: TownInfo138_5
rows.name:
We humans are lucky there's so many of us.
I wonder what it feels like to be the last
member of your race. That's gotta be lonely.

rows.label: TownInfo139_1
rows.name:
My husband is a Pathfinder. Every time he
returns home from duty, I make him a hot
meal and thank the heavens for his safety.

rows.label: TownInfo139_2
rows.name:
That Kirsty woman is always giving my
husband dangerous assignments! She says she
doesn't have enough staff to survey Nightglow Forest,
but who does she think she's kidding?!

rows.label: TownInfo139_3
rows.name:
A Growth attack on top of everything else!
It's amazing we suffered as few casualties as
we did. And yet, my husband was guarding
the hangars... He didn't make it home.

rows.label: TownInfo139_4
rows.name:
I can't believe we had a traitor in our midst!
That bastard sold us out to the enemy and
got my husband killed! If we don't find that
Lifepoint soon...

rows.label: TownInfo139_5
rows.name:
So that Lao fellow redeemed himself after his
betrayal, huh? Well, he won't have my
forgiveness until my husband comes back
and holds me in his arms again.

rows.label: TownInfo140_1
rows.name:
The best shop in all of NLA? That's Gina's,
no doubt. We should go there next time.

rows.label: TownInfo140_2
rows.name:
This neighborhood sure has sprung to life since
the xenos arrived. I'm happy to have them,
provided they don't cause any trouble.

rows.label: TownInfo140_3
rows.name:
After spending time with the Bias, I realize
they're not much different from us. And living
as they do—in large families out in nature—
they're actually a lot like ancient humans.

rows.label: TownInfo140_4
rows.name:
Bazis Wolfen is about to have a baby!
...I wonder what Bias babies look like.

rows.label: TownInfo140_5
rows.name:
Apparently the Bias have a full-grown
body at five years old. It must suck for
your childhood to be so short...

rows.label: TownInfo141_1
rows.name:
I heard they found debris from the White 
Whale on the cliffs of a small island in the
western part of Cauldros, but that recovering
it has proven too difficult.

rows.label: TownInfo141_2
rows.name:
There's more than one way to reach the
northernmost continent. If you can't walk
to it, maybe try flying or swimming to it?

rows.label: TownInfo141_3
rows.name:
Even our Blue Bloods can't endure the
punishing heat of the lava in Cauldros.
So make sure not to touch it if you ever
go there, all right?

rows.label: TownInfo141_4
rows.name:
The sky above Cauldros seems to be the
hunting ground of extremely powerful indigens.
You're honestly safer traveling by foot.

rows.label: TownInfo141_5
rows.name:
Who do you think built that mining machinery
in Cauldros? It doesn't seem like it was the
Growth...but then who was it?

rows.label: TownInfo142_1
rows.name:
What do you think that percentage displayed
on BLADE Tower represents? It seems to be
slowly ticking down to something, right?
It's seriously making me nervous.

rows.label: TownInfo142_2
rows.name:
I'd never have guessed the percentage
displayed on BLADE Tower was counting
down the power left in the Lifepoint.
And now that I know, I really wish I didn't!

rows.label: TownInfo142_3
rows.name:
What a strange time to be alive. The Nopon
Commerce Guild has set up shop as an arms
manufacturer. Never imagined I'd be giving
those fuzzbutts my money...

rows.label: TownInfo142_4
rows.name:
Factory 1.21 makes a lot of weapons with
unique shapes, but they all seem pretty
powerful. I'd love to try one out someday.

rows.label: TownInfo142_5
rows.name:
Our battle with the Growth may be over,
but as long as there are dangerous indigens
about, we still need good gear. I hope other
xenos join the Ma-non and sell their wares.

rows.label: TownInfo143_1
rows.name:
A cute girl just asked me the way to BLADE
Tower. She probably just arrived and doesn't
know her way around yet. Still, it was the
highlight of my day.

rows.label: TownInfo144_1
rows.name:
BLADE has placed equipment caches in 
each district of the city. Let's hope the day
never arrives when they need to use them.

rows.label: TownInfo144_2
rows.name:
I've heard that when they're outside NLA,
BLADEs sleep in tents at their base camps.
Apparently they're more spacious and
comfortable than they sound.

rows.label: TownInfo145_1
rows.name:
Now Hope's helping out in the industrial
district! Is that woman just gonna work
herself until she collapses?

rows.label: TownInfo146_1
rows.name:
Interceptors remove threats so Pathfinders can
install data probes, which lets Landbankers
harvest miranium. They're like gears in a
well-oiled machine.

rows.label: TownInfo146_2
rows.name:
The miranium the Landbankers harvest is used
to develop new weapons that are tested by
the Arms. They're like gears in a well-oiled
machine that just keep turning.

rows.label: TownInfo146_3
rows.name:
I've heard a giant lophid has been sighted in
the sea surrounding the solitary island at the
northern tip of Primordia. I hope this doesn't
interfere with the Landbankers' work there.

rows.label: TownInfo146_4
rows.name:
Some people think it's a mistake to promote
private enterprise at this time—but if we don't
invest in arms manufacturers now, they may
not be able to meet our needs in the future.

rows.label: TownInfo146_5
rows.name:
Once NLA is complete, ships could be next.
Then the ship-building industry is really gonna
heat up! I'd get into that business now, if I
were you. Cha-ching. You dig me?

rows.label: TownInfo147_1
rows.name:
You know how BLADE has base camps all
over the planet now? Well, I heard it was a
major hassle hauling in provisions and
protecting the supply routes.

rows.label: TownInfo147_2
rows.name:
I don't mind camping, but no way in hell am I
eating mystery indigen meat. I mean, what if
it's poisonous and I'm trapped in the wilds?
Huh? What then?

rows.label: TownInfo147_3
rows.name:
I can't believe someone jumped and killed
themselves right here. It's such a shame...

rows.label: TownInfo147_4
rows.name:
It turned out the suicide that happened here
wasn't a suicide at all—it was a murder!
And that guy from the pizza restaurant was
the one who did it! I'm still in shock...

rows.label: TownInfo147_5
rows.name:
I hope we can maintain this peace. If we
could dispense with all the fighting, I might
actually have a modicum of optimism about
all the things we still have to do.

rows.label: TownInfo148_1
rows.name:
Your Enemy Index records detailed information
about all the enemies you've defeated.
It would be a real waste not to take
advantage of it.

rows.label: TownInfo148_2
rows.name:
I've heard that since the Ma-non came here,
our water consumption has increased so much
that the repurification systems can't keep up.

rows.label: TownInfo148_3
rows.name:
Using the water from Biahno Lake to solve
our water shortage is a pretty good idea.
The water on this planet is potable and
plentiful, after all.

rows.label: TownInfo148_4
rows.name:
I saw a cute xeno girl sunbathing in the park.
That's the sort of thing that makes me feel like
everything's right with the world.

rows.label: TownInfo148_5
rows.name:
We humans were able to work together with
the xenoforms. If only the Growth had been
willing to cooperate, none of this would have
happened.

rows.label: TownInfo149_1
rows.name:
This is an office building for private firms.
They deal in apparel, publishing, food
services—you name it!

rows.label: TownInfo149_2
rows.name:
Since the city isn't finished and our population
is small, all private companies receive
assistance from the government. Frankly,
I don't know if they'd survive without help.

rows.label: TownInfo149_3
rows.name:
Businesses have been working as hard as ever
since coming to this planet. Mira is so rich in
natural resources that some items are actually
cheaper than they were on Earth.

rows.label: TownInfo149_4
rows.name:
As an energy source, miranium has a fantastic
cost-performance ratio. It's not only important
to the arms manufacturers—normal businesses
like ours need it as well.

rows.label: TownInfo149_5
rows.name:
What the human business community needs
now is more diversity. After all, these xenos
are potential customers too!

rows.label: TownInfo150_1
rows.name:
Using transports is the quickest way to move
from district to district within NLA,
especially if you don't have a car or Doll
of your own.

rows.label: TownInfo150_2
rows.name:
Most resources are precious, so think long and
hard about how you want to use them. As for
miranium, it's plentiful enough to be put to use
whenever you want.

rows.label: TownInfo150_3
rows.name:
Find some treasure you can't open?
Word on the street is you'll need to
acquire certain special skills first!

rows.label: TownInfo150_4
rows.name:
Most of Cauldros seems to be under the
Growth's control. But if we could sneak into
their headquarters and steal their supplies...

rows.label: TownInfo150_5
rows.name:
Have you noticed the headless statues scattered
throughout Cauldros? Are they marking the
graves of the area's former inhabitants?
And if so, who were they?

rows.label: TownInfo151_1
rows.name:
BLADEs work hard outside the city, and we
work hard within the city. That's the Union
of labor, and you better believe we're gonna
do our part.

rows.label: TownInfo151_2
rows.name:
Hey, um... Listen, I just saw a xeno that I've
never seen before in the industrial district.
I'm not sure that it's supposed to be there...

rows.label: TownInfo151_3
rows.name:
That unknown xeno in the industrial district?
Apparently everyone is calling it "Doctor B"
for...some reason.

rows.label: TownInfo151_4
rows.name:
Doctor B sure ascended to the role of
company president quickly. Does he even
know HOW to run a company?

rows.label: TownInfo151_5
rows.name:
Despite being an individually-run arms
manufacturer, Factory 1.21 sure produces
some incredible items! I guess Doctor B
really was something special...

rows.label: TownInfo152_1
rows.name:
It's hard to imagine we're the only ones who
have landed on this planet, but the last two
months have been so peaceful...

rows.label: TownInfo152_2
rows.name:
The Ma-non keep pretty loose work schedules.
I'd complain about their long lunch breaks,
but I've seen them working quietly till all hours
of the night, so it's probably fine.

rows.label: TownInfo153_1
rows.name:
Captain Nagi—or rather, Secretary Nagi—has
earned our trust. He may have lost the White
Whale, but we've only come back stronger!

rows.label: TownInfo153_2
rows.name:
I sure see Nagi and Vandham together a lot.
I wonder if they've been friends since before
all this happened.

rows.label: TownInfo153_3
rows.name:
I swear it's true! Secretary Nagi lives a second
life in which he performs the normal duties of
a BLADE operative! You have to believe me!

rows.label: TownInfo153_4
rows.name:
I saw Secretary Nagi at the intersection on
North Founders Street at eight o'clock this
morning! Eight! In the MORNING! So you
totally HAVE to believe me now, right?

rows.label: TownInfo153_5
rows.name:
Secretary Nagi is Japanese, right? I wonder if
that means he has some connection with
Sakuraba Industries...

rows.label: TownInfo154_1
rows.name:
Primordia is a lot scarier at night. A LOT.
Big, nasty indigens that don't appear during
the day come out and strut around like they
own the joint.

rows.label: TownInfo154_2
rows.name:
It's hard to find even a single one of those
super-rare collectibles, right? Well, I know
you won't believe this, but some occasionally
appear in coastal waters near the continents.

rows.label: TownInfo154_3
rows.name:
Have you ever climbed onto that giant ring
in Valley of Oblivion? I bet the views from up there are
incredible!

rows.label: TownInfo154_4
rows.name:
Do you know that stuck-up jerk, Tobias? 
Lately he seems to be searching for someone.
And whoever that someone is, they have my 
deepest sympathies. Ha!

rows.label: TownInfo154_5
rows.name:
Whoever designed FrontierNet doesn't get
enough credit. If we didn't have it, that search
for the Lifepoint would have been a whole lot
harder.

rows.label: TownInfo155_1
rows.name:
I've been on this planet for two whole months,
and it's about time I found myself a boyfriend.
Ideally, I'd like to meet a BLADE with a Doll
license. ...Who is handsome. ...And rich.

rows.label: TownInfo155_2
rows.name:
When you consider that we may never find
the Lifepoint, doesn't it seem ridiculous to
spend every day working? I mean, shouldn't
we be out whooping it up while we can?

rows.label: TownInfo155_3
rows.name:
I just got a tongue lashing from Dreamy
McGlasses. Then he told me to do my job
and never give up until the light fades from
my eyes. It was pretty intense!

rows.label: TownInfo155_4
rows.name:
So my BLADE friend? He went to Valley of Oblivion.
Some place called the Dorian Caravan,
I think? And he hasn't come back since.
I really hope he's okay...

rows.label: TownInfo155_5
rows.name:
My friend Milly was saying there are giant 
Nopon that are almost 10 times bigger than
normal ones. That's like six meters tall!
It would be so scary!

rows.label: TownInfo156_1
rows.name:
How about we meet again tonight? We can
talk about how to survive all the threats
facing NLA and how best to find the
Lifepoint...among other things.

rows.label: TownInfo156_2
rows.name:
I don't think we'll be able to explore Valley of Oblivion
by conventional means. Much of the terrain is
impassible on foot, and there are Growth
bases scattered throughout.

rows.label: TownInfo156_3
rows.name:
When I went to, er..."confer" with Kirsty, she
told me not to even talk to her because she
was far too busy thinking about Sylvalum.
Can you even BELIEVE that?

rows.label: TownInfo156_4
rows.name:
I went to ask a Nopon in the Dorian Caravan
for information about the Lifepoint, and he said
the answer would cost me 1,000,000 credits!
Man, I only have, like, 70...

rows.label: TownInfo156_5
rows.name:
Our research found that the auravis in Valley of Oblivion
occasionally mistake treasure for food and
take it back to their nests. Sooo...yeah.
I can't believe this is what I do all day.

rows.label: TownInfo157_1
rows.name:
A BLADE friend of mine was attacked by what
is known as an Overed—an unusually powerful
version of common indigens. Apparently he
was the only survivor. So be careful out there!

rows.label: TownInfo157_2
rows.name:
You know how an electromagnetic storm can
screw up your sensors? Well, I bet it does the
same thing to mechanoid enemies. That could
provide a perfect opening to attack!

rows.label: TownInfo157_3
rows.name:
Just before dawn, I stumbled into some secret
meeting in the industrial district, and a woman
there pointed a gun at me! For reals!
I almost got shot!

rows.label: TownInfo157_4
rows.name:
That Murderess lady who pointed a gun at me
is apparently some notorious outlaw. Now I
treat each and every day as a gift...

rows.label: TownInfo157_5
rows.name:
I can't get that Murderess woman out of my
head. I know if I saw her again she'd only be
cruel to me, but I still can't stop! Oh, why do
I always fall for bad girls?

rows.label: TownInfo158_1
rows.name:
They've managed to reconstruct the flight path
of the White Whale as it crashed. Sounds like
it entered the atmosphere above Valley of Oblivion's
Lake Basel and circled Mira from there.

rows.label: TownInfo159_1
rows.name:
The weapons from Grenada Galactic Group
are really cool. It makes me wanna sign up
for BLADE so I'd have a reason to use 'em!

rows.label: TownInfo159_2
rows.name:
Even the BLADE emergency supply caches are
sort of badass. See for yourself! There's one
right behind the cathedral in the residential
district.

rows.label: TownInfo159_3
rows.name:
I need to get a hip-hop scene started in NLA.
Surely the BLADEs would be happy to have
some new music to listen to, right?

rows.label: TownInfo159_4
rows.name:
Aw, man! I did NOT see that coming.
The Ma-non have more rhythm than we do! 
My pride as a human has been shattered...

rows.label: TownInfo159_5
rows.name:
I'm gonna do it! I'm gonna start a record
company, and I'm gonna sign Ma-non as
hip-hop artists! When their records start
dropping, I'm gonna make fat cheddar...

rows.label: TownInfo160_1
rows.name:
Just go straight home and into bed, okay? 
Do that, and it'll be morning before you
know it.

rows.label: TownInfo160_2
rows.name:
You know the Ma-non have technology way
beyond anything we had on Earth, so you
probably don't want to be making fun of how
short they are.

rows.label: TownInfo160_3
rows.name:
They found wreckage from the White Whale in
the northern side of the Northeast Plain near
Sayram Lake. They want to send BLADEs out
to salvage it, but can't spare the manpower.

rows.label: TownInfo160_4
rows.name:
I heard there was a cave in the cliffs in the
northwest part of Primordia. If there's treasure
in there, I know just what I'd do with it.

rows.label: TownInfo160_5
rows.name:
With all these xenos moving in, our city is
changing. They certainly make it more lively,
but at the same time, I kind of miss the way
it used to be.

rows.label: TownInfo161_1
rows.name:
You all better watch out for the Companions.
You may start trouble, but they'll be the ones
who finish it. They're some of BLADE's finest.

rows.label: TownInfo161_2
rows.name:
I saw a stuffed animal lying on the ground in
the industrial district outside the Arms test
hangar. There was something kind of...creepy
about it, so I just kept walking.

rows.label: TownInfo161_3
rows.name:
If you see any stuffed lobsters around,
keep your distance! The rumor is that they're 
actually bombs!

rows.label: TownInfo161_4
rows.name:
That Blood Lobster has got to be some sort of
Growth spy, right? I hope BLADE finds him
and deals with him appropriately.

rows.label: TownInfo161_5
rows.name:
I never imagined the person setting bombs in
NLA would turn out to be a Companion.
He must have gone plumb loco after we
landed on this planet.

rows.label: TownInfo162_1
rows.name:
Nice job making it up here! Good for you!
Makes me wish I had something interesting
to tell you. Let's see... Um... Oh! Did you
know that dogs sweat through their paws?

rows.label: TownInfo162_2
rows.name:
You're asking how I got up on the roof?
We all got Blue Bloods, youngster!
Anyone could do it!

rows.label: TownInfo162_3
rows.name:
We fell for that Growth diversion like a
bunch of mopes! If they were looking to
destroy stuff, there would have been way
more damage to this area.

rows.label: TownInfo162_4
rows.name:
I heard they spotted a giant scirpo in Nightglow Forest
during a foggy period. You all watch out for
that, okay?

rows.label: TownInfo162_5
rows.name:
Call me crazy, but I want to climb to the top
of BLADE Tower. And why? Well, because it's
there, of course!

rows.label: TownInfo163_1
rows.name:
Why are all these people surrounding me?
I'm not famous, right?

rows.label: TownInfo163_2
rows.name:
Our technology is pretty advanced, you know?
I mean, we can boil water in a second.
A literal second. Like, as in, one. So we could
even boil humans if we wanted to, right?

rows.label: TownInfo163_3
rows.name:
I don't think people like the way we Ma-non
talk. Which is hard, you know? Because to us,
everyone else just sounds kind of...assertive?

rows.label: TownInfo163_4
rows.name:
I'm glad that humans appreciate the greatness
of Ma-non now. But but I think what I really
want is for someone to buy me pizza?

rows.label: TownInfo163_5
rows.name:
So if you want a new career, maybe consider
joining Candid & Credible? We pay in pizza.
Pizza! Two per hour! That's a really fair deal,
don't you think?

rows.label: TownInfo164_1
rows.name:
As the White Whale crashed, we looked down
at the planet and saw nothing outside of the
five continents. So where is the Lifepoint?

rows.label: TownInfo164_2
rows.name:
Dogs sure are cute! Whenever I see Lin 
playing with one here during the day,
it always makes me want one of my own.

rows.label: TownInfo164_3
rows.name:
No one digs graves for the dead these days.
What's the point? Once we find the Lifepoint,
the dead will be able to return to their real
bodies.

rows.label: TownInfo164_4
rows.name:
Are we really going to find the Lifepoint?
Or are we gonna die in these Blue Bloods
without ever returning to our real bodies?

rows.label: TownInfo164_5
rows.name:
After we found the Lifepoint, I asked my
boyfriend when we'll be able to return to our
real bodies. He just said, "In a little while."
Does that seem intentionally vague to you?

rows.label: TownInfo165_1
rows.name:
Sure, we party hard at night, but when the
sun comes up we always put in a hard day's
work. ...No, seriously!

rows.label: TownInfo165_2
rows.name:
I was watching some footage earlier and
noticed some of the Growth mechs deployed
along the outer walls of Sylvalum were
destroyed. Seriously!

rows.label: TownInfo165_3
rows.name:
I saw a woman wearing strange clothes
suddenly transform into a BLADE! Seriously!
What the heck was that about?!

rows.label: TownInfo165_4
rows.name:
I saw an Orphean happily drinking water from
the fountain! I swear it! Double pinky swear!

rows.label: TownInfo165_5
rows.name:
If the Growth really are a part of a giant
interstellar federation known as Samaar,
theeeeeen...we're pretty well screwed. Right?

rows.label: TownInfo166_1
rows.name:
The arms manufacturers have their own
building near the entrance to Armory Alley.
They have dedicated terminals outside for
buying gear and donating resources.

rows.label: TownInfo166_2
rows.name:
Apparently it's true that the Bias used to
eat Nopon. What a bunch of jerks!

rows.label: TownInfo166_3
rows.name:
A Zaruboggan, I think? It was acting like it
wanted to say something to me but gave up
and went back to the Ma-non ship. 
Maybe it was looking for something?

rows.label: TownInfo166_4
rows.name:
Did you hear how the Growth basically
treated the Zaruboggan as little more than
disposable scouts? What a heartless way to
behave toward an ally!

rows.label: TownInfo166_5
rows.name:
It doesn't seem like it would be so bad to be
a Zaruboggan. I mean, sure, your role in life
is determined when you're born, so you don't
have freedom—but the job security is great!

rows.label: TownInfo167_1
rows.name:
All of BLADE is still busy searching for the
Lifepoint. We need to do our part by making
sure we don't do anything to distract them
from their duties.

rows.label: TownInfo167_2
rows.name:
I guess there's no end to the assignments
available on the Quest Board board, huh?
So if we think we could help with one, we
should take the initiative and do it.

rows.label: TownInfo167_3
rows.name:
If any of us have a major problem that
requires the assistance of others to solve,
we should take it to BLADE HQ. They'll
put it up on Quest Board for us.

rows.label: TownInfo167_4
rows.name:
I saw a Nopon collapsed in the residential
district! Poor little guy looked sick or crazy
or something, so I just kept my distance.

rows.label: TownInfo167_5
rows.name:
We're living in a time when even Nopon
can become BLADEs! Does that seem weird
to you? I mean, they're just little balls of fluff!
...Ah, well. If they can help, so be it.

rows.label: TownInfo168_1
rows.name:
They say none of the BLADEs sent to the
northwest part of Primordia have returned.
Maybe they found something there?
Something good, hopefully?

rows.label: TownInfo168_2
rows.name:
If a BLADE finds anything that could be a
usable resource, they have to examine it.
And I mean ANYTHING. Even dung from
some indigen in Valley of Oblivion.

rows.label: TownInfo168_3
rows.name:
I saw Sakuraba's new line of ground gear at
the Arms test hangar. Man, I would KILL
to get my hands on some of those babies!
...Er, not literally, of course. But you know.

rows.label: TownInfo168_4
rows.name:
Even if you do find a Growth base, you
shouldn't just launch a frontal assault. A better
tactic would be to find a hidden or lightly
guarded entrance and sneak in.

rows.label: TownInfo168_5
rows.name:
The speed with which we're surveying Mira is
due in large part to Elma's team. I'd like to
thank them personally one day.

rows.label: TownInfo169_1
rows.name:
The best way to earn credits is to carry out
assignments. My friend in the Avalanchers says
you gotta be diligent about checking in at
Quest Board!

rows.label: TownInfo169_2
rows.name:
When I went to lunch earlier, I saw a Ma-non
arguing with some kind of xeno I've not seen
before, near the restaurant. I hope that doesn't
become...a thing? The arguing, I mean...

rows.label: TownInfo170_1
rows.name:
The quarantine procedure of this city is quite
the hassle, don't you think? I mean,
we Ma-non are already so so much cleaner
than humans, so...

rows.label: TownInfo170_2
rows.name:
We Ma-non also want to defeat the Growth,
but we're still a bit uncomfortable about the
idea of supplying weapons. I guess we prefer
defense over offense, if that makes sense?

rows.label: TownInfo170_3
rows.name:
I think the Companion named Beats who patrols
the commercial district is is is searching for
electronic books while he works?
That's human diligence for you...

rows.label: TownInfo170_4
rows.name:
Have you noticed humans seem to regard
Ma-non as if we were take-out meals?
Really wish they wouldn't do that, you know?

rows.label: TownInfo170_5
rows.name:
Vandham is very rough with the Ma-non,
don't you think? But so long as he gives us
pizza, I guess we'll be okay with it...

rows.label: TownInfo171_1
rows.name:
It is testament to how much Nopon value
human friends that Elder Nan, big cheese of
caravans, came to city!

rows.label: TownInfo171_2
rows.name:
Nopon no longer scared of Bias thanks to
human friends bashing them in face.
Now they not eat Nopon like marshmallows
anymore.

rows.label: TownInfo171_3
rows.name:
Economic outlook in NLA is good!
Maybe this is time to leave caravan and start
independent small business.

rows.label: TownInfo171_4
rows.name:
Miia not like Nopon after all—she only have
eye for stupid cat! Time to give her pieces of
mind next time she comes to commercial
district! Meh!

rows.label: TownInfo171_5
rows.name:
Meh-meh! Tried to open Nopon Café,
but big shots say plan violate city health code.
So why is café where friends pet cat okay?!

rows.label: TownInfo172_1
rows.name:
So when we Ma-non fled from the Growth,
we spent a lot of time researching Mira,
you know? But but we still didn't find your
Lifepoint anywhere...

rows.label: TownInfo172_2
rows.name:
Humans have such crazy fashions, right?
Not like us Ma-non. We change clothes
maybe once a year? Something like that?

rows.label: TownInfo172_3
rows.name:
So so I saw an alien container near the
Delusian Mountains. But I figured it was
probably full of junk and stuff, so I just...
left it alone?

rows.label: TownInfo172_4
rows.name:
The Orphe are strange, right? Very strange.
They seem rational but make decisions based
on some animal instinct we don't understand,
if that makes sense?

rows.label: TownInfo172_5
rows.name:
Now that the Growth are gone, doesn't it
seem like the alien races are much happier?

rows.label: TownInfo173_1
rows.name:
I've never seen a city like this, you know?
It's great! So so great! Isn't it great?

rows.label: TownInfo173_2
rows.name:
The Growth's attack seemed half-hearted,
didn't it? They didn't even try to murder
everyone or...all that. Maybe they actually just
wanted to steal that Doll?

rows.label: TownInfo173_3
rows.name:
You humans defeated the Zu Pharg, right?
Good. If it came here, it would have probably
destroyed everything you love!

rows.label: TownInfo173_4
rows.name:
This Lifepoint is very important to you humans,
isn't it? Well, we really hope you find it!
So don't let the Growth get there first, okay?

rows.label: TownInfo173_5
rows.name:
Now that things have settled down, let's make
a new food that beats hamburgers, hot dogs,
and pizza, okay? I mean, Ma-non should take
the lead in culinary tech, don't you think?

rows.label: TownInfo174_1
rows.name:
It's a lot of fun looking at Nopon merchandise.
And they are just so darn CUTE when they
explain how it works! I'm definitely coming
back any time I feel low.

rows.label: TownInfo174_2
rows.name:
I think I bought too much. Now I have to earn
a bunch of rewards by doing assignments
from Quest Board in order to get my head
above water. Damn you, easy credit terms!

rows.label: TownInfo174_3
rows.name:
Hey, can I ask you some questions about 
Nightglow Forest? Your caravan went there a bunch
of times, right?

rows.label: TownInfo174_4
rows.name:
A Doll was shot down at the Decapotamon
and hasn't been recovered yet? That's great
intel! I'm gonna head right over to Nightglow Forest.

rows.label: TownInfo174_5
rows.name:
When the survey of Mira is finally complete,
I wonder if the Unions will be reorganized?
After all, the Pathfinders and Testamenters will
be out of a job.

rows.label: TownInfo175_1
rows.name:
Can we take containers in lower level
of residential district? They might make
nice chairs.

rows.label: TownInfo175_2
rows.name:
Carrying cargo is easy. But your instructions
are hard to understand.

rows.label: TownInfo175_3
rows.name:
Tree Clan girls are sweet.
Cavern Clan girls are ugly hags!

rows.label: TownInfo175_4
rows.name:
Tree Clan wandered for 10,000 suns before
coming here. Sometimes I want to leave city
and go hunt in nature.

rows.label: TownInfo175_5
rows.name:
Tree Clan was beaten by Cavern Clan and fled
to Mira. Now Tree Clan is strong again.
Thank you, Earth-alien friends!

rows.label: TownInfo176_1
rows.name:
Nopon came first, so we veterans on planet!
Humans and Ma-non and Growth should
all bow to Nopon wisdom!

rows.label: TownInfo176_2
rows.name:
When friends eat red pollen orb, it feel like
party in head with everyone invited!
Maybe new Ma-non friend wants some...

rows.label: TownInfo176_3
rows.name:
Meh! Tried to bring red pollen orb into city,
but got yelled at by scary man. He said
red pollen not good for eating.

rows.label: TownInfo176_4
rows.name:
Friends should take Ma-non ship, attack Jair 
Fortress, and steal treasure that is there!

rows.label: TownInfo176_5
rows.name:
Genius flash! Friends should use Ma-non ship
to carry Nopon cargo and make big profit!

rows.label: TownInfo177_1
rows.name:
As you can see, this area is still under 
construction. I wouldn't get too close if I
were you—it's just not very safe.

rows.label: TownInfo177_2
rows.name:
This guy Hugo in the industrial district got all
excited about how he'd made some earth-
shattering discovery, but when he tried to
explain it? Whoosh! Right over my head.

rows.label: TownInfo177_3
rows.name:
Can you believe that thing hovering over the
city? It's floating in midair, yet I've never seen
it move so much as an inch. How do they
keep it so stable?

rows.label: TownInfo177_4
rows.name:
I'm glad the city's safe. I thought it'd be a 
smoldering ruin, frankly, but there wasn't much
damage at all. We probably don't even need
to delay our construction schedule.

rows.label: TownInfo177_5
rows.name:
They found the Lifepoint, so now it's our turn.
Let's get out there and build NLA!

rows.label: TownInfo178_1
rows.name:
Some indigens seem to be able to take
defensive actions. At times like that, you just
have to wait the crafty buggers out.

rows.label: TownInfo178_2
rows.name:
I wish we could have weapons for self-defense.
Also, it'd be great if Sakuraba Industries sold
their Cobra assault rifle to citizens, because
something called that HAS to be awesome.

rows.label: TownInfo178_3
rows.name:
Sometimes I see flashbacks of Earth from two
years ago, like I was suddenly in a dream.
I wonder what's left of Earth now.
Rocks and junk I suppose, yeah?

rows.label: TownInfo178_4
rows.name:
Hey, you know that Gus guy? I hear he's up
to some real shady business. You ask me,
BLADE would be better off without him
around.

rows.label: TownInfo178_5
rows.name:
Bias aren't all cut from the same cloth.
Even among the Cavern Clan, there's this one
named Slovity who seems like a real stand-up
gal. I think I could probably trust her? Maybe?

rows.label: TownInfo179_1
rows.name:
It'd be hard to afford a car like this...
Cars are a luxury here, and they cost way
more than they ever did on Earth.

rows.label: TownInfo179_2
rows.name:
Cars are like Dolls—if you get 'em insured,
you'll be covered even if they get wrecked.
...Er, you DO have insurance, right?

rows.label: TownInfo179_3
rows.name:
Salvage tickets seem to be the equivalent of
an insurance policy for Dolls. If you don't
have one of those, you'll have to pay out of
your own pocket.

rows.label: TownInfo179_4
rows.name:
I was looking at footage of the North Silent
Sandsea earlier when I saw an ovis herd.
And man, their leader seemed like a real
badass! I'd like to see him in real life one day.

rows.label: TownInfo179_5
rows.name:
When NLA is finally finished, we should
have a street race. The Companions might try
to bust us, but I ain't gonna live in fear, man!
Fight the power!

rows.label: TownInfo180_1
rows.name:
This is the first time I've been off duty in a
long time. Still, I gotta make sure I'm ready in
case they need to call me back.

rows.label: TownInfo180_2
rows.name:
The Growth in Sylvalum seem a lot tougher
than the ones around here. It looks like they're
mostly made up of Marnuck instead of
Bias.

rows.label: TownInfo180_3
rows.name:
Be careful when searching beneath the
noctilucent spheres in Sylvalum, okay?
That's where vivohasts like to hide in hopes
of trapping prey.

rows.label: TownInfo180_4
rows.name:
I'd like to survey the mountains northwest
of Lake Ciel in Sylvalum, but there's no way
I can do it with a normal Doll.

rows.label: TownInfo180_5
rows.name:
There are six caves in Sylvalum.
I guess our survey still has a ways to go.

rows.label: TownInfo181_1
rows.name:
To get to Valley of Oblivion, leave through NLA's
east gate and head due east to Janpath Lake.
Then cross the plains north of the lake and
boom! You're in business.

rows.label: TownInfo181_2
rows.name:
FrontierNet is showing a hit in Valley of Oblivion,
but we can't check it out because the target
area is right next to a base of hostile xenos.

rows.label: TownInfo181_3
rows.name:
Compared to what's outside, NLA is
paradise. It's well protected, surrounded by
high walls, and home to good people.

rows.label: TownInfo181_4
rows.name:
A fine meal, a warm bath, and a good night's
sleep... Even with Blue Bloods, such things
are still necessities for our mental health.

rows.label: TownInfo181_5
rows.name:
With the Lifepoint found, we can finally return
to our bodies. I'm looking forward to it, but...
Well, I'm also kinda worried.

rows.label: TownInfo182_1
rows.name:
Bias like nature and simple things.
We prefer to fight with bow and arrows.
Growth beam weapons are no good for us.

rows.label: TownInfo182_2
rows.name:
Tree Clan relies too much on Earth aliens.
They fight Cavern Clan all alone now.

rows.label: TownInfo182_3
rows.name:
Earth aliens are kind to Bias.
Ma-non are also kind to Bias.
Both should visit Bias home planet of
Tormein as honored guests!

rows.label: TownInfo182_4
rows.name:
Earth-alien women are strange. Some even
buy big houses and live in them together.

rows.label: TownInfo182_5
rows.name:
Bias will repay debt to Earth aliens in time.
That is Tree Clan way.

rows.label: TownInfo183_1
rows.name:
If you choose your equipment to suit the
weather, you can fight more effectively.
But the weather on Mira is fickle, so matching
isn't as easy as I just made it sound.

rows.label: TownInfo183_2
rows.name:
Can you believe the Nopon have caravans
in both Sylvalum and Cauldros? They're
tough little buggers, I'll give 'em that.

rows.label: TownInfo183_3
rows.name:
As the survey of Mira progresses, it's a good
idea to revisit the base camps and caravans
from time to time. You never know when you
might be able to garner some new intel.

rows.label: TownInfo183_4
rows.name:
If you land at the northern part of Cauldros,
you might be able to avoid the Growth
altogether.

rows.label: TownInfo183_5
rows.name:
There seem to be some landmasses that 
FrontierNet can't fully survey—mostly isolated
islands floating in the sea. I wonder if there's
anything on them...

rows.label: TownInfo184_1
rows.name:
Bias were slaves in Valley of Oblivion.
Things should be different here.

rows.label: TownInfo184_2
rows.name:
Growth treats Bias like dogs because of
Cavern Clan. They are easily controlled fools!

rows.label: TownInfo184_3
rows.name:
Bias can't fit in your tiny Dolls.
Only puny Earth aliens can fit! Har har!

rows.label: TownInfo184_4
rows.name:
I hear of Sylvalum cave where Marnuck hid
great treasure by south wall...

rows.label: TownInfo184_5
rows.name:
There are no plants in Valley of Oblivion, but many here.
This is strange. They are very close.
They should both have plants!

rows.label: TownInfo185_1
rows.name:
Blue Bloods seem like very very good tech,
don't you think? Especially since you can 
control them remotely from the Lifepoint while
you sleep...

rows.label: TownInfo185_2
rows.name:
The Growth are way way too strong.
Oh, and their Larsian allies are a big
problem. Maybe someone should stop them
from teaming up?

rows.label: TownInfo185_3
rows.name:
Did you know I peeked at the humans' new
Doll? It looked pretty good! Might even be
able to take care of that giant Zu Pharg
machine if it comes back. ...Er, I hope?

rows.label: TownInfo185_4
rows.name:
This war seems to be really hard on humans,
doesn't it? But don't worry—we Ma-non will
do everything we can to to to help you from
within the safety of the city walls.

rows.label: TownInfo185_5
rows.name:
Humans sure are hard workers, aren't they?
They kill the Growth, then go right back to
to surveying Mira. I think most Ma-non would
take a vacation in between...

rows.label: TownInfo186_1
rows.name:
Offering your miranium to Candid & Credible
is smart. So so smart! We'll make something
much better than humans would, you know?

rows.label: TownInfo186_2
rows.name:
The machine recovered from Nightglow Forest must be
very important to the Growth, right? I mean,
look how badly they wanted it back...

rows.label: TownInfo186_3
rows.name:
There are scarier things in Nightglow Forest than even
the Growth, you know? So, um, probably
best to just...stay away?

rows.label: TownInfo186_4
rows.name:
You know unafulges? They live in the Celestial
Ascent at Nightglow Forest, and and are dangerous
even when separated from their schools.

rows.label: TownInfo186_5
rows.name:
You put data probes everywhere, yes?
Human tenacity is so so so incredible!
We Ma-non could probably learn much from
studying you...

rows.label: TownInfo187_1
rows.name:
Alas, I must decline this "cola" you offer.
We Orphe drink only water.

rows.label: TownInfo187_2
rows.name:
Even the Growth have not managed to
locate this Lifepoint for which you humans
so very feverishly search.

rows.label: TownInfo187_3
rows.name:
We'd never have been beaten and used by
the Growth if we'd had access to resources
on the level of the Ma-non ship—or even those
you used to construct NLA.

rows.label: TownInfo187_4
rows.name:
I recall hearing a report that a human-made
Doll had been shot down near King's Falls.
Shouldn't you recover that? Mmm?
Or am I out of line suggesting so?

rows.label: TownInfo187_5
rows.name:
Might I ask you a question? Where does
the energy that powers NLA come from?
Is there a power source in a place that
we have yet to be informed about?

rows.label: TownInfo188_1
rows.name:
What are you doing here?! You ruin secret
plan to sneak into kitchen from roof!

rows.label: TownInfo188_2
rows.name:
Nopon cherish Enduron lead as symbol of
bond between couples. This very important
knowledge! Friend should remember it!

rows.label: TownInfo188_3
rows.name:
Has friend heard of Sword of Legendaryness?
Nopon pass down tale of powerful sword for
generations. But it probably all talk...

rows.label: TownInfo188_4
rows.name:
Friends look like little pieces of trash blowing
in breeze when seen from up here.

rows.label: TownInfo188_5
rows.name:
Why are Nopon in this place?
Why are Nopon even on this planet?

rows.label: TownInfo189_1
rows.name:
Humans are most generous. *fssssh*
Even knowing what we Zaruboggan are like,
they don't enslave us. Perhaps a similar past
experience gives them empathy?

rows.label: TownInfo189_2
rows.name:
Cauldros is a terrifying place.
We were ordered to survey the lava flows,
and many lives were lost. *fssssh*

rows.label: TownInfo189_3
rows.name:
Our survey of the Stonelattice Cavern in
Primordia was equally treacherous. *fssssh*
Four of my friends fell into lava after being
attacked by a terrible creature.

rows.label: TownInfo189_4
rows.name:
I barely escaped with my life during our survey
of the Divine Roost in Nightglow Forest. *fsssh*
Every last one of my companions were killed.

rows.label: TownInfo189_5
rows.name:
*fsssh* Being in this city and speaking so
casually with you makes me feel guilt for all
the friends I've lost. But I suppose such is the
nature of peace.

rows.label: TownInfo190_1
rows.name:
Ask Sun'barac's group to tell you about their
time with the Growth. I am confident they
have information you humans will find useful.

rows.label: TownInfo190_2
rows.name:
Sun'barac was one of the five Orpheans
who provided technology to the Growth.
What an ill-fated decision that was.

rows.label: TownInfo190_3
rows.name:
Please recommend Orpheus Parfait
equipment to your BLADE acquaintances.
It could increase their survival rate by as
much as five percent.

rows.label: TownInfo190_4
rows.name:
That reminds me... There was a giant
petramand that lived atop the magma waterfall
in Cauldros. It would have been quite the
menace had it existed on our planet.

rows.label: TownInfo190_5
rows.name:
I could never make light of human technology.
It's absolutely fascinating to see how far it's
advanced in just these last 10 years.

rows.label: TownInfo191_1
rows.name:
I just saw Ada getting advice from Hope.
It felt so strange to see their usual roles
reversed like that!

rows.label: TownInfo192_1
rows.name:
So the BLADE who went missing had saved up
a whole lot of scratch, eh? Maybe he was
targeted by someone because of his wealth.
Eat the rich and all that?

rows.label: TownInfo193_1
rows.name:
Rumor has it they've found a new piece of the
White Whale in Valley of Oblivion. Haven't recovered it
yet, but let's hope it's something good.

rows.label: TownInfo194_1
rows.name:
There seems to be quite the infestation of
blattas in Primordia. Just the thought of them
creeping into NLA makes my oatmeal
want to hit the wall.

rows.label: TownInfo195_1
rows.name:
You wanna come over for some hot pot? 
We'll just gather a bunch of local Miran
ingredients, cram 'em in a pot, and see
what happens. It'll be MAGICAL!

rows.label: TownInfo196_1
rows.name:
People sure seem to have a lot of accidents
in Nightglow Forest. If you head straight for a base
camp, you should be okay—but the thickly
forested areas are just murder.

rows.label: TownInfo196_2
rows.name:
I saw something I'd never seen before rolling
around the Sylvalum Searoad. I think it was
some sort of mechanical lifeform? Anyway,
I don't know, so I'd stay far, far away.

rows.label: TownInfo196_3
rows.name:
Arc Rock has got to have the most stunning
view in all Sylvalum—it's even higher than the
Delusian Mountains! Too bad you'd have
to fly to be able to reach it...

rows.label: TownInfo196_4
rows.name:
Traveling in Dolls attracts a lot of attention.
So when you're trying not to be noticed,
it's better to go on foot. Sneaky, sneaky!
...What? Was that last bit weird?

rows.label: TownInfo196_5
rows.name:
Now that we've found the Lifepoint, I bet we
can start restoring Earth's animals. I'd love to
pet a fuzzy bunny for once instead of running
from some crazed...whatever lives out here.

rows.label: TownInfo197_1
rows.name:
The missing person? Yeah, I'm not sure.
Sounds like he was meeting with a female
BLADE operative, but I don't know the details.

rows.label: TownInfo198_1
rows.name:
That missing guy was all excited about some
hot date he was headed to. Apparently the
lady was a BLADE or something?

rows.label: TownInfo199_1
rows.name:
The bullets that were fired at the Ma-non ship
originated from the direction of Bedrock Hold,
so it's dollars to donuts you'll find the
responsible party there.

rows.label: TownInfo200_1
rows.name:
Drill Sergeant Wolf wants to recruit xenoform
BLADEs to join the fight against the Growth.
As if any xeno could survive his training
regimen! Ha!

rows.label: TownInfo1142_1
rows.name:
Why won't you let me into your shop? 
Is is is it because I'm too short?

rows.label: TownInfo1142_2
rows.name:
Clothes that don't get clean unless you wash
them yourself? I've never seen such a thing.
Can can can you show me more of this
low-tech wizardry?

rows.label: TownInfo1142_3
rows.name:
When the Growth attacked, we let you take
refuge on our ship, right? So maybe you
could give me some kind of a...discount?

rows.label: TownInfo1142_4
rows.name:
The final battle with the Growth is upon us,
isn't it? Now fight hard, retail-store clerks!

rows.label: TownInfo1142_5
rows.name:
So the Growth have been defeated, right?
Does that mean you're going to hold a peace
and victory sale? With discounts of, say...
100 percent or so?

rows.label: TownInfo1452_1
rows.name:
This building is high, yet Earth aliens built it.
Your skills approach Growth's!

rows.label: TownInfo1452_2
rows.name:
Cavern Clan beat Tree Clan and joined
Growth. Now they are too strong.

rows.label: TownInfo1452_3
rows.name:
Growth are good for Cavern Clan.
They allow them to fight all year round.

rows.label: TownInfo1452_4
rows.name:
When Growth are destroyed, Cavern Clan
will weaken. Then we will war again!

rows.label: TownInfo1452_5
rows.name:
Growth are destroyed. Cavern Clan is weak.
Soon our war begins again!

rows.label: TownInfo1522_1
rows.name:
So the Orphe are too weak to fight, right?
Yet they managed to survive this long by
dividing themselves. That's basically what
worms do, isn't it?

rows.label: TownInfo1522_2
rows.name:
I'm pleased to announce a new collaboration
between Candid & Credible and Orphean
Technologies. Don't you think we'll produce
the greatest weapons ever?

rows.label: TownInfo1522_3
rows.name:
I regret to announce the cancellation of the
collaboration between Candid & Credible and
Orpheus Parfait. It, uh, seems we aren't
very good at listening to each other?

rows.label: TownInfo1582_1
rows.name:
I've been hearing Cedric grunting away in the
hangars at night. Has someone asked him
to create another ridiculous invention?

rows.label: TownInfo1692_1
rows.name:
Would you maybe teach me more about
humans? That could be very helpful...

rows.label: TownInfo1692_2
rows.name:
So I guess there was an incredibly high-tech
Doll found in Nightglow Forest? I don't suppose that
we Ma-non could maybe...get a look at it?

rows.label: TownInfo1692_3
rows.name:
So I guess there was an incredibly high-tech
Doll found in Nightglow Forest? Too bad we Ma-non
couldn't see it before it was lost...

rows.label: TownInfo1692_4
rows.name:
There's a traitor among the the the humans?
But I was so sure that our side would win!
I mean, they have all the pizza technology,
don't they?

rows.label: TownInfo1692_5
rows.name:
Even with our ship, it's impossible to escape
this planet, you know? But but if we keep
researching the problem, I'm sure we'll
eventually figure something out...

rows.label: TownInfo529_1
rows.name:
Meh-meh! Aerozium is completely sold out!
Mujiji from Dorian Caravan needs to send
more.

rows.label: TownInfo528_1
rows.name:
Does friend know Mujiji from Dorian Caravan
in Valley of Oblivion? Mujiji have total monopoly on
aerozium. Meh!

rows.label: TownInfo201_1
rows.name:
They're using mechanized bodies? That is so
so so awesome! Maybe someone will let me
dissect one and see how it works...

rows.label: TownInfo201_2
rows.name:
I can't believe the Growth were sent packing
like that. If the the humans are that strong,
they might even be able to take on the
Samaar Federation?

rows.label: TownInfo201_3
rows.name:
Even the Growth seem to believe there's
some sort of amazing power hidden inside
real human bodies, right? What could it be?

rows.label: TownInfo201_4
rows.name:
All sorts of races have gone to war with
the Growth and ended up crushed, right?
But humans won! They must be so strong,
you know?

rows.label: TownInfo202_1
rows.name:
Did you know Giogion and his friend Lu are
going to make gadgets and sell them in a
shop? I guess they're looking for a location
in Armory Alley right now...

rows.label: TownInfo202_2
rows.name:
We Ma-non are quite impressed by Lu's crazy
idea of squeezing more slots onto people's
equipment wherever possible, you know?
So maybe we should go shopping?

rows.label: TownInfo202_3
rows.name:
Lu's shop was able to add lots and lots of slots
to my equipment, which is so so so great!
Still, I should probably get some augments to
put in them, right?

rows.label: TownInfo202_4
rows.name:
Giogion and Lu's shop seems to be a smashing
success, you know? Maybe we should open a
store in Armory Alley too?

rows.label: TownInfo203_1
rows.name:
Valley of Oblivion can be real scary, you know?
I was almost eaten by a giant mortifole that
lives on top of the Twin Arches...

rows.label: TownInfo203_2
rows.name:
Did you know that visigels and other indigens
actually explode when they're about to die?
That is worrisome. So so worrisome.
Nature here just seems so...intense?

rows.label: TownInfo203_3
rows.name:
We should all go grab some pizza, yes?
I mean, with this stomach-emptying medicine I
invented, we can eat all we want and never
get full, so...

rows.label: TownInfo203_4
rows.name:
So do you think we should all go live down
below like Ackwar does? That would probably
be the more interesting choice...

rows.label: TownInfo204_1
rows.name:
Friend needs lost memory synthesizers?
Rumor say they sometimes drop in Valley of Oblivion.
But they like ugly Nopon—very rare!

rows.label: TownInfo204_2
rows.name:
If friend wants topaz wine, friend should
smash bellies of tectinsulas in Valley of Oblivion.
Oh, and save some for others!

rows.label: TownInfo204_3
rows.name:
If friend wants lucky rainbow whisker, friend
must smash 'stache of balaena. In interesting
sidebar, every Nopon must get lucky rainbow
whisker to become licensed merchant.

rows.label: TownInfo204_4
rows.name:
Friend needs upgraded coil for ship repair?
Nopon gossip say funny Growth robots at
Seabird's Beak drop those. Robots called
oc-serv or something like that.

rows.label: TownInfo205_1
rows.name:
Did you hear that I nearly got killed by the
Growth? Thankfully some nice humans came
along and and and saved me.

rows.label: TownInfo205_2
rows.name:
I heard that in Valley of Oblivion's Ivica Desert,
there are tectinsulas that go for years without
food or water. Pretty stoic, right?

rows.label: TownInfo205_3
rows.name:
The warp machine is in tip-top shape, okay?
Nothing to worry about. So maybe come get
in the jump field?

rows.label: TownInfo205_4
rows.name:
Folding space is the best way to warp, no?
Sure, black holes and atomic reconstruction
are more efficient at longer ranges,
but they're a little...risky for my taste.

rows.label: TownInfo206_1
rows.name:
Damn Cavern Clan! We would beat them in
fair fight. But they cheat and ally in Growth,
who gave them foul weapons in return.

rows.label: TownInfo206_2
rows.name:
Cavern Clan came into NLA.
Will killing start again?

rows.label: TownInfo206_3
rows.name:
I was in commercial district this morning.
Saw small girl with huge giant. Is this Celica?

rows.label: TownInfo206_4
rows.name:
Are you Bias man? Then challenge Rock!
No true Bias fear his size!

rows.label: TownInfo207_1
rows.name:
It seems our technology and yours are quite
complementary. Shall we engage in an
exchange for the betterment of both parties?

rows.label: TownInfo207_2
rows.name:
I've implemented the technology you
shared with me into a new wide-range
radar device. I do hope you'll come take
a look once I've finished with it.

rows.label: TownInfo207_3
rows.name:
To test my radar, which utilizes your
technology, I pointed it at Sylvalum.
Quite happily, I was able to locate a
xenoform relic in the North Cinderdunes.

rows.label: TownInfo207_4
rows.name:
With the resilient humans surveying Mira and
our ingenuity supporting their efforts, we've
achieved much. I daresay this alliance may
prove a match for even Samaar.

rows.label: TownInfo207_5
rows.name:
My radar has been able to detect the
presence of the precious vegetable known as
mizaria celery. According to my data, it
can be harvested west of Lake Ciel.

rows.label: TownInfo208_1
rows.name:
Our empty storehouses have been filled thanks
to the generosity of the humans, you know?
We're very very grateful.

rows.label: TownInfo208_2
rows.name:
During the attack, everyone hid on our ship
and ate pizza, right? But, uh, they ate too
much, and now we've run out again.

rows.label: TownInfo208_3
rows.name:
Help from the Bias has made loading and
transporting cargo a breeze, no? I just wish
they didn't eat all our food in one sitting...

rows.label: TownInfo208_4
rows.name:
Pollen and meat, pumpkin and leaves...
The more races that come here, the more
supplies we need, you know? But we're
saving all the pizza for us!

rows.label: TownInfo209_1
rows.name:
Support-type data probes can upgrade all
sorts of FrontierNet functions, you know?
That is very very useful technology.

rows.label: TownInfo209_2
rows.name:
So I guess Tatsu single-handedly rescued the 
troops that were left behind in Valley of Oblivion?
Or at least that's what Tatsu is saying...
Maybe I shouldn't believe it?

rows.label: TownInfo209_3
rows.name:
I hear the wreckage of the Growth mechs
still hasn't been fully removed from the
commercial district? I guess no one wants to
to to clean after surviving a huge battle.

rows.label: TownInfo209_4
rows.name:
You heard the news, yes? If you patch into
FrontierNet, you can download all the data
humans have gathered about this planet.

rows.label: TownInfo209_5
rows.name:
Now that I've viewed all the data BLADE
gathered about Mira, there are many many
places I want to visit, you know?
Don't suppose they'd let me...take our ship?

rows.label: TownInfo210_1
rows.name:
So humans don't live in capsule pods?
More like wide-open rooms with lots and lots
of stuff everywhere. Not sure I see the point...

rows.label: TownInfo210_2
rows.name:
Again? Why are the Bias always destroying
their capsule pods?! What are they doing in
there? ...Do you know?

rows.label: TownInfo210_3
rows.name:
Er, hellooooo? The Growth are gone, okay?
You can come out of your pod now...

rows.label: TownInfo210_4
rows.name:
Did you know the human named Chausson
said he wanted lots and lots of our capsule
pods? I guess many many humans are about
to come home to NLA...

rows.label: TownInfo211_1
rows.name:
I am free now. But it is not end.
One day I will kill Growth and Cavern Clan!

rows.label: TownInfo211_2
rows.name:
We learned to fight for over 10,000 suns.
But Growth's weapons are too strong.
We need Dolls.

rows.label: TownInfo211_3
rows.name:
Ryyz attacked city. Now she is dead and her
machine destroyed. Her debt has been repaid
in blood. This is Bias way!

rows.label: TownInfo211_4
rows.name:
You killed Growth's boss? This is good!
Earth aliens achieved what they wanted.
Bias can learn much from your courage.

rows.label: TownInfo212_1
rows.name:
Pizza really is the greatest, don't you think?
You really should go to Army Pizza one of
these days...

rows.label: TownInfo212_2
rows.name:
Even Dr. Staccata couldn't find a cure for this
disease. But apparently it will heal up if I visit
Fraisie in the cathedral?

rows.label: TownInfo212_3
rows.name:
When I drank the medicine Dr. Staccata gave
me, the pain in my chest cleared right up.
Amazing, right? Maybe we Ma-non don't
need miracle water...

rows.label: TownInfo212_4
rows.name:
If you're not feeling well, maybe you should
talk to Dr. Staccata? I hear he can even cure
Orphean diseases...

rows.label: TownInfo213_1
rows.name:
We broke four galactic boosters while
escaping from that valley? Four? Are you sure?
...So I guess we're not heading back to space
anytime soon, are we?

rows.label: TownInfo213_2
rows.name:
We could build all sorts of things if we had
some noka mirrorstones from Nightglow Forest, right?
So shouldn't we go collect lots of them?

rows.label: TownInfo213_3
rows.name:
Did you hear that the resources the humans
gave us were enough to fix two of our
galactic boosters? That's so so great!
Maybe we'll be able to fly in space again...

rows.label: TownInfo213_4
rows.name:
If we can just expand FrontierNet a little
more, maybe we can fix the last main
galactic booster?

rows.label: TownInfo213_5
rows.name:
The last main galactic booster has been fixed.
Seems like good news, right? But a strange
power is still preventing us from taking off...

rows.label: TownInfo214_1
rows.name:
Many friends were enslaved by Growth
and died. But Ma-non were saved before
being caught by Growth. This is good!

rows.label: TownInfo214_3
rows.name:
Many Bias died building Growth base in
Valley of Oblivion. Why did they build it there?

rows.label: TownInfo214_4
rows.name:
Indigens nest outside North Coast.
Clever Earth aliens might find something there.

rows.label: TownInfo214_5
rows.name:
Growth enslaved and killed many Bias to
build Valley of Oblivion base. Now that Earth aliens
killed Growth, they can rest in peace.

rows.label: TownInfo215_1
rows.name:
In all my travels through space, this is the only
planet that's been too dangerous to explore,
you know? I wish I'd never come here...

rows.label: TownInfo215_2
rows.name:
So a human named Miia is traveling around
Mira by herself? And she's not even a BLADE?
Humans are so so crazy sometimes...

rows.label: TownInfo215_3
rows.name:
That scientist Hugo looked so so thrilled while
he was tinkering with machines in the
Arms test hangar... Maybe that means
something exciting is about to happen?

rows.label: TownInfo215_4
rows.name:
I heard Miia's adventures in Valley of Oblivion were 
a total triumph? I sure would love to meet
her someday. I mean, if she's okay with it...

rows.label: TownInfo215_5
rows.name:
That woman on the deck of our ship is Miia
the famous explorer, right? Maybe she'd sit
down and tell me tales of her adventures...

rows.label: TownInfo216_1
rows.name:
So this ship runs on photon energy?
I would very much appreciate having
the Ma-non elucidate the fundamental
principles behind this technology.

rows.label: TownInfo216_2
rows.name:
If we were to incorporate that photon
energy source into our laser-lens
technology... Hmm. Yes, we might be
able to craft something quite interesting.

rows.label: TownInfo216_3
rows.name:
A giant duoguill lives at the lake near the
Fallen Unknown Ring in Valley of Oblivion. But my observational
hypothesis is that it only comes out during
electromagnetic storms.

rows.label: TownInfo216_4
rows.name:
This photon energy is an excellent power
source for propulsion systems but has been
impossible to weaponize. Exactly the sort of
technology I'd expect from the Ma-non.

rows.label: TownInfo216_5
rows.name:
Frenzied Bias are apparently rampaging
throughout Valley of Oblivion. How I wish they could
learn to share your Ma-non love of peace.

rows.label: TownInfo217_1
rows.name:
Humans have an odd shape, don't you think?
Their elongated torsos remind me of those cute
little critters inhabiting the oceans of the planet
Dobab. You see it, right?

rows.label: TownInfo217_2
rows.name:
Earlier I saw a BLADE lady who seemed to be
in some sort of trouble? But when I asked her
what was wrong, she screamed and ran
to the east gate. Was it something I said?

rows.label: TownInfo217_3
rows.name:
So I guess Inisae has made friends with a
human lady? She is so so lucky. I'd give most
anything for a human friend of my own...

rows.label: TownInfo217_4
rows.name:
So Inisae learned to make homemade pizza
from her human friend Sarona? That means
she can have it any time she wants, right?
Even at night? Or for breakfast? So jealous...

rows.label: TownInfo218_1
rows.name:
Is this your largest pod? It is small.
It makes my body hurt.

rows.label: TownInfo218_2
rows.name:
Please craft us better weapons.
Then we can slay Growth if they dare to
strike again!

rows.label: TownInfo218_3
rows.name:
Growth are cowards, but Larsians are
warriors. They should break away.
Become allies of Bias.

rows.label: TownInfo218_4
rows.name:
If enemies attack ship, Bias and Larsians
will fight. We cannot be stopped!

rows.label: TownInfo219_1
rows.name:
So I guess our lost companion was eaten by
a vicious suid on the north shore of Janpath
Lake? That is so so terrible...

rows.label: TownInfo219_2
rows.name:
The Growth don't joke around, do they?
If that huge group had attacked us once more,
we might all be... You know? Dead?

rows.label: TownInfo219_3
rows.name:
The Growth won't take the destruction of
their war machine sitting down, right?
They'll probably fight all-out from here.

rows.label: TownInfo219_4
rows.name:
So the Growth boss is dead, right?
For sure and totally? ...Yes! Now it's nothing
but happy times and pizza forever!

rows.label: TownInfo220_1
rows.name:
We are still too few in number, and so must
multiply aggressively. It is the only way to
guarantee the continuation of the Ovah.

rows.label: TownInfo220_2
rows.name:
So the humans are finally ready to bring
this war to its conclusion. Was allying
ourselves with them the proper choice?
I imagine we will find out soon...

rows.label: TownInfo220_3
rows.name:
It was the will of the Ovah that we side with
the humans, and the humans were victorious.
The answer was within us all along.

rows.label: TownInfo220_4
rows.name:
The humans have expanded their FrontierNet
throughout the entirety of Mira. If we remain
their allies, we should be able to expand our
numbers and territory as much as we desire.

rows.label: TownInfo221_1
rows.name:
I wonder if we'll make more friends here.
When we used to wander the stars, we often
had alien passengers, you know?

rows.label: TownInfo221_2
rows.name:
So the Nopon will be joining us on the ship,
I guess? That's nice. So so nice! We'll make
our new guests lots of capsule pods and try to
keep plenty of raw ingredients in stock, yes?

rows.label: TownInfo221_3
rows.name:
Did you know I met a human named Lin at
the construction site in the residential district?
Well, I did! And then she asked a million
questions about our ship...

rows.label: TownInfo221_4
rows.name:
Nopon seem terrified of that Lin person.
I guess it's because she's a really good cook
or something? Maybe? Anyway, I'd sure love
to try something of hers.

rows.label: TownInfo222_1
rows.name:
Drongo Caravan moved to Ouchy Hot Lava
Land in distant north. Hopefully it still okay!

rows.label: TownInfo222_2
rows.name:
Spinny! Spinny! So spinny!
That thingy best part of whole Ma-non ship.
There must be way to get inside it...

rows.label: TownInfo222_3
rows.name:
Ma-non get ragey if friends try to get inside
spinny thing. Rant on and on about how it
"dangerous" and "could kill everyone." Meh!

rows.label: TownInfo222_4
rows.name:
Strange caecus is attacking friends that go
to Dragonbone Promontory in Cauldros.
Maybe it think cape is home?

rows.label: TownInfo222_5
rows.name:
Friend from Drongo Caravan sent over super-
chewy brambloo shoots. They grow in solitary
place called Slavebird Isle.

rows.label: TownInfo223_1
rows.name:
It sounds like we're going to deliver the
Ma-non's newest inventions to the humans.
And we have a lot of them, so...roll up those
sleeves, I guess?

rows.label: TownInfo223_2
rows.name:
From now on, the Bias will help us deliver
cargo, okay? So let's all give them a big
Ma-non welcome. Ready? Hip hip... Um...
We're fairly glad you're here? I guess?

rows.label: TownInfo223_3
rows.name:
Hey, so we have to to to get these supplies to
Candid & Credible. The fight against the
Growth is heating up and all that, so we
need to do our part for the cause, okay?

rows.label: TownInfo223_4
rows.name:
I guess that if a BLADE operative masters one
of the final-level classes, [ST:gender p1=he p2=she ] can use that
class's weapons in other classes as well?
That's so so cool...

rows.label: TownInfo223_5
rows.name:
Did BLADE really defeat the Growth's boss?
Maybe this means there won't be any more
fighting?

rows.label: TownInfo224_1
rows.name:
The air-purification system is running really
really well, so the ship's air should be clean
and nice. ...Er, it IS nice, right? Isn't it?

rows.label: TownInfo224_2
rows.name:
I saw this human named Frye down by the
fountain in the residential district. He smelled
of alcohol and seemed to be fighting with a
cat? So so strange...

rows.label: TownInfo224_3
rows.name:
Did you know Frye came on our ship reeking
of alcohol? Very very stinky. Thankfully,
the air-purifier took the smell right away,
but still...

rows.label: TownInfo224_4
rows.name:
Did you know that our miraculous air-
purification system cleans the air on our ship?
So clean. But I think maybe the Zaruboggan
might be getting bored...

rows.label: TownInfo225_1
rows.name:
So those Bias warriors were using weapons
stolen from from humans? That's a relief!
We thought maybe humans had joined the
Growth or something...

rows.label: TownInfo225_2
rows.name:
Hmm. You Bias seem to have about five
times the muscle mass of an average human,
no? That's impressive. Really impressive.

rows.label: TownInfo225_3
rows.name:
So I guess 10,000 years spent fighting led
to your physical prowess? Interesting...
Yes, not like us Ma-non. Not at all.
We're actually kind of the opposite, aren't we?

rows.label: TownInfo225_4
rows.name:
I suppose mighty bodies like yours might be
necessary to to survive on a planet like Mira?
Hmm... Would you mind if I perform a few
cell transplants later?

rows.label: TownInfo226_1
rows.name:
We found something near Hilal Meadow
in Sylvalum. It may be alien artifact.
But Growth fortress is very close,
so there is much risk to claiming it.

rows.label: TownInfo226_2
rows.name:
Remember alien artifact near Hilal Meadow?
Growth were there, but Earth aliens claimed
it anyway. Such bravery befits Bias!

rows.label: TownInfo226_3
rows.name:
Sylvalum is surrounded by cliffs. Tall cliffs.
Swimming around is no good.
Only way to enter is through Seabird's Beak.

rows.label: TownInfo226_4
rows.name:
How did you find giant-tusked prey?
...Hmm? You used "front ear nav"?
But you only have ears on sides.

rows.label: TownInfo227_1
rows.name:
I can't get an all-purpose plug unless I smash
one of those Galdr machines, but that's too
risky for me, soooo...yeah. Guess I just have
to make do without?

rows.label: TownInfo227_2
rows.name:
Some Arms said they found an indigen
nest at a place called the Ancient Warscape?
Scary. Cauldros is so so so scary.
It's basically unexplorable, isn't it?

rows.label: TownInfo227_3
rows.name:
We weren't so so good at making weapons,
but but we just kept at it and eventually got
the hang of it, right? So long as we receive
the materials, we can keep producing them.

rows.label: TownInfo227_4
rows.name:
I bet some tough human explorer could
obtain an octopus board from one of the
xe-dom that are terrorizing Cauldros, yes?

rows.label: TownInfo228_1
rows.name:
Those Growth meanies force other alien
races to serve as their underlings, right?
That's bad. So so bad.

rows.label: TownInfo228_2
rows.name:
They say the Larsians are the mightiest 
mercenaries in the whole galaxy, right?
And apparently they're working for the
Growth? Yeah. No. Not good.

rows.label: TownInfo228_3
rows.name:
The Larsians are probably the mightiest
mercenaries in the whole galaxy, aren't they?
And I guess they are on our side now?
Whew! What a relief...

rows.label: TownInfo228_4
rows.name:
The Larsians went out to fight some baddie 
that was running amok in Primordia, right? But
but they seem to have been beaten instead.
Their captain's brooding about it on our deck.

rows.label: TownInfo228_5
rows.name:
Gi Zang? The Larsian who came onto our
ship? Yeah, he's strong. So so strong.
I don't think I'm afraid of the Growth 
anymore, actually.

rows.label: TownInfo229_1
rows.name:
Samaar Federation backs Growth?
Mmm. I do not understand.

rows.label: TownInfo229_2
rows.name:
Why does Growth come here?
And how is their army so large?
Is it Samaar Federation's doing?

rows.label: TownInfo229_3
rows.name:
Bias have warred for 10,000 suns and even
we could not beat Growth.
So how can Earth aliens?

rows.label: TownInfo229_4
rows.name:
Growth are defeated, but Samaar Federation
remains. This makes me nervous.

rows.label: TownInfo230_1
rows.name:
Faster-than-light-speed travel provided by
an internal combustion energy source?
How intriguing. No wonder the Growth
wished to acquire this technology.

rows.label: TownInfo230_2
rows.name:
So the goal of the Growth incursion was
neither destroying NLA nor stealing this
Ma-non ship? They merely sought to
recover a single Doll?
