rows.label: TownInfo230_3
rows.name:
Do you possess any information about the
strange tree near Nightglow Forest's Bident Crossing?
For some reason, it makes my Ovah
throb whenever I look upon it.

rows.label: TownInfo230_4
rows.name:
Nightglow Forest is an enigmatic place indeed.
It seems to hold some strange fascination not
only for us, but also the many other lifeforms
that congregate there.

rows.label: TownInfo231_1
rows.name:
Everything's running smoothly with the energy-
generation systems, so we should be able to
create about 500 more years' worth of energy.
Er, give or take?

rows.label: TownInfo231_2
rows.name:
So a BLADE named Phog was here earlier.
He just sort of...stood there, I guess?
Just watching the machinery or...something?
Actually, I'm not sure WHAT he was doing...

rows.label: TownInfo231_3
rows.name:
So I saw Phog in the commercial district's
Barista Court earlier. He was just...staring into
a café of some kind. That's weird, right?
Isn't that weird?

rows.label: TownInfo231_4
rows.name:
I used to think BLADEs were all wild fighting
types, you know? Killing and maiming and
all that? But now I know there are some
deeper ones—like maybe Phog.

rows.label: TownInfo232_1
rows.name:
Some enemies lower your tension or stop your
Arts. Those enemies must be killed quickly.

rows.label: TownInfo232_2
rows.name:
My body grows weak in this city.
I must leave to hunt in Primordia.

rows.label: TownInfo232_3
rows.name:
I found strange tall pole while hunting.
...Hmm? BLADEs put it there? Good to know.
I was going to drag it back.

rows.label: TownInfo232_4
rows.name:
Now when I hunt, I find BLADEs everywhere.
They have taken over most of planet.

rows.label: TownInfo233_1
rows.name:
Nopon have treasure called nopolith.
They said it was in Valley of Oblivion, but I cannot
find it. Perhaps Nopon lied?

rows.label: TownInfo233_2
rows.name:
I will not lose to BLADE. I will find legendary
treasures of Mira! First, I must pack sentient
furball snack for energy...

rows.label: TownInfo233_3
rows.name:
Gotthard the Intimidating from the Yawning
Giant is dangerous. Even Tree Clan warriors
are no match.

rows.label: TownInfo233_4
rows.name:
Bias have defeated many creatures.
We will do so again. I will beat Gotthard
the Intimidating! This I swear!

rows.label: TownInfo234_1
rows.name:
So when I was hiding in Valley of Oblivion, there was
shooting and explosions pretty much
everywhere. I thought I was a dead Ma-non
for sure, you know?

rows.label: TownInfo234_2
rows.name:
Humans are really strong, aren't they?
I mean, look how they beat that giant.
They might even be able to beat the Growth!
Um, maybe? I think?

rows.label: TownInfo234_3
rows.name:
Elma's team has really done some pretty
amazing things, right? Probably only a matter
of time before they defeat all the the baddies
on this planet...

rows.label: TownInfo234_4
rows.name:
I don't know if Ma-non would still be alive if
not for humans, you know? We were really
really lucky that day in Valley of Oblivion.

rows.label: TownInfo235_1
rows.name:
These capsule are comfy! Nopon should claim
extras and sell them at caravan for hugely
inflated prices.

rows.label: TownInfo235_2
rows.name:
Meh! Stupid Ma-non put kibosh on plan to
get rich quick by selling capsules. Maybe there
is other plan waiting on FrontierNet.

rows.label: TownInfo235_3
rows.name:
Stupid giant Growth warship is hanging
around far northern skies of Sylvalum.
Some nice friend should bring it down
before it bring down sales!

rows.label: TownInfo235_4
rows.name:
Meh-meh! Amazing idea! Clever businesspon
can make tons of money by selling pizza to
gullible Nopon!

rows.label: TownInfo236_1
rows.name:
Business was supposed to be good here,
but stupid customers aren't interested in rare
and wonderful items. Meeeeh...

rows.label: TownInfo236_2
rows.name:
Hey! Big glutton friend! You should buy
yummy lava chestnuts special from Cauldros!
...Huh? N-no! Nopon not for sale!

rows.label: TownInfo236_3
rows.name:
Hey! Masked friend! You seem to like
dangerous things, so buy these assassin
springtails from Primordia!

rows.label: TownInfo236_4
rows.name:
Hey! Bug lady friend! Come buy some fresh-
picked fodornallow greens from Nightglow Forest!
Tingly taste make antenna stand straight up.

rows.label: TownInfo236_5
rows.name:
Kitty friend should buy dithblade fragments.
They are super-rare item dropped only in
Cauldros.

rows.label: TownInfo237_1
rows.name:
I see you haven't let your womanhood stop
you from becoming a warrior either. Well met!
I hope to spar with you one day.

rows.label: TownInfo237_2
rows.name:
I met a human named Frye on Melville Street
who isn't above raising a glass with
Larsians. I hope we can learn to be so
cordial in our own dealings.

rows.label: TownInfo237_3
rows.name:
The men of the Larsians and Bias both
pride themselves on their drinking prowess.
Yet not a one of them has managed to drink
that Frye human under the table!

rows.label: TownInfo237_4
rows.name:
The humans seem to be expanding their
territory with great haste, and we Larsians
mustn't fall behind. With weapons in hand,
we shall tame Mira at humanity's side!

rows.label: TownInfo238_1
rows.name:
So you're asserting that I am a "woman"
like yourself? I'm afraid that gender is not
really a concept that we Orphe have much
familiarity with.

rows.label: TownInfo238_2
rows.name:
Could you elaborate on your assertion that I
am female? Should my apparent gender be
guiding my behavior in some way? My Ovah
provides no insight on this matter.

rows.label: TownInfo238_3
rows.name:
So Bias females knit clothing for the males?
I wonder how an Orphean alphaform might
respond to a gift of such ineffective armor.

rows.label: TownInfo238_4
rows.name:
So the primary privilege of femaleness is the
ability to birth children? But the alphaforms
and betaforms of our species carry out binary
fission in exactly the same fashion.

rows.label: TownInfo239_1
rows.name:
Earth aliens use war to bond. It is same with
Tree Clan. We fight together for 10,000 suns
or more!

rows.label: TownInfo239_2
rows.name:
We saw wrecked Doll on Irian Trail in
Valley of Oblivion. Then we left flowers to honor
memory of brave Earth-alien soldier.

rows.label: TownInfo239_3
rows.name:
I must go to Valley of Oblivion and find missing
companions. It is our duty as survivors.

rows.label: TownInfo239_4
rows.name:
Human machines found bodies of missing 
companions. Now I feed them to indigens.
This is Bias way. It is how we mourn.

rows.label: TownInfo240_1
rows.name:
Without food or medicine, we could but watch
as our comrades-in-arms sickened and died.
What a glorious paradise this is, compared to
that wretched shell of an existence!

rows.label: TownInfo240_2
rows.name:
I cannot abide being a leech on the humans!
Perhaps I could earn my keep by aiding
BLADEs who are guarding the city perimeter?

rows.label: TownInfo240_3
rows.name:
While on perimeter duty, I sighted a progen
at Headwater Summit. 'Tis a rare sight
to behold around here, but if you wish
to challenge it, proceed with caution!

rows.label: TownInfo240_4
rows.name:
And now they've even exterminated the progen
of Headwater Summit! If I am to keep up with
these humans, I shall have to redouble my
patrolling efforts.

rows.label: TownInfo241_1
rows.name:
If friend falls down north cliffs, circle around
and climb back up from Northpointe Cove.
Price for lesson is 100 credits!

rows.label: TownInfo241_2
rows.name:
Nopon not snacks! Nopon highly intellismart
sentient beings! Even if Bias very, very, very,
very, very, hungry, it not okay to eat Nopon!

rows.label: TownInfo241_3
rows.name:
Growth mess up Larsian home world as
much as Mira? Growth awful! Meh-meh!

rows.label: TownInfo241_4
rows.name:
Many xenos come to Mira and bring trouble,
but it good to have met such good
revenue sourc... Er, custome... Er, friends!
Friends. Yes. That.

rows.label: TownInfo242_1
rows.name:
Er, what are those Bias doing? I keep
hearing this hideously loud...screeching?
It's really really starting to scare me.

rows.label: TownInfo242_2
rows.name:
Apparently the screaming Bias are just
mourning their killed friends? Which is sad.
I just wish maybe it wasn't quite so...loud?

rows.label: TownInfo242_3
rows.name:
Now the Bias are discussing which indigen
they should feed their dead friends to?
I don't even, right? I just...don't.

rows.label: TownInfo243_1
rows.name:
Many clan members are still hurt from time in
captivity. Damn Cavern Clan! They will pay!

rows.label: TownInfo243_2
rows.name:
Orphean named Kon'luarb in residential district
asks lots of questions about Biahno water-
purification plant. What is he planning?

rows.label: TownInfo243_3
rows.name:
Some clanmates were wounded in Growth
attack. But Hope brought bandages and
medicine. They live thanks to her.

rows.label: TownInfo243_4
rows.name:
Growth wounded us, but we healed.
Now we join Earth aliens to fight Growth.
We will repay our debt in full!

rows.label: TownInfo243_5
rows.name:
Strongest member of Cavern Clan lives in
Dryland Cave Fortress. Ha ha ha! We shall
kill him together!

rows.label: TownInfo244_1
rows.name:
Some enemies use abilities to grow strong.
You must be careful even when retreating.

rows.label: TownInfo244_2
rows.name:
You will harvest materials in Valley of Oblivion?
Let me help. Let me protect you!

rows.label: TownInfo244_3
rows.name:
I found wrecked Earth-alien Doll north of
Lake Basel in Valley of Oblivion. Maybe it contains
treasure?

rows.label: TownInfo244_4
rows.name:
Where do we go next? Travel is perfect for
getting lazy bodies back in shape!

rows.label: TownInfo245_1
rows.name:
Cargo floats while on ship. It is easy to move.
I enjoy this Ma-non "tech-no-logee"!

rows.label: TownInfo245_2
rows.name:
Deliveries come from all over Mira?
This Earth alien "front ear nav" is amazing!

rows.label: TownInfo245_3
rows.name:
"Front ear nav" found our missing brothers.
I also want a front ear!

rows.label: TownInfo245_4
rows.name:
I must find rare myuena cactus in Valley of Oblivion near
Big Arch. I must go search for it! Perhaps
Earth aliens will loan me their front ear?

rows.label: TownInfo246_1
rows.name:
The Growth forced many races to serve them
under duress. But others, like the Bias and
Milsaadi, chose to lick the Growth's boots of
their own volition.

rows.label: TownInfo246_2
rows.name:
This Bias Cavern Clan willingly did the
Growth's dark bidding, yet now they are
here in the city? Surely I am not the only one
to question the wisdom of this!

rows.label: TownInfo246_3
rows.name:
Apparently there's a group of wounded
Bias soldiers at the east gate.
And they're from the Cavern Clan!
Whatever is going on here?

rows.label: TownInfo246_4
rows.name:
And now the Growth have attempted to
assassinate the Cavern Clan for betrayal?
Truly, they are a loathsome bunch!

rows.label: TownInfo247_1
rows.name:
Prince Jiarg has bade his starving subjects
come to NLA, yet he himself remains in
Valley of Oblivion with those who are too weak to travel.
He is truly a great Larsian!

rows.label: TownInfo247_2
rows.name:
When we were being pressured to serve the
Growth, Prince Jiarg agonized over the
decision for three sleepless nights. Finally,
he abandoned his pride to save his people.

rows.label: TownInfo247_3
rows.name:
We discovered an alien container in the dunes
to the west of Lake Ciel in Sylvalum. Perhaps
the humans can make better sense of it than
we Larsians could?

rows.label: TownInfo247_4
rows.name:
Thanks to the humans' information network,
it has become much easier to communicate
with Prince Jiarg in Valley of Oblivion. We salute their
mighty technological efforts!

rows.label: TownInfo248_1
rows.name:
It was an unfortunate series of events that
brought us to Mira, but Director of Planning
Trachlo Lythren being among us was
somewhat of a silver lining. *fsssh*

rows.label: TownInfo248_2
rows.name:
*fsssh* A fearsome Marnuck called Daril the
Eradicator is known to appear at a polluted
lake on a small island off of Primordia. So
approach there with care. Especially at night!

rows.label: TownInfo248_3
rows.name:
How fares Kiliran in the crafting of the voltant
dispersion map? I do hope he's able to return
safely. *fsssh*

rows.label: TownInfo248_4
rows.name:
We've been able to confirm Kiliran's continued
survival with FrontierNet. I am confident his
voltant dispersion map will be everything we're
hoping for. *fsssh*

rows.label: TownInfo249_1
rows.name:
I've never seen so much food in my life!
Your ample provisions will save the lives
of a great many Larsians.

rows.label: TownInfo249_2
rows.name:
I saw an adsecula variant at the watering hole
in the eastern part of Valley of Oblivion's Ibra Ravine,
but I lost sight of the vermin when it melted
into the cliffs. Blast!

rows.label: TownInfo249_3
rows.name:
If only we Larsians could learn your food
production technology, our long dark history
of poverty and starvation would become a
thing of the past.

rows.label: TownInfo249_4
rows.name:
Since humans are mechanical in nature,
they may enjoy the magnetic properties of
charupa leaves. Perhaps I will pick some
when next I visit the caves of Valley of Oblivion.

rows.label: TownInfo250_1
rows.name:
When you wear ground gear from Orphean
Technologies, the sensors woven into the
material allow you to evade any enemy attack!

rows.label: TownInfo250_2
rows.name:
Weapons from Orpheus Parfait employ
special techs—such as graviton waves and
ether—to end enemy lives, even against the
most physically resilient of foes.

rows.label: TownInfo250_3
rows.name:
Lately, traitors who deny the Ovah have
appeared in our midst. On'tonam in the
residential district is dealing with the situation.

rows.label: TownInfo250_4
rows.name:
An Orphean who denies the Ovah is not part
of the Orphe at all! I cannot respect the
ideology of this anti-Ovah zealot, Run'tonam.

rows.label: TownInfo251_1
rows.name:
This vessel is full of senirapa water?
Then perhaps I will be able to use it to
reproduce one day.

rows.label: TownInfo251_2
rows.name:
Were you aware that you can access
FrontierNet from the terminals in this ship?
It makes it easy to keep up on developments
in the outside world.

rows.label: TownInfo251_3
rows.name:
Whenever I look at the panoramas of Mira
broadcast over FrontierNet, I cannot
help but feel a strange emotion welling up
inside me. How to describe it...?

rows.label: TownInfo251_4
rows.name:
The feeling we betaforms experience when we
look at Mira is probably closest to what
humans refer to as "nostalgia." What strange
influence has this planet had upon us?

rows.label: TownInfo252_1
rows.name:
What is the purpose of all these trees, you
ask? It's an experiment to see if we can
successfully cultivate the trees on which we
Orphe feed.

rows.label: TownInfo252_2
rows.name:
We haven't yet been able to cultivate a
tree that satisfies our Ovah. We simply
don't possess enough samples.

rows.label: TownInfo252_3
rows.name:
As I'd hypothesized, of all the flora on Mira,
the trees in Nightglow Forest are most similar to
those of our homeworld. If only we had more
information about that area...

rows.label: TownInfo252_4
rows.name:
We've finally succeeded in cultivating a
high-quality edible tree for Orpheans!
Perhaps we could convince the Ma-non to
put aside that "pizza" they're always eating.

rows.label: TownInfo253_1
rows.name:
Cap...sool...pod? Worp...injin? I appreciate
you taking the time to explain about your
lifestyle on this ship, but such things are
beyond the ken of a warrior!

rows.label: TownInfo253_2
rows.name:
What? You're saying this ship bears virtually
no armaments at all?! And yet you possess
such incredible technology!

rows.label: TownInfo253_3
rows.name:
You noticed a Larsian atop the BLADE
Tower? That would be Gu Ladha, I imagine.
She usually keeps to herself like that.

rows.label: TownInfo253_4
rows.name:
Gu Ladha is a weakling, but none would deny
her prowess with a Doll. The only Larsian
who pities her is Gu Ladha herself.

rows.label: TownInfo254_1
rows.name:
So this capsule pod will be your home sweet
home. How does it look? It's just so so very
spacious and comfortable, isn't it?
...Er, for a Ma-non, I mean.

rows.label: TownInfo254_2
rows.name:
You want to raise a pet suid inside your
capsule pod? Um... Ummmmmm...
Yeah, I think that might be a bit...difficult?

rows.label: TownInfo254_3
rows.name:
You're actually raising a pet suid inside your
capsule pod? And he's your best friend?
Well, that's good, I guess...

rows.label: TownInfo254_4
rows.name:
So when you went to capture your pet suid in
Valley of Oblivion, you picked up some arc-sand ore?
Er, do you think there might be more to be
found in that area?

rows.label: TownInfo255_1
rows.name:
When I came here, I left little brother behind.
None know where he is now.

rows.label: TownInfo255_2
rows.name:
My brother was found dead in Cavern Clan
fortress. I will make them pay! Kill them all!

rows.label: TownInfo255_3
rows.name:
Stinking Cavern Clan Slovity is in city!
I am ordered not to touch her.
I do not know if I can obey.

rows.label: TownInfo255_4
rows.name:
I saw Lu this morning at Deliverance Park.
He seems to be doing Bias dance of
courtship. Is it rutting season for Lu?

rows.label: TownInfo255_5
rows.name:
L claimed his dance was growing-up dance.
But it looked like Bias courtship dance.
If Lu dance that way in front of Bias lady,
L in BIG trouble.

rows.label: TownInfo256_1
rows.name:
Even among the Growth's leadership,
Goetia and Ryyz were famed for their ferocity.
The humans who slew them could pose a
threat to even Luxaar himself!

rows.label: TownInfo256_2
rows.name:
They say that in the final battle, a human
named Lao sacrificed himself to stop Luxaar.
What a magnificent end. Worthy of a song!

rows.label: TownInfo256_3
rows.name:
Apparently the last survivor of the Hundred
Hellions has joined Rogan's unit.
What I would give for a chance to witness
that warrior's legendary Art!

rows.label: TownInfo256_4
rows.name:
I'm hearing reports that a human has bested
the peerless warriors of the Larsian Battle
Gauntlet. How could this possibly be?!

rows.label: TownInfo257_1
rows.name:
We cannot afford to lose a single one of our
precious Dolls! Should your Doll become
imperiled, it is your duty to eject and
annihilate your foes on foot!

rows.label: TownInfo257_2
rows.name:
I hear a gargantuan aprica called Sviatoslav,
the Reproachful appears when rain falls upon
Valley of Oblivion's Balance Rock area. How I long
to bathe my sword in its blood!

rows.label: TownInfo257_3
rows.name:
Please entrust it to me! I will study this kata,
and one day become as mighty a warrior as
Buidhe herself!

rows.label: TownInfo257_4
rows.name:
This is the treasured Perfect Serenity kata.
I will master it and serve the Larsians with
as much distinction as the great lady Buidhe!

rows.label: TownInfo258_1
rows.name:
Prince Jiarg has ordered us to ally with the
humans until the day of the Growth's defeat.
I stand ready to fight and die at the prince's
command!

rows.label: TownInfo258_2
rows.name:
Well fought, everyone! Luxaar has fallen,
and the Growth stand at the brink of
annihilation!

rows.label: TownInfo258_3
rows.name:
Prince Jiarg has ordered me to hunt down
Growth loyalists in unexplored areas.
I shall not disgrace myself by allowing
BLADE to find them first!

rows.label: TownInfo258_4
rows.name:
With the power of that "front ear nav,"
I have located Growth loyalists at Nightglow Forest's
Vitriol Cesspool. We will ensure that
none among them survive!

rows.label: TownInfo259_1
rows.name:
This light is strange. Like Great Tree.
I sense presence of Old Ones inside.

rows.label: TownInfo259_2
rows.name:
I heard voice of oracle from fountain!
It spoke of broken oc-serv on North Coast
in Valley of Oblivion.

rows.label: TownInfo259_3
rows.name:
There is mighty presence in this fountain.
Presence of Old Ones who protect us.
Gives us hope of one day returning to
Bias home world.

rows.label: TownInfo259_4
rows.name:
Voice of oracle spoke again from fountain!
It said, "One can harvest light-speed jet fins
from aetrygon at King's Falls."
...I do not understand most of that.

rows.label: TownInfo260_1
rows.name:
That Bias family is full of proud and brave
warriors. Auld Belgazus leads them now.

rows.label: TownInfo260_2
rows.name:
Bias value family like no other race.
Even Nemard treasures family.

rows.label: TownInfo260_3
rows.name:
Have you ever smashed xiphias's horn?
You might find pretty sapphire horn inside.
I want ring like that when I marry.

rows.label: TownInfo260_4
rows.name:
Nemard is married. Auld Belgazus has died. 
New soul is born. Life is river.

rows.label: TownInfo261_1
rows.name:
Please, I beg of you, do not make any sudden
loud noises or abrupt movements. I may
interpret them as a threat and roll up into
a ball. It is instinctual, and not at all funny!

rows.label: TownInfo261_2
rows.name:
While I am growing accustomed to your
immense physical frames, it still causes
stress for me to look upon them. This is due
to my own species' frailty, you understand.

rows.label: TownInfo261_3
rows.name:
I just saw a Zaruboggan in the industrial
district with smoke billowing out of his
backpack. Is that...supposed to happen?

rows.label: TownInfo261_4
rows.name:
We can calculate the most efficient way to
take advantage of your physical abilities.
Shall we leverage our skills to the benefit
of each other?

rows.label: TownInfo262_1
rows.name:
I trust Earth aliens, but also watch them.
True, they saved us this time. But next time?
Who can say?

rows.label: TownInfo262_2
rows.name:
I saw Earth-alien corpse on battlefield.
They really are machines! It is...disturbing.

rows.label: TownInfo262_3
rows.name:
Growth seek Central Life.
Earth aliens seek Central Life.
It must be powerful weapon!

rows.label: TownInfo262_4
rows.name:
Earth aliens gave me meat to celebrate finding
of Central Life. No one who gives free meat
can be bad!

rows.label: TownInfo263_1
rows.name:
Hmm. So you use that mirror-like contraption
to gather information? What fascinating
wizardry you command!

rows.label: TownInfo263_2
rows.name:
If I could claim an eel kebab of the dragon
king, would you accept it in trade for your
mirror? Now, where were those colubrims?
It was either Primordia or Mount M'gando...

rows.label: TownInfo263_3
rows.name:
I journeyed to Mount M'gando in Cauldros,
but was beset from above by a ferocious ictus.
I nearly became a kebab myself!

rows.label: TownInfo263_4
rows.name:
You say if I help you peddle your wares,
you'll give me that terminal? It's a bargain
I'd gladly make, but would Prince Jiarg permit
me to engage in such moonlighting?

rows.label: TownInfo264_1
rows.name:
Thrust! Thrust! Thrust! We must train, and train
yet more, if we hope to avenge the insult that
Luxaar has inflicted upon our master!

rows.label: TownInfo264_2
rows.name:
Do not let this peace soothe your rage!
Never forget the days when all that stood
between us and starvation was but a single
beagflea squash!

rows.label: TownInfo264_3
rows.name:
Thrust! Thrust! Thrust!
Exceed your self-imposed limitations!
Exceed the skill of the Hundred Hellions!
You have it within you!

rows.label: TownInfo264_4
rows.name:
I'd not believed I'd see the day that Zo Ozuchi
was felled in battle. We must redouble our
training, lest we Larsians face extermination
on the day our alliance with humanity ends.

rows.label: TownInfo265_1
rows.name:
So in Valley of Oblivion, I think saw a blue Bias being
bullied by a pink Bias? What the heck is that
all about...

rows.label: TownInfo265_2
rows.name:
At night, a Bias lady comes and sits here
with a frown on her face. I don't know—
is she lonely? Did she forget something back
in Valley of Oblivion, maybe?

rows.label: TownInfo265_3
rows.name:
There's a hidden treasure in an indigen's nest
in Cauldros's O'rrh Sim castle ruins, right?
Should I get it for the Bias lady who sits
here at night to try and make her feel better?

rows.label: TownInfo265_4
rows.name:
I asked the Bias lady who sits here at night
if there's anything she wanted, and she said
"love." I'm not sure I can help her with that?

rows.label: TownInfo266_1
rows.name:
The Nopon are just fluffy little lunch pails,
right? I mean, they're just the right size
and they stay fresh for a long long time!
Maybe more will decide to come to our ship?

rows.label: TownInfo266_2
rows.name:
Really? You came all the way back from
Sylvalum to look for a fighter who might
recover the alien reliquary east of Lake Ciel?
Er, well, good luck with that...

rows.label: TownInfo266_3
rows.name:
I'm so happy that you and I are friends now,
you know? Let's stay up all night talking and
laughing and maybe...um...tasting things?

rows.label: TownInfo266_4
rows.name:
Say, would you mind if I put you on a pizza,
covered you with cheese, peppers, and caseras
mushrooms, and then cooked you in the
microwave for a bit? ...Maybe?

rows.label: TownInfo267_1
rows.name:
So, I heard if you become really good friends
with a BLADE you've scouted, the scout level
will go up and you can receive all kinds of
rewards, right? Sounds like fun, doesn't it?

rows.label: TownInfo267_2
rows.name:
Is it night already? It is, right? Maybe?
I can never tell what time it is on this ship.

rows.label: TownInfo267_3
rows.name:
You're hungry, right? So maybe we should call
up Army Pizza and get a late-night delivery?

rows.label: TownInfo267_4
rows.name:
After I ate five late-night pizzas, my stomach
started to feel...hurty? Yeah. Hurty, I think.
Maybe I caught some human disease?
...I think I'm scared. Hold me!

rows.label: TownInfo268_1
rows.name:
I wonder what the rest of our people are
doing. I mean, they're probably sending out
scouting vessels to look for us, right?

rows.label: TownInfo268_2
rows.name:
Most of my friends say they're happy wherever
so long as there's pizza to eat, you know?
But but but I still want to escape from this
crazy place...

rows.label: TownInfo268_3
rows.name:
I was thinking about the Zaruboggan baby
that was born in the industrial district.
Can you imagine being born in a crazy place
like this? Poor poor baby...

rows.label: TownInfo268_4
rows.name:
I hear that newborn Zaruboggan baby is
trying really really hard to thrive here, right?
Maybe I should be following his lead...

rows.label: TownInfo268_5
rows.name:
Maybe I could I use some of the materials the
humans gave us to make a really really strong
transmission device and send an SOS signal
back to our people...

rows.label: TownInfo269_1
rows.name:
So I heard there's a strange petrified tree in
the South Cinderdunes in Sylvalum?
This sounds like a job for the universe's
greatest treasure hunter! ...Which is, er, me?

rows.label: TownInfo269_2
rows.name:
Humans beat me to the treasure in the
South Cinderdunes. I just... I mean, to think
that a treasure hunter of my caliber could be
bested, you know? Weird. So so weird.

rows.label: TownInfo269_3
rows.name:
You need missile wiring, right? I've heard
there's some in the South Cinderdunes
area of Sylvalum, so I can go grab a piece
for you. I mean...if you want?

rows.label: TownInfo269_4
rows.name:
If you want jagitos copper, you'll have to get
dangerously close to Hilal Stronghold—but
that's half the fun, right? So, um, maybe I
can go grab you some?

rows.label: TownInfo270_1
rows.name:
Is there not a single molecule of voltant
anywhere on this ship? This must be the fault
of the Ma-non's overpowered air-purification
system. I'd like to hurl it overboard! *fsssh*

rows.label: TownInfo270_2
rows.name:
On the Ma-non ship's deck, the Orphe were
running around Sun'barac in panicked circles.
*fsssh* They're a weak race like us, which
means there's always a reason to worry.

rows.label: TownInfo270_3
rows.name:
I certainly never imagined that Orphean would
go off and reproduce by splitting its body into
two new organisms. *fsssh* But still I wish
Golbogga's blessing upon thee, Orphean.

rows.label: TownInfo270_4
rows.name:
The Orphe have been multiplying rapidly.
We Zaruboggan must continue devoltanizing
and spawn progeny of our own. *fsssh*

rows.label: TownInfo271_1
rows.name:
Just hearing the name of the Growth sends a
cold shiver down my Ovah. My five fission
progenitors must have met some terrible fate
at their hands!

rows.label: TownInfo271_2
rows.name:
A Growth weapon of mass destruction?
When we were being forced to make
weapons while in captivity, we may have
crafted a few parts for that.

rows.label: TownInfo271_3
rows.name:
Hypothetically, should the humans fall to the
Growth, we'll have no recourse but to take
this ship and flee to the edge of the universe.

rows.label: TownInfo271_4
rows.name:
I would dearly hate to be on humanity's bad
side—their potential seems nearly limitless.
Thank the heavens that we chose to ally
with them.

rows.label: TownInfo272_1
rows.name:
You don't have to be scared of all xenoforms,
you know? Don't worry—you can come
over here. We aren't going to eat you...

rows.label: TownInfo272_2
rows.name:
None of the Bias here ever bully us Ma-non.
But if you're scared, feel free to go back over
there by yourself, okay? No shame, right?

rows.label: TownInfo272_3
rows.name:
The Larsians told me that they found vehicle
wreckage in the northern part of Valley of Oblivion's
South Coast. I should probably thank them for
the tip, right?

rows.label: TownInfo272_4
rows.name:
A Larsian gave me a beagflea squash,
so I boiled it with some some soy sauce,
right? It was so so good! I think it might
be the next pizza, you know?

rows.label: TownInfo273_1
rows.name:
No one ever comes to hang out in our guest
area anymore, you know? When we were
sailing through space, we had all sorts of
xenos staying here...

rows.label: TownInfo273_2
rows.name:
You know I saw some alien wreckage near
Cauldros's M'gando Gorge? I'd love to retrieve
it and analyze it and and see what it's about.
...I mean, if that's okay?

rows.label: TownInfo273_3
rows.name:
The Larsians sure are high spirited, right?
Nothing but kee-yah! and hi-yah! and all that
all night long. ...Actually, I could really really
use a good night's sleep.

rows.label: TownInfo273_4
rows.name:
The more I watch the Larsians train,
the more fun it looks. Maybe I should try
some kee-yahs and hi-yahs myself?
I mean, if they don't get mad...

rows.label: TownInfo274_1
rows.name:
I would give my life to kill Cavern Clan.
But I must wait for Sevvy Belgazus's command.

rows.label: TownInfo274_2
rows.name:
...What? You say BLADE fights while we sit
and talk? Bah! We are only waiting for
orders to fight!

rows.label: TownInfo274_3
rows.name:
Larsians hold fighting tournament at
Arms test hangar. Do you think you are
warrior? Go prove it!

rows.label: TownInfo274_4
rows.name:
Cavern Clan woman was strong.
Larsian warriors were strong.
But Earth alien who won Battle Gauntlet
was stronger!

rows.label: TownInfo275_1
rows.name:
If Kopopo becomes our representative,
the Nopon might take over NLA.
Don't you think we should put a rational
xenoform in control? Maybe an Orphean?

rows.label: TownInfo276_1
rows.name:
Representatives should be smart.
Maybe Orphe? Orphe seem smart.

rows.label: TownInfo277_1
rows.name:
I was so disappointed in Adappin, you know?
I guess our best bet now is to have a rational,
serious Orphean take the job...

rows.label: TownInfo278_1
rows.name:
I wanna be as much help to the humans as I
can, you know? But but if they won't help me,
I guess there isn't much I can do, is there?

rows.label: TownInfo278_2
rows.name:
We've heard there are lots of humans saying
good things about us Ma-non all over New
LA. But but I don't know if I believe it...

rows.label: TownInfo279_1
rows.name:
I think we Ma-non might be more popular if
the humans would make a bigger deal about
our great technicians. ...Er, you know?
Technicians like Tutura and Aganeba?

rows.label: TownInfo279_2
rows.name:
Doesn't it seems like the number of humans
who are saying nice things about us Ma-non
has increased? ...By lots and lots, even?

rows.label: TownInfo281_1
rows.name:
When I was hiding from the Growth,
I remember hearing a big old noise, right?
So loud. So so so loud. I think it may have
been the sound of this city falling to Mira...

rows.label: TownInfo281_2
rows.name:
I guess some weird Doll was found out in
Nightglow Forest, right? I wish we could be allowed to
examine it. Maybe even just for a little while?

rows.label: TownInfo281_3
rows.name:
So I guess Doll they found in Nightglow Forest was
stolen? Aw, that stinks. I mean, I was hoping
we'd be able to to to examine it, you know?

rows.label: TownInfo281_4
rows.name:
They say the Growth's big big boss was
piloting that stolen Doll, right? And that it
was super strong? I really wish I could have
studied it...

rows.label: TownInfo282_1
rows.name:
Being a BLADE sounds easy, right?
I mean, they just run around outdoors and
stick big data probes in the ground.
That actually sounds like fun to me...

rows.label: TownInfo282_2
rows.name:
I hear the Arms are working with Candid
& Credible to help create our new line of
products. I guess BLADE does come in handy
for certain things, don't they?

rows.label: TownInfo282_3
rows.name:
When I was outside gathering materials,
a BLADE pretty much saved my life.
Those guys are so so so so so awesome,
you know? SO awesome!

rows.label: TownInfo282_4
rows.name:
If it weren't for BLADE, everyone in this city
would be dead, wouldn't we? So so so I guess
that means we all owe them our lives, right?

rows.label: TownInfo283_1
rows.name:
We were 15 siblings. Now only us left.
Cavern Clan will pay!

rows.label: TownInfo283_2
rows.name:
Growth is no match for power of siblings.
They can come back. We will win again!

rows.label: TownInfo283_3
rows.name:
BLADE leads attack while we protect city.
Now sibling power can shine!

rows.label: TownInfo283_4
rows.name:
Me and my siblings will use united strength
to slaughter Cavern Clan. They are nothing
without Growth!

rows.label: TownInfo284_1
rows.name:
If you ever need a hand, maybe talk to Hope?
She can help with pretty much anything.
I think she's out in the commercial district
right now, actually...

rows.label: TownInfo301_1
rows.name:
We're short on manpower and materials.
And as a result of that current resource crisis,
expansion of the residential district has pretty
much stalled.

rows.label: TownInfo301_2
rows.name:
So you guys were traveling all around the
galaxy in that ship, huh? You sure have
amazing tech for a species that's so small!

rows.label: TownInfo301_3
rows.name:
Thanks a lot for sheltering us on your ship
when the Growth attacked. I thought I was
going to be fertilizer for sure!

rows.label: TownInfo301_4
rows.name:
When we find the Lifepoint, a lot of my friends
will be able to return to NLA. That's all the
more reason to get these construction projects
rolling.

rows.label: TownInfo301_5
rows.name:
What? You Ma-non are going to help with
our residential-district expansion projects?
That'll be a huge help!

rows.label: TownInfo302_1
rows.name:
If you're a BLADE, you can just take one of
those transports there to another district any
old time you please. As for the rest of us?
Well, we have to walk.

rows.label: TownInfo302_2
rows.name:
They really need to start letting civilians use
the transports. It's so annoying how I have to
take some huge detour just to get to the
industrial district!

rows.label: TownInfo302_3
rows.name:
You looking for Gerome? I haven't seen him,
but my friend said she saw him at the water-
purification plant.

rows.label: TownInfo302_4
rows.name:
Have you heard? They're saying that as soon
as they're able to mine a surplus of fuel,
they'll start allowing civilians to use transports.
IT'S ABOUT DAMN TIME!

rows.label: TownInfo302_5
rows.name:
Life has gotten easier now that we civilians
can use the transports. I guess we owe BLADE
a thank-you for being so accommodating...

rows.label: TownInfo303_1
rows.name:
With our current shortage of parts, we can't
fix so much as a single trailer! It's pathetic!
No, wait. It's BEYOND pathetic!

rows.label: TownInfo303_2
rows.name:
Now that they've started miranium mining,
we should probably be able to resume
manufacturing the parts we need for this old
piece of junk. ...If only they'd let us!

rows.label: TownInfo303_3
rows.name:
The Doll wreckage found on Wonderment
Bluff? Yeah, that's a particularly dangerous
area, even by the standards of Primordia.
Recovery may be impossible.

rows.label: TownInfo303_4
rows.name:
And this baby's finally fixed! We owe it all to
the Landbankers who gathered all the resources.

rows.label: TownInfo303_5
rows.name:
Whoa! A Ma-non just tinkered with this,
and now it's like a million times as powerful
as it was when it was brand new!
Seriously, those little guys are incredible.

rows.label: TownInfo304_1
rows.name:
It's nice and quiet in this district. I can see the
commercial district from here, and it's always
a little too lively for my tastes.

rows.label: TownInfo304_2
rows.name:
There are too many scary hoodlum types
operating in the commercial district.
Oh, and there's also this loose-cannon BLADE
named Yelv. You should steer clear of him!

rows.label: TownInfo304_3
rows.name:
I saw Yelv walking with a group of BLADEs
like they were all close friends. He always
struck me as the dangerous loner type.
You know? Crazy eyes and all that?

rows.label: TownInfo304_4
rows.name:
While she was exploring Valley of Oblivion, my
Pathfinder friend saw a human foot
that had fallen into the East Ibra Ravine.
What is up with THAT?!

rows.label: TownInfo304_5
rows.name:
Most of the mementos that were buried at the
church funeral were gathered by Testamenters.
Their work truly helps to heal the human spirit.

rows.label: TownInfo305_1
rows.name:
I hear once you step outside of Primordia,
the weather can get super dangerous.
There are even places where it rains balls of
fire! Goodness gracious!

rows.label: TownInfo305_2
rows.name:
When I went shopping at the boutique earlier,
Alesa and a Ma-non named Wersal were
really going at it. What would those two
possibly have to argue about?

rows.label: TownInfo305_3
rows.name:
I hear reckless BLADEs sometimes dive into the
city's underground layer of gel to get psyched
up for battle.

rows.label: TownInfo305_4
rows.name:
The Orphe went to the city's underground
aqueous layer in search of something called
senirapa water. They seemed disappointed
when they found out it was all gel.

rows.label: TownInfo305_5
rows.name:
That's what I've been trying to tell you!
The aqueous layer below us is cushioning gel!
Don't drink it, man! DON'T DRINK THE GEL!

rows.label: TownInfo306_1
rows.name:
For the life of me, I can't figure out what that
countdown timer on BLADE Tower is for.
Maybe I should ask my team leader? ...Nah.
It's probably nothing important.

rows.label: TownInfo306_2
rows.name:
Aaaaugh! I badgered my team leader about
the countdown timer, and she finally admitted
that it's the moment when we all DIE!
Aaaaauugh!

rows.label: TownInfo306_3
rows.name:
We repelled the Growth invasion, but our
remaining time on this world is circling the
drain. We gotta do something, and FAST!

rows.label: TownInfo306_4
rows.name:
There's only a little time left before our
Blue Bloods shut down. We have to get the
Central Life back, no matter the cost!

rows.label: TownInfo306_5
rows.name:
So I guess we actually won? We don't have to
worry about all our Blue Bloods suddenly
shutting down at exactly the same time?
...Holy crap, that is a creepy thought.

rows.label: TownInfo307_1
rows.name:
You heard of falsaxum? They're indigens that
disguise themselves as boulders. One of my
team members sat down on top of one once—
he won't make that mistake again!

rows.label: TownInfo307_2
rows.name:
We can't drink the water of Mira as is
because of some strange bacteria. Is there
anything on this planet that WON'T kill you?
...Er, besides Nopon, I mean.

rows.label: TownInfo307_3
rows.name:
Now that the Biahno water-purification plant
is complete, our water crisis is finally over.
We owe a great debt to the engineers who
pulled that one off.

rows.label: TownInfo307_4
rows.name:
So that guy sitting in the lowest strata beneath
Deliverance Park—is that Gerome? What could
he possibly be doing down there?

rows.label: TownInfo307_5
rows.name:
I've heard a rare, light-absorbing butterfly
called Absop's swallowtail has been found at
Rust Lake in Nightglow Forest. Should we try to hunt
one down?

rows.label: TownInfo308_1
rows.name:
They've found a massive wooded landmass
past the Biahno Grassland to the northwest.
They're calling it Nightglow Forest. You should join
BLADE and go investigate it.

rows.label: TownInfo308_2
rows.name:
It's our first date in I don't know how long,
and you take me to a water-purification plant?
Are you an IDIOT?!

rows.label: TownInfo308_3
rows.name:
...Huh? I should let the water-purification plant
thing be "water under the bridge"? That better
not be a joke, because I am NOT laughing!

rows.label: TownInfo308_4
rows.name:
I just saw Gwin playing with a dog up in
Ishmael Hills. ...N-not that I care one way or
the other about him, of course! What are you
getting so jealous about?!

rows.label: TownInfo308_5
rows.name:
...You think we should buy a house in Ishmael
Hills and live there forever? Oh, I'm going to
cry! And THAT'S the best waterworks-related
thing that's ever happened to us!

rows.label: TownInfo309_1
rows.name:
Some of the most talented BLADEs,
like Colonel Elma and Irina, use unique,
self-taught Arts. I wonder if they'd teach me
if I got all buddy-buddy with them.

rows.label: TownInfo309_2
rows.name:
There's a BLADE aspirant at the storage area
behind Union Drive who can't get through
basic training. But she refuses to give up,
and poor Walter is about to lose his mind.

rows.label: TownInfo309_3
rows.name:
If something strange ever got into the water-
purification plant, it could be serious trouble.
So if you see anyone behaving suspiciously,
let us know immediately!

rows.label: TownInfo309_4
rows.name:
What? A suspicious masked xeno has been
wandering around the perimeter of the water-
purification plant at night? I want it captured
and questioned at once!

rows.label: TownInfo309_5
rows.name:
Wait. You mean that suspicious xeno has been
sneaking in late at night to PURIFY the water?
...Huh. So that's why it tasted so good lately.

rows.label: TownInfo310_1
rows.name:
This engine is running hot, hot, hot!
This ain't gonna be easy to fix, no sir.

rows.label: TownInfo310_2
rows.name:
Yeah, I had a feeling it was some sort of
systems error. Thanks for coming down to help
with this, pal. Software ain't my bag.

rows.label: TownInfo310_3
rows.name:
It never would have occurred to me to even
try that fix. Ma-non engineering is way
beyond anything I ever thought possible!

rows.label: TownInfo310_4
rows.name:
Yep, we finally got it fixed. Luckily, I had all
the help I needed to do it. Thanks, you guys!

rows.label: TownInfo311_1
rows.name:
If you want to get to Valley of Oblivion, go around
Janpath Lake to the northeast and head east
from there. ...But did you really need to pull
me out of the maintenance center for THAT?

rows.label: TownInfo311_2
rows.name:
You found a wrecked vehicle at Valley of Oblivion's Twin
Arches? Well, it doesn't look like I'll be back
in action any time soon, so you'll have to
handle it.

rows.label: TownInfo311_3
rows.name:
Seems like they've made a lot of progress
surveying Valley of Oblivion. I wanna have my eyes fixed
as soon as possible so I can return to active
duty and help out!

rows.label: TownInfo311_4
rows.name:
Are you saying you guys know how to
reverse vision loss caused by a Blue Blood
degradation? Really? Even the Ma-non
technicians can't work that out!

rows.label: TownInfo311_5
rows.name:
You were able to fix my Blue Blood's eyes!
Now I can return to active duty as a BLADE!
Man, you Orphe are all right.

rows.label: TownInfo312_1
rows.name:
Is that the footage of Sylvalum received from
the research data probes? With that thick mist
hanging over everything, this is gonna be one
tough survey to carry out.

rows.label: TownInfo312_2
rows.name:
Phog's been locked in a staring contest with a
cat in Ishmael Hills for I don't know how long.
What is up with that guy? He's the oddest
duck in this city, and that's saying something.

rows.label: TownInfo312_3
rows.name:
Apparently the cat got the better of Phog in
their staring contest, and he ran away crying.
How can a self-respecting BLADE be
outmatched by a house cat?

rows.label: TownInfo312_4
rows.name:
They say those beaporge critters in Sylvalum
love to wash things. Be a dear and go to the
Cinderdunes to catch one for me, okay?
I could do with something like that around.

rows.label: TownInfo312_5
rows.name:
I can't believe you actually went to the
Cinderdunes all the way out in Sylvalum
and caught me a beaporge! I love you
soooo much!

rows.label: TownInfo313_1
rows.name:
Satie had an urgent job come up and went
running off to the administrative district.
It ain't easy being a mechanic, I tell you...

rows.label: TownInfo313_2
rows.name:
My husband just got back from an away
mission. I hope your husband is also able
to make it back from his assignment safely!

rows.label: TownInfo313_3
rows.name:
That woman's husband was killed in the line
of duty. As spouses of BLADE operatives
ourselves, we have to do what we can to
support her in this most terrible time.

rows.label: TownInfo313_4
rows.name:
You may be a Bias, but dealing with a
stubborn husband is hardly an alien concept
to us humans. We feel your pain, dear.

rows.label: TownInfo313_5
rows.name:
What do you say we get all the human and
Bias spouses together for a potluck?
Everyone can bring their favorite dish!
...As long as it's not weird.

rows.label: TownInfo314_1
rows.name:
I can't believe that such strong fighters could
go exploring and never return. Mira really is
a flaming pile of death once you leave this
city, isn't it?

rows.label: TownInfo314_2
rows.name:
They say the Bias woman who murdered my
friends is hiding out in Valley of Oblivion's Mesa Fortress.
Damn her! If I had the strength to do it,
I'd go kill her myself!

rows.label: TownInfo314_3
rows.name:
What's the deal with this little character here?
Are you trying to cheer me up?

rows.label: TownInfo314_4
rows.name:
It's incredible that such a tiny little fella could
survive in the outside world, what with all
those hungry indigens running around...

rows.label: TownInfo314_5
rows.name:
You want me to pay you for cheering me up?
You Nopon really are all about the money!
Well, how about I treat you to dinner?

rows.label: TownInfo315_1
rows.name:
What is BLADE thinking? Why would they
bring something as dangerous as that Doll
into this district?

rows.label: TownInfo315_2
rows.name:
I hear that Dolls are powerful enough to
pierce the armored hide of a millesaur.
They aren't actually expecting one of THOSE
to come wandering by here...right?

rows.label: TownInfo315_3
rows.name:
Thanks to this Doll, we were able to escape
when those bastards attacked us. But to
ensure the safety of the residential district,
they'll need to deploy a lot more!

rows.label: TownInfo315_4
rows.name:
There's a Zaruboggan named Shiraton
standing in front of Rosemoss in the
commercial district. That can't be good for
business.

rows.label: TownInfo315_5
rows.name:
The Zaruboggan removed all the dangerous
materials that had been packed into my
house. ...Whaaaat?! That was the reason the
Doll had been stationed here all along?!

rows.label: TownInfo316_1
rows.name:
It sounds like this planet has native people on
it too, right? I would love to meet one of them
someday. ...I mean, if I can?

rows.label: TownInfo316_2
rows.name:
Hey, you're one of those walking lunches I
heard about. A Nopon, right? Look, do you
mind if I take a bite of you? Just a small one
for for sampling purposes...

rows.label: TownInfo316_3
rows.name:
That Growth attack was way way too much,
you know? Both us Ma-non and the Nopon
worked together to to to run away as fast
as we could...

rows.label: TownInfo316_4
rows.name:
You'll do your best, won't you, BLADE friends?
And Ma-non are on your side now, so so
don't go losing to the Growth, all right?
That would make us so so sad...

rows.label: TownInfo316_5
rows.name:
I think Nopon overcharged and cheated me?
But but but I guess there may be a certain
excitement in dealing with such con artists...

rows.label: TownInfo317_1
rows.name:
I heard some White Whale wreckage fell
beyond North Coast in Valley of Oblivion. Course,
I'm just a wrench slinger, so it don't have
nothing to do with me.

rows.label: TownInfo317_2
rows.name:
I never thought I'd still be piddling around
fixing stuff even at the goddamn edge of the
universe. I just want to be a Doll mechanic
working for BLADE, for crying out loud!

rows.label: TownInfo317_3
rows.name:
But let's talk about this door here! What the
heck are you mixed up in that THIS happened
to it? Fixing this is gonna be way harder than
maintaining the White Whale...

rows.label: TownInfo317_4
rows.name:
That reminds me—what IS Miia doing these
days? That girl always wanted to be a BLADE,
but she got stuck with mechanic duty instead.

rows.label: TownInfo317_5
rows.name:
Miia's a BLADE now? Then what the hell am I
doing with my life? That's it! I'm gonna buckle
down and be the Doll mechanic I always
wanted to be! ...Soon as I fix this door.

rows.label: TownInfo318_1
rows.name:
I talked with Hope about what I want to do
next, and she really put my mind at ease.
You should talk to her about whatever's
bothering you.

rows.label: TownInfo318_2
rows.name:
I saw Hope tending to flowers at the small
park by the cathedral during lunch. Knowing
her, it was probably a favor for someone else.

rows.label: TownInfo318_3
rows.name:
My politician husband couldn't cut it on the
White Whale crew, so they sent him to sleep
in the Lifepoint. I hope they wake him soon so
he can join me here in the city.

rows.label: TownInfo318_4
rows.name:
Your family is in the Central Life, right?
...What?! They weren't even able to board the
White Whale? Oh, I'm so sorry.

rows.label: TownInfo318_5
rows.name:
Now that we know so much about Mira,
I would imagine that our families sleeping in
the Lifepoint should be able to return to us
soon.

rows.label: TownInfo319_1
rows.name:
So what did you get for dinner last night?
Aren't the foods made at the integrated
production plant the WORST?! They're
so flavorless. It's like Soylent Barf.

rows.label: TownInfo319_2
rows.name:
Kirsty's in a mood about something—she's
been barking orders at BLADEs near the
Home all day. Must be nice to be so pretty
that you even look good when you're mad.

rows.label: TownInfo319_3
rows.name:
Since we've learned how to make products out
of the resources available on Mira, more and
more commodities are becoming available.
God bless the Collepedians!

rows.label: TownInfo319_4
rows.name:
For dinner tonight, we're having bananaleaf
stew with amidresian tomatoes. Once you
give it a chance, Miran cuisine really starts
to grow on you!

rows.label: TownInfo319_5
rows.name:
My friend picked me a sonar lemon from
the North Janpath Plain. You can't hear it,
but when you float one in water, it actually
emits ultrasonic waves! So cool!

rows.label: TownInfo320_1
rows.name:
What must God think of us, his floundering
children, who have lost Earth and everything
upon it?

rows.label: TownInfo320_2
rows.name:
These xenos that BLADE has discovered—
the Nopon and Bias, I believe? I wonder if
they have their own gods that they worship?

rows.label: TownInfo320_3
rows.name:
The Ma-non say they don't believe in God.
Should we really choose to ally with the
faithless?

rows.label: TownInfo320_4
rows.name:
Sometimes I can't help but wonder—should
humans really have lived to see the day that
they discarded the bodies bestowed upon them
by their creator?

rows.label: TownInfo320_5
rows.name:
They finally managed to recover the Lifepoint.
At long last, we'll be able to reclaim the
fleshly bodies that God bestowed upon us!

rows.label: TownInfo321_1
rows.name:
You have to think in three dimensions to fight
effectively. You can strike enemy blind spots
when you're attacking from above, and attacks
from below can be easier to land, too.

rows.label: TownInfo321_2
rows.name:
Elma's team seems to have joined the
FrontierNet expansion game in a big way.
We're gonna have to step up our efforts!

rows.label: TownInfo321_3
rows.name:
They've detected a strange radio signal in
Primordia. But we need to expand FrontierNet
more before we can pinpoint the exact source.

rows.label: TownInfo321_4
rows.name:
Seems those strange radio waves were
coming from alien debris on Cliffside Beach
in Primordia. We should go check 'em out
when we have some spare time.

rows.label: TownInfo321_5
rows.name:
FrontierNet now covers nearly all Primordia.
It's time to use that as a stepping stone
to expand into more distant lands.

rows.label: TownInfo322_1
rows.name:
Grenada Galactic's ground gear is treated
with a high-quality anti-laser coating.
It puts Sakuraba's gear to shame!

rows.label: TownInfo322_2
rows.name:
Hey, is it true Meredith & Co. has been trying
to headhunt you? Those bastards are loaded,
and they've been poaching our people left
and right!

rows.label: TownInfo322_3
rows.name:
I feel like I can see eye to eye with you
Ma-non. I'm an atheist as well, you see.
I put my faith in my own talents.

rows.label: TownInfo322_4
rows.name:
You saw a plant-like indigen aggressively
circling the skies over Nightglow Forest's Everwhelm
Falls? Hmm... I wonder if it was an Overed?

rows.label: TownInfo322_5
rows.name:
You're an engineer for Candid & Credible?
And you actually think you can compete with
us at Grenada GG? Ha! Good luck!

rows.label: TownInfo323_1
rows.name:
Irina seems to have settled down a bit now
that she's found someone worthy of her
respect in Elma. In the old days, she was
almost like a rabid dog.

rows.label: TownInfo323_2
rows.name:
At sunset, I heard dogs barking at Irina
in front of a house near the cathedral.
That woman is just terrible with animals.

rows.label: TownInfo323_3
rows.name:
Despite all that, Irina's still really popular!
It's a shame she hates men, because there are
a whole lot of them who would love to make
her happy.

rows.label: TownInfo323_4
rows.name:
Whiling the time away as a gentle breeze
blows, I can almost forget that it's
pandemonium right outside those walls.

rows.label: TownInfo323_5
rows.name:
The trials we've faced on this planet have
really changed a lot of peoples' outlook on
life. It's certainly made me a little more
religious than I used to be.

rows.label: TownInfo324_1
rows.name:
It's a good thing that we'd already begun
producing Dolls before the tragedy hit Earth.
Without them, there's no way we'd ever have
managed to make it this far.

rows.label: TownInfo324_2
rows.name:
So even though the Ma-non managed to
build that amazing ship, they never possessed
Doll technology? ...Heh. Guess they don't
have us beat at everything, eh?

rows.label: TownInfo324_3
rows.name:
I've been thinking about trying to obtain a
Doll license myself. Of course, I'd have to
become a member of BLADE first.

rows.label: TownInfo324_4
rows.name:
You found a piece of White Whale wreckage
beyond the Keegan Ridge in Valley of Oblivion?
Best to leave the recovery of that sort of thing
to the Testamenters.

rows.label: TownInfo324_5
rows.name:
I've just been assigned to the Arms.
Just you wait and see—I'm gonna work night
and day until I finally earn that Doll license!

rows.label: TownInfo325_1
rows.name:
If you want to kill some time, grab a seat on
that red bench over there. These church
benches are ideal for whiling away a few
peaceful hours.

rows.label: TownInfo325_2
rows.name:
I'm glad a fair-minded man like Letrick was
put in charge of the cathedral. He's made it
possible for people of all faiths and beliefs to
feel welcome here.

rows.label: TownInfo325_3
rows.name:
I heard Letrick is out looking for a congregant
who visited the cathedral while he was out.
He's a diligent man, that one.

rows.label: TownInfo325_4
rows.name:
Elma's team repelled the Growth's giant
weapon of mass annihilation? That's GREAT!
...Although it seems like her team's always
the lead story in the news lately.

rows.label: TownInfo325_5
rows.name:
Do you think members of the Growth
worship a deity of some kind?
I wish I understood what they believe in,
in order to fathom why they attacked us.

rows.label: TownInfo326_1
rows.name:
Exploring the distant north?! Why do you
always get such dangerous assignments?
Please, please, PLEASE make it home safely!

rows.label: TownInfo326_2
rows.name:
My boyfriend was a BLADE, and you're the
ones who killed him! Damned xenos!
Get out of my sight! Get out of our city!

rows.label: TownInfo326_3
rows.name:
The xeno who uses a pack of caro to guard
O'rrh Sim Castle is the one who killed my
boyfriend! Xenoforms are our enemy!
So get the hell out of here already!

rows.label: TownInfo326_4
rows.name:
You went outside of the city and picked
lea lilies just to cheer me up...?

rows.label: TownInfo326_5
rows.name:
I guess there are some nice xenos out there.
And I'm...I'm sorry for all the horrible things
I said earlier.

rows.label: TownInfo327_1
rows.name:
You don't think we can trust Director General
Chausson? Then you, my friend, are an idiot!
He's a virtuous man!

rows.label: TownInfo327_2
rows.name:
A giant balaena has been sighted over the sea
south of La Mancha in Primordia. The Avalanchers
are all in an uproar about it.

rows.label: TownInfo327_3
rows.name:
When we crashed here, Chausson managed
to ease everyone's anxiety with his eloquent
speeches and financial-support programs.
There's a lot we could learn from him.

rows.label: TownInfo327_4
rows.name:
Look, we're in a crisis here, so it can't be
helped. But once they find the Lifepoint,
I want to establish a congress and start
deciding things democratically.

rows.label: TownInfo327_5
rows.name:
I was thinking we should start a political party
for when they establish the inevitable NLA
congress. Maybe you could be my secretary
or something?

rows.label: TownInfo328_1
rows.name:
Hey, if Phog is fit to serve as a BLADE,
surely we could pass the exam. I mean,
how hard can it be?

rows.label: TownInfo328_2
rows.name:
Phog's been wandering around the construction
site by the park. I bet he spaced out and
dropped his wallet or something.

rows.label: TownInfo328_3
rows.name:
Phog's been spacing out at the construction
site by the park. As usual, I have no idea
what's going on in that guy's head.

rows.label: TownInfo328_4
rows.name:
That Phoskeran guy has been hanging out in
Ishmael Hills, yelling to everyone about his
newfound obsession with fortune-telling.
...He is one weird Zaruboggan.

rows.label: TownInfo328_5
rows.name:
I saw Phog and Phoskeran chatting happily
about something. Figures those two nutjobs
would be on the same wavelength.

rows.label: TownInfo329_1
rows.name:
Take a pleasure drive around NLA?
What, to see the sights? Let me save you
the time—there's walls, walls, aaaaand oh!
MORE WALLS!

rows.label: TownInfo329_2
rows.name:
So, as long as your Doll is insured, you
can total it, and have it repaired and returned
to you as good as new? That's great!
I wish I could get a policy like that for my car.

rows.label: TownInfo329_3
rows.name:
A weird Ma-non by the name of Chiopitus is
walking in Barista Court in the commercial
district. I guess he wants humans to help with
an experiment, which, yeah. No thanks.

rows.label: TownInfo329_4
rows.name:
So you're saying if I continue north past
Northpointe, traveling along the shallows,
I'll reach a new continent? Thanks, but there's
no way my car can handle a trip like that.

rows.label: TownInfo329_5
rows.name:
I hope that one day they build long freeways
over the surface of Mira, so I can just drive
anywhere I want to go. Pave over paradise,
says I!

rows.label: TownInfo330_1
rows.name:
Whenever they want to recruit me into BLADE,
I'll be ready! Just gotta build up a little muscle
mass first.

rows.label: TownInfo330_2
rows.name:
Yeah, those guys... I think they made some
very wrong assumptions about how the game
of tennis is played.

rows.label: TownInfo330_3
rows.name:
Most of the folk who weren't able to evacuate
the residential district ended up taking refuge
on the Ma-non ship. They seem like goofballs,
but they sure came through in the clutch.

rows.label: TownInfo330_4
rows.name:
The joints in my right knee feel a little stiff.
Maybe I should take my Blue Blood in for a
diagnostic at the maintenance center?

rows.label: TownInfo330_5
rows.name:
My Blue Blood is back in top shape!
Now maybe I can give Ma-non-style tennis a
try. It actually looks like a lot of fun.

rows.label: TownInfo331_1
rows.name:
You're on nighttime wall-maintenance duty?
I'm pulling the graveyard shift doing basic
labor at the integrated production plant.
...Phew! These support jobs ain't easy.

rows.label: TownInfo331_2
rows.name:
Hey, you sure that ship ain't gonna crash? 
We survived against the odds for so long,
and it would really suck to be smashed flat
by that thing.

rows.label: TownInfo331_3
rows.name:
First they torch Earth, and now they're
attacking us in NLA? Why does this keep
happening? I mean, what did we do to piss
these guys off so much?

rows.label: TownInfo331_4
rows.name:
Aren't the Larsians the ones who attacked
this city? Is it really a good idea to let them
through the gates?

rows.label: TownInfo331_5
rows.name:
I saw a group of Larsians earlier, and they
had this really cool Japanese vibe to them!
I wonder if they have ninjas and pretty fans
and all that stuff?

rows.label: TownInfo332_1
rows.name:
My roof was leaking so bad I had to get a
repairman—turns out the shock waves from the
forced landing left cracks all over the place.

rows.label: TownInfo332_2
rows.name:
Greetings, Mr. Xenoform, and welcome to
NLA. I come in peace! If there is ever
anything you need help with while you're here,
please don't hesitate to ask.

rows.label: TownInfo332_3
rows.name:
There's a storage area behind the sports
complex where Phog has been wandering
around and staring at the ground all day.
Guess he must have dropped something...

rows.label: TownInfo332_4
rows.name:
This fully-automated laundry machine the
Ma-non made is incredible. It really is FULLY
automated—the clothes go straight from the
dryer into my closet!

rows.label: TownInfo332_5
rows.name:
I hope the Ma-non move beyond weapons
and expand their line of high-tech household
products. It'd sure make our daily lives here a
lot more pleasant.

rows.label: TownInfo334_1
rows.name:
I'm glad they planted all the trees from the 
White Whale around our block. It makes it
way easier to relax when you're surrounded
by familiar foliage.

rows.label: TownInfo334_2
rows.name:
I hear there's an unusual evello near Valley of Oblivion's
River Isle that spends all its time mindlessly
foraging for food. ...Like my ex! Ha!

rows.label: TownInfo334_3
rows.name:
Outside of gardening, there isn't a lot to do
for fun around here. That's probably why
everyone's yards are in such immaculate
condition.

rows.label: TownInfo334_4
rows.name:
So the Orphe eat plants, right? And some
people have been complaining about their
gardens getting ravaged? Maybe we need to
start putting up anti-animal netting.

rows.label: TownInfo334_5
rows.name:
When things settle down a bit, it would be
nice if we could start producing whatever
plants Orphe eat right here in NLA.

rows.label: TownInfo335_1
rows.name:
It's great to meet you all. Since we'll all be
sharing a house together, I hope we can learn
to trust and rely on each other.

rows.label: TownInfo335_2
rows.name:
Even now we have to share our houses, as
there aren't enough for everyone. When they
find the Lifepoint, they'll really have to expand
the residential district!

rows.label: TownInfo336_1
rows.name:
Is BLADE still undermanned? In addition to all
the former army personnel, it seems that all
the Lifepoint management staff are also being
transferred to BLADE.

rows.label: TownInfo336_2
rows.name:
I've been told to transfer to BLADE, but I'm just
a civilian! I wouldn't know the first thing about
fighting off indigens and junk, man!
I'm gonna die out there...

rows.label: TownInfo336_3
rows.name:
They say there's a giant bird indigen at
Mount M'gando in Cauldros. When I imagine
myself having to fight that thing... Nope.
Nope nope nope nope nope.

rows.label: TownInfo336_4
rows.name:
I've made up my mind. I'm still scared, but I'm
gonna become a BLADE operative after all.
I just couldn't bear to see my family killed by
indigens and know I could have stopped it.

rows.label: TownInfo336_5
rows.name:
Thanks to Drill Sergeant Wolf running me
ragged every day, I think I've actually gotten
a bit stronger. I hope I can go out for field
training and kill some indigens soon.

rows.label: TownInfo337_1
rows.name:
It seems the exploration team that went to
Sylvalum was completely wiped out. I wonder
what horrible indigens and strange mysteries
lie beneath that continent's misty shroud.

rows.label: TownInfo337_2
rows.name:
Did you guys actually set your Blue Bloods to
grow hair and fingernails? Isn't this life
challenging enough without having to worry
about junk like that?

rows.label: TownInfo337_3
rows.name:
Sounds like they found wreckage at the Anvil
Sandplain of a helicopter that was sent to
Sylvalum right after we landed on Mira...
I can't imagine there were any survivors.

rows.label: TownInfo337_4
rows.name:
When we were on Earth, lots of people were
vehemently against transferring their
consciousness to Blue Bloods. ...Really?
I mean, is flesh and blood so important?

rows.label: TownInfo337_5
rows.name:
Even though we've found the Lifepoint, I'd like
to stay in my Blue Blood. Having a flesh-and-
blood body that can never be replaced is just
a needless hassle!

rows.label: TownInfo338_1
rows.name:
They say it's when night falls that the truly
dangerous indigens come out. I think we're
safe here behind the city walls, but we should
probably still be careful.

rows.label: TownInfo338_2
rows.name:
There's a BLADE named Gwin who's always
training near the sports complex—even in the
dead of night. I certainly don't mind putting
my life in the hands of a man like that!

rows.label: TownInfo338_3
rows.name:
If it ever came down to it, we'd also take up
weapons and fight the evil xenoforms.
I refuse to lie down and be wiped out!

rows.label: TownInfo339_1
rows.name:
They say Nightglow Forest is a labyrinth, and many of
the BLADEs who've tried to explore it have
disappeared. My brother's there right now,
you know? I sure hope he's okay...

rows.label: TownInfo339_2
rows.name:
I heard they found Doll wreckage in
Nightglow Forest's Middle Hushflood. But it's
probably not the one my brother was
piloting...

rows.label: TownInfo339_3
rows.name:
My brother the BLADE is officially missing.
They're using FrontierNet to search for him,
but...

rows.label: TownInfo339_4
rows.name:
It looks like they found my missing brother's
signal with FrontierNet! I hope they locate him
soon...

rows.label: TownInfo339_5
rows.name:
BLADE never would have been able to rescue
my brother if they hadn't expanded
FrontierNet so much. He owes his life to
those brave Pathfinders!

rows.label: TownInfo340_1
rows.name:
They call that strange rock spire Talon Rock,
right? I hear it's surrounded by powerful
indigens and junk. No thanks, man. Keep me
far, far away from stuff with big teeth!

rows.label: TownInfo340_2
rows.name:
You know Talon Rock, over beyond the wall?
Doesn't it scare you to see living creatures on
it? I wish they'd hurry up and complete their
survey of that area...

rows.label: TownInfo340_3
rows.name:
BLADE's doing some great work. I hear their
survey of the dangerous area around Talon
Rock is almost complete.

rows.label: TownInfo340_4
rows.name:
I saw Miia standing in front of her Ishmael
Hills home looking troubled. And that is not
like her at ALL! She's about the spunkiest
person I know.

rows.label: TownInfo340_5
rows.name:
I wonder what Miia's mother was like? If she
was anything like her daughter, she must have
been one hell of an energetic lady.

rows.label: TownInfo341_1
rows.name:
I hear if you live at the BLADE Home, you
can change your floor's wall colors, lighting,
and even posters just by logging on to your
common room's terminal. How cool is that?

rows.label: TownInfo341_2
rows.name:
Apparently BLADEs with a Doll license can
customize their Dolls at the BLADE Home.
Their quarters are so different from the boring
old houses we civilians live in!

rows.label: TownInfo341_3
rows.name:
A Nopon named Warawa is searching the
commercial district for the super-rare gold
nopopotamus Miralife Card. Hooo boy!
That will NOT be easy to find...

rows.label: TownInfo341_4
rows.name:
The Ma-non have been space hobos for a
long time, and the ones I've met certainly
seem to exemplify that freedom.

rows.label: TownInfo341_5
rows.name:
The Ma-non seem like a reasonable people,
but I bet they wouldn't be so welcoming to
other races if their ship was a lot smaller!

rows.label: TownInfo342_1
rows.name:
My housemate is so antisocial that she climbed
up on the roof and refuses to come down.
I wish that just once I could get a normal
person to live with me.

rows.label: TownInfo342_2
rows.name:
The Orphe seem to be very few in number.
I've heard they're living in NLA now,
but I've barely seen any sign of them.

rows.label: TownInfo343_1
rows.name:
That's right! When you attack from a high
location like this, your foe will have trouble
responding. You can land frequent hits,
and it will be easier to strike weak points.

rows.label: TownInfo343_2
rows.name:
The real battle begins before you ever get into
combat. Don't forget that as you venture out
into Valley of Oblivion—I want you to come home safely.

rows.label: TownInfo343_3
rows.name:
I've heard you can recover some pretty rare
items out of the indigen dung around Victory
Rock in Valley of Oblivion. ...Huh? So WHAT if it's
filthy?! Go do it for all humankind's sake!

rows.label: TownInfo343_4
rows.name:
You're having trouble performing synchronized
Overclocks? Sure you are—it's the ultimate
BLADE technique! You all have to work as one
and be in perfect harmony with each other.

rows.label: TownInfo343_5
rows.name:
I should give you a break because you're off
duty? You'd best be forgetting about breaks!
If you don't spend more time training,
you'll never catch up to Elma's team.

rows.label: TownInfo344_1
rows.name:
Relax. As long as those giant defensive walls
are standing, no indigens or enemy xenos
will be getting into this city.

rows.label: TownInfo344_2
rows.name:
I've been thinking about the xenos who
attacked our BLADEs. And no matter how
ferocious they were, there's no way they
can destroy these walls. We're totally safe.

rows.label: TownInfo344_3
rows.name:
I can't believe how easily they were able to
get past our walls to attack us! That'll teach
me to get all cocky about our defenses...

rows.label: TownInfo344_4
rows.name:
If that massive Zu Pharg thing were to come
to this city, it'd be game over, man.

rows.label: TownInfo344_5
rows.name:
I hear the new plan is to have the Ma-non
help us build some kind of force field barrier
around the city walls. NLA's defenses are
only getting better!

rows.label: TownInfo345_1
rows.name:
I know this isn't the time to be complaining
about such things, but the clothes they've
supplied us with are simply horrible. I look
like a reject from an old Earth outlet mall!

rows.label: TownInfo345_2
rows.name:
Belle Betty Fashions' new lineup is out!
Finally we'll be free of these charmless
government-issued clothes!

rows.label: TownInfo345_3
rows.name:
Oh my gosh! Victoria from Belle Betty
Fashions is recruiting designers at Barista
Court! I'm going to be so fashionable before
this is all over, you won't even believe it.

rows.label: TownInfo345_4
rows.name:
Have you tried the new fragrance from
Belle Betty Fashions' up-and-coming
Ma-non designer, Panyar? It's incredible.

rows.label: TownInfo345_5
rows.name:
I hope Panyar releases something new soon,
and I also hope the line includes some fresh
new fashions. My hat selection is simply
dreadful. And spring outerwear? Forget it!

rows.label: TownInfo346_1
rows.name:
In the searing heat of Valley of Oblivion's Barbarich
Desert, wreckage from the White Whale
sits waiting to be recovered. We need
to go find it!

rows.label: TownInfo346_2
rows.name:
During a heat wave, your body won't function
normally, significantly decreasing your melee-
combat ability. Keep that in mind in when out
in Valley of Oblivion.

rows.label: TownInfo346_3
rows.name:
The Ma-non ship floats without making any
noise at all. Do you think they can control
gravity or something? Man, I bet the Growth
would kill for tech like that.

rows.label: TownInfo346_4
rows.name:
Such an impressive ship, and yet it has no
armaments whatsoever. The Ma-non must be
the biggest damn optimists in the universe.

rows.label: TownInfo346_5
rows.name:
If we study the technology used to make the
Ma-non ship, couldn't we make an even more
advanced version of the White Whale? Then
WE could be the ones traveling the galaxy!

rows.label: TownInfo347_1
rows.name:
If all of the indigens on the other side of that
wall climbed over in a coordinated attack,
what would we do? I mean, besides scream.
...And probably die.

rows.label: TownInfo347_2
rows.name:
Far to the east, in Valley of Oblivion, there are starving
indigens that have gone days without food or
water. Apparently they've already eaten several
BLADEs, soooo...yeah.

rows.label: TownInfo347_3
rows.name:
There's a rocklike ovis near the Twin Arches
that attacks everything in sight. ...You know
what? Sometimes I really hate this planet.

rows.label: TownInfo347_4
rows.name:
If that Ma-non ship floating over the city were
to start bombing us in the dead of night,
we'd be screwed. ...This is why I can't sleep
anymore.

rows.label: TownInfo347_5
rows.name:
I finally realized that the scariest thing in the
world is the thought of you leaving me.
I promise to be brave from now on so you'll
never have to be ashamed of me again.

rows.label: TownInfo348_1
rows.name:
A patrol helicopter crashed near Arendt Bridge
on Talon Rock to the north of NLA.
But it sounds like BLADE doesn't have the
manpower to recover the wreckage.

rows.label: TownInfo348_2
rows.name:
Getting drunk is pretty much the only thing
there is to do for fun in this city, and that's
just making drunken idiots out of everyone.
We need a mini-golf course or something.

rows.label: TownInfo348_3
rows.name:
When I lived on Earth, I'd often go to movie
theaters on the weekends. But now the data
for most of Earth's greatest films is lost in the
wreckage of the White Whale. It's a tragedy...

rows.label: TownInfo348_4
rows.name:
Our historical databases in the Lifepoint
Archive units are being destroyed by
the Growth—and with them, our culture.

rows.label: TownInfo348_5
rows.name:
Hey, why don't we all build a movie theater?
And if we don't have movies, we'll just shoot
our own! I bet our new xeno friends would be
pretty impressed.

rows.label: TownInfo349_1
rows.name:
I logged onto FrontierNet, but there's barely
any decent information on it! What the hell
has BLADE been doing? And where am I
supposed to get my funny cat pictures?

rows.label: TownInfo349_2
rows.name:
A slow trickle of information has begun to
appear on FrontierNet. It's not much, but I'm
finally able to learn about the outside world.

rows.label: TownInfo349_3
rows.name:
If the posts on this FrontierNet message board
are to be believed, Mira seems to be a world
that can support human life. ...Aside from
all the stuff that wants to eat you, that is.

rows.label: TownInfo349_4
rows.name:
It was nice of BLADE to put a research data
probe at such a beautiful spot. I can look at
this view all day and never get sick of it.

rows.label: TownInfo349_5
rows.name:
FrontierNet is finally open to everyone,
and there's a ton of information about Mira
available. Nicely done, BLADE. Nicely done.

rows.label: TownInfo350_1
rows.name:
Shout from your soul! Answer my Soul Voice!
RAAAWR! I can feel power welling up
from within, just like when fighting!

rows.label: TownInfo350_2
rows.name:
Tonight, we put our assignments and troubles
out of our minds and erupt! And we send off
our comrades who are being deployed with
the power of DANCE!

rows.label: TownInfo350_3
rows.name:
Let us celebrate the return of our comrades
from Sylvalum! Dance! Dance because of all
the pain in the world! Dance because you
are truly free! DAAAAAAAANCE!

rows.label: TownInfo350_4
rows.name:
You found an alien container in Sylvalum?
In the foothills of the Southern Delusians?
Forget that and dance! No duty now!
There is only THE DAAAAAANCE!

rows.label: TownInfo350_5
rows.name:
Now and only now, I permit you to dream!
Because when tomorrow comes, you shall be
a splendid BLADE once more!

rows.label: TownInfo351_1
rows.name:
I'd better tell those young folks who are being
all rowdy in the park to quiet down a little.
...Damn, that makes me sound old.

rows.label: TownInfo351_2
rows.name:
What a tragedy to see one's fleeting youth
spoiled by duty. I can certainly sympathize
with those rowdy kids in the park, but...

rows.label: TownInfo351_3
rows.name:
Near Valley of Oblivion's Lake Basel, there's a mephite 
that gathers and lives off the leavings of other
indigens. Maybe it's some sort of mutation?

rows.label: TownInfo351_4
rows.name:
There seem to be more young people than
ever who aspire to become BLADEs. And that's
despite their lack of military experience and
natural fear of combat. It's impressive!

rows.label: TownInfo351_5
rows.name:
The foolish young kids in the park are the
future of NLA. It's our duty to help them
channel that abundant energy in the right
directions and quit horsing around!

rows.label: TownInfo352_1
rows.name:
We know this planet is rich in ferocious 
indigens, but could it prove to be just as rich
in natural resources? Those who venture out
may have useful information along such lines.

rows.label: TownInfo352_2
rows.name:
Now that we've made friends with xenos who
command such impressive technology, I wonder
if there might actually be a way for us to
muddle through this war.

rows.label: TownInfo352_3
rows.name:
You had a "memory" of seeing wreckage of
an alien civilization in Nightglow Forest's Qing Long
Glade? Did you actually see it, or just sense it
with that Ovah-whatever thing you do?

rows.label: TownInfo352_4
rows.name:
So you Orphe only eat plants? All right then.
Next time, I'll make a huge salad, roast some
carrots, and press some fresh tofu.
Trust me, you'll love it.

rows.label: TownInfo352_5
rows.name:
We know we can trust you Larsians.
You're always fighting hard outside, so when
you're in the city, take some time to relax and
enjoy yourselves, m'kay?

rows.label: TownInfo353_1
rows.name:
Even when you're off duty, you're still on call.
What are you gonna do if there's an
emergency, huh? You're way too plowed to
fight at the moment!

rows.label: TownInfo353_2
rows.name:
You do know how your beloved Gwin got to
where he is now, right? By working hard day
in and day out!

rows.label: TownInfo353_3
rows.name:
Gwin and Mathias were having a passionate
discussion about something at the water-
purification plant. Those two sure are close!

rows.label: TownInfo353_4
rows.name:
Even when you're off duty, you should be
doing what you can to contribute to your
Union. That way everyone will benefit from
receiving better supplies.

rows.label: TownInfo353_5
rows.name:
Look, I know you're off duty, but I'm working 
right now! Why do you always do this to me?
