...Because you miss me? Hey! I told you to
stop mixing our private life with work!

rows.label: TownInfo354_1
rows.name:
If you meet a Collepedian who calls herself
the Murderess, watch out. They say she's
conned plenty of her "friends" along the way,
and isn't even above a little...murder.

rows.label: TownInfo354_2
rows.name:
During lunch, I saw the Murderess talking to
a suspicious-looking guy at the house across
from Deliverance Park. Then I walked away,
because I don't want to end up in a ditch...

rows.label: TownInfo354_3
rows.name:
If you belong to a squad that produces results
in an online mission or squad tasks, you'll get
your cut of the reward even if you're standing
guard a mile away. ...Like I did just now! Heh.

rows.label: TownInfo354_4
rows.name:
When you Larsians join our patrols, it's like
having 100 additional troops! Seriously, you're
kind of amazing. And scary. So glad you're
on our side.

rows.label: TownInfo354_5
rows.name:
Ever since you started helping out with the
night patrols, the amount of suspicious activity
has dropped to nearly nothing. Huge props!

rows.label: TownInfo355_1
rows.name:
So maybe my sister had some sort of
communication error and that's why I haven't
heard anything during her deployment? Like,
she can't get onto FrontierNet or something?

rows.label: TownInfo355_2
rows.name:
I got a message from my sister saying there's
a valuable-looking alien reliquary in the
magma fields of Cauldros. Ooo, so exciting!

rows.label: TownInfo355_3
rows.name:
I owe a debt of gratitude to the Testamenters for
risking their lives to bring my sister's remains
back from Cauldros. Now we can finally
give her a proper funeral. ...Oh, Sis.

rows.label: TownInfo355_4
rows.name:
Hey, Sis. I've become a BLADE just like you.
And I promise you this—one day I'll bring you
back to life in your real body.

rows.label: TownInfo355_5
rows.name:
I saw a beautiful flower called a jaharmum
growing in the lava-covered land near the
Emerian Battlegrounds. I want to pick a few
more as an offering for my late sister.

rows.label: TownInfo356_1
rows.name:
A great many BLADEs have lost their lives to
the mutant variants of indigens known as
Overeds. Of all the planets to land on, why did
we have to wind up in such an awful place?

rows.label: TownInfo356_2
rows.name:
There seems to be a particularly dangerous
Overed in Primordia. They say it annihilated
two BLADE teams in a matter of seconds,
then promptly fled the scene.

rows.label: TownInfo356_3
rows.name:
They've learned more about that murderous
Overed in Primordia. Apparently it's a saltat
defending a wide swath of territory centered
on Fallshorn Isle.

rows.label: TownInfo356_4
rows.name:
That indigen who devoured those tainted
creatures in Nightglow Forest may have saved our
lives.

rows.label: TownInfo356_5
rows.name:
Could mere BLADEs even hope to defeat
Nightglow Forest's Ruler of Fates? It is like some sort
of divine being, I hear.

rows.label: TownInfo357_1
rows.name:
Don't be so glum! The White Whale may be
gone, but at least we're alive and kicking.

rows.label: TownInfo357_2
rows.name:
BLADE has identified a wide variety of
xenoforms. Some of these may also eventually
become our allies, just like the Ma-non did.

rows.label: TownInfo358_1
rows.name:
You should outfit yourself in Grenada GG
gear for your next assignment. It's the best
way for us to advertise our armaments and
help grow our business.

rows.label: TownInfo358_2
rows.name:
I've seen Phog hanging out by himself at the
lower strata beneath Deliverance Park in broad
daylight. It's awfully suspicious behavior, right?
Maybe we should report him to the Companions?

rows.label: TownInfo358_3
rows.name:
Another exhausting day... I'm really struggling
with my job at Grenada GG. To be honest,
I don't know all that much about weapons.

rows.label: TownInfo358_4
rows.name:
I think I might be able to succeed if I just keep
at it. I've gotten a little more used to the
weapons-development side of the business,
and the job's starting to get more satisfying.

rows.label: TownInfo358_5
rows.name:
I've been put in charge of new weapons
development! Mark my words—our new
lineup is gonna make all the other AMs
stand up and take notice.

rows.label: TownInfo359_1
rows.name:
I caught a glimpse of that new member of
Elma's team. I can't put my finger on it,
but I have a feeling that one's about to
accomplish great things.

rows.label: TownInfo359_2
rows.name:
All right, we need to start sharing any
intel we gather between our squads.
That's the best way to look out for one
another in the crazy, mixed-up world!

rows.label: TownInfo359_3
rows.name:
I heard a Ma-non named Ackwar became a
Companion. Can you tiny little fellas really fulfill
the duties of a BLADE?

rows.label: TownInfo359_4
rows.name:
I saw Ackwar interviewing witnesses on
Melville Street. Did something happen there?

rows.label: TownInfo359_5
rows.name:
Man, I never would have guessed that Powell
was a serial killer! That is so...wow. I mean,
he always seemed so nice.

rows.label: TownInfo360_1
rows.name:
Those rescued crew members were lucky the
indigens didn't destroy their Lifepods.
Otherwise...kkkkkkccch!

rows.label: TownInfo360_2
rows.name:
It didn't really hit me until we landed here,
but I can't believe we've spent the last two
years running across the galaxy and away
from those bastards!

rows.label: TownInfo360_3
rows.name:
We've been ordered to recover the Doll
wreckage that was discovered at South Coast
in Valley of Oblivion. I have a feeling it's not going to be
a pleasant assignment.

rows.label: TownInfo360_4
rows.name:
People always say it's more dangerous to
explore at night, but some dangerous
indigens—like the vigents of Valley of Oblivion—only
come out during the day.

rows.label: TownInfo360_5
rows.name:
To our friends asleep in the Lifepoint, life
stopped two years ago. They're gonna be
awfully surprised when they wake up.

rows.label: TownInfo361_1
rows.name:
So you're an Interceptor now? Well, I hope
you can restrain yourself from going
overboard the way Irina always does.

rows.label: TownInfo361_2
rows.name:
The rules say that a Pathfinder who discovers
a new area gets to name it, which has folks
rushing to find new locations. That Vandham
can be pretty shrewd sometimes.

rows.label: TownInfo361_3
rows.name:
I heard there's a Nopon caravan at Valley of Oblivion's
Lake Basel. If you ever end up exploring that
area, make sure to pay it a visit.

rows.label: TownInfo361_4
rows.name:
The Nopon at Valley of Oblivion's Lake Basel think the
aetrygons that live in the rocky area around
them are divine emissaries that swoop down
from above. ...What a funny bunch of guys.

rows.label: TownInfo361_5
rows.name:
I've lost a lot of good friends recently.
Now I'll just have to work that much harder
to continue their legacy.

rows.label: TownInfo362_1
rows.name:
I can't help but wonder what happened to
Earth after we left. It was consumed by that
huge bright light, but then? Who knows?

rows.label: TownInfo362_2
rows.name:
No matter how hard they try to make the city
look like Earth, it isn't. It's not Earth, and it
won't ever BE Earth!

rows.label: TownInfo362_3
rows.name:
I signed on to one of the research data probes
that Elma's team installed and saw scenery
unlike anything I'd ever imagined. It made me
start crying, and...I have no idea why.

rows.label: TownInfo362_4
rows.name:
I saw Miia in the alley behind the residential
district one night, and she was as perky as
ever. Seeing her like that always makes me
feel better.

rows.label: TownInfo362_5
rows.name:
Seeing the footage of the outside world on
FrontierNet makes me realize that while we
may have lost Earth, we have an opportunity
to build a new world here on Mira.

rows.label: TownInfo363_1
rows.name:
When you wound an indigen or destroy one
of its body parts, they seem to enter some sort
of violent frenzy. So don't get complacent until
you know that it's deader than disco.

rows.label: TownInfo363_2
rows.name:
I've heard that if you bring down a suid,
once in a blue moon they drop an incredibly
delicious marbled fillet. Oh, and the stronger
the beast, the better the odds.

rows.label: TownInfo363_3
rows.name:
There's still wreckage from Growth Dolls
in the commercial district, but we've been told
not to move it until the investigation is over.
Come on, already! I'm tired of lookin' at it!

rows.label: TownInfo363_4
rows.name:
As someone with no particular skills, I only
got a spot on the White Whale because my
daddy was a high government official.
...I think people resent me for that.

rows.label: TownInfo363_5
rows.name:
I wonder if the people who were selected for
the Earthlife Colonization Project due to merit
hate me for getting in through connections.
I...I can't really blame them.

rows.label: TownInfo364_1
rows.name:
In the two years since we left Earth, I've come
to view all my fellow companions as family.

rows.label: TownInfo364_2
rows.name:
Welcome to NLA! It's a pleasure to meet you
and welcome you into your new family.

rows.label: TownInfo364_3
rows.name:
...Hmm? An elder at the Nopon Bazaar is so
sick he's about to collapse? That's horrible!
If there's anything we can do to help,
don't hesitate to ask.

rows.label: TownInfo364_4
rows.name:
Were those giant fireworks launched from the
Nopon caravan? They were beautiful! I'd love
to see them again one day.

rows.label: TownInfo364_5
rows.name:
Once the Growth have been wiped from this
planet, I would love to travel around Mira and
visit all four Nopon caravans.

rows.label: TownInfo365_1
rows.name:
I've loved you from the moment I met you on
the White Whale! And when I return from
my next assignment, I want to marry you!

rows.label: TownInfo365_2
rows.name:
What? You can't marry me because we've
made so little progress expanding FrontierNet?
Then I'll install every last data probe myself!

rows.label: TownInfo365_3
rows.name:
You won't marry me unless I install more
data probes in Sylvalum? That's so random...
Uh, I mean... Very well! I'll depart at once!

rows.label: TownInfo365_4
rows.name:
You won't marry me until I've recovered the
alien container that was discovered at Badr
Basin in Sylvalum? SERIOUSLY?
You have the strangest conditions...

rows.label: TownInfo365_5
rows.name:
We can finally get married? All right!
I don't know who it was that did all those
Sylvalum survey assignments for me, but thanks
for everything, random mysterious stranger!

rows.label: TownInfo366_1
rows.name:
We Bias are strong. Not so good at crafts.
But with full bellies, we can lift anything!

rows.label: TownInfo366_2
rows.name:
I worked all day. Stomach is growly.
Boss! Call Army Pizza! Order 10!

rows.label: TownInfo366_3
rows.name:
Earth-alien food is tasty, but amounts are tiny.
Boss! Add 30 grenade pizzas to order!

rows.label: TownInfo366_4
rows.name:
I work hard to build our home. I need pizza.
Lots of pizza. Fifty grenade pizzas!

rows.label: TownInfo366_5
rows.name:
We build place where Earth aliens and xenos
live together. Now we get pizza! Much pizza!
One hundred pizzas for party with new
friends!

rows.label: TownInfo367_1
rows.name:
Ah, this wood looks quite edible. ...Hmm?
This wood is so precious a commodity that
you would "punch my fat face" if I ate it?
Such violent thoughts befit a savage species!

rows.label: TownInfo367_2
rows.name:
Unlike your people, we Orphe do not waste
precious wood in manufacturing projects.
We build our homes among the trees.

rows.label: TownInfo367_3
rows.name:
Life aboard the Ma-non vessel does not agree
with my epidermis. Perhaps you humans would
be so kind as to build me a small shed in that
lovely green park there?

rows.label: TownInfo367_4
rows.name:
Ah, so this "Earth" from which you hail was a
beautiful world with abundant greenery?
That sounds lovely. I would have very much
liked to have visited it.

rows.label: TownInfo367_5
rows.name:
The vigor and celerity with which you
humans finished your survey of Nightglow Forest
was nothing short of incredible.
And, conversely, potentially terrifying.

rows.label: TownInfo368_1
rows.name:
Ha ha! When we Ma-non get together with
you humans, everyone has a wonderful time!
...Er, we DO have a wonderful time, right?

rows.label: TownInfo368_2
rows.name:
At the Arms test hangar, a human named
Hugo claims to be making an invention that'll
reshape history. Do you think he'd let me help
with his research, maybe?

rows.label: TownInfo368_3
rows.name:
You know Miss Celica who lives in the
industrial district? I wonder what planet
she came from. I've never seen the
likes of her before, have you?

rows.label: TownInfo368_4
rows.name:
Miss Celica risked her life to become a BLADE
for Rock's sake, right? What a good friend! 
I wish she was my good good friend too,
you know?

rows.label: TownInfo368_5
rows.name:
Miss Celica and Rock sure have made
themselves at home over there, haven't they?
They seem to have lots of human friends
visiting them at that warehouse all the time.

rows.label: TownInfo369_1
rows.name:
Everyone is so obsessed with this "pizza"
foodstuff right now, but but but I'm not.
I mean, can just eating food really be that
enjoyable? Really?

rows.label: TownInfo369_2
rows.name:
Wow, that was delicious and fun, wasn't it?
Until I tried pizza, I had no idea, you know?
Humans are so so so incredible...

rows.label: TownInfo369_3
rows.name:
So in the commercial district, I guess a Nopon
named Bubu is worried about his wife going
missing? That is so so sad...

rows.label: TownInfo369_4
rows.name:
Humans say they use this "cathedral" facility
near here to get married, right? So maybe
you'd like to...um...try it out some day?

rows.label: TownInfo369_5
rows.name:
When we get married, we should have Shallot
at Army Pizza make our wedding pizza.
...That's a thing, right? Wedding pizza?
That's a thing that people do?

rows.label: TownInfo370_1
rows.name:
This shiny lamp imported straight from
Dodonga Caravan! Some wealthy friend
sure to buy it for 500,000 credits!

rows.label: TownInfo370_2
rows.name:
These are magical finding rods sent all the
way from Dorian Caravan in Valley of Oblivion.
They practically sell selves, so don't return
until all are sold!

rows.label: TownInfo370_3
rows.name:
Meh-meh! No one want to buy limited-edition
spore balloon from Dopang Caravan!
Where are children? Children always waste
money of parent on silly things.

rows.label: TownInfo370_4
rows.name:
Friend can get treasure from strange tree at
the Middle Hushflood in Nightglow Forest. Now step
up sales, or else lazy helper will
go get it instead!

rows.label: TownInfo370_5
rows.name:
Extra-large cash box was purchased from
Drongo Caravan in Cauldros, but it still
mostly empty. Human friends are too stubborn
with coin purses!

rows.label: TownInfo371_1
rows.name:
Humans are so so strong, you know? But even
strong humans need weapons. Maybe it would
be okay if we made you weapons so you
could go fight baddies?

rows.label: TownInfo371_2
rows.name:
Thanks for protecting us from the Growth.
I was thinking that maybe we could make you
lots and lots of cool stuff as a reward?

rows.label: TownInfo371_3
rows.name:
Lately, we've started researching your
Blue Bloods. That's okay, isn't it?
Anyway, if you're having problems, I'd be
so so happy to take a look...

rows.label: TownInfo371_4
rows.name:
The Growth seem to have some sort of un-
manned weapons they call "xe-dom" on their
mining ships in Cauldros. Perhaps you could
use your human power to...smash them?

rows.label: TownInfo371_5
rows.name:
BLADE smashed up those xe-dom in the mining
ships, didn't they? Perhaps now that we have
human power on our side, the Growth won't
seem quite so so scary...

rows.label: TownInfo372_1
rows.name:
Never mind electricity-resistant ground gear,
you know? Candid & Credible should focus on
making high-performance tennis gear, right?

rows.label: TownInfo372_2
rows.name:
Ready, steady, er...serve? I will not be
defeated on this tennis court...I hope?

rows.label: TownInfo372_3
rows.name:
I've given tennis everything I have, you know?
But but but I still can't beat this guy...

rows.label: TownInfo372_4
rows.name:
They say there's an alien reliquary in the Old
Ceremonial Hollow in Cauldros, you know?
Maybe if I had whatever relic lies within there
I could finally finally beat this guy...

rows.label: TownInfo372_5
rows.name:
Tennis is a really really deep game...
Maybe the net is actually a metaphor for life?

rows.label: TownInfo373_1
rows.name:
...Eat you? I won't eat you.
I want company for training.

rows.label: TownInfo373_2
rows.name:
Nopon are too weak for training partner.
City needs stronger xenos!

rows.label: TownInfo373_3
rows.name:
You fought well. I was sloppy.
Not so next time. Now train with me more!

rows.label: TownInfo373_4
rows.name:
Strong turba named Tormenta, the Scarlet-Clad
lives at the Decapotamon in Nightglow Forest.
I will go there and slay it!

rows.label: TownInfo373_5
rows.name:
Someone killed mighty turba of the
Decapotamon. But next Overed I will kill!

rows.label: TownInfo374_1
rows.name:
When friend has Nopon weapons, indigens 
that fear fire are easy-peasy pickings!
Weapon also good for making s'mores,
so friend must buy entire stock right away!

rows.label: TownInfo374_2
rows.name:
You! Rich friend! Come invest wealth in
Nopon Commerce Guild. Friend is practically
guaranteed to not lose single credit!
...Not legally guaranteed though.

rows.label: TownInfo374_3
rows.name:
Human friends are incredible—they even
explore Cauldros! Friends should find
precious miranium there and invest every
last gram in Nopon Commerce Guild.

rows.label: TownInfo374_4
rows.name:
Apparently Nopon friend saw White Whale
wreckage at Wildcat Fortress in Cauldros.
Wonder if it full of treasure?

rows.label: TownInfo374_5
rows.name:
Thanks to rich human friends investing in
business, Nopon Commerce Guild grow even
bigger. Nopon look forward to continued
relationship of lucrativeness!

rows.label: TownInfo375_1
rows.name:
Can the humans truly defeat the Growth?
Perhaps I should factor in the newest
developments and recalculate victory odds.

rows.label: TownInfo375_2
rows.name:
I've just recalculated the humans' odds
of victory against the Growth.
The expansion of FrontierNet has only
improved their chances by 0.03 percent.

rows.label: TownInfo375_3
rows.name:
Expanding FrontierNet increases the odds
of the city's survival. My research confirms
that these things are indeed related.

rows.label: TownInfo375_4
rows.name:
Have you been following the election news?
According to Sun'barac, who's been
gathering data on the Ma-non ship, a
dangerous new candidate has emerged.

rows.label: TownInfo375_5
rows.name:
If only everyone on this planet had access
to the Ovah, we could conclude this
election in a much more efficient fashion.

rows.label: TownInfo376_1
rows.name:
The sap of the trees that the humans planted
is barely palatable. It makes me long for
the days when we lived in the forest.

rows.label: TownInfo376_2
rows.name:
To think that the Growth are powerful
enough to bend even the mighty Larsians
to their will. Samaar has certainly created
a monster in them.

rows.label: TownInfo376_3
rows.name:
The humans have been using artificial bodies
that cannot speak with the Ovah.
That is truly unsettling.

rows.label: TownInfo376_4
rows.name:
I've gathered the materials. Now perhaps I
shall tinker with the trees in this park.

rows.label: TownInfo376_5
rows.name:
The work is complete. Within 100 years or so,
the trees in this park will grow into giants on
a scale rarely seen outside of Nightglow Forest.

rows.label: TownInfo377_1
rows.name:
I suppose I must analyze this human concept
of "God," and try to determine whether it
might have utility for us Orphe.

rows.label: TownInfo377_2
rows.name:
It seems the Bias and the Nopon both
worship beings that bear a conceptual
resemblance to the God of humanity.
Is there a meaning in this pattern?

rows.label: TownInfo377_3
rows.name:
In the industrial district, I spied the xenoform
Celica massaging the head of a small,
long-eared animal. Could that have been a
form of religious worship as well?

rows.label: TownInfo377_4
rows.name:
Nopon and Ma-non alike seem to be
fleeing in shock at our presence here.
What could they possibly be so afraid of?

rows.label: TownInfo377_5
rows.name:
I am grateful to the xenoform, Celica.
She is the only one who reacts to our
presence with a smile instead of some
woeful expression of panic.

rows.label: TownInfo378_1
rows.name:
My Ovah is surging! There seems to be some
mysterious aura on this field the humans refer
to as a "tennis court."

rows.label: TownInfo378_2
rows.name:
When I saw the Prog Ares as it sped away
from the hangar, the sight set my Ovah astir.
I cannot begin to speculate as to why this is...

rows.label: TownInfo378_3
rows.name:
The humans did indeed defeat Luxaar in the
end. Was the judgment of my previous five
fission progenitors correct after all?

rows.label: TownInfo378_4
rows.name:
Now humanity's knowledge of this planet has
surpassed even the information amassed by
the Growth. I wonder just how much power
these humans will manage to collect.

rows.label: TownInfo378_5
rows.name:
Perhaps the people in that tower will manage
to solve the mysteries of this planet that even
the Growth could not.

rows.label: TownInfo379_1
rows.name:
Growth have mighty tech, but Earth aliens
have best city. Even better than forts on
Tormein.

rows.label: TownInfo379_2
rows.name:
Earth aliens endured Growth's power. 
Tree Clan could not. Earth aliens may have
strength to beat Growth for good.

rows.label: TownInfo379_3
rows.name:
Vandham is strong. Very strong.
He beat me arm-wrestling!

rows.label: TownInfo379_4
rows.name:
Earth aliens fight! Larsians fight!
Even tiny Nopon Tatsu fight!
We must not be humbled on battlefield!

rows.label: TownInfo379_5
rows.name:
We are allies with Cavern Clan now.
This Earth-alien "diplomacy" is strong.

rows.label: TownInfo380_1
rows.name:
With Aganeba's help, we're now even able to
readily obtain some materials that are really
difficult to refine. The Ma-non have some
impressive technologies, I tell you what!

rows.label: TownInfo381_1
rows.name:
You're looking for Gerome? A friend of mine
just saw him at the water-purification plant.

rows.label: TownInfo391_1
rows.name:
Even though NLA still lacks a lot of crucial
facilities, I appreciate that they made building
the cathedral a priority.

rows.label: TownInfo391_2
rows.name:
Looks like another BLADE funeral. I hope that
poor soul can find the way to heaven from
this rock...

rows.label: TownInfo391_3
rows.name:
They say in the dead of night, when no one's
looking, a masked xenoform comes to the
cathedral to worship demons! Isn't that just
terrifying?

rows.label: TownInfo391_4
rows.name:
That Tobias will do anything to make a buck!
He's engaged in all sorts of dirty business
down in the industrial district, I hear. Someone
needs to give him a taste of God's wrath.

rows.label: TownInfo391_5
rows.name:
You know those xenos that worship the devil?
The Zaruboggan, I think they're called?
I wonder what their devil god looks like?
Horns, probably. Maybe a big fork.

rows.label: TownInfo392_1
rows.name:
You're a mechanic for the Collepedians Union
now? Yikes! You'd better watch out for a
BLADE named the Murderess if you know
what's good for you!

rows.label: TownInfo392_2
rows.name:
I saw Lara Nara flirting with his boyfriend at
the terrace in front of BLADE Tower.
He was saying he had some good news...

rows.label: TownInfo392_3
rows.name:
Irina sure is nice to her fellow BLADEs.
I even see her talking to that Murderess
misfit sometimes!

rows.label: TownInfo392_4
rows.name:
Did you hear? They say the Murderess finally
snapped and killed someone. Hate to say I
told you so, but I TOLD YOU SO!

rows.label: TownInfo392_5
rows.name:
I just saw the Murderess looking at the houses
around here with a giant grin on her face!
Er, because she was exonerated for murder,
I guess? I didn't even know she COULD smile.

rows.label: TownInfo393_1
rows.name:
If you're looking for Tatsu, I saw him running
toward the BLADE Home. Those things can
really hustle when they're in a hurry!

rows.label: TownInfo394_1
rows.name:
I just saw a Nopon enter the Home with
tears streaming down its face. I think it might
have been that Tatsu fellow from Elma's team.

rows.label: TownInfo395_1
rows.name:
I just saw Lin's little pet running towards the
BLADE Home. Poor thing looked absolutely
miserable. How can something so fuzzy ever
be sad?

rows.label: TownInfo396_1
rows.name:
If we pick a Nopon representative, he'll put the
government up for sale to the highest bidder,
right? So so why not an Orphean? They have
no interest in acquiring personal wealth.

rows.label: TownInfo397_1
rows.name:
They have their quirks like every other xeno
race on this planet, but the Orphe are free of
greed and gluttony. So overall, I have a good
impression of them.

rows.label: TownInfo398_1
rows.name:
They say that the Orphe are unselfish and
incorruptible. Of all the xenoforms who have
taken up residence here in NLA, they
appear to be the most trustworthy.

rows.label: TownInfo399_1
rows.name:
You're looking for new recipes? Then I'll teach
you the curry recipe that's been handed down
in my family for generations. Careful, though.
It's spicy. Like, "ring of fire" spicy.

rows.label: TownInfo400_1
rows.name:
The trajectory of the rounds that were fired at
the Ma-non ship originated from the direction
of Bedrock Hold. However, given the distance,
they must have been fired from a Doll.

rows.label: TownInfo3092_1
rows.name:
Why yes, I have been devoltanizing in this
area, but I am not "someone suspicious," no.
*fsssh*

rows.label: TownInfo3092_2
rows.name:
I am glad you finally understand. *fsssh*
We were only collecting the residual that could
not be fully purified by your own facility.

rows.label: TownInfo3102_1
rows.name:
There seems to be this weird container that's
been dumped at the integrated production
plant. What could possibly be inside it?
Nothing good, I'll warrant!

rows.label: TownInfo3102_2
rows.name:
All that time spent working on it, and the
thing gets totaled as soon as it leaves the
shop! Some machines are just plain cursed.

rows.label: TownInfo3102_3
rows.name:
The insurance had run out on both of the
Dolls involved in the accident? Oh man...
These repairs are gonna cost 'em an arm,
a leg, and most of the torso.

rows.label: TownInfo3102_4
rows.name:
These two were at each other's throats until
the very end. And now that we've found the
Central Life, it's pretty much over anyway.

rows.label: TownInfo3352_1
rows.name:
Capsule house on Ma-non ship are tight fit.
Don't Ma-non want big house where they can
jump and run about with family?

rows.label: TownInfo3352_2
rows.name:
Friend Lin is buying ingredients in commercial
district again. Lucky Tatsu always get to eat
such wonderlicious foods!

rows.label: TownInfo3352_3
rows.name:
Good-bye to tight capsule on Ma-non ship!
Hello to new home! We neighbors now!

rows.label: TownInfo3382_1
rows.name:
You fair maidens wish to learn the art of
combat? Then allow me to teach you all that
I know.

rows.label: TownInfo3382_2
rows.name:
Your training has served you well. I am
confident that you now possess the skills to
best any beast that might trouble you.

rows.label: TownInfo3422_1
rows.name:
While reproduction remains our top priority,
we must secure sufficient food and shelter,
as well. Compared to the Ma-non ship, this
area has more trees and superior housing...

rows.label: TownInfo3422_2
rows.name:
So we have new companions among us?
Interesting. I have noticed a strange itching in
my Ovah when I'm near the red one...

rows.label: TownInfo3422_3
rows.name:
This house has become quite cramped.
Perhaps our reproduction has been
excessive? If only we could make our
residence inside that spacious "cathedral"...

rows.label: TownInfo3572_1
rows.name:
Oh great Golbogga! Bringer of muck! *fsssh*
Bestow upon us thy purest of filth!

rows.label: TownInfo3572_2
rows.name:
I often wonder... *fsssh*
What form does our creator Golbogga take?

rows.label: TownInfo3572_3
rows.name:
Just as our creator once filled Planet Bedun
with voltant, I wish for the humans to give rise
to a second coming—a deluge of voltant for
us to thrive in once more...

rows.label: TownInfo401_1
rows.name:
I've learned a thing or two from Robert
myself—like never to cut corners on mission
prep. So I'm heading back to Armory Alley
to make sure I've got everything I need.

rows.label: TownInfo401_2
rows.name:
Once again, Robert's team managed to
install a data probe in a new segment on
the FrontierNet map.

rows.label: TownInfo401_3
rows.name:
I saw Robert in the industrial district.
Poor guy looked really upset about something.
I wonder what happened?

rows.label: TownInfo401_4
rows.name:
That new member of Robert's team said he
was saved by an Orphean when things went
sour in Nightglow Forest. Maybe these Orphe are
more friendly than they look?

rows.label: TownInfo401_5
rows.name:
Robert's team has had no end of success
since they started working with the Orphe.
Maybe I should be trying to recruit an
Orphean BLADE onto my team as well?

rows.label: TownInfo402_1
rows.name:
So what if it's an Overed? I don't want to hear
your excuses! You're supposed to be Avalanchers,
for hell's sakes!

rows.label: TownInfo402_2
rows.name:
You're saying one of our patrol copters was
shot down near the palace in the southeast
of Cauldros? Damn! I can't imagine a worse
place for a chopper to go down.

rows.label: TownInfo402_3
rows.name:
Most of our patrol choppers are being shot
down by those damn flying mechs known as
Xern! Surveying Cauldros by air may be futile.

rows.label: TownInfo402_4
rows.name:
What? You're being deployed to Cauldros?
Then equip yourself with gear that can resist
the heat attacks of those tersquals, and make
sure you come back alive.

rows.label: TownInfo402_5
rows.name:
Elma's team has already taken down multiple
Overeds in Cauldros? Ain't much we could do
to compete with that. Might as well go home
and put my feet up...

rows.label: TownInfo403_1
rows.name:
Apparently some guy named H.B. just aced
the aptitude test, and I mean flat-out
MURDERED that sucker!

rows.label: TownInfo403_2
rows.name:
You know that guy Hugo? He's going around
the industrial district bugging every BLADE he
sees to help him with some new invention.
But no one wants to, and I don't blame 'em!

rows.label: TownInfo403_3
rows.name:
I tried out one of those battle data probes
and managed to turn a tough fight into a
total rout! They're incredible, though it's too
bad that they're still so rare and expensive.

rows.label: TownInfo403_4
rows.name:
There's a FrontierNet probe placement site on
the cliffs behind Stickstone Rise. But are we
supposed to climb up those cliffs to reach it?!
I'm gonna let someone else handle that one!

rows.label: TownInfo403_5
rows.name:
Once we've set the last probe, I guess our
duties will be done. Maybe I'll go see if I can
help out the Avalanchers next door.

rows.label: TownInfo404_1
rows.name:
BLADE won't be able to accomplish anything
until we expand FrontierNet, so it's up to us
Pathfinders to blaze the trail to the future.

rows.label: TownInfo404_2
rows.name:
We're being dispatched to search Sylvalum?
Hopefully this time we'll actually find the
Lifepoint, buuut...I'm pretty sure I said the
same thing last time.

rows.label: TownInfo404_3
rows.name:
I'm glad that Lao survived, but...
Team Belisarda was completely wiped out?!

rows.label: TownInfo404_4
rows.name:
Kirsty has been looking for that new member
of Elma's team near the water-purification
plant. She sure seemed to be excited about
something.

rows.label: TownInfo404_5
rows.name:
Kirsty just came up out of nowhere and asked
if we were ready to go set a data probe at
the edge of the universe. What is UP with that
girl?!

rows.label: TownInfo405_1
rows.name:
You're having trouble finding FrontierNet
probe placement sites? Well, you gotta search
carefully. They could be behind a rock, or in a
cave, or something like that.

rows.label: TownInfo405_2
rows.name:
We have to set up more data probes!
At our current rate, the survey of Mira is
going nowhere fast.

rows.label: TownInfo405_3
rows.name:
If we could just expand FrontierNet a little
more in Valley of Oblivion, I know we'd be able to find
our lost companions. We can't give up!

rows.label: TownInfo405_4
rows.name:
Doll wreckage near Valley of Oblivion's Mesa Fortress?
This could be what we've been waiting for.
We gotta go retrieve that wreckage!

rows.label: TownInfo405_5
rows.name:
Valley of Oblivion has been almost completely surveyed
by FrontierNet. I've never been more proud to
be a Pathfinder!

rows.label: TownInfo406_1
rows.name:
Your team is your family now.
If something is bothering you,
know that you can tell us anything.

rows.label: TownInfo406_2
rows.name:
I can't believe Nelson's unit was slaughtered
by xenos like that. We'll make those giant
bastards pay for what they did!

rows.label: TownInfo406_3
rows.name:
So the Bias who killed our friends are
different from the Bias who have come to
NLA? Are we sure about this?

rows.label: TownInfo406_4
rows.name:
A Bias named Loda Gorida was raising a
huge fuss on the Ma-non ship, saying his
daughter was abducted by a human.
Could that really be true? Come on!

rows.label: TownInfo406_5
rows.name:
The other day I stayed up till dawn drinking
with a Bias named Wazdo. He was a
really good guy! Totally straight-up!

rows.label: TownInfo407_1
rows.name:
So where are you from? I emigrated from
Russia before the calamity struck Earth.

rows.label: TownInfo407_2
rows.name:
Nationality doesn't mean anything anymore.
I'm just another human now, and will fight
with you all until the bitter end.

rows.label: TownInfo407_3
rows.name:
When I looked at those pictures of Sylvalum
you showed me, I couldn't help but remember
the Siberian tundra of my homeland.

rows.label: TownInfo407_4
rows.name:
It seems a really unusual petrified tree was
found in the southeast part of Sylvalum.
Any chance you're going back to take a
closer look?

rows.label: TownInfo407_5
rows.name:
The more FrontierNet expands, the easier it
gets to explore Sylvalum. At this point,
I'm confident that I could find my way through
its mists no matter how thick they become.

rows.label: TownInfo408_1
rows.name:
They say you need a Doll to participate in
Testamenter wreckage-recovery missions, but...
Yeah. I failed my Doll license test. Aaagain.

rows.label: TownInfo408_2
rows.name:
Commander Vandham said he was gonna let
that new recruit take the Doll license test.
Probably ace it on the first try, too!

rows.label: TownInfo408_3
rows.name:
I saw Defense Secretary Nagi behind BLADE
Tower, and it looked like he was thinking
hard about something. Working out the
details of our next operation, I guess.

rows.label: TownInfo408_4
rows.name:
I really gotta earn my Doll license before the
next major recovery operation...

rows.label: TownInfo408_5
rows.name:
I passed my Doll license test, but I'm still
struggling with the controls. It's gonna take a
bit more practice before I'm ready for any real
combat...

rows.label: TownInfo409_1
rows.name:
How's the mining going? If you don't have
enough data probes, just ask the Pathfinders
to help you find resources.

rows.label: TownInfo409_2
rows.name:
As a Landbanker, I'll do whatever it takes to
harvest the natural resources of Nightglow Forest.

rows.label: TownInfo409_3
rows.name:
They say an Overed named Froste, the Courteous
lives in the Vitriol Cesspool. I wonder if the
name is because it's less aggressive than other
Overeds or something...

rows.label: TownInfo409_4
rows.name:
We've almost gathered enough resources to
meet our needs. We couldn't have done it
without the support of the Pathfinders.

rows.label: TownInfo409_5
rows.name:
It looks like we finally hit our mining targets.
Let's invite over all the Pathfinders who helped
us and throw a giant party!

rows.label: TownInfo410_1
rows.name:
They found an additional 10 crew members?
Hot damn! I mean, good steaming hot damn!
We haven't had a piece of news like that in
a while!

rows.label: TownInfo410_2
rows.name:
Did you see the Ma-non ship? That thing is
absurdly huge! It's a good thing we're on the
same side.

rows.label: TownInfo410_3
rows.name:
It takes a lot of resources to fix a Doll once
it's been destroyed by the Growth. NLA
repelled their attack, but the work of us
Landbankers has just begun.

rows.label: TownInfo410_4
rows.name:
We're finally taking the fight to the enemy's
headquarters. The war's pivotal battle is upon
us, so we'd better make sure humanity has as
many resources as we can provide.

rows.label: TownInfo410_5
rows.name:
The Central Life is safe now, right? So...
when are we getting our real bodies back?

rows.label: TownInfo411_1
rows.name:
Another BLADE team got attacked by that
potamus at Primordia's Sayram Lake?
Someone needs to put that thing down!

rows.label: TownInfo411_2
rows.name:
Our stock of supplies is dwindling fast.
If we can't scrape together some metal ore
from this planet, we won't even be able to
repair our equipment soon.

rows.label: TownInfo411_3
rows.name:
It's not much, but at least there's a little
mining going on now. Should be enough to
keep BLADE provisioned with at least the most
basic equipment.

rows.label: TownInfo411_4
rows.name:
The expansion of FrontierNet has given us a
steady supply of ore. We might even have
enough to start boosting our Doll production.

rows.label: TownInfo411_5
rows.name:
We've established enough mining lines that
we no longer need to worry about shortages
of raw materials. Let's start forwarding the
surpluses over to the construction crews.

rows.label: TownInfo412_1
rows.name:
I wonder if that crew member Elma's team
found will come through here? I'd love to get
a peek at the newbie!

rows.label: TownInfo412_2
rows.name:
If you're looking for energy tubes, I've heard
you can get them from those alien ground
mechs known as "puges."

rows.label: TownInfo412_3
rows.name:
Battles with the Growth are erupting
throughout Mira, and they've already claimed
the lives of a great many BLADE operatives.
Do we have any real shot of winning this?

rows.label: TownInfo412_4
rows.name:
The heroes who defeated the Zu Pharg return!
If we can follow their lead, I know we can
beat the Growth.

rows.label: TownInfo412_5
rows.name:
If we build more cities and have lots of
children, maybe one day humanity will thrive
as much on Mira as it did on Earth.

rows.label: TownInfo413_1
rows.name:
So we still don't have a time frame on fixing
the patrol Doll? Bah! It's little more than a
decoration if all it can do is stand there.

rows.label: TownInfo413_2
rows.name:
A piece of White Whale wreckage was seen
just east of Silent Mire. It sure would be nice
if there were some usable parts in the debris...

rows.label: TownInfo413_3
rows.name:
Thanks to the data probes being planted
throughout Primordia, we might actually get
enough resources to repair this old junk pile.
Finally! Some good news for once!

rows.label: TownInfo413_4
rows.name:
The Doll repairs are finally finished?
This is a great day for justice.

rows.label: TownInfo413_5
rows.name:
It's official—we Companions are getting a new
allotment of Dolls. Now there will be no
injustice too grave for us to handle!

rows.label: TownInfo414_1
rows.name:
Shouldn't you all strive to be as passionate
about fulfilling your duties as Justin?

rows.label: TownInfo414_2
rows.name:
Is Tracey causing trouble again?
She's doubled-down on another
misunderstanding, hasn't she?

rows.label: TownInfo414_3
rows.name:
What's Doug saving up so much money for?
Guy must have his eyes on something spendy.

rows.label: TownInfo414_4
rows.name:
In the evenings, I often see Doug standing
in the commercial district parking lot,
staring at a car with a big dumb grin.
I think he finally bought himself one...

rows.label: TownInfo414_5
rows.name:
I mostly only drive on patrol, so a Union car
is all I need. And yet, whenever I look at
Doug's new car, I can't help but want one for
myself...

rows.label: TownInfo415_1
rows.name:
They say gigantic purgovent smashing up
Valley of Oblivion's North Coast! Here's hoping friends
not run into it.

rows.label: TownInfo415_2
rows.name:
Welcome to Mira! Nopon always happy to
see new friends who buy large amount of
Nopon-made goods.

rows.label: TownInfo415_3
rows.name:
So after BLADE get xeno Doll,
it get stolen right back by Growth?
What is BLADE doing?

rows.label: TownInfo415_4
rows.name:
Big war with Growth nearing end.
Time to sell many weapons for final terrible
battle and make final terrible profit!

rows.label: TownInfo415_5
rows.name:
Human friends sure make great customers!
Nopon should all visit this "Earth" planet
friends come from and make huge fortune.

rows.label: TownInfo416_1
rows.name:
Another member poached from the Companions
Union? I know exploration is important,
but it doesn't mean a warm bucket of spit if
we can't keep the peace back home.

rows.label: TownInfo416_2
rows.name:
That new recruit is one heck of a soldier.
Thanks to [ST:gender p1=him p2=her ] completing so many exploration
assignments, our reassigned Companions are
finally able to come back to us.

rows.label: TownInfo416_3
rows.name:
I just saw Julius in front of the maintenance
center talking with that Orphean—Han'barac
or something. Things seemed rather serious,
judging by the look on Julius's face.

rows.label: TownInfo416_4
rows.name:
So the Orphe all have some weird virus?
Er, we won't be able to catch it after we
return to our real bodies, will we?

rows.label: TownInfo416_5
rows.name:
If FrontierNet hadn't been expanded so much,
Julius wouldn't have been able to spot the
indigens' abnormal growth rates so quickly.

rows.label: TownInfo417_1
rows.name:
A good Companion can never have enough info.
Just walking around the city and listening to
gossip can provide invaluable leads.

rows.label: TownInfo417_2
rows.name:
Okay, can we keep this matter between you
and me? If my wife were to find out...

rows.label: TownInfo417_3
rows.name:
I heard they've discovered an alien container
near Bedrock Hold in Primordia. We ought
to claim that as soon as we possibly can.

rows.label: TownInfo417_4
rows.name:
Is this some sort of publicity photo of Lin Lee
Koo? ...Heh. She's a real cute kid.

rows.label: TownInfo417_5
rows.name:
Whenever I look at that picture of Lin you
gave me, I remember the daughter I left
behind on Earth. It really fires up my fighting
spirit!

rows.label: TownInfo418_1
rows.name:
You know that item you gave me?
I'm going to slather it on my skin and
be as pretty as Colonel Elma!

rows.label: TownInfo418_2
rows.name:
We've worked hard and accomplished a lot,
but we're still nowhere close to Elma's
league—both as BLADEs and as women.

rows.label: TownInfo418_3
rows.name:
I went to see Elma at the Home, but she
was too lost in thought to say anything. Also,
I can't believe how good she looks when she's
thinking! Smart ladies are just the best.

rows.label: TownInfo418_4
rows.name:
Did you know Lin and that new recruit are
both living with Elma? I can't believe how
lucky they are.

rows.label: TownInfo418_5
rows.name:
Did you hear about Elma? I KNEW it! Now
we know why she's so strong and beautiful!
...Hmm? Oh, come on. You know exactly
what I'm talking about.

rows.label: TownInfo419_1
rows.name:
If you're looking for that particular prototype,
it's already been taken to the Arms test
hangar. We gotta put it through its paces fast
so we can clear it for fieldwork.

rows.label: TownInfo419_2
rows.name:
That prototype? Yeah, Axena put it through
a whole kit and caboodle of functionality tests.
Sounds like it's been approved for immediate
use on the battlefield.

rows.label: TownInfo419_3
rows.name:
The arms manufacturers' engineers always
seem to get a kick out of how much Axena
enjoys testing their prototypes.

rows.label: TownInfo419_4
rows.name:
I heard they discovered some ridiculously huge
indigen in Sylvalum's West Cinderdunes.
Our new weapon may be just what we need
to stand a chance against that kind of thing.

rows.label: TownInfo419_5
rows.name:
Our diligence in weapons testing allowed our
soldiers' new weapons to function flawlessly
on the battlefield. It seems fighting on the front
lines isn't the only way to serve BLADE.

rows.label: TownInfo420_1
rows.name:
Aw man, nothing beats Dollin' through the
wide open fields of Primordia. You guys gotta
get your Doll licenses post-haste! Chop-chop!
...Also, is Dollin' a word?

rows.label: TownInfo420_2
rows.name:
They say there's treasure hidden in an indigen
nest in the northeast part of Cauldros. But I
doubt I could get close enough to find out,
even with my awesome Doll.

rows.label: TownInfo420_3
rows.name:
I saw all sorts of weird ruins while surveying
Valley of Oblivion. I wonder who made them?

rows.label: TownInfo420_4
rows.name:
When I was Dollin' my way through Sylvalum
I saw an ocean floating in the sky! For real!
I ain't lying, and it wasn't no mirage neither!

rows.label: TownInfo420_5
rows.name:
I was attacked by some dragon monster in
Nightglow Forest, and it wrecked my Doll in one hit!
Dammit, man! The hell WAS that thing?

rows.label: TownInfo421_1
rows.name:
Defense Secretary Nagi came out to greet
the new crew member personally?
He must be expecting big things from [ST:gender p1=him p2=her ].

rows.label: TownInfo421_2
rows.name:
So what was the deal with that Yardley guy
at the Arms test hangar? Did he really
think we'd give him our precious resources
for his nonsensical research project?

rows.label: TownInfo421_3
rows.name:
You want to learn more advanced combat
techniques? Then you should ask Drill Sergeant
Wolf to teach you. He's right here in the
BLADE Concourse.

rows.label: TownInfo421_4
rows.name:
They're powerful, they're durable, and they
can even subdue enemies with their Bind
ability! Use all of a Doll's features to resist
the Growth's high-powered weaponry.

rows.label: TownInfo421_5
rows.name:
The Growth have fallen, the Lifepoint is back
in our hands, and we at BLADE have secured
humanity's future. So let's hear it, everyone!
Hip hip, hoor-BLADE! ...Ugh. Awkward.

rows.label: TownInfo422_1
rows.name:
You need money? Then get serious about
completing missions. You can also search
out collectibles, or just defeat enemies and
sell what you salvage from them.

rows.label: TownInfo422_2
rows.name:
I knew the equipment I'd been using wouldn't
be good enough for Sylvalum, so I burned
my entire life savings to buy a new set of
Sakuraba gear.

rows.label: TownInfo422_3
rows.name:
Colonel Elma's team has been setting up data
probes all over the map. No wonder Irina
holds Elma in such high regard.

rows.label: TownInfo422_4
rows.name:
Sounds like Colonel Elma is visiting the
Ma-non ship to further human-xeno relations.
No surprise, since she was a driving force
behind the treaty in the first place.

rows.label: TownInfo422_5
rows.name:
Xeno weapons have a variety of attributes
that can enable powerful new combat tactics.
It seems Sakuraba isn't the only top-class
weapon designer out there.

rows.label: TownInfo423_1
rows.name:
We may have failed to protect Earth, but I
joined the Interceptors to prove that we could
at least protect NLA, no matter what fate
throws at us.

rows.label: TownInfo423_2
rows.name:
So the east gate is open? Well, don't worry
about a thing. If any of those indigens attempt
an attack, I won't let a single one through!

rows.label: TownInfo423_3
rows.name:
How can we call ourselves Interceptors when
we let that many enemies into the damn city?
We're gonna make sure those bastards never
get anywhere near NLA again!

rows.label: TownInfo423_4
rows.name:
So the day of BLADE's greatest mission is
upon us—the recovery of the Central Life.
While the rest of BLADE fights the good fight,
we Interceptors will be keeping the city safe.

rows.label: TownInfo423_5
rows.name:
As long as deadly beasts are skulking around
and Growth survivors are plotting revenge,
the work of the Interceptors is far from done.

rows.label: TownInfo424_1
rows.name:
I've been working from morning till night,
you know? It's just too too much! Those
humans should really learn to relax.

rows.label: TownInfo424_2
rows.name:
Did you hear about the ferocious indigen that
patrols the skies above the northwest part of
Lake Ciel in Sylvalum? Let's hope the humans
bring it down fast, right?

rows.label: TownInfo424_3
rows.name:
The human influence has inspired lots of
Ma-non to work harder, you know?
But but it's still okay if WE slack off, right?

rows.label: TownInfo424_4
rows.name:
The humans have put lots and lots of hard
work into expanding FrontierNet, right?
So maybe we should try harder too?

rows.label: TownInfo424_5
rows.name:
Pizza tastes so so much better after a full day
of hard work, right? We need to show our
human friends that we Ma-non can work just
as hard as they do...

rows.label: TownInfo425_1
rows.name:
Don't you get it? This is an emergency!
Chaos! End of days! Dogs and cats, living...
Look, what I'm saying is that this is no time
for getting married.

rows.label: TownInfo425_2
rows.name:
Around noon, I saw Doug rubbing his cheek
against some dog at the Ishmael Hills steps.
...He seemed tired. Must be working too hard.

rows.label: TownInfo425_3
rows.name:
I already said, I won't marry you!
And if you have time to think about that,
spend it searching for new collectibles.

rows.label: TownInfo425_4
rows.name:
Yeah, I suppose I've gotten somewhat used to
our new life here on Mira, but I'm still not in
a position to be thinking about marriage OR
our future.

rows.label: TownInfo425_5
rows.name:
Your boundless enthusiasm has finally worn
me down. So, yes. I will marry you.
...Now start saving up so we can buy a
giant house in Ishmael Hills.

rows.label: TownInfo426_1
rows.name:
That's right—if you register your collectibles in
your Collepedia, you can earn rewards.
That's at the core of what we do as Collepedians.

rows.label: TownInfo426_2
rows.name:
There's a guy up there who's always hitting on
one of our members. Asking if she'll marry
him... Bringing gifts... Big, pretty gifts...
Wh-what? No, I am NOT jealous!

rows.label: TownInfo426_3
rows.name:
In a world as vast as Mira, sometimes I
wonder if it's even possible to gather all the
collectibles and complete our Collepedias.

rows.label: TownInfo426_4
rows.name:
A team that was heading to Nightglow Forest's
Divine Roost said they saw an indigen
lurking inside a gigantic plant. Could it be
one of those Overeds folks talk about?

rows.label: TownInfo426_5
rows.name:
The war won't end for us Collepedians until every
collectible has been registered in our
Collepedias. And it's a war I intend to win!

rows.label: TownInfo427_1
rows.name:
All right, people. Remember that each of us
bears the weight of humanity's very existence
upon our shoulders!

rows.label: TownInfo427_2
rows.name:
The Growth don't scare us. We will keep
fighting as long as our Blue Bloods are
operational, and we will recover the Lifepoint
Core.

rows.label: TownInfo427_3
rows.name:
There isn't much time. We have to install as
many data probes as we can, because any
one of them could find the clue that points the
way to the Central Life.

rows.label: TownInfo427_4
rows.name:
Did you not hear Defense Secretary Nagi?
We have to clear a trail to the Central Life,
no matter the cost. NO MATTER THE COST!

rows.label: TownInfo427_5
rows.name:
Excellent work, BLADE operatives.
Your efforts have not been in vain—
we've finally found the Central Life!

rows.label: TownInfo428_1
rows.name:
If you have a Doll license, you can buy a
Doll from the shop terminal in Armory Alley.
Man, I LOVE living in the future!

rows.label: TownInfo428_2
rows.name:
Kirsty was in front of the building across from
the maintenance center, searching for that
new crew member. I wonder what she wants
with [ST:gender p1=him p2=her ]?

rows.label: TownInfo428_3
rows.name:
There were more casualties yesterday? Damn.
Let's hope for some better luck today.

rows.label: TownInfo428_4
rows.name:
Our BLADEs seem to be getting stronger every
day. It's as if they're being tempered by the
trials of Mira.

rows.label: TownInfo428_5
rows.name:
The BLADEs of today, those who have been
tempered in the wilds of Mira, have little to
fear from mere hostile indigens!

rows.label: TownInfo429_1
rows.name:
How in the heck am supposed to pull off this
job by myself? It's madness! MADNESS!
...Er, hey. You wanna come along and help?

rows.label: TownInfo429_3
rows.name:
We now know a lot more about Cauldros
than we used to. It's made completing my
assignments a whole lot easier.

rows.label: TownInfo429_4
rows.name:
Wait. They've detected a Lifepod on Cauldros's
Slavebird Isle? Say whaaaaaat? How in the
heck did it ever end up in a place like that?

rows.label: TownInfo429_5
rows.name:
Elma's team completed another high-profile
assignment? Of course they did. OF COURSE.
We really need to step it up if we want to
compete on their level...

rows.label: TownInfo430_1
rows.name:
All Frye does is get drunk on Scotch. He's an
embarrassment to Interceptors everywhere!

rows.label: TownInfo430_2
rows.name:
I've heard that they're letting close friends form
squads together. So please let me and my
friend here form our own squad!

rows.label: TownInfo430_3
rows.name:
We want to show the world that we can
accomplish great things just like Team Elma.
So can you please give us a more challenging
assignment?

rows.label: TownInfo430_4
rows.name:
What? There's a ghost of a Nopon that
appears at the top of BLADE Tower?
Sh-shut up! I don't even believe in ghosts!
Stop trying to scare me with your voodoo!

rows.label: TownInfo430_5
rows.name:
There's an S-class Overed on the high ground
near Bedrock Hold? Oh man, we have to
go kill that thing right now! We'll be famous!

rows.label: TownInfo431_1
rows.name:
From here, I can gaze out at Irina in the
base over there whenever I like. *sigh*
I'm the luckiest man in BLADE...

rows.label: TownInfo431_2
rows.name:
If only I'd become an Interceptor...
Then I'd be able to fight at Irina's side...

rows.label: TownInfo431_3
rows.name:
Lately, Irina has been spending her
mornings getting her weapons modified at
that BLADE gathering spot in the hangars.

rows.label: TownInfo431_4
rows.name:
I'm jealous of the woman tuning Irina's
weapons. I can do that! ...With more training.
...And practice. ...And a set of tools.
But whatever! It should still be me!

rows.label: TownInfo431_5
rows.name:
Irina sure seems to smile a lot when she's
talking to that new recruit. Like she really
enjoys [ST:gender p1=his p2=her ] conversation... Hmmm...

rows.label: TownInfo432_1
rows.name:
The BLADEs that are being deployed to
Valley of Oblivion are being picked off by a sphinx
that lurks beneath Victory Rock!

rows.label: TownInfo432_2
rows.name:
Have you ever eaten a beagflea squash? It's a
fairly rare collectible that can be found near
Lake Basel and in the caves of Valley of Oblivion.

rows.label: TownInfo432_3
rows.name:
We simply don't know enough about Mira to
expand into other parts of the planet just yet.
We need BLADE to proceed with their
surveying efforts first.

rows.label: TownInfo432_4
rows.name:
Thanks to Team Elma's efforts, we're acquiring
information about Mira at a rapid clip.

rows.label: TownInfo432_5
rows.name:
We've gathered a great deal of information
about this planet, but the only thing it tells us
for sure is that Mira still holds a mystery we 
haven't solved.

rows.label: TownInfo433_1
rows.name:
I'll never forget when the xenos attacked Earth.
The way they leveled skyscrapers like they
were knocking over a child's tower of blocks...
Oh, it was so horrible.

rows.label: TownInfo433_2
rows.name:
We BLADEs aren't the only ones fighting this
war. Let's never forget the gratitude we owe to
the civilians of NLA, who are supporting
us all the while.

rows.label: TownInfo433_3
rows.name:
Miranium truly is a miracle ore. If we'd had it
on Earth, we could have solved our resource
shortages overnight.

rows.label: TownInfo433_4
rows.name:
Why has Phog been staring at the water-
purification plant with such a serious look on
his face? I don't get that guy at all.

rows.label: TownInfo433_5
rows.name:
Phog and Frye are brothers? I guess they
HAVE been spending a lot of time together,
but... No. That's crazy talk. You're crazy!

rows.label: TownInfo434_1
rows.name:
It sounds like the gates still aren't being
opened yet. It's so inconvenient!

rows.label: TownInfo434_2
rows.name:
Let's make each other a promise: We're both
gonna come back from our deployments alive.
Deal?

rows.label: TownInfo434_3
rows.name:
Another part of the Lifepoint was destroyed?
It's absolutely imperative that we locate the
remaining parts before the Growth do!

rows.label: TownInfo434_4
rows.name:
Let's recover the Central Life and raise a
glass in celebration. And this time, we'll feel
that drink in our real bodies!

rows.label: TownInfo434_5
rows.name:
I still can't manage to wrap my head around
the fact we just defeated the monsters who
destroyed Earth. Ha! Take that, suckers!

rows.label: TownInfo435_1
rows.name:
So many potential customer in big city!
Smell of profit hangs heavy in air...

rows.label: TownInfo435_2
rows.name:
Nopon have caravan here and there
throughout Mira. We have friend treaty now,
so new friends can visit whenever!

rows.label: TownInfo435_3
rows.name:
Muimui at side of BLADE Tower claim to
discover way to get filthy, crazy rich.
What Muimui know? When Muimui know?
MUST LEARN!

rows.label: TownInfo435_4
rows.name:
Economy of Mira has been on fire ever since
human friends arrive. Please keep fighting.
And playing. And making Nopon very rich!

rows.label: TownInfo435_5
rows.name:
Oh no! Defeat of Growth could lead to crash
in Nopon weapon-manufacturing industry!
Uh, never mind... Hurray for victory!

rows.label: TownInfo436_1
rows.name:
I killed an indigen the other day, and a
weapon popped out of its belly. Now I will
wield it in combat to honor the comrade
that monster ate.

rows.label: TownInfo436_2
rows.name:
The shop terminal in Armory Alley has more
options than ever now that xeno-made gear is
being sold. Be sure to tailor your equipment
to match the target you intend to hunt.

rows.label: TownInfo436_3
rows.name:
Dr. Hugo is developing a new battle data
probe in the Arms test hangar? Intriguing.
Shall we go check it out?

rows.label: TownInfo436_4
rows.name:
Dr. Hugo really is a genius. He created the
very first battle data probe all on his own!

rows.label: TownInfo436_5
rows.name:
Don't get so reliant on your Doll that you
neglect your own equipment. When all else is
lost, the battle must be fought with ground
gear.

rows.label: TownInfo437_1
rows.name:
Sakuraba gear isn't so bad—their stuff is high
in accuracy and stability, at least, although
it tends to be pretty weak to certain attribute
attacks.

rows.label: TownInfo437_2
rows.name:
There's an especially fearless progen that's
making life difficult for the Landbankers working
on the cliffs near Valley of Oblivion's King's Falls.

rows.label: TownInfo437_3
rows.name:
If we only had more miranium, we could get
a certain prototype out of development and
onto the field where it belongs.

rows.label: TownInfo437_4
rows.name:
There seems to have been steady growth in
the number of miranium mining points, which
has really been a boon for our new weapon-
development programs.

rows.label: TownInfo437_5
rows.name:
I never imagined that Mira would be so rich in
resources. With such abundant materials,
I expect we'll be able to develop nearly all of
our weapon designs to completion.

rows.label: TownInfo438_1
rows.name:
Aren't there any wealthy BLADEs anywhere
who are willing to donate resources to the
arms manufacturers? It'll really help speed up
the creation of new equipment!

rows.label: TownInfo438_2
rows.name:
And now the xenoforms are starting their
own arms manufacturers? Well, there's no
way we're gonna let them beat us!

rows.label: TownInfo438_3
rows.name:
The Growth are incredibly scientifically
advanced. I don't even know if it's possible
to resist them with our current level of
technology.

rows.label: TownInfo438_4
rows.name:
Our weapons took down the Zu Pharg—
the Growth's so-called death machine!
This proves that human ingenuity can
overcome anything that is thrown at us.

rows.label: TownInfo438_5
rows.name:
The arms manufacturers are doing their utmost
to support BLADE any way they can. So return
the favor by going out there and using their
latest weapons to annihilate the enemy!

rows.label: TownInfo439_1
rows.name:
So Danny didn't make it...
I guess it falls to me to finish the job.

rows.label: TownInfo439_2
rows.name:
The Testamenters managed to recover Danny's
personal effects. I'm heading to the cathedral
for the funeral now.

rows.label: TownInfo439_3
rows.name:
They found information about some White
Whale wreckage in Danny's personal effects?
Damn! We've got to get that into FrontierNet
and see if we can pinpoint the location.

rows.label: TownInfo439_4
rows.name:
Danny discovered a piece of White Whale
wreckage in northern Primordia during his
final mission. We have to make sure his death
wasn't in vain.

rows.label: TownInfo439_5
rows.name:
After the way this city stubbornly managed to
survive the Growth threat, I have to imagine
Danny is smiling down on us.

rows.label: TownInfo440_1
rows.name:
They're assigning Leroy and Dirk to the
Avalanchers? Those two are barely out of their
training pants! ...This manpower shortage
must be worse than I thought.

rows.label: TownInfo440_2
rows.name:
Sensei Bozé caught me spacing out during our
last assignment, and man, did he ever tear me
a new one. I think he tore two!

rows.label: TownInfo440_3
rows.name:
Fritz was negotiating with this woman in
Armory Alley, right? Next thing I know,
she walked around the corner and suddenly
turned into a xeno! I saw it with my own eyes!

rows.label: TownInfo440_4
rows.name:
So that shape-shifting xeno I saw was a
Definian, huh? Well, good on Elma's team for
exposing that thing for what it was.

rows.label: TownInfo440_5
rows.name:
Looks like they've completed the survey of
every area of Primordia. If all goes well,
maybe we can start settling some new territory
outside the city walls.

rows.label: TownInfo441_1
rows.name:
That sensor is too primitive. If you replace
it with one of ours, you can expect a
43.5 percent increase in efficacy.

rows.label: TownInfo441_2
rows.name:
As fierce as the Growth attack was,
I had predicted a 64.5 percent chance
that you would successfully repel it, and
I stand by that calculation.

rows.label: TownInfo441_3
rows.name:
I would appreciate the opportunity to dissect
and study one of your Blue Bloods. Do not
worry—there is an 82.4 percent probability
that I can successfully reassemble it.

rows.label: TownInfo441_4
rows.name:
I do hope that you humans are able to
reclaim your Ovah from the Central Life.

rows.label: TownInfo441_5
rows.name:
The five Orpheans that suggested we side
with humanity have been proven correct.
I do hope that you will continue to protect us.

rows.label: TownInfo442_1
rows.name:
If you go down in combat, I'll rush right over
to help you back up! And if I'M the one who
goes down, you'll do the same for me.
...Right? You'll do that? For me?

rows.label: TownInfo442_2
rows.name:
I have my Blue Blood checkup today, and
uuuuugh. Worried. I've been pushing it pretty
hard, so I'm sure they're going to find
something wrong with it.

rows.label: TownInfo442_3
rows.name:
I got the results back on my Blue Blood
checkup! Everything came back clear,
even after all the crap I put it through.
These things really are built like tanks.

rows.label: TownInfo442_4
rows.name:
They say there's a gigantic beast called the
Ruler of Fates that lives at the highest point at
the top of Nightglow Forest. I certainly don't plan to
go anywhere NEAR that thing.

rows.label: TownInfo442_5
rows.name:
Hey, that's Elma's team—they're the ones who
managed to bring down the Ruler of Fates.
Man, those guys are unstoppable.

rows.label: TownInfo443_1
rows.name:
It looks like that team that got wiped out in
Valley of Oblivion tried to send a bunch of SOS calls,
but none of them got through because of the
electromagnetic storm.

rows.label: TownInfo443_2
rows.name:
FrontierNet isn't just for collecting information,
you know. It can also be used to deliver it.
...What? That's all I got. You expecting the
wisdom of the ages or something?

rows.label: TownInfo443_3
rows.name:
Lately, BLADE teams have been able to use
FrontierNet to send out distress calls from
anywhere, even during electromagnetic storms.

rows.label: TownInfo443_4
rows.name:
A Nopon named Chiroro seems to be
sending out distress calls from the Floating
Reef over in Valley of Oblivion.

rows.label: TownInfo443_5
rows.name:
I'm impressed that Chiroro girl was able
to make it up to the Floating Reef at all.
Maybe the Nopon actually can fly with those
little feather things of theirs...

rows.label: TownInfo444_1
rows.name:
You're assigning me to gather anhydrous
radiators and heatproof inox pipes? Yessir!
I believe I can find all you need here in
Primordia, sir.

rows.label: TownInfo444_2
rows.name:
It will be fine, sir. BLADE will not lose to the
likes of the Bias. Put your faith in us and let
us do our job.

rows.label: TownInfo444_3
rows.name:
Sir, perhaps you could learn something from
the wisdom Director General Chausson and
Defense Secretary Nagi showed in accepting
the Ma-non.

rows.label: TownInfo444_4
rows.name:
The entire Pathfinders Union is conducting a
simultaneous joint survey? What on Earth is
going on here at BLADE, sir?

rows.label: TownInfo444_5
rows.name:
You've earned my complete trust since we've
arrived here on Mira, sir. I feel comfortable
following your orders. You have my full faith
and confidence.

rows.label: TownInfo445_1
rows.name:
They found wreckage from an alien civilization
on Sickle Rock Rise just east of here.
Ooo, I'd just LOVE to dig that puppy up
and do a little research...

rows.label: TownInfo445_2
rows.name:
I hear Elma's team investigated the alien
wreckage on Sickle Rock Rise. I wonder if
they found anything useful there?

rows.label: TownInfo445_3
rows.name:
Until just recently, I've been swamped with
repairs on damaged Dolls—but now I finally
have a little free time on my hands.

rows.label: TownInfo445_4
rows.name:
They're deploying a new series of Dolls?
They look mighty complicated and difficult
to repair, huh? ...Oooo, I can't wait to start
digging into these babies!

rows.label: TownInfo445_5
rows.name:
With new Dolls flying off the shelves the way
they are, no one on my maintenance team is
getting much sleep. But that's all right, because
all the new tech has us fired UP!

rows.label: TownInfo446_1
rows.name:
Even BLADE Tower—the center of NLA's
government—is barely 70 percent complete.
But it's not like we have the luxury of waiting
around for it to be finished.

rows.label: TownInfo446_2
rows.name:
Now that the C-01 Elevator is finished,
ferrying raw materials to the residential district
has gotten a whole lot easier.

rows.label: TownInfo446_3
rows.name:
We suffered plenty of casualties in the enemy
attack, but the city mostly survived unscathed.
Thank heavens for that.

rows.label: TownInfo446_4
rows.name:
It looks like they're recruiting test pilots for
Doll flight modules on the Quest Board
board. ...Flying Dolls? Is that even possible?

rows.label: TownInfo446_5
rows.name:
Doll flight modules would finally give us
a way to counter the Growth's aerial
weaponry.

rows.label: TownInfo447_1
rows.name:
Once you stagger an enemy, use Arts to
topple it. A toppled foe is immobilized,
making even the deadliest of creatures
as harmless as a kitten.

rows.label: TownInfo447_2
rows.name:
Have you set up all your skills like I told you?
If you don't have the appropriate skills
boosting your abilities, I don't see how you
can survive the upcoming battles.

rows.label: TownInfo447_3
rows.name:
What possible power source allows that ship
to float like that? Do they have antigravity
engines or something? It's like the laws of
physics don't apply to Ma-non.

rows.label: TownInfo447_4
rows.name:
They say a gargantuan millepod lurks at the
bottom of the Giant Crack. The Nopon that
inhabit the area seem to live in constant fear
of it.

rows.label: TownInfo447_5
rows.name:
If we're gonna be living here indefinitely,
we need to come up with cool names for
those five moons in the sky.

rows.label: TownInfo448_1
rows.name:
Now that pact of friendship is forged, Nopon
do everything we can to rescue long-suffering
humans. And since we friends, we do it at
substantial discount!

rows.label: TownInfo448_2
rows.name:
During invasion, Nopon feverishly performed
dance of victory from inside Ma-non ship.
Human friends have Nopon to thank for
NLA being safe!

rows.label: TownInfo448_3
rows.name:
BLADE team led by Tatsu destroyed Growth's
super-flying-city-smashy-smasher. Tatsu is pride
of Nopon everywhere!

rows.label: TownInfo448_4
rows.name:
The final battle begins! Nopon support friends
by performing dance of victory until dawn!

rows.label: TownInfo448_5
rows.name:
Is it true Tatsu kill Luxaar with single blow?
So incredible! Tatsu is great hero.

rows.label: TownInfo449_1
rows.name:
I've said it before and I'll say it again—this
ain't Earth. Don't expect that you'll be able
to trust your instincts.

rows.label: TownInfo449_2
rows.name:
Don't try to be a lone wolf out there, okay?
There are base camps in every region of Mira.
Work with the BLADEs there and complete
your assignments together.

rows.label: TownInfo449_3
rows.name:
There's no need to take a transport if you
want to get to the Ma-non ship. There's a
warp device right in front of BLADE Tower
that will beam you onto the ship instantly.

rows.label: TownInfo449_4
rows.name:
These Blue Bloods won't be functional for
much longer. But we have to keep fighting
for as long as we can.

rows.label: TownInfo449_5
rows.name:
I hope we can live the rest of our lives without
having to worry about some countdown timer
ticking toward oblivion. Even a New Year's
Eve countdown will probably make me cry...

rows.label: TownInfo450_1
rows.name:
BLADE has an interesting mix of members.
It's composed of everything from the military
elites of the Coalition government to famous
explorers who surveyed the moon.

rows.label: TownInfo450_2
rows.name:
You've been accepted into the Pathfinders,
huh? I joined the Collepedians, myself. Good luck
to both of us.

rows.label: TownInfo450_3
rows.name:
I hear Corwin's team is looking for new
members. If you're interested, you should ask
around at the Pathfinders' headquarters.

rows.label: TownInfo450_4
rows.name:
Sounds like Corwin's team got attacked by
some weird xeno. We gotta watch out for
that sort of thing ourselves.

rows.label: TownInfo450_5
rows.name:
After what happened with Corwin's team, it
seems like the Growth are done playing nice.
Maybe that means we have them worried?

rows.label: TownInfo451_1
rows.name:
If NLA falls, then that's it for humanity.
Fortifying the city defenses has to be our
absolute top priority.

rows.label: TownInfo451_2
rows.name:
I wonder how that new recruit is faring?
Defense Secretary Nagi must have thought
highly of [ST:gender p1=him p2=her ] to put [ST:gender p1=him p2=her ] on Elma's team.

rows.label: TownInfo451_3
rows.name:
The new recruit saved us all. If [ST:gender p1=he p2=she ] hadn't
been there, NLA may well have been lost.

rows.label: TownInfo451_4
rows.name:
Every night, Lu gathers a bunch of xenos at the
entry passage to the Ma-non ship. Got no
idea why, but I bet it's to try and sell 'em a
few more bottles of snake oil.

rows.label: TownInfo451_5
rows.name:
That new recruit on Elma's team has had a
remarkable string of successes. I hope [ST:gender p1=he p2=she ] can
keep guiding the rest of us towards our true
potential.

rows.label: TownInfo452_1
rows.name:
Have you seen that timer they put on the front
of BLADE Tower? No one seems to know what
it's for.

rows.label: TownInfo452_2
rows.name:
I know BLADE is doing their best, but
FrontierNet is nowhere near to covering all
of Mira.

rows.label: TownInfo452_3
rows.name:
It's hard to believe that we can use
FrontierNet to inspect over half of this planet.
BLADE has been doing incredible work.

rows.label: TownInfo452_4
rows.name:
I swear I'm telling the truth—Irina was
actually humming to herself as she was
shopping in the commercial district!
What is going on with her?

rows.label: TownInfo452_5
rows.name:
You think Irina sees Gwin as a sort of little
brother? Huh. I always thought she saw him
more like... I dunno. A pet, I guess.

rows.label: TownInfo453_2
rows.name:
You can use this warp device to beam right
onto the Ma-non ship. Don't be afraid.
Just hop on it and instantaneously soar on
over to the other side.

rows.label: TownInfo453_3
rows.name:
Prepare to move out! You're heading for
Nightglow Forest's Lakeview Stronghold to recover an
alien container that's been sighted nearby.

rows.label: TownInfo453_4
rows.name:
So you're not going to yield on this?
You're going to hold your ground no matter
what? Are you describing your combat style
here on Mira or something?

rows.label: TownInfo453_5
rows.name:
Oh, so NOW you're ready to depart for your
survey of Nightglow Forest? Too bad! Elma's team has
already done almost all of the work for you.

rows.label: TownInfo454_1
rows.name:
Every category of indigen has a weakness to
something. For example, flame-based attacks
are particularly effective against theroids.

rows.label: TownInfo454_2
rows.name:
I strongly support Director General Chausson's
open-arms policy. Considering the situation
we're in, we can't afford to hold grudges—
we must ally with any xenoform that's willing.

rows.label: TownInfo454_3
rows.name:
If any xenos want to start arms manufacturers,
we should invest generously. Their technology
could be a huge asset to us.

rows.label: TownInfo454_4
rows.name:
A Larsian warrior is searching for able-
bodied BLADEs? In the interest of establishing
friendly relations, we should dispatch BLADEs
to their refuge immediately.

rows.label: TownInfo454_5
rows.name:
Earning the cooperation of mercenaries as
powerful as the Larsians could provide a
potentially significant boost to our military
capability.

rows.label: TownInfo455_1
rows.name:
The suspension on this Doll is completely
wrecked. It must have put up a good fight
against the xenos when we made our
emergency landing.

rows.label: TownInfo455_2
rows.name:
Apparently there's still Doll wreckage at the
Plundered Ruin to the northwest. I wonder
if we could salvage any usable parts from
the debris...

rows.label: TownInfo455_3
rows.name:
Not like I got a lot of free time on my hands,
but I'll upgrade your gear. Doesn't look good
to have the guards that defend the Home
wielding out-of-date equipment.

rows.label: TownInfo455_4
rows.name:
Lately they've been cranking out new gear for
Dolls at a blistering pace. They're getting
stronger and stronger with no end in sight.

rows.label: TownInfo455_5
rows.name:
What do you think? This Doll's a work of art,
right? Oh, it may look pretty conventional on
the outside, but when you get behind the
controls, it's gonna blow your mind!

rows.label: TownInfo456_1
rows.name:
The area beyond this point is still under
construction. There's nothing to see there.
Yep. Nooothing at all. Toootally boring.

rows.label: TownInfo456_2
rows.name:
At the guard post in the lower area, I saw
Gwin spend his lunch hour talking to a
newbie friend and looking all grim. He didn't
even eat! I wonder what's going on...

rows.label: TownInfo456_3
rows.name:
Gwin's certainly made quite a name for
himself since we arrived here on Mira.
Must be all the hazing he gets from Irina.

rows.label: TownInfo456_4
rows.name:
That Gwin has really been nipping at the heels
of Elma's team lately! I think it's time for us to
show our own initiative and join the effort to
explore Nightglow Forest.

rows.label: TownInfo456_5
rows.name:
I found one of those joadtanks at the Divine
Roost in Nightglow Forest. That Gwin ain't gonna
show me up this time!

rows.label: TownInfo457_1
rows.name:
What's up with this shop? There's something
funny about that Lu guy who runs it. And do
you REALLY think that machine can add more
augment slots to things? Is that even possible?

rows.label: TownInfo457_2
rows.name:
It looks like that contraption really CAN boost
the amount of augment slots equipment can
have. I dunno know about the rest of the junk
in this shop, but that machine is the real deal.

rows.label: TownInfo457_3
rows.name:
Armory Alley sure has gotten a lot more
interesting since Lu blew into town. ...I mean
that in a good way, but also a bad way.

rows.label: TownInfo458_1
rows.name:
We're out of amplification lenses, and can't
make any more of Grenada GG's trademark
beam weapons! Go tell our colleagues in the
industrial district to hurry up and make more!

rows.label: TownInfo458_2
rows.name:
The resource shortage has thrown our
production line into chaos. Now all we can
do is hope the Arms and Landbankers
manage to bail us out.

rows.label: TownInfo458_3
rows.name:
They must have expanded mining throughout
Mira, because we're finally able to get our
products back in production. We owe a lot to
BLADE and the industrial district workers.

rows.label: TownInfo458_4
rows.name:
I hear a massive indigen that no one's ever
seen before lives in the western part of
Sylvalum's Lake Ciel. I wonder if our weapons
would even be effective against such a thing?

rows.label: TownInfo458_5
rows.name:
Our stock shortages are finally a thing of the
past. Now our focus needs to turn to making
newer and better products, and I think we're
more than up to the challenge.

rows.label: TownInfo459_1
rows.name:
Any BLADE can use that terminal there to
purchase new weapons and protective wear.

rows.label: TownInfo459_3
rows.name:
The more resources the arms manufacturers
receive, the more new products they can
develop. I've got my eye on something now,
so I gotta get out there and gather miranium!

rows.label: TownInfo459_4
rows.name:
You already bought your own Doll? Wow...
Now that I have a Doll license, I'd sure love
to get a Doll of my own one day!

rows.label: TownInfo459_5
rows.name:
All of the newly released Dolls have flight
modules installed. This is the perfect chance
to buy my own Doll and start soaring
through the skies of Mira. Wheeeee!

rows.label: TownInfo460_1
rows.name:
Many small islands are on oceans of Mira.
Maybe great treasure there? Or kinda great?
Friend should go explore all sort of things!

rows.label: TownInfo460_2
rows.name:
Merchants from Dorian Caravan say they
discover wreckage from human ship near
Sea Whisper Valley.

rows.label: TownInfo460_3
rows.name:
Perhaps friend wants to buy noctilucent
dragonfly fresh captured from Nightglow Forest?
It sparkle so bright! So beautiful!

rows.label: TownInfo460_4
rows.name:
In market for Sylvalum shia cattleya direct
from Dopang Caravan? It beautiful as jewel
and twice as charming!

rows.label: TownInfo460_5
rows.name:
Friend wants rogebra shockstone? Friend can
feel it crackle with electricity! It make for
wonderful—if slightly dangerous—gift for loved
one or boss man.

rows.label: TownInfo461_1
rows.name:
All work and no play is a recipe for driving
yourself nuts. You need to come with me to
Gina's Bar and cut loose once in a while.

rows.label: TownInfo461_2
rows.name:
You wouldn't guess it by looking at him,
but Commander Vandham is quite the
machinery buff.

rows.label: TownInfo461_3
rows.name:
They say there's a vicious Overed lurking in
