Nightglow Forest, but there isn't enough data in
FrontierNet to narrow down its habitat.

rows.label: TownInfo461_4
rows.name:
The Overed that attacked so many BLADEs has
apparently been spotted flying just beyond the
Celestial Cleave at the back of Nightglow Forest.

rows.label: TownInfo461_5
rows.name:
A monster from the Central Life was spotted
at Nightglow Forest's Vitriol Cesspool. I guess this
still isn't over!

rows.label: TownInfo462_1
rows.name:
That "Murderess" woman from the Collepedians
is causing problems again? When is HQ
finally gonna cut that psycho loose?

rows.label: TownInfo462_2
rows.name:
When fighting erupts in the commercial district
alleyways at night, the Murderess is always
watching from the crowd. Some new scheme
of hers, I bet. Or maybe she just likes blood.

rows.label: TownInfo462_3
rows.name:
Not everyone is a fan of Maurice Chausson's
high-handed leadership style, but when times
are tough, he's gotta do what he's gotta do.

rows.label: TownInfo462_5
rows.name:
BLADE looks good because Director General
Chausson and the rest of us do its dirty work.
You can't maintain an organization like that
without someone wading through the muck.

rows.label: TownInfo463_1
rows.name:
Watch out—we're not alone anymore!
I'll resume my report about...you-know-what
at a later time.

rows.label: TownInfo463_2
rows.name:
Yeah, I'll keep sniffing around the Pathfinders.
I'm sure I'll pick up the traitor's trail soon.

rows.label: TownInfo463_3
rows.name:
We've received intel that one or more
Growth-affiliated xenoforms have infiltrated
NLA. I'll see what else I can find out.

rows.label: TownInfo463_4
rows.name:
I just never suspected it would be Lao...
Rest assured that I intend to perform a
thorough investigation to find out if anyone
else in BLADE is working with the Growth.

rows.label: TownInfo463_5
rows.name:
The spies who infiltrated NLA were from
an alien race known as the Definians. We owe
a great debt to the BLADE operatives who
took care of them for us.

rows.label: TownInfo464_1
rows.name:
Our Ma-non arms manufacturer seems to
invent handy equipment that human cannot,
right? Like weapons with bolt attributes or
armor that reduces your debuff time?

rows.label: TownInfo464_2
rows.name:
The Growth have some so so powerful
weapons, yes? If you want to go up against
those, we'll probably need to make you some
better weapons for yourself, won't we?

rows.label: TownInfo464_3
rows.name:
Our arms manufacturer is facing more and
more competition from non-human rivals lately,
isn't it? I suppose we can't really afford
to get sloppy...

rows.label: TownInfo464_4
rows.name:
So that Bias? Slovity? The scary one?
I don't know what she's planning to do up on
our ship, but I really really REALLY hope it's
nothing bad...

rows.label: TownInfo464_5
rows.name:
So that Bias? Slovity? Big scary one?
She's destroying lots and lots of Growth
bases, isn't she? She must be so so strong.

rows.label: TownInfo465_1
rows.name:
Next time our team's gonna be the one to
find a survivor. I'm tired of being shown up
by Elma's team every damn time!

rows.label: TownInfo465_2
rows.name:
You didn't find any signs of Lifepoint debris
on your last exploration mission either?
Dammit! Where could that thing have landed?

rows.label: TownInfo465_3
rows.name:
That signal we picked up from Valley of Oblivion's
South Coast? Yeah, that wasn't part of the
Lifepoint. It was just being transmitted from
some Doll wreckage.

rows.label: TownInfo465_4
rows.name:
With FrontierNet having expanded as much as
it has, the lack of any Lifepoint news suggests
it crashed somewhere really unusual.

rows.label: TownInfo465_5
rows.name:
All that time I spent searching for the Lifepoint
Core in Valley of Oblivion... Ha! I never imagined it
would turn up way out west of Cauldros
instead.

rows.label: TownInfo466_1
rows.name:
Your accuracy improves when attacking foes
from behind, and it's also easier to hit their
weak points. You must always pay attention
to positioning when you fight.

rows.label: TownInfo466_2
rows.name:
They say if you continue north past the bay at
Northpointe, you can reach a whole different
continent called Sylvalum. I don't think my
team is up for that challenge yet.

rows.label: TownInfo466_3
rows.name:
Have you seen that giant indigen at Sylvalum's
Hilal Meadow? We keep our eyes peeled for
that thing every time we pass through there.

rows.label: TownInfo466_4
rows.name:
That thunderbolt emblem we found at the
Northern Searoad was apparently left there
by Larsians. I wonder if something happened
to them in Sylvalum?

rows.label: TownInfo466_5
rows.name:
Wherever we go these days, we find data
probes that were installed by Elma's team.
We gotta tip our hats to how much they've
accomplished.

rows.label: TownInfo467_1
rows.name:
If you destroy a forfex's head, you might be
able to extract some crab paste from it.
Mmm...crab paste... Uh, I mean, bring some
back as a souvenir for your fellow BLADEs!

rows.label: TownInfo467_2
rows.name:
That xeno named Lu was selling "a belt that
cures your fatigue just by wearing it," and of
course I fell for it. But the damn thing's so
heavy, I feel even more tired when I put it on.

rows.label: TownInfo467_3
rows.name:
I saw Lu staring at a cat over in the residential
district. He was mumbling to himself about
how one might go about eating such a
creature. So, uh, yeah. Lock up your cats.

rows.label: TownInfo467_4
rows.name:
I tried to fix my own Blue Blood and
managed to take apart my right hand, but it
was functioning even worse when I finished.
Guess I have to take this thing in after all.

rows.label: TownInfo467_5
rows.name:
Now that there's less pressure at work, I was
thinking of building RC helicopters like I used
to. If you come across any good components
from Earth you don't need, send 'em my way!

rows.label: TownInfo468_1
rows.name:
How many Dolls do you need to wreck before
you're satisfied? How about you try fighting a
little less recklessly maybe?

rows.label: TownInfo468_2
rows.name:
Just because you have a Doll license doesn't
mean you can ride any Doll out there.
You have to pick one that matches your level.

rows.label: TownInfo468_3
rows.name:
If your Doll's frame level is low, you may not
be able to equip it with certain weapons.
Make sure to look out for that when you're
shopping for new armaments.

rows.label: TownInfo468_4
rows.name:
Defense Secretary Nagi is attending a party
with the Sakuraba big shots at noon today.
Shouldn't you go to the residential district to
provide security?

rows.label: TownInfo468_5
rows.name:
That's soooo impressive that you totaled 20
Dolls without suffering so much as a scratch!
...Hey, what are you smiling about?
I was being sarcastic, you moron!

rows.label: TownInfo469_1
rows.name:
A Doll can always be repaired, so just focus
on getting yourself back alive, okay?

rows.label: TownInfo469_2
rows.name:
What's the deal with that Lu guy we found in
Nightglow Forest? He seems awfully...interested in us
humans.

rows.label: TownInfo469_3
rows.name:
Looks like that Lu guy has opened up his own
shop in Armory Alley. Maybe we should
check it out next time we're in the area.

rows.label: TownInfo469_4
rows.name:
I hear Zurranik just received a small fortune in
credits from some weird Larsian. Now he's
up on the Ma-non ship, freaking out about
how many Miralife Cards he can buy.

rows.label: TownInfo469_5
rows.name:
Welcome back! I'm so happy to see you safe
and sound. That matters more to me than the
most amazing mission success.

rows.label: TownInfo470_1
rows.name:
Is it the type of indigen that has hearing as
its primary sense? Because if it can sense my
coming even as I sneak up on it from behind,
I'm gonna be pretty much done for, right?

rows.label: TownInfo470_2
rows.name:
We've already lost 21 BLADEs to the giant
Overed of Hilal Meadow. I can barely
comprehend how dangerous that thing must
be. It makes my knees tremble!

rows.label: TownInfo470_3
rows.name:
The ability to live safely behind NLA's
defensive walls is so utterly priceless. That
thought always hits me all the more strongly
when I'm back from a long deployment.

rows.label: TownInfo470_4
rows.name:
I fear that we'll soon be at the point where
we'll have no choice but to begin surveying
the most dangerous areas of Mira...

rows.label: TownInfo470_5
rows.name:
Considering how far the survey has come,
I think I've earned the right to relax in NLA
for a while. What do you say? Want to join
me for a nice quiet picnic one of these days?

rows.label: TownInfo471_1
rows.name:
That new crew member they found is going
straight onto Elma's team? Talk about lucky!

rows.label: TownInfo471_2
rows.name:
Lately, whenever I see Lin she's with some
small animal that she calls "Tatsu." I don't
know if it's a pet or what, but it's nice to see
her enjoying herself.

rows.label: TownInfo471_3
rows.name:
You know Tracey? The Companion? I just saw
her arrest a Zaruboggan down at Barista
Court in the commercial district! I hope this
doesn't turn into some diplomatic disaster...

rows.label: TownInfo471_4
rows.name:
The Zaruboggan are a very polite species.
When I gave them the industrial wastewater
that was over there, they thanked me for
almost five straight minutes!

rows.label: TownInfo471_5
rows.name:
The ground has been contaminated in our next
survey location? Er, I don't suppose we could
get a Zaruboggan to accompany us?

rows.label: TownInfo472_1
rows.name:
I can't believe that after we traveled on the
White Whale for two years, it's been reduced
to debris scattered throughout Mira. We have
to recover it and put its pieces to use in NLA!

rows.label: TownInfo472_2
rows.name:
As soon as the surrounding areas are secured,
we'll be able to begin exploring Mira for real.
You gotta improve the mobility of our Dolls!

rows.label: TownInfo472_3
rows.name:
Our regional data for Primordia is growing at
an astonishing pace. Do we have that new
member of Elma's team to thank for this, too?

rows.label: TownInfo472_4
rows.name:
I hear Secretary Nagi's paying a visit to Team
Elma's quarters at the BLADE Home. Yep,
that group sure is close with the secretary...
MUST BE NICE!

rows.label: TownInfo472_5
rows.name:
Secretary Nagi has joined up with Elma's team
to serve as a BLADE? Wait, WHAT?!
Yeah, I don't know what you think you saw,
but there's no way in hell it was that.

rows.label: TownInfo473_1
rows.name:
A trailer loaded with precious resources was
attacked at Nightglow Forest's Decapotamon.
Just goes to show how dangerous it is to
be out there without a Doll.

rows.label: TownInfo473_2
rows.name:
When an enemy's stance is broken, you can
use a Doll to bind and subdue it. And while
the Doll is holding on for all it's worth,
your teammates can smack it around!

rows.label: TownInfo473_3
rows.name:
Relax, there's no need to get so worked up.
I promise I'll fix it as soon as the parts arrive
from the manufacturer.

rows.label: TownInfo473_4
rows.name:
Let me know how this feels when you use it.
I added a bunch of xeno arms manufacturers'
parts—in terms of raw strength, it should be
nearly twice as powerful as it was originally.

rows.label: TownInfo473_5
rows.name:
We're seeing a lot of Dolls that have been
modified with components from xeno arms
manufacturers. Nearly 80 percent of the parts
in this one are come from Candid & Credible.

rows.label: TownInfo474_2
rows.name:
We lost many of the research facilities that
were on the White Whale, as well as the
Lifepoint Archives. As a result, the inner
workings of some technology has been lost.

rows.label: TownInfo474_3
rows.name:
Could I ask you to go through that again
from the beginning? Your tech is so advanced,
I'm struggling to understand even the broad
strokes of what you're saying.

rows.label: TownInfo474_4
rows.name:
Yes, we've detected a badly-damaged alien
container in Cauldros's north T'phnom Shelf.
Do you think you will be able to retrieve
anything out of it?

rows.label: TownInfo474_5
rows.name:
I never imagined that what awaited us on
Mira would be a second technological
revolution. It's all thanks to you and your
generous sharing of scientific knowledge!

rows.label: TownInfo475_1
rows.name:
I'm not sure I could have endured the two-year
journey on the White Whale if it wasn't for
Hope's constant encouragement.

rows.label: TownInfo475_2
rows.name:
These image files of Hope are incredible.
I'll have to thank Quentin for sending them my
way. Oh, how I look forward to talking to her
again!

rows.label: TownInfo475_3
rows.name:
Has Hope seemed a little depressed to you
lately? I wonder what happened to her?
I really miss her smile.

rows.label: TownInfo475_4
rows.name:
Hope somehow looks like even more of an
angel when she's playing with that dog in the
commercial district. Wish I was a dog...

rows.label: TownInfo475_5
rows.name:
I want to be Hope's pet dog, but I don't
know quite how to go about it. ...Probably
shouldn't discuss that with her, huh?

rows.label: TownInfo476_1
rows.name:
The exploration of Mira is about to begin in
earnest. Good luck—I know it's going to be a
busy time for all of you.

rows.label: TownInfo476_2
rows.name:
Each Doll weapon has different fuel needs.
When customizing your Doll, it's important to
factor in fuel consumption and not just focus
on a weapon's attack power and attributes.

rows.label: TownInfo476_3
rows.name:
We've received word that the boss of those
grex indigens is patrolling near the Beasts'
Lair in Primordia. You'd better hurry up and
Overed-proof that Doll of yours!

rows.label: TownInfo476_4
rows.name:
I heard someone took down that grex boss
already. It makes me feel like a proud papa
knowing that Dolls we serviced may have
played a role in that.

rows.label: TownInfo476_5
rows.name:
BLADE would never have been able to
accomplish all that it has if we didn't have
you mechanics toiling away behind the scenes.
You have our sincerest thanks.

rows.label: TownInfo477_1
rows.name:
This off-roader got stuck in Nightglow Forest's
poison swamps. I guess the driver's been
comatose and in critical condition ever since.
What a savage planet this is...

rows.label: TownInfo477_2
rows.name:
Did you see that creepy mech Elma's team
recovered? Why would the Growth even
have wanted it in the first place?

rows.label: TownInfo477_3
rows.name:
You're saying the Growth threw that large
of an army at us just to get that mech back?
That seems completely bizarre to me.

rows.label: TownInfo477_4
rows.name:
I wonder if we'll be able to get the Lifepoint
Core back safely? All we can do is put our
faith in BLADE and pray for their success.

rows.label: TownInfo477_5
rows.name:
Hey, I know Director General Chausson hasn't
officially announced anything yet, but what do
you think happened with the Central Life?

rows.label: TownInfo478_1
rows.name:
Heh heh heh. Is there anything better than
having two men competing for your love?
Keep trying, suckers! Aaaah ha ha ha ha!

rows.label: TownInfo478_2
rows.name:
If either of you truly love me, you'll go to
Cauldros and recover the patrol copter that
crashed in the lava fields!

rows.label: TownInfo478_3
rows.name:
Was that an uppercut? Your fighting over
me is getting more and more impressive.

rows.label: TownInfo478_4
rows.name:
You two are basically professional-level fighters
at this point. Has your love for me really
elevated your combat capabilities this much?
Oooo, that's SO EXCITING!

rows.label: TownInfo478_5
rows.name:
If you truly love me, you will continue to fight
each other for all eternity! So long as you do,
I will continue to bestow favor on you both.
Now fight! Fight for my love!

rows.label: TownInfo479_1
rows.name:
I saw this crazy tree that looks like a giant
dragon's tail in Nightglow Forest. I can't get it out
of my head! Could someone please investigate
it for me, maybe?

rows.label: TownInfo479_2
rows.name:
So so so I was just asked by an arms
manufacturer to help develop an augment that
protects against the effects of weather...
That sounds like a lot of work, doesn't it?

rows.label: TownInfo479_3
rows.name:
You know about the Growth attack, right?
Well, we have so so many things that need
repairing now. Oh, and somebody keeps
mentioning something called "overtime"?

rows.label: TownInfo479_4
rows.name:
What what what happened in the restricted
hangar? Did the Growth attack us?
They did, right?

rows.label: TownInfo479_5
rows.name:
I hear there was a human traitor, yes?
That's terrible. So so terrible!
Does this mean humans aren't all one big
happy family, then?

rows.label: TownInfo480_1
rows.name:
The amana durian found in Nightglow Forest's 
Elephant's Trunk area is covered in spikes,
so no one's been able to eat one yet.
But that's not going to stop me from trying!

rows.label: TownInfo480_2
rows.name:
Making equipment out of indigen parts like
fangs and hide seems to be becoming
something of a trend. Though I certainly
wouldn't turn down a warm grex-skin coat.

rows.label: TownInfo480_3
rows.name:
The entrance to Cauldros's O'rrh Sim Castle
is guarded by a cutting-edge model of Galdr
that shimmers like gold. There's no way I'd
even make it through the front door.

rows.label: TownInfo480_4
rows.name:
They say if you break the petals of the
sacrifole indigens that live in Cauldros, you
can harvest their spicy pollen. ...Is it SPICY
spicy? Like, will steam come out of your ears?

rows.label: TownInfo480_5
rows.name:
Even the indigens that used to terrify us are
now just another source of materials for use in
our daily lives. We really are the top of the
food chain, aren't we?

rows.label: TownInfo481_1
rows.name:
Calling out to your companions during combat
can bring out a strength from within them that
is many times greater than normal. ...Or, so I
hear. I still have to test it out in battle myself.

rows.label: TownInfo481_2
rows.name:
We have to follow through on the dying
wishes of our comrades who were lost
defending NLA. Now let's get out there
and find the Central Life!

rows.label: TownInfo481_3
rows.name:
No! You're telling me the restricted hangar
was built to protect that new model of Doll?

rows.label: TownInfo481_4
rows.name:
Wreckage from the White Whale has been
spotted at the northern part of Lake Basel in
Valley of Oblivion? Even the Testamenters wouldn't be
capable of recovering anything from there!

rows.label: TownInfo481_5
rows.name:
I'm glad that new Prog Ares Doll was
recovered safely, but I still don't know
what special power makes that thing
so...um...special.

rows.label: TownInfo482_1
rows.name:
If you're going to be putting your life on the
line when you fight, then I'll devote my life to
making equipment that protects you—even if it
means working through the night.

rows.label: TownInfo482_2
rows.name:
That Lin girl has been wrestling with a flight
module at the Arms test hangar until the
wee hours of the night. She truly is a diligent
researcher, that one.

rows.label: TownInfo482_3
rows.name:
Lin has proven herself much more valuable as
an engineer than the rest of these greenhorns.
She really is incredible!

rows.label: TownInfo482_4
rows.name:
Your next deployment is to Nightglow Forest?
Can you bring me back some caseras
mushrooms as a souvenir? Like, lots?
Those things are incredible!

rows.label: TownInfo482_5
rows.name:
So you nearly got lost in Nightglow Forest, but were
saved by FrontierNet? Sounds like you owe
whoever installed all those data probes a
big sloppy kiss.

rows.label: TownInfo483_1
rows.name:
As long as you've got the funds, you can
scout BLADEs much stronger than yourself.
Keep it in mind when you're having trouble
out there—could be a lifesaver!

rows.label: TownInfo483_2
rows.name:
Archive 07 seems to have been destroyed.
I'd always meant to read through the
classical texts it held. What a damn shame.

rows.label: TownInfo483_3
rows.name:
I thought I'd try to make friends with some of
the xenos in the city, so I stuck out my index
finger and told them to phone home.
...It didn't work out like it did in the movie.

rows.label: TownInfo483_4
rows.name:
It isn't just BLADE. Every single person in this
city is doing everything in their power to bring
down the Growth.

rows.label: TownInfo483_5
rows.name:
We won! Come on already, let's get dressed
up and throw ourselves a victory party!

rows.label: TownInfo484_1
rows.name:
You'll accumulate battle points as you grow
as a BLADE. These can be used to strengthen
your Arts and skills to better take on the
enemy.

rows.label: TownInfo484_2
rows.name:
Think about what might have happened if it
had been the Central Life that Goetia
destroyed. Brrr... It sends a shiver down
my spine.

rows.label: TownInfo484_3
rows.name:
So how come this Goetia knows about the
operational limits of our Blue Bloods?
That's something that most of humanity
doesn't even know!

rows.label: TownInfo484_4
rows.name:
How could Lao do this? Even in the Coalition
military, I'd never met a soldier who was more
single-minded in looking out for the well-being
of his comrades.

rows.label: TownInfo484_5
rows.name:
There are some people who still can't forgive
Lao for what he did. But I could never hate a
man who sacrificed his life to bring down
Luxaar like that.

rows.label: TownInfo485_1
rows.name:
You're interested in the mystery of the missing
squad? Well, the only people who know the
truth are the survivors—the so-called "Celeste
Three." They're somewhere here in NLA.

rows.label: TownInfo485_2
rows.name:
I saw Fosdyke—one of the Celeste Three—at
Deliverance Park in the residential district.
Seriously! It was totally him!

rows.label: TownInfo485_3
rows.name:
Once we dug a little deeper, it turned out the
entire "missing team" incident was nothing
more than a ruse of the Celeste Three.
I'd always suspected something like that...

rows.label: TownInfo485_4
rows.name:
I wonder how much treasure is in the safe
that the Celeste Three were protecting?

rows.label: TownInfo485_5
rows.name:
I can't believe it! A Larsian made off with
the Celeste Three's treasure! I thought all
Larsians were honorable and junk, but I
guess even they have some bad apples.

rows.label: TownInfo486_1
rows.name:
Lin's flight module designs have failed time
and time again, but she never gives up.
That girl's got real grit! You could learn
a lot from her.

rows.label: TownInfo486_2
rows.name:
That sandwich Lin brought over sure was
good. It seems insane that someone can be
so smart AND such a good cook!

rows.label: TownInfo486_3
rows.name:
Lin's down in the administrative district,
holding court with all the ladies from the
Landbankers. I see it's not only the lads who
that girl's popular with.

rows.label: TownInfo486_4
rows.name:
If your Doll's arms get destroyed, you won't
be able to use hand-operated weapons. If you
don't want to end up in that situation, best be
diligent about keeping your Doll maintained.

rows.label: TownInfo486_5
rows.name:
You know the Prog Ares that was stolen from
the restricted hangar? I hear there's also a
prototype of it that they just call the Ares.

rows.label: TownInfo487_1
rows.name:
If climb high enough, human friends look like
ant. It really funny!

rows.label: TownInfo487_2
rows.name:
Nopon try to help with repairs, but all these
funny spinny gears not make sense to us.
Friends' machines are too fancy!

rows.label: TownInfo487_3
rows.name:
Nopon sometimes sneak on board Doll,
but hands not long enough to reach controls.
Human friends should make Doll that Nopon
can drive!

rows.label: TownInfo487_4
rows.name:
Fellow Nopon in Sylvalum was attacked by
boss monster of Cavernous Abyss. BLADE
friends should take Doll down there and
kill evil thing to death!

rows.label: TownInfo487_5
rows.name:
Can Doll of friend take passengers to Dopang
Caravan? Many Nopon have family there!

rows.label: TownInfo488_1
rows.name:
You honestly think Irina would give you the
time of day? Ha ha ha! What a dreamer!
You know she pretty much hates men, right?

rows.label: TownInfo488_2
rows.name:
I heard Carl grumbling about something over
at the east gate. I wonder if he's having some
sort of trouble with his assignment?

rows.label: TownInfo488_3
rows.name:
Lara Nara has been telling everyone that he
thinks you're cute. Why not give up on Irina
already and get to know Lara better instead?

rows.label: TownInfo488_4
rows.name:
Now Elma's team has won over the
Larsians? Oh, come on. That's just...
I can't even stand them right now.

rows.label: TownInfo488_5
rows.name:
What is the Larsian chief Ga-Derg still
doing in Valley of Oblivion? We have an alliance!
Shouldn't he move here to NLA?

rows.label: TownInfo489_1
rows.name:
Dealing with an Overed that harasses you with
dangerous attacks? Then work on destroying
body parts like its arms or head to seal those
nasty attacks off!

rows.label: TownInfo489_2
rows.name:
We lost contact with a guy in Sylvalum's
Silent Sandsea who was piloting a Doll
loaded with treasure. We gotta go reclaim
that loot!

rows.label: TownInfo489_3
rows.name:
We finally reached Sylvalum, but that Doll
wreckage we were after had already been
recovered. Beaten to the punch by Elma's
team yet again, it seems...

rows.label: TownInfo489_4
rows.name:
Hey, looks like they posted a bunch of high-
paying assignments! As soon as you finish this
game, let's go check out Quest Board.

rows.label: TownInfo489_5
rows.name:
Now that things have finally settled down
around here, I wish they'd build a casino in
NLA. Mama needs a new pair of shoes!

rows.label: TownInfo490_1
rows.name:
A BLADE was injured? Well, that's not so so
big a problem for you humans. I mean,
you just go to the repair shop and are
good as new, right?

rows.label: TownInfo490_2
rows.name:
It looks like Veverta dropped her comm device,
doesn't it? She seems to be wandering the
commercial district saying bad things under
her breath. Bad bad things...

rows.label: TownInfo490_3
rows.name:
I'm going to try to be like Veverta, okay?
I'll help Cheche fix broken Dolls without
slacking off at all! That's a good plan, right?

rows.label: TownInfo490_4
rows.name:
If you have a salvage ticket, you can have
your broken Doll repaired for free, right?
Even if your insurance has lapsed?

rows.label: TownInfo490_5
rows.name:
The Dolls? The ones that went to the Lifepoint
Core? They all came back in a bad bad state.
Must have been a dangerous battle...

rows.label: TownInfo491_1
rows.name:
Tatsu seemed depressed, so I suggested he go
to the terrace to try and cheer himself up.

rows.label: TownInfo492_1
rows.name:
Tatsu said he wanted to go somewhere far
away, so I introduced him to that transport
pilot in front of BLADE Tower.

rows.label: TownInfo493_1
rows.name:
I saw a man with a rifle case hurriedly
descending down into the hangars.
What was going on there?

rows.label: TownInfo494_1
rows.name:
I thought I saw a man with a rifle case
rushing into the garage, and a moment
later, a Doll flew out of it! I lost sight of it
near the industrial district.

rows.label: TownInfo495_1
rows.name:
An unidentified Doll ran through here at
high speed and broke through the gate.
I chased it for a bit, but it seemed like that
thing was rushing off to Sylvalum.

rows.label: TownInfo496_1
rows.name:
That Lifepoint Archive that's full of private data
like diaries and photos? Unfortunately that's
just not important enough to justify sending
anyone out to look for it at this point in time.

rows.label: TownInfo497_1
rows.name:
I wonder if the Lifepoint Archive unit containing
people's private data is actually unit 13.
You know—the one Ada was looking for?

rows.label: TownInfo498_1
rows.name:
If you're looking for Lifepoint Archive unit
number 13, we're confident that it crashed to
the north.

rows.label: TownInfo499_1
rows.name:
There's a lake with a special quality to its
water in that cave in Cauldros they call the
Bestial Utopia. Maybe that's the water that
the Orphe have been looking for?

rows.label: TownInfo500_1
rows.name:
Believe it or not, I was a chef back in San
Francisco. I'll teach you the famous Peking
duck recipe that my teacher entrusted to me.

rows.label: TownInfo501_1
rows.name:
Very well. If it's that important to you,
I'll teach you my secret Peking duck recipe.

rows.label: TownInfo502_1
rows.name:
I mastered this Peking duck recipe when I was
still young. It's a real step up from all those
other cheap knock-offs.

rows.label: TownInfo503_1
rows.name:
I thought all he cared about was Dolls,
but he was feeding that cat every day and
really seemed to be happy about it.

rows.label: TownInfo504_1
rows.name:
You know, it's been a while since I've seen
that kitty... Maybe it was so cute that one of
the mechanics couldn't help but take it home?

rows.label: TownInfo505_1
rows.name:
That cat seemed really well-adapted to life in
NLA. It wasn't even afraid of the Dolls.

rows.label: TownInfo506_1
rows.name:
Do you know what that cat's name is?
We call it Aisha. Every time I turn around,
Mathias is searching for it again.

rows.label: TownInfo507_1
rows.name:
The cat that always used to come here for
food has been spotted at Cliffside Beach.
She's probably gonna get eaten by some
monster out there!

rows.label: TownInfo508_1
rows.name:
If you break the tail rotor on your copter,
you should always connect any backup system
to the blue wire. You got that? The BLUE wire!
Blue! Like sadness! ...Write that down.

rows.label: TownInfo509_1
rows.name:
I'm gonna teach you how to disarm a bomb.
If you remember this well, you'll be able to
survive having a time bomb strapped to you!
Er, not that you want... Anyway, let's begin.

rows.label: TownInfo510_1
rows.name:
The east gate is sealed. If you want to head
outside, you have to go to the west gate.

rows.label: TownInfo510_3
rows.name:
Some people like to charge off into the more
dangerous areas as soon as they get
comfortable exploring. It's a good way to find
undiscovered treasure...if you survive.

rows.label: TownInfo510_4
rows.name:
I swear I shall never let the Growth pass
through this gate again! I don't want you
worrying about the safety of NLA as you
search for the Lifepoint.

rows.label: TownInfo510_5
rows.name:
I can't even count the number of people who
set off through this gate to explore and never
came back. I'm glad that their sacrifices did
not have to be in vain.

rows.label: TownInfo511_1
rows.name:
Tatsu asked me to take him to see the
Forgotten Mining Frigates in Cauldros.
What business could he possibly have
in a dangerous place like that?

rows.label: TownInfo512_1
rows.name:
I just saw that Tatsu guy walking to the
heliport. Is he okay? He looked like he was
shaking. He's not gonna jump or something,
is he?

rows.label: TownInfo513_1
rows.name:
Long-range shots fired from Bedrock Hold
were able to reach the Ma-non ship?
What in the heck is going on?!

rows.label: TownInfo514_1
rows.name:
A human woman was forcibly dragging one
of those bug guys towards the east gate.
Er, that's kidnapping, right? Or bug-napping?
Either way, I should have done something.

rows.label: TownInfo515_1
rows.name:
The woman dragging the xeno stole a vehicle
before it could be refueled? On that amount
of gas, she probably couldn't get any further
than the entrance to Valley of Oblivion.

rows.label: TownInfo516_1
rows.name:
A small xenoform girl said she wanted to
meet a top BLADE, so I told her all about
Commander Vandham. I wonder if she was
ever able to meet him?

rows.label: TownInfo517_1
rows.name:
That little xeno girl was being followed by a
massive xeno giant! He was so scary that...
Actually, you know what? He could still be
nearby, so I'm going to shut up now.

rows.label: TownInfo518_1
rows.name:
I saw a large xenoform wandering around
Team Elma's floor in the BLADE Home.
Could he have been searching for someone?

rows.label: TownInfo519_1
rows.name:
Even when night falls and Commander
Vandham returns to BLADE Tower, the hangars
are hopping. You wouldn't believe how much
we have to repair before sunrise!

rows.label: TownInfo520_1
rows.name:
At night, Commander Vandham goes to
handle his duties at BLADE Tower. I don't
know how a guy that busy still manages to
smile like he does.

rows.label: TownInfo521_1
rows.name:
I heard the victim died after being shot in the
foot and temple! If I were you, I'd avoid
going anywhere alone whenever possible.

rows.label: TownInfo522_1
rows.name:
I heard the men who were killed were all shot
in the right thigh and between their eyes.
That's completely insane, right?
It has to be the work of some mad xeno!

rows.label: TownInfo523_1
rows.name:
The victims of the serial murderer were all
killed in one of the same two ways. What do
they have in common? And what is the
murderer possibly hoping to achieve?

rows.label: TownInfo524_1
rows.name:
The insectoid indigens tend to be very sturdy,
so it's a lot more effective to battle them with
things like flame and certain energy waves 
than with physical attacks.

rows.label: TownInfo524_2
rows.name:
I hear there's a cervus with golden horns in
the South Ciel Sandsea of Sylvalum. I can't
even IMAGINE trying to take down that thing!

rows.label: TownInfo524_3
rows.name:
You analyzed some Global Nemesis body
part fragments and discovered a rare find?
You should hand those in to be converted
into rare materials.

rows.label: TownInfo524_4
rows.name:
Mondo, Shingo, and Saiden were good men
and good Pathfinders. And I know how highly
they all thought of Lao.

rows.label: TownInfo524_5
rows.name:
I know it was complicated, but when all was
said and done, Lao got the end he wanted.
I wonder how he's getting along with Mondo
and those guys on the other side?

rows.label: TownInfo525_1
rows.name:
Who left that busted-up trailer just beyond
Armory Alley? Let's at least reclaim the stuff
inside that thing so it can be moved later!

rows.label: TownInfo525_2
rows.name:
Containers and trailers with unclaimed
contents have been left to rot all over NLA.
...What's my point? Stop dumping them is my
point! Sheesh!

rows.label: TownInfo525_3
rows.name:
NLA survived, but the damage was extensive.
If we don't take measures to protect ourselves,
we might not be so lucky next time...

rows.label: TownInfo525_4
rows.name:
We need all available BLADEs down at the
restricted hangar NOW!

rows.label: TownInfo525_5
rows.name:
With all the mechanics working together,
we were able to fix the restricted hangar's
broken door almost immediately. I was truly
impressed with your efforts.

rows.label: TownInfo526_1
rows.name:
My Blue Blood was thrashed in an accident,
but a Ma-non technician was able to fix it
for me. I owe those little guys my life!

rows.label: TownInfo527_1
rows.name:
That woman who'd been talking to Fritz just
entered a back alley muttering under her
breath. I went over to see if she was okay,
and she transformed into some kind of alien!

rows.label: TownInfo701_1
rows.name:
That's the White Whale's Habitat unit there
to the east. If you keep proceeding along the
cliff top, you should be able to reach it
without much difficulty.

rows.label: TownInfo701_2
rows.name:
If you travel north through the Biahno
Grassland and then head west, you'll arrive
at the Green Threshold. You can reach
the continent of Nightglow Forest from there.

rows.label: TownInfo701_3
rows.name:
This area is relatively peaceful, but when night
falls, forfexes begin to appear near their
spawning grounds. They can be prickly,
so you'll want to give them a wide berth.

rows.label: TownInfo701_4
rows.name:
I found a weird insect mound near the Biahno
River. That place has some scary indigens, so
I don't really want to go back. ...But someone
should probably go check it out.

rows.label: TownInfo701_5
rows.name:
Meteor Valley is a pretty dangerous area.
If it hadn't been Elma leading the search,
I doubt we'd have found the last survivor.

rows.label: TownInfo702_1
rows.name:
If you fall off the cliff, don't panic. Just head
east until you reach the Habitat, and try not
to engage any powerful enemies on the way.

rows.label: TownInfo702_2
rows.name:
I spotted some debris from the White Whale
in the southern part of the Grieving Plains.
But I didn't have the skills to recover it
myself, so it's probably still there.

rows.label: TownInfo702_3
rows.name:
The giant herbivores known as lepyxes are
extremely gentle, but still strong enough to
send an entire team flying. So don't get
complacent around 'em.

rows.label: TownInfo702_4
rows.name:
Biahno Lake to the north is the habitat of a
gentle—but powerful—species known as the
millesaur. And trust me, you do NOT want
to accidentally pick a fight with those guys.

rows.label: TownInfo702_5
rows.name:
To reach Headwater Summit, you need to
go via Fallshorn Isle—which is to the north
of Biahno Lake. It's not an easy journey
by any measure.

rows.label: TownInfo703_1
rows.name:
NLA is to the northeast, but after you walk
along the shoreline here, you'll need to climb
uphill and circle around a bit.

rows.label: TownInfo703_2
rows.name:
Maintaining these camps is a challenge,
but without them, we'd never be able to
survey Mira like we have been.

rows.label: TownInfo703_3
rows.name:
Colonizing Mira is going to require more
than us just expanding FrontierNet.
Completing assignments for BLADE will no
doubt be a large part of it as well.

rows.label: TownInfo703_4
rows.name:
Say, you know Fallshorn Isle, right?
Well, that's saltat territory, and they'll attack
if you get anywhere near it. So unless you've
got urgent business there, I'd stay far away.

rows.label: TownInfo703_5
rows.name:
Out here, our intel doesn't always paint the
fullest picture, so it's a good idea to return to
the city occasionally and talk to people there.
You'll learn all sorts of important things.

rows.label: TownInfo704_1
rows.name:
The primordial creatures—or indigens, as we
BLADEs call them—in these parts are vicious.
It's a good idea not to engage them unless
you absolutely have to.

rows.label: TownInfo704_2
rows.name:
To reach Nightglow Forest, you have to cross the
Biahno Grassland to the north. You'll be in
for a pretty long walk if you don't ford the
Biahno River, so be careful out there.

rows.label: TownInfo704_3
rows.name:
We found a piece of White Whale wreckage
on the North Janpath Plain. I wonder if it's
been reclaimed yet?

rows.label: TownInfo704_4
rows.name:
I heard some Overeds can even control the
weather. What the heck are you supposed
to do when you run into one of those?

rows.label: TownInfo704_5
rows.name:
You know, there are augments that protect you
from the weather. If you had one of those,
you'd be in decent shape even if you
encountered a weather-controlling Overed.

rows.label: TownInfo705_1
rows.name:
BLADE has base camps set up throughout Mira
where you can rest up in a tent or trailer.
If you find one, kick off your boots and make
yourself at home—that's what they're there for!

rows.label: TownInfo705_2
rows.name:
Nelson's team continued east from here.
It's a long way away, but there is another
camp if you continue in that direction.
Maybe you could try asking after them there?

rows.label: TownInfo705_3
rows.name:
At night, I've seen what appears to be an
enemy mech flying around the summit of
Talon Rock. I sure hope that was my mind
playing tricks on me, but...I don't think it was.

rows.label: TownInfo705_4
rows.name:
To reach the neighboring continent of Valley of Oblivion,
proceed to the northeast of here. Oh, and the
environment there is entirely different from
what it's like here, so watch out for that.

rows.label: TownInfo705_5
rows.name:
Is your Doll still insured? If it is, you won't be
on the hook if it's destroyed. And despite how
precious they are, they get destroyed a LOT.

rows.label: TownInfo706_1
rows.name:
Did you come to install a data probe?
If you head a short distance to the north,
you should be able to see the spot. Be careful.

rows.label: TownInfo706_2
rows.name:
East of here is simius territory. They're smart
and highly aggressive, so be really careful.
Or you can avoid them entirely by looping to
the south and following the coast.

rows.label: TownInfo706_3
rows.name:
We haven't been able to officially confirm the
location of the Overed vesper, but we're pretty
sure it has a roost inside Talon Rock.

rows.label: TownInfo706_4
rows.name:
No matter how gentle millesaurs seem, they'll
fight back if attacked first. And man, are they
ever the wrong creatures to pick a fight with!
...Er, unless you're in a Doll, of course.

rows.label: TownInfo706_5
rows.name:
There's a pond to the north with a dome-like
covering that serves as an oasis for the
local indigens. Just be careful about going
there at night—that's when the duoguills visit.

rows.label: TownInfo707_1
rows.name:
Nelson's team set off to climb the mountain
that's just ahead, but I have no idea what
happened to them after that.

rows.label: TownInfo707_2
rows.name:
I never imagined we'd find intelligent life on
this planet! After not seeing any sign of it for
two months, it really caught us by surprise.

rows.label: TownInfo707_3
rows.name:
Head north to reach the continent of Valley of Oblivion.
Eventually you should start noticing wastelands
to the east—that's what you're looking for.

rows.label: TownInfo707_4
rows.name:
You know that small island west of NLA?
A helicopter crashed there, but everyone on
board made it back safely. They were lucky it
happened so close to home.

rows.label: TownInfo707_5
rows.name:
The Growth's power may be on the wane,
but as long as Mira is full of dangerous
indigens, we can't afford to relax. I pray
we all learn to coexist someday soon.

rows.label: TownInfo708_1
rows.name:
This camp has only just been established,
so the area around it hasn't been surveyed
at all.

rows.label: TownInfo708_2
rows.name:
I will continue to observe enemy movements
from here. It may be dangerous, but NLA
is nearby, and we can't ignore potential
threats to the city.

rows.label: TownInfo708_3
rows.name:
I saw an Overed millesaur strutting around the
West Janpath Plain like it owned the place.
They're typically a gentle species, but that
one seemed...different.

rows.label: TownInfo708_4
rows.name:
Those Growth bastards are using our own
weapons against us! Did they take them from
dead BLADEs? Or could they have infiltrated
NLA somehow?

rows.label: TownInfo708_5
rows.name:
Sounds like the Definians were the ones
stealing weapons from NLA and giving
them to the Growth. What a nightmare!

rows.label: TownInfo709_1
rows.name:
It looks like you can cross the rock bridge
south of here to get to the top of a giant
waterfall. I tried, but the enemies were too
strong—I had to retreat before long.

rows.label: TownInfo709_2
rows.name:
Biahno Hills is to the north, just before you
get to Unicorn Rock. There appear to be some
ruins there, but no one's really surveyed the
area yet.

rows.label: TownInfo709_3
rows.name:
We saw research data that suggests all of the
auravises in this area could be coming from a
single mating pair over at Unicorn Rock.
If we could just find those two...

rows.label: TownInfo709_4
rows.name:
It looks like you can cross the rock bridge
south of here to get to the top of a giant
waterfall. I tried, but the enemies were too
strong—I had to retreat before long.

rows.label: TownInfo709_5
rows.name:
Biahno Hills is to the north, just before you
get to Unicorn Rock. There appear to be some
ruins there, but no one's really surveyed the
area yet.

rows.label: TownInfo710_1
rows.name:
If you travel southeast and cut through the
Grieving Plains, you can reach the west gate
of the Habitat. Be careful—you'll face vicious
indigens if you stray from the path.

rows.label: TownInfo710_2
rows.name:
Follow the path west, cross the river,
and pass through the Green Threshold
to reach the continent of Nightglow Forest.

rows.label: TownInfo710_3
rows.name:
Cross two rock bridges to the northwest, and
you'll find yourself at the Growth's largest
fort. No idea why you'd go there, but if you
do, make sure you're armed to the teeth.

rows.label: TownInfo710_4
rows.name:
I felt terrible about having to abandon my
Doll south of Bedrock Hold, but if I hadn't,
there's no way I'd have survived.

rows.label: TownInfo710_5
rows.name:
There seems to be a particularly dangerous
Marnuck living over near Talon Rock.
The Growth's boss may be dead,
but this war isn't over yet.

rows.label: TownInfo711_1
rows.name:
You see that hazy landmass to the north?
It's not a short trip, but if you proceed along
the shallows from Northpointe Beach, you can
actually walk to it.

rows.label: TownInfo711_2
rows.name:
Take care when exploring the northern coast.
If you fall down, the only way back up is
through Northpointe Cove.

rows.label: TownInfo711_3
rows.name:
Sometimes, late at night, you can see flashes
of light traveling at high speeds above the
Bias fortress. I've never seen anything move
that fast, so be on your guard around there.

rows.label: TownInfo711_4
rows.name:
There are two caves in this area—one to the
north and one to the south. We should go
take a look and see if there's treasure inside!

rows.label: TownInfo711_5
rows.name:
Well, I guess our exploration of Primordia
is finished. Now we turn our attention to
expanding the city, fortifying the camps,
that sort of thing. Time marches on.

rows.label: TownInfo712_1
rows.name:
Are you sure you want to go out and explore
Mira dressed like that? If I were you, I'd go
into the city and pick up some better
equipment.

rows.label: TownInfo712_2
rows.name:
You're looking for Nelson? I haven't seen him
in these parts. There's another camp to the
south, though—maybe you should try asking
around over there?

rows.label: TownInfo712_3
rows.name:
If you proceed east and follow the thin path
along the cliffs, you'll reach a desolate
landmass of swirling sands known as Valley of Oblivion.
It's full of starving indigens, so be careful.

rows.label: TownInfo712_4
rows.name:
It seems a xiphias has found its way into
the shoals of Northpointe Cove. That's an
extremely abnormal occurrence, so we suspect
it might be an Overed.

rows.label: TownInfo712_5
rows.name:
There still seem to be a number of small
islands on Mira that FrontierNet hasn't been
able to detect. We'll have to go explore them
sooner or later.

rows.label: TownInfo713_1
rows.name:
If you're trying to enter the Habitat,
you'll need to circle around to the west since
the east gate is sealed at the moment.

rows.label: TownInfo713_2
rows.name:
Talon Rock seems to be composed of two
separate strata of rock. There are climbing
paths to the northwest and northeast,
but neither seem to go all the way to the top.

rows.label: TownInfo713_3
rows.name:
Have you found any schematics? If so,
you should donate them to one of the arms
manufacturers via the AM terminal in Armory
Alley. It's not like they're of any value to us.

rows.label: TownInfo713_4
rows.name:
Some debris from the White Whale fell over at
Sayram Lake and hasn't been recovered yet.
Sounds like it's a pretty tough job.

rows.label: TownInfo713_5
rows.name:
A dangerous Marnuck has taken up residence
near Talon Rock, but he's not like any you've
fought before, Those Growth bastards grow
deadly when their backs are against the wall.

rows.label: TownInfo714_1
rows.name:
Nelson's team hasn't come through this way.
I think they went off toward the east side of
NLA.

rows.label: TownInfo714_2
rows.name:
The road through the Grieving Plains to the
west of here will take you towards Nightglow Forest.
There's another camp in the Biahno Grassland
that you'll want to visit, too.

rows.label: TownInfo714_3
rows.name:
We found some alien wreckage north of
Sayram Lake. I wonder if they were wiped
out by indigens?

rows.label: TownInfo714_4
rows.name:
The Beasts' Lair is northeast of here.
Please watch out for it when you're exploring
in the area.

rows.label: TownInfo714_5
rows.name:
FrontierNet performed a scan of each of
Mira's continents just before the White Whale
crashed. So that's how we know the lay of the
land. But it hasn't helped us find the Lifepoint...

rows.label: TownInfo715_1
rows.name:
If you head east from here, you'll reach
Janpath Lake. Was that where Nelson's team
said they were headed?

rows.label: TownInfo715_2
rows.name:
Nelson's team was completely wiped out?
But...we promised each other that we'd get
lunch at the Sunshine Café the next time we
both had a day off...

rows.label: TownInfo715_3
rows.name:
If you're looking for a shortcut to Valley of Oblivion,
proceed through the small ravine to the north,
then cut through the North Janpath Plain.

rows.label: TownInfo715_4
rows.name:
You know those armored suids that have
been trained by the Bias? I bet the best and
strongest ones are kept at the Bias base.

rows.label: TownInfo715_5
rows.name:
If the weather on Mira changes drastically,
it can have a significant effect on our bodies.
When you sense danger, you may just want
to take refuge in a cave and wait it out.

rows.label: TownInfo716_1
rows.name:
The east gate of the Habitat is just ahead
but it's closed at the moment. You'll have to
circle around to the west gate.

rows.label: TownInfo716_2
rows.name:
I hear a piece of White Whale wreckage
landed in the northern part of the Silent Mire.
I just hope some dumb indigen hasn't torn it
apart already.

rows.label: TownInfo716_3
rows.name:
Just like Earth animals, some of Mira's
indigens are only active at night. If you don't
care to meet them, feel free to sleep through
the night in that trailer over there.

rows.label: TownInfo716_4
rows.name:
We won't be able to fully complete the survey
of Primordia without some means of flight.
It sure would be nice if Lin could complete that
flying Doll she's been working on.

rows.label: TownInfo716_5
rows.name:
The Doll flight module is an amazing piece of
technology. Now we can reach anywhere on
Mira and finish our survey at last!

rows.label: TownInfo721_1
rows.name:
You see that cave north of here? There are
some really tough indigens hiding out in there.
If you're heading north, I'd circle around to
the west and give the cave a pass.

rows.label: TownInfo721_2
rows.name:
Nightglow Forest is full of indigens that camouflage
themselves as natural objects like flowers and
rocks. They won't show up on your radar,
so proceed with caution.

rows.label: TownInfo721_3
rows.name:
There's an Overed in the Rustpool Banks.
I hear it's a scirpo, so it's one of those
spider-type things. I pray I never have to
see it for myself! I simply can't stand bugs.

rows.label: TownInfo721_4
rows.name:
Did you see the pair of simius roaming
together over that way? If you don't want to
fight them, you should try to pass behind so
they don't notice you.

rows.label: TownInfo721_5
rows.name:
Dilus-infested waters will sap your HP.
...Which only makes sense, right? I mean,
come on, they're diluses. Anyway, maybe just
try to travel on dry land whenever possible.

rows.label: TownInfo722_1
rows.name:
Besides the hovering lights, you sometimes see
fine blue particles floating in the air here.
I'd like to research exactly what they are.

rows.label: TownInfo722_2
rows.name:
Go west to reach the heart of the forest—
but watch out for the acidic bogs.
I know a few BLADEs who have seriously
hurt themselves in them.

rows.label: TownInfo722_3
rows.name:
Some Arms went farther into the forests to
test out a new weapon, but none of them have
returned. That's...probably not good, huh?

rows.label: TownInfo722_4
rows.name:
Depending on the area you're searching,
the collectibles you find may vary. Some can
only be found in caves, for example.

rows.label: TownInfo723_1
rows.name:
There's a xeno base to the west of here.
It isn't large, but it's guarded by skilled
warriors, so make sure you don't accidentally
wander too close.

rows.label: TownInfo723_2
rows.name:
They located a part of the Lifepoint in the
northern part of this continent? Well, we're in
the middle of our own assignment, so I'll leave
that to you.

rows.label: TownInfo723_3
rows.name:
That Lifepoint unit was destroyed?
The goddamned Growth! It's clear they have
no intentions of finding a peaceful resolution.

rows.label: TownInfo723_4
rows.name:
We found an alien container near the Rustpool
Banks, but no one could figure out how to get
it open. What a shame.

rows.label: TownInfo724_1
rows.name:
You can get past the mountain by traveling
through the cave here. I think it's a lot safer
than taking the western route.

rows.label: TownInfo724_2
rows.name:
A Nopon caravan has set up camp inside the
cave here. Seems like they intend to stick
around for a while.

rows.label: TownInfo724_3
rows.name:
I think the Dodonga Caravan is starting to
treat us like their personal security team.
They even got us to clear out all the blattas
for them!

rows.label: TownInfo724_4
rows.name:
I think the Dodonga Caravan is starting to
treat us like their personal messengers.
They just asked us to deliver a payment to
some Nopon named Tatsu.

rows.label: TownInfo724_5
rows.name:
I think the Dodonga Caravan is starting to
treat us like their personal security team.
They even got us to clear out all the turbas
for them!

rows.label: TownInfo725_1
rows.name:
There's a natural bridge just ahead, and
beyond that, the forest grows even more wild.
You'll have to keep a sharp eye out for
indigens as you travel through there.

rows.label: TownInfo725_2
rows.name:
There are Lifepoint readings coming from the
west of here. Here's hoping it's good news
when we find their source.

rows.label: TownInfo725_3
rows.name:
I didn't want to believe it, but when I saw the
smoke I felt a lump in my throat. I can't
believe they actually destroyed part of the
Lifepoint. This is devastating...

rows.label: TownInfo725_4
rows.name:
You see a lot of aprica around here in the
morning hours, but at night, it's the
levitath that come out. You need to be
on your guard around both of them.

rows.label: TownInfo725_5
rows.name:
Lately, the guys from the Dodonga Caravan
have started inviting us over for dinner.
The food tastes like it's made from bugs,
but it's still a lot of fun.

rows.label: TownInfo726_1
rows.name:
We were looking for saltats the other day
when a simius attacked us out of nowhere.
I thought I was a goner for sure—those things
are insanely territorial!

rows.label: TownInfo726_2
rows.name:
I wish I had a Doll license. If I was piloting a
Doll, I'd be able to deal with all sorts of
hazards that interfere with my duties as a
Landbanker.

rows.label: TownInfo726_3
rows.name:
I've heard there's a really ferocious dilus
in the northern part of Rust Lake. If that thing
gets its jaws around you, you're toast!
Er, unless you're in a Doll or something.

rows.label: TownInfo726_5
rows.name:
Maybe I should change Unions. I think I
might be a better fit in a different one,
you know? Plus it's good to try new things.

rows.label: TownInfo727_1
rows.name:
Doesn't it look like it would be possible to
climb to the top of this tree? I just can't figure
out where to start.

rows.label: TownInfo727_2
rows.name:
There's another base camp just north of here.
Why not cross through these woods and pay
it a visit? It's at a beautiful spot that's just
right for putting weary travelers at ease.

rows.label: TownInfo727_3
rows.name:
I found an unexplored territory past the
Canopied Nightwood, but before I could
enjoy it, a strong Overed camouflaged as a
boulder came at me. I beat it outta there!

rows.label: TownInfo727_4
rows.name:
You see a lot of Absop's swallowtails near
the Rustpool Banks. That light they emit at
the moment they die is strangely beautiful.

rows.label: TownInfo727_5
rows.name:
The survey of Nightglow Forest is complete, and my
job as a Pathfinder is done. I wonder what
Union I should transfer into next?

rows.label: TownInfo728_1
rows.name:
You'll see a lot of similar terrain in this forest,
so you have to work not to get lost. If you do
lose your bearings, head west—it's easier to
find your way walking along the cliffs.

rows.label: TownInfo728_2
rows.name:
If you decide to pick a fight with the scirpos
around here, pay attention to the foliage
overhead. There may be other camouflaged
ones waiting to drop down and join the fray.

rows.label: TownInfo728_3
rows.name:
An alien mech...? I heard accounts of people
seeing something like that in Dead Man's
Gulch, but that's quite a bit north of here.

rows.label: TownInfo728_4
rows.name:
FrontierNet sure comes in handy, huh? It's not
only great for gathering intel, but it can even
put cash in your pocket if you know what
you're doing.

rows.label: TownInfo728_5
rows.name:
You gotta be flexible when fighting out here—
that means switching to a new strategy without
missing a beat. There are some enemies that
can even shrug off certain debuffs.

rows.label: TownInfo729_1
rows.name:
The survey of the opposite shore is going
nowhere. There isn't even a camp over there.
What on Earth is impeding our progress?

rows.label: TownInfo729_2
rows.name:
The red scirpos are belligerent, so you wanna
watch out for them. But the blue scirpos won't
attack unless you attack them first.

rows.label: TownInfo729_3
rows.name:
This giant tree here? We call it the Skybound
Coil Tree. You can go right inside and climb
all the way up to the top—the view will blow
your mind!

rows.label: TownInfo729_4
rows.name:
Have you ever been to a place known as an
"unexplored territory"? They're apparently
pretty hard to find, but I'd love to be the
first person to discover one of them.

rows.label: TownInfo729_5
rows.name:
The survey of Nightglow Forest is complete. Good
work, and enjoy your well-deserved rest.
Of course, we'll be continuing to patrol the
area in order to keep NLA safe.

rows.label: TownInfo730_1
rows.name:
This is a great campsite. If this were Earth,
I'd pitch a tent and go hunting here on my
days off.

rows.label: TownInfo730_2
rows.name:
The alien mech was spotted farther north of
here. You need to cross through Qing Long
Glade to get there.

rows.label: TownInfo730_3
rows.name:
I'm with the Collepedians Union, so my primary
interest here is the resonating madonaters.
They're relics of an alien civilization,
but I think they could be put to practical use.

rows.label: TownInfo730_4
rows.name:
Did you know that all of the millesaurs go to
some unknown location at night? Maybe they
all return to the nest or something...

rows.label: TownInfo730_5
rows.name:
The boss of the Growth may have been
defeated, but his former loyalists are still out
there causing trouble. This war isn't over.
Not by a long shot.

rows.label: TownInfo731_1
rows.name:
Stay away from the high ground to the east.
We're in no shape to be facing off against the
indigens there.

rows.label: TownInfo731_2
rows.name:
You can get to the top of the waterfall by
circling around from its west side.
Diving from the top of those falls is my one
and only joy in this miserable life.

rows.label: TownInfo731_3
rows.name:
Be careful when traveling along Fukai Pass.
It appears to be insidia territory.
There's one of them in particular that's
unusually tough and tenacious.

rows.label: TownInfo731_4
rows.name:
You can get to the top of the waterfall by
circling around from its west side.
Diving from the top of those falls is my one
and only joy in this miserable life.

rows.label: TownInfo731_5
rows.name:
Stay away from the high ground to the east.
We're in no shape to be facing off against the
indigens there.

rows.label: TownInfo732_1
rows.name:
We've sighted hostile xenos in this area,
and the local indigens aren't much friendlier.
Watch yourself out there!

rows.label: TownInfo732_2
rows.name:
You're going to recover that mech? Then you
should travel north through the valley ahead.
I think that's the safest possible route.

rows.label: TownInfo732_3
rows.name:
Viragoes look like they're just lumbering
around at random, right? But I have a theory
about that—what if they're actually
safeguarding hidden treasures?

rows.label: TownInfo732_4
rows.name:
Viragoes look like they're just lumbering
around at random, right? But I have a theory
about that—what if they're actually
safeguarding hidden treasures?

rows.label: TownInfo732_5
rows.name:
When my mission ends, I want to return to
NLA and study the ecosystems of Mira.
I've always wanted to be a scholar.
...Or a figure skater. But mostly a scholar.

rows.label: TownInfo733_1
rows.name:
You know that waterfall you can see to the
north of here? What do you think that is
growing on top of it? They look like red tree
roots or something...

rows.label: TownInfo733_2
rows.name:
Sometimes I hear what sounds like an animal's
call coming from the top of the waterfall,
but it doesn't sound like any beast or bird
we know of. What could it be?

rows.label: TownInfo733_3
rows.name:
We discovered that a part of the White Whale
landed near the Ensconced Citadel. But how
on Earth are we supposed to recover it?!

rows.label: TownInfo733_4
rows.name:
Sometimes I hear what sounds like an animal's
call coming from the top of the waterfall,
but it doesn't sound like any beast or bird
we know of. What could it be?

rows.label: TownInfo733_5
rows.name:
That call coming from the top of the waterfall
sounds like it's changed a little bit.
Maybe whatever was making it has finally
come to accept us.

rows.label: TownInfo734_1
rows.name:
There are some xenos looking to build a fort
around here. I think it's the ones they call the
Bias? Not sure. Anyway, we'll have to keep
our heads on a swivel around them.

rows.label: TownInfo734_2
rows.name:
Some Growth thugs are trying to build a fort
near here. If you're headed to Dead Man's
Gulch, you'll have to suck it up and blast your
way through.

rows.label: TownInfo734_3
rows.name:
It sounds like the alien mech was recovered
successfully. Who'd ever have thought that our
Blue Bloods could accomplish so much?

rows.label: TownInfo734_4
rows.name:
Quos are noteworthy for the way they support
their allies. It's a good idea to take them out
fast, lest the battle spiral out of control.

rows.label: TownInfo734_5
rows.name:
The Growth's boss may have fallen, but it
doesn't seem to have demoralized his troops.
I figured those scoundrels wouldn't have any
sense of loyalty, yet still they fight on!

rows.label: TownInfo735_1
rows.name:
If you travel south from here and follow the
trail up the mountains, you'll reach a Growth
outpost called the Ensconced Citadel.
It's...staunchly defended. Let's leave it at that.

rows.label: TownInfo735_2
rows.name:
Just past here is the territory of indigens we
call "the tainted." You see where it's bare rock
without any vegetation? That's because they
eat damn near everything.

rows.label: TownInfo735_3
rows.name:
Dead Man's Gulch appears to be populated
by thalluses, so be warned: they are masters
of camouflage. Just keep your eyes open
and you should be all right.

rows.label: TownInfo735_4
rows.name:
I spotted a new Sylooth at the Silent Stream
that seemed to be in some sort of leadership
position. Damn you, Growth! Is there no end
to your military resources?!

rows.label: TownInfo735_5
rows.name:
How did this planet end up this way? Like,
the continent of Sylvalum is right past there,
but it could not be more different than this
place. It's like an entirely new ecosystem!

rows.label: TownInfo736_1
rows.name:
You know that big cave right beneath us?
I'd love to go explore it, but there are strange
xenos I've never seen before hanging around
the entrance.

rows.label: TownInfo736_2
rows.name:
If you follow the cliffs that are just past here,
you can pass through a cavern and into Dead
Man's Gulch. The path is pretty narrow, so
watch that you don't fall.

rows.label: TownInfo736_3
rows.name:
What the heck was that crazy creature I saw?!
It filled me with fear and awe at the same
time, but also... I don't know. There was more
to it than that. It's hard to describe.

rows.label: TownInfo736_4
rows.name:
The Ruler of Fates that lives in that giant red
tree seems to be the only being of its kind on
this planet. I wonder how it reproduces?

rows.label: TownInfo736_5
rows.name:
When I went to the heart of the Vitriol
Cesspool, I encountered a strange chimerical
lifeform. The thing was insanely powerful,
so I ran for the exit like my ass was on fire!

rows.label: TownInfo741_1
rows.name:
By and large, the BLADEs stationed in this
region were raised in America, so most of its
areas have been given American-style names.
U-S-A! U-S-A! U-S... Sorry. I'll stop now.

rows.label: TownInfo741_2
rows.name:
When you reach the edge of the crevasse,
turn left toward the greener side and cross
over the Twin Arches. At that point, you
should be able to see the next camp.

rows.label: TownInfo741_3
rows.name:
I saw a massive flying object that seemed like
it was being pursued by the Growth.
I have absolutely no idea what happened to it
or where it went, though.

rows.label: TownInfo741_4
rows.name:
Lots of creatures in this region mimic rocks
and boulders, so don't make the mistake of
assuming it's safe to lean on them. I've fallen
for that trick before, and it is NOT fun!

rows.label: TownInfo741_5
rows.name:
The monoceroses in this area are gentle and
herbivorous, but if you make 'em angry, the
bastards will kick you square in the head.
And that does NOT feel good, let me tell you.

rows.label: TownInfo742_1
rows.name:
One of the main geographical features here
in Valley of Oblivion is a huge crevasse we call the
Giant Crack. And believe you me, if you
fall into that thing, you are NOT coming out.

rows.label: TownInfo742_2
rows.name:
The numerous giant rings and mysterious ruins
in Valley of Oblivion are believed to have been made in
ancient times. I can't wait to investigate them
further!

rows.label: TownInfo742_3
rows.name:
There's a large suid sow that naps right in the
middle of the road near here. I don't think you
want to mess with her if you can avoid it, so
don't wake mommy, okay?

rows.label: TownInfo742_4
rows.name:
So you've seen how Valley of Oblivion's dotted with
all these giant rings and mysterious ruins
that were built in the ancient past? Well,
our research into them is going nowhere.

rows.label: TownInfo742_5
rows.name:
Auravises seem to occasionally mistake
treasure for food and bring it back to their
nests. If only trying to get our hands on those
treasures wasn't so darn dangerous!

rows.label: TownInfo743_1
rows.name:
If you travel southeast of here along the river,
you'll reach the River Isle base camp.
Gotta be a nicer gig than this bone-dry
hellhole...

rows.label: TownInfo743_2
rows.name:
The western side of Valley of Oblivion is the so-called
crevasse area, which is split in two by that
giant canyon. The east side is the mountainous
area, and beyond that is the lakes area.

rows.label: TownInfo743_3
rows.name:
I discovered some White Whale wreckage
here in the Torhogne Plain, but my skills weren't
sufficient to do a proper analysis.

rows.label: TownInfo743_4
rows.name:
Sabulas never seem to notice people on higher
ground. If you're able to exploit that blind
spot, you can reach the northern coast without
ever having to fight them.

rows.label: TownInfo743_5
rows.name:
The ferocious vigents that inhabit this area
return to their nests at night. That's your
chance to move around freely.

rows.label: TownInfo744_1
rows.name:
If you travel north from here, you'll reach the
coast. There's that waterfall's basin to the east,
and if you head south, you'll find the Cliffside
Camp.

rows.label: TownInfo744_2
rows.name:
The best way to reach the mountainous area
is from the trail that starts near the base of
the largest ring. You can get more detailed
information at the camp southeast of here.

rows.label: TownInfo744_3
rows.name:
What could be on that floating island to the
east? Is it a nightmare land full of deadly
monsters? Or a dreamland full of splendid
treasures! ...Or both. Could be both, I guess.

rows.label: TownInfo744_4
rows.name:
What could be on that floating island to the
east? If only I had a Doll flight module,
I could go up there and see for myself.

rows.label: TownInfo745_1
rows.name:
If you take that bridge across the crevasse to
Mesa Fortress, you'll be trapped like hogs in
a barn. There has to be a less obvious way
to infiltrate it...

rows.label: TownInfo745_2
rows.name:
We saw an incredible amount of anti-aircraft
fire coming from the Growth base. But it
doesn't seem to have even nicked the paint
on that unidentified ship they were firing at.

rows.label: TownInfo745_3
rows.name:
We found wreckage from an alien civilization
at the southern side of the Giant Crack,
but none of us were up for the task of
recovering anything from it.

rows.label: TownInfo745_4
rows.name:
Have you seen those giant millepods?
Those things can bring down whole mountains
when they get angry. Even the Growth don't
seem to know what to do about them.

rows.label: TownInfo745_5
rows.name:
There's an auravis nest at the top of the fallen
ring, but there are also a lot of dangerous
indigens that target that nest lurking around it.
Take care if you're gonna make a play for it.

rows.label: TownInfo746_1
rows.name:
There's a natural formation that looks like an
anthill near here, but hostile xenos have been
making it hard to get a good look.

rows.label: TownInfo746_2
rows.name:
If you look closely at the terrain around Mesa
Fortress, you'll notice it's basically divided into
two tiers. Looks like it would be a lot easier
to approach it from the upper one...

rows.label: TownInfo746_3
rows.name:
They may have found part of the Lifepoint out
here in Valley of Oblivion? Let's pray it's the Core this
time!

rows.label: TownInfo746_4
rows.name:
So the Lifepoint unit in Valley of Oblivion wasn't the Core
after all... I just hope we secure that Core
before the Growth find it. Because if they do,
it's good-bye for all of us.

rows.label: TownInfo746_5
rows.name:
Those Growth jerks have unleashed some
Bias madman who's as tough as he is crazy!
...Please don't let him come this way.
Please oh please oh please oh pleeeeeease.

rows.label: TownInfo747_1
rows.name:
That waterfall to the northeast is King's Falls.
If you approach it by traveling upstream along
the river, you'll only be able to reach the basin
at its bottom. That way doesn't lead to its top.

rows.label: TownInfo747_2
rows.name:
A Growth Doll paid a visit to the ancient
ruins atop the butte west of here. It seemed to
be searching for something...

rows.label: TownInfo747_3
rows.name:
The indigens that live atop the cliffs to the
east seem especially tough. So if you're
heading that way, please be careful.

rows.label: TownInfo747_4
rows.name:
Nopon come down from the north sometimes
to peddle their wares here, and I always end
up buying junk I don't need. Last time, I spent
my pay on a pair of remote-controlled socks!

rows.label: TownInfo747_5
rows.name:
We may have secured the Central Life, but
that's no guarantee that we'll be able to live
safely here on Mira. Our work has only just
begun.

rows.label: TownInfo748_1
rows.name:
Doesn't it look like there's a small terrace-like
structure off to the side of King's Falls?
Think it could be a part of some old ruins?

rows.label: TownInfo748_2
rows.name:
To get upstream from the falls, you'd need
to traverse the mountains—but that area has
barely been explored at all. I'd move pretty
darn carefully if I were going there.

rows.label: TownInfo748_3
rows.name:
I've seen some saltats acting really weird near
King's Falls—like they're making some sort of
offering to the water. It's interesting, but also
a little bit creepy, you know?

rows.label: TownInfo748_4
rows.name:
It looks like there's a small terrace-like
structure off to the side of King's Falls.
Think it could be a part of some old ruins?
Or perhaps the Growth built it?

rows.label: TownInfo748_5
rows.name:
From here we can keep an eye on those
Larsians. They may be our allies now,
but they used to be part of the Growth,
so I don't trust 'em as far as I can throw 'em!

rows.label: TownInfo749_1
rows.name:
If you're heading to the mountainous area,
first continue on to the Balance Rock base
camp. From there, proceed along the northeast
trail through the mountains.

rows.label: TownInfo749_2
rows.name:
The desert here is so vast that there are even
indigens living beneath the sand. They'll attack
out of nowhere, so keep your wits about you.

rows.label: TownInfo749_3
rows.name:
That grex lurking in the rocky areas of the
Keegan Ridge is unobtrusive, but I bet
good money it's a hardened veteran.

rows.label: TownInfo749_4
rows.name:
The shade cast by the giant ring sure is a
lifesaver, huh? Makes me understand why the
Bias are so fond of camping down there.

rows.label: TownInfo749_5
rows.name:
Hard to believe that alien races capable
of building such huge structures could be
completely eradicated like that. Makes
you worry about us puny humans, eh?

rows.label: TownInfo750_1
rows.name:
Who do you think built that giant ring?
Oh, and when? And why? Also how?
I have so many questions!

rows.label: TownInfo750_2
rows.name:
This base camp is located in almost the dead
center of Valley of Oblivion. It's quite close to both
Broken Hill to the north and Balance Rock to
the southwest.

rows.label: TownInfo750_3
rows.name:
Irina and Gwin's team traveled here from
the southeast and continued into the
mountainous area. I hope they find that piece
of the Lifepoint and come back out alive.

rows.label: TownInfo750_4
rows.name:
That piece of the Lifepoint was destroyed by
the Growth? Damn them! That's another part
of humanity's history lost forever.

rows.label: TownInfo750_5
rows.name:
The Growth have been destroying the pieces
of the Lifepoint that were scattered all over the
planet. But at least we managed to protect the
most important part. Point, humanity! Ha ha!

rows.label: TownInfo751_1
rows.name:
You can reach the mountainous area by
following the trail northeast from here. I've
seen some really odd indigens out that way,
but it could have just been my imagination.

rows.label: TownInfo751_2
rows.name:
If you travel south from here, you'll arrive at
South Coast. The indigens there are tough,
so make sure your gear is up to the task.

rows.label: TownInfo751_3
rows.name:
The Sylooth that strut around the center of
the Ibra Ravine have strange plants growing
from their heads that seem to be highly prized
by the surrounding indigens.

rows.label: TownInfo751_4
rows.name:
You can reach the mountainous area by
following the trail northeast from here. I've
seen some really odd indigens out that way,
but it could have just been my imagination.

rows.label: TownInfo751_5
rows.name:
The adsecula swarms that hover around the
Sylooth are in fact vying for extract from that
rare plant that grows on those xenoforms'
heads. Fascinating! ...And also gross.

rows.label: TownInfo752_1
rows.name:
There's a base held by hostile xenos in the
heart of the mountains. It may well be the
largest and best-defended of all the enemy
positions in this area.

rows.label: TownInfo752_2
rows.name:
We've discovered a number of routes through
the Ibra Ravine to the northeast. The central
route is home to many vicious indigens, so I'd
stick with the west or east routes if I were you.

rows.label: TownInfo752_3
rows.name:
If you cross through the Ibra Ravine to the
northeast and then head north, you'll find a
huge lake. That's where the Nopon's Dorian
Caravan has set up camp.

rows.label: TownInfo752_4
rows.name:
Are you collecting myuena cacti?
You won't find any around here, but they're
pretty easy to gather near Big Arch.

rows.label: TownInfo752_5
rows.name:
Dadaan, the self-proclaimed world's strongest
Bias, attacked me near the oasis, and you
better believe I ran like hell! We have GOT
to do something about that psycho.

rows.label: TownInfo753_1
rows.name:
That cliff-top fort that's visible to the southwest
seems to be quite a large-scale operation.
We've seen scores of Bias around it, but
haven't been able to locate the entrance yet.

rows.label: TownInfo753_2
rows.name:
The power of the Growth is truly terrifying.
I can't believe they were able to build that
fortress to the southwest in the brief time since
we landed on this planet.

rows.label: TownInfo753_3
rows.name:
You know how electromagnetic storms tend to
knock all our sensors out of commission?
That's got to be true for the Growth as well,
right? There must be some way to use that...

rows.label: TownInfo753_4
rows.name:
The vigents that live on the Torhogne Plain
are extremely vicious. Oh, and hungry. So I'd
avoid making eye contact unless you feel like
being torn limb-from-limb.

rows.label: TownInfo753_5
rows.name:
The survey of Valley of Oblivion is complete, and it's
about damn time! I've got sand in places that
I didn't even know were places! ...I'm going
back to NLA and showering for a month.

rows.label: TownInfo754_1
rows.name:
The indigens in this area are pretty daunting.
If you're ever worried, remember that there's
no shame in retreating and living to fight
another day.

rows.label: TownInfo754_2
rows.name:
Irina's team hasn't been down this way.
And isn't the piece of the Lifepoint they're after
in the mountainous area to the east?

rows.label: TownInfo754_3
rows.name:
Is that Doll wreckage still in the southern part
of South Coast? If that guy had stuck to doing
business in NLA, he'd probably still be
alive today. Such a shame!

rows.label: TownInfo754_4
rows.name:
I've seen giant monsters coming into and out
of the bottom of that crevasse nearby, and I
am not even kidding. They're huge!

rows.label: TownInfo754_5
rows.name:
If we had a Doll flight module, we could
actually survey the crevasse. There are places
within there that no human has ever laid eyes
on, you know? Anything could be down there!

rows.label: TownInfo755_1
rows.name:
On clear days, you can see a mysterious
continent across the sea from here. I wonder if
the BLADEs who were dispatched there are
doing okay?

rows.label: TownInfo755_2
rows.name:
Occasionally I get the sense that there's a
huge, scary...something crawling around on
top of the giant ring to the south.

rows.label: TownInfo755_3
rows.name:
The wrecked Doll on North Coast? Yeah, that
belonged to me. Took a pounding on my very
first mission out here and barely managed to
escape with my life.

rows.label: TownInfo755_4
rows.name:
I saw a millesaur that had lost its whole fake
neck and head, leaving only a stump above its
actual head. In that sorry state, maybe it just
wants a good place to lay down and die...

rows.label: TownInfo755_5
rows.name:
The survey of Valley of Oblivion is complete, but the local
indigens are still a serious threat—so don't get
overconfident out there.

rows.label: TownInfo756_1
rows.name:
There are a number of ways to get to the top
of Big Arch. There's a mountain path that
starts along the coast west of here, and a path
on the other side of the mountains too, I think.

rows.label: TownInfo756_2
rows.name:
If you're trying to cross over to the northern
continent, you'd best take a Doll. If I could
get my license, I'd buy one and travel safe,
but...that doesn't seem to be happening.

rows.label: TownInfo756_3
rows.name:
An Overed named Edgardo, the Carefree prowls
the North Coast. I doubt he'll be much
of an obstacle if you travel by Doll, but I'd
look out for him all the same.

rows.label: TownInfo756_4
rows.name:
Whenever a heat wave occurs, watch out!
Your melee combat ability will drop
dramatically, so you should switch to
ranged attack tactics.

rows.label: TownInfo756_5
rows.name:
This is a lovely area, but I'd like to visit
Sylvalum and go inside that giant sphere.
I'm sure it's dangerous, but the prospect
always gets my heart pumping!

rows.label: TownInfo761_1
rows.name:
This is Sylvalum. Er, the scale of this place
is a bit bigger than you might be used to,
so brace yourself for that.

rows.label: TownInfo761_2
rows.name:
Beyond Sylvalum lies the continent of Cauldros.
There are inland routes to Cauldros, but
swimming there along the coast isn't as crazy
of an idea as it may sound.
