rows.label: TownInfo761_3
rows.name:
Did you see that big petrified tree nearby?
I'd love to survey that, but it's beyond my
physical capabilities. I'll just have to ask the
Testamenters to do it. *sigh*

rows.label: TownInfo761_4
rows.name:
Lao's team passed through here quite some
time ago. Said they had a lead on a piece of
the Lifepoint and it sounded really promising.

rows.label: TownInfo761_5
rows.name:
You can harvest mizaria celery at the west
side of Lake Ciel. We get a lot of requests
for it from BLADE HQ, so you'll want to keep
that in mind.

rows.label: TownInfo762_1
rows.name:
Sylvalum is a significantly more dangerous
region than Primordia. It's best to utilize
FrontierNet's mapping functions and plot
your movements carefully.

rows.label: TownInfo762_2
rows.name:
The entrance to this continent is guarded by
rather powerful mechanoids. But they do
go on periodic patrols around the area,
which provides an opening.

rows.label: TownInfo762_3
rows.name:
There are caves in the cliffs east of here,
but we haven't quite figured out how to reach
them. I'm not even sure it's possible if you
have a Doll.

rows.label: TownInfo762_4
rows.name:
If you had a Doll capable of flight, you could
maybe enter those caves in the eastern cliffs?
No one's ever explored them before, so I'm
super pumped to hear what's inside.

rows.label: TownInfo763_1
rows.name:
Hostile xenos have a base southeast of here.
We call it Hilal Stronghold.

rows.label: TownInfo763_2
rows.name:
I can't stop staring at the noctilucent sphere
floating in the western sky. It's so bizarre,
and yet so strangely beautiful...

rows.label: TownInfo763_3
rows.name:
The massive indigens east of Lake Ciel seem
to grow violent when crimson auroras occur.
It's important to pay attention to how the
weather affects such primordial creatures.

rows.label: TownInfo763_4
rows.name:
You know the noctilucent sphere to the west?
If you had a Doll that was capable of flight, I
wonder if you could enter that sphere through
those tunnels where the water drains out of it?

rows.label: TownInfo763_5
rows.name:
The giant mechs that the Growth deploy
don't ever seem to react to our presence
while we're on foot. They only respond to
more serious threats, like Dolls.

rows.label: TownInfo764_1
rows.name:
Seems like it would be safer to circle north
around the Lake Ciel area than it would be
to cross it directly.

rows.label: TownInfo764_2
rows.name:
Lao seemed to be seriously wounded when he
returned from the north. I hope everything
turned out okay...

rows.label: TownInfo764_3
rows.name:
The Larsians prove that the Growth's
membership is less tight-knit than we realized.
There's got to be some way to get them to
forge an alliance with us.

rows.label: TownInfo764_4
rows.name:
A Larsian saved my life earlier.
They may seem like a bunch of angry thugs,
but they're actually quite honorable.

rows.label: TownInfo765_1
rows.name:
If you're heading north from here, you can
shorten your trip by cutting through the cave
that's just ahead.

rows.label: TownInfo765_2
rows.name:
The group exploring the landmass beyond
Sylvalum are an impressive bunch. They mostly
hail from Russia, Africa, and the Middle East.

rows.label: TownInfo765_3
rows.name:
There's a large pack of indigens in the vicinity
of the Shivering Sands. We suspect the
monoceros that leads them is an Overed.

rows.label: TownInfo765_4
rows.name:
If you look up at Sandsprint Slope, you'll
notice a cave opening. I wish I had a flying
Doll so I could explore it.

rows.label: TownInfo765_5
rows.name:
When the weather changes to spore clouds,
watch out! The spores hang over Sylvalum
like a heavy mist, and it's thick enough to
obstruct your vision.

rows.label: TownInfo766_1
rows.name:
If you travel up east from here, you'll find a
small plateau with an oasis that's prettier
than Lake Ciel.

rows.label: TownInfo766_2
rows.name:
It looked like a Pathfinder fought someone at 
the top of this hill, but only one of them made
it back down. I sure hope it was ours...

rows.label: TownInfo766_3
rows.name:
Once you cross Sandsprint Slope to the
north, watch that you don't stray too west.
Badr Stronghold is over that way, and the
whole area is under the Growth's control.

rows.label: TownInfo766_4
rows.name:
There's a reliquary from an alien civilization at
the South Ciel Sandsea, but it doesn't look
like it has anything to do with the Growth.
What sort of beings used to live there?

rows.label: TownInfo766_5
rows.name:
I'd love to try climbing that tall mountain north
of here, but I don't even think it would be
possible without a flying Doll.

rows.label: TownInfo767_1
rows.name:
If you're trying to reach the summit of the
northern Delusian Mountain, the trek starts
at the trail ahead. There's a camp up there
too, so be sure to drop by!

rows.label: TownInfo767_2
rows.name:
There's a subspecies of ovis that lives on the
trails up the Delusian Mountains. The little
pom-poms on their tails always light up at
night—it's really adorable.

rows.label: TownInfo767_3
rows.name:
I discovered an alien container in North
Hardheart Canyon. If we could recover it
and analyze its contents, I bet it could be
of some use to humanity.

rows.label: TownInfo767_4
rows.name:
There are these repulsive humanoid creatures
living in Hardheart Canyon. Everyone says I
just imagined seeing them, but that's not true.
I know they're real! I KNOW it!

rows.label: TownInfo767_5
rows.name:
They've discovered thunderbolt emblems on
the Sylvalum Searoad, so I was ordered to
go gather them. ...I am getting REAL tired
of being sent to dangerous locations.

rows.label: TownInfo768_1
rows.name:
If you travel north from here, you'll reach the
entrance to the continent of Cauldros. Intel
suggests that the area is swarming with hostile
xenos, so if you head that way, be on guard.

rows.label: TownInfo768_2
rows.name:
You're here to repair that data probe?
...Huh? Well, the team at the summit camp
did mention that they'd sent for help, so...
Anyway, yeah. Just follow this trail right to it.

rows.label: TownInfo768_3
rows.name:
According to FrontierNet's scans, there seems
to be wreckage from an alien civilization in
the northwestern part of this area. But I doubt
my team is equipped to recover it.

rows.label: TownInfo768_4
rows.name:
I think I've seen that giant craft before.
It might be the one that brought down the
White Whale!

rows.label: TownInfo768_5
rows.name:
Our war with the Growth may be over,
but as long as there are stragglers to keep in
check, this camp needs to be garrisoned.

rows.label: TownInfo769_1
rows.name:
We discovered a large, odd-looking petrified
tree on the Northern Searoad, but couldn't
get close enough to survey it properly.

rows.label: TownInfo769_2
rows.name:
The Delusian Mountains consist of a rocky
peak to the south and another to the north.
If you want to reach the southern one, you
should cross the natural rock bridge ahead.

rows.label: TownInfo769_3
rows.name:
You came to fix the data probe? That's the
best news I've heard all day! We just didn't
have enough supplies to do it ourselves.

rows.label: TownInfo769_4
rows.name:
Great work downing that giant death machine!
On behalf of all us worthless BLADEs who
weren't able to help, I thank you.

rows.label: TownInfo769_5
rows.name:
Wow, you destroyed the Growth AND
secured the Central Life?! You may be
the greatest human who ever LIVED!

rows.label: TownInfo770_1
rows.name:
You can get a pretty clear view of Cauldros
from here. It sure looks like a harsher land
than Sylvalum—surveying it must be an awful
lot of work.

rows.label: TownInfo770_2
rows.name:
There's one more mountain past here in an
unexplored area, and we can hear roars
from there that actually shake the earth!
It's...really unnerving.

rows.label: TownInfo770_3
rows.name:
There's one cave in the northern Delusian
Mountain, and another in the southern
Delusian Mountain. But no efforts have
been made to explore them yet.

rows.label: TownInfo770_4
rows.name:
You know that alien wreckage in the southern
part of the Silent Sandsea? Well, it seems
those sluggards in the lower base camp still
haven't gotten around to salvaging it.

rows.label: TownInfo770_5
rows.name:
When the air fills with spores, dangerous
creatures come to this area. We weren't
confident that we could beat them, so we
decided to hide in our tents until they passed.

rows.label: TownInfo771_1
rows.name:
Don't you wonder what it's like inside the
noctilucent sphere? There's so much that we
could learn if only we had Doll flight
modules.

rows.label: TownInfo771_2
rows.name:
West of here is Badr Basin, and just beyond
that is Badr Stronghold—which serves as
a base for hostile xenos.

rows.label: TownInfo771_3
rows.name:
There are enemies who hide like land mines in
the sandy soil around here. So even when an
area seems empty, you'll want to pay careful
attention to your surroundings.

rows.label: TownInfo771_4
rows.name:
I spotted a petramand near Samuel Incline that
looked like it had been captured by the
Growth. Time to gear up and take it out!

rows.label: TownInfo771_5
rows.name:
I often see beaporges near the West
Cinderdunes. They're so incredibly cute,
I just want to take one home as a pet!
...That would be okay, right?

rows.label: TownInfo772_1
rows.name:
To reach the peaks of the two mountains that
tower over Sylvalum, take the trail that goes
east from here. Or if you have flight
capabilities... Well, never mind.

rows.label: TownInfo772_2
rows.name:
We found a cave near the base of that giant
arch that you can see north of here.
No one's gone inside it yet—I think we need
to be better prepared for that.

rows.label: TownInfo772_3
rows.name:
There are also small Growth camps around
the perimeter of Badr Stronghold. If we were
to steal the supplies from those camps, that'd
be quite a poke in the eye for those jerks!

rows.label: TownInfo772_4
rows.name:
That giant Growth death machine...
My legs were shaking so hard I couldn't even
fight. If I had a Doll, I'd have been right there
with you...

rows.label: TownInfo772_5
rows.name:
Some indigens only appear when the air is
thick with spores, while others vanish when
spore clouds appear. If you want to vanish
yourself, your best bet is to rest in a tent.

rows.label: TownInfo773_1
rows.name:
If you continue north from here, you'll arrive at
a place known as Cauldros Threshold.
Pass through that, and you're in Cauldros.

rows.label: TownInfo773_2
rows.name:
You know who came up with the name
"Silent Sandsea"? That was all me, baby!
Yeah, I got a good ear for that sort of thing.

rows.label: TownInfo773_3
rows.name:
I wrecked my Doll near Hilal Stronghold. Let
myself get distracted for just an instant, but
that's all the time it took. She was the best
partner I ever had... *sniff*

rows.label: TownInfo773_4
rows.name:
When night falls in these parts, vicious
indigens from Cauldros come wandering over.
And that's when the local indigens make
themselves scarce.

rows.label: TownInfo773_5
rows.name:
When night falls in these parts, vicious
indigens from Cauldros come wandering over.
And that's when the local indigens make
themselves scarce.

rows.label: TownInfo774_1
rows.name:
Are you going to visit the Delusian Mountains
to the southwest of here? There's a cave
in the foothills that's apparently being used
as a caro den, so tread lightly.

rows.label: TownInfo774_2
rows.name:
You can't climb the Delusian Mountains
from here. If that's where you're headed,
make your way to our other camp first—
it's just a little ways to the south.

rows.label: TownInfo774_3
rows.name:
There's a big petrified tree near the Anvil
Sandplain that's listed as a survey target, but
it's such a dangerous area that we haven't
been able to get close. Feel free to try...

rows.label: TownInfo774_4
rows.name:
This can be a scary place, but when I watch
some indigen drinking from a stream with her
baby, it really calms my nerves. ...As does all
the candy I bring from NLA.

rows.label: TownInfo774_5
rows.name:
The survey of this region is basically complete,
but we're only gonna start working harder.
We owe it to all the good folk we left behind
on Earth!

rows.label: TownInfo775_1
rows.name:
If you're heading west, make sure you're well
prepared. Lots of hostile xenos that way, and
the indigens are even worse. Remember that
no alien wreckage is worth your life to find!

rows.label: TownInfo775_2
rows.name:
We've done an incalculable amount of
damage to the Growth by destroying their
giant death machine. ...Okay, maybe it's
TECHNICALLY calculable. But whatever!

rows.label: TownInfo775_3
rows.name:
A black Doll passed by here on its way to
Cauldros. I think it was headed straight
toward the Growth headquarters.

rows.label: TownInfo775_4
rows.name:
So we finally found our way to the Lifepoint.
You have to reclaim it for us—
we want our real bodies back!

rows.label: TownInfo775_5
rows.name:
So the Central Life is finally secure?
I wonder when we'll be able to get back to
our real bodies. I have so many friends whose
Blue Bloods have been...lost.

rows.label: TownInfo776_1
rows.name:
Have you had a chance to stop in at the
Nopon's Dopang Caravan? It's a fair distance
from here, at the oasis to the south.

rows.label: TownInfo776_2
rows.name:
Head north to end up in Cauldros—which is
where the Growth's HQ is located. Wish we
could go see what they're doing up there,
but our mission is guarding this post.

rows.label: TownInfo776_3
rows.name:
Cauldros is a much harsher continent than this
one. There are lots of Growth forts there as
well, so flying at high elevations is especially
dangerous.

rows.label: TownInfo776_4
rows.name:
Have you seen the helicopter wreckage in the
Needle Rock Sandsea? It was shot down by
the Hilal Stronghold. One of these days, we're
going to have to go and recover what's left.

rows.label: TownInfo776_5
rows.name:
There's a cave to the west where ferocious
indigens congregate. They've even been seen
chasing Growth troops out of the area,
which gives me a perverse sense of joy.

rows.label: TownInfo781_1
rows.name:
A lot of the area names within Cauldros are
weird and tricky to remember, right? That's
because they were named by analyzing relics
of past civilizations.

rows.label: TownInfo781_2
rows.name:
The Nopon Drongo Caravan is at the bottom
of this slope. They do business with the
Growth too, but don't worry—that doesn't
stop them from welcoming human customers.

rows.label: TownInfo781_3
rows.name:
The Scholes Battlegrounds are home to a
caro who is an exceptional hunter. It lunges
from the shadows of rocks like a loosed arrow
from the bow.

rows.label: TownInfo781_4
rows.name:
Some carnivores become more active at night.
And the ones you see sleeping during the
day start moving around too, so be careful.

rows.label: TownInfo781_5
rows.name:
Those thick pillars floating in the air around
here seem to be some sort of mining
machines. They appear to predate the
Growth's arrival on this planet.

rows.label: TownInfo782_1
rows.name:
The skies above Cauldros are constantly being
patrolled by large warships. Attempting to
proceed by air would put you in constant
danger.

rows.label: TownInfo782_2
rows.name:
Have you noticed the strange structure floating
in the northeast of FN site 501 on the segment
map? Readings suggest there's treasure inside,
but how are we supposed to retrieve it?

rows.label: TownInfo782_3
rows.name:
We were able to verify that the Doll Lao stole
landed at old O'rrh Sim Castle. I can't believe
that he intends to betray humanity!

rows.label: TownInfo782_4
rows.name:
Where could the Central Life be? The damn
Growth have taken every possible precaution
to ensure we can't track them back to it.

rows.label: TownInfo782_5
rows.name:
It's been a long and treacherous road, but we
finally secured the Central Life, and that's
what matters. I have hope that we'll be able to
make a decent life for ourselves here on Mira.

rows.label: TownInfo783_1
rows.name:
The east is extremely dangerous—don't even
THINK of going that way with inadequate
gear and supplies. ...And if you DO go there,
don't come crying to me when you die.

rows.label: TownInfo783_2
rows.name:
There are remains of a Doll from an alien
civilization on the Emerian Battlegrounds.
I guess even they had their hands full
protecting themselves from the local indigens.

rows.label: TownInfo783_3
rows.name:
The black Doll went inside the O'rrh Sim
castle ruins. If you're trying to pursue it by
land, follow the road that extends to the east.

rows.label: TownInfo783_4
rows.name:
The Growth's ships went to the east.
Could that be the direction of the Lifepoint?
Or is it just a feint?

rows.label: TownInfo783_5
rows.name:
You may have defeated the Growth's boss,
but plenty of his loyal flunkies are still out for
blood. Don't lower your guard!

rows.label: TownInfo784_1
rows.name:
Those mining machines that float in the skies
above here still seem to be at least partially
functional. We've confirmed that enemy xenos
have been using them for transportation.

rows.label: TownInfo784_2
rows.name:
How did you manage to get here? Did you
take the sea route from the west? Or did you
follow along the coast from the east? Or did
you come from Sylvalum?

rows.label: TownInfo784_3
rows.name:
If you head south and cross the sea, you'll see
an island that flying creatures use as a roost.
But since we lack flight capabilities, I doubt we
could put up much of a fight against them.

rows.label: TownInfo784_4
rows.name:
We saw multiple Larsian Dolls head to
the O'rrh Sim castle ruins. My team tried to
ascertain how the battle was going, but it's
too difficult to tell what's happening inside.

rows.label: TownInfo784_5
rows.name:
I'm heartened to hear that the Larsians have
allied with us. When they were our enemy,
I had grave doubts about whether we would
be capable of defeating the Growth.

rows.label: TownInfo785_1
rows.name:
We're on the front lines here, so the enemy's
attacks are particularly relentless. Please take
every possible caution when exploring.

rows.label: TownInfo785_2
rows.name:
If you proceed to the north, you'll reach
Dragonbone Promontory. From there you'll
have a good view of Great Reef Lake,
which sits at the very center of Cauldros.

rows.label: TownInfo785_3
rows.name:
I saw an elderly Gularth in front of Sunset
Falls, just staring intently at the tumbling
magma. Maybe it likes the solitude?

rows.label: TownInfo785_4
rows.name:
There's an area south of here known as
Tengu's Playground. Have you been there yet?

rows.label: TownInfo785_5
rows.name:
Electromagnetic storms create all sorts of odd
effects. For example, they get those mining
machines crackling with electricity, which
causes rare indigens to gather around them.

rows.label: TownInfo786_1
rows.name:
If you head farther north, you'll find a
waterfall of lava we call Sunset Falls. It's really
beautiful—reminds me of Niagara Falls back
home.

rows.label: TownInfo786_2
rows.name:
East of here is the T'phnom Shelf which
serves as the Growth's front line.
Continue north from there, and you'll be
right at those scumbags' headquarters.

rows.label: TownInfo786_3
rows.name:
Our battle with the Growth draws toward its
conclusion. We're at a huge disadvantage,
but I'm not afraid. We will strike hard, strike
fast, and strike furiously!

rows.label: TownInfo786_4
rows.name:
Have you heard of the jaharmum flower?
It blooms in the magma patches near the
Emerian Battlegrounds. I hope I can show it to
her someday...

rows.label: TownInfo787_1
rows.name:
There are ancient ruins known as the Kw'arah
Cloister at the base of the southern cliffs.
How can you not be intrigued by that?

rows.label: TownInfo787_2
rows.name:
The various ruins scattered throughout
Cauldros seem to belong to an ancient
civilization that perished long before the
Growth took over.

rows.label: TownInfo787_3
rows.name:
Have you seen the alien wreckage near the
M'gando Gorge? I wonder how much it would
benefit NLA if we could recover that?

rows.label: TownInfo787_4
rows.name:
O'rrh Sim Castle and those floating mining
machines were built in completely different
eras. In fact, it's possible that the mining
machines were actually... Oh, never mind...

rows.label: TownInfo787_5
rows.name:
I've seen a huge, ominous shadow over the
peak of Mount M'gando during brimstone
storms. Could that be... No, it couldn't
possibly... Could it?

rows.label: TownInfo788_1
rows.name:
Do you see that big volcano over there?
It's called Mount M'gando, and if you hike up
the trail to its summit, you can go all the way
to the crater. Nature! Gotta love it!

rows.label: TownInfo788_2
rows.name:
When the weather changes to raining down
brimstone, watch out! The properties of some
indigens may change, and new species may
appear.

rows.label: TownInfo788_3
rows.name:
Be careful when traveling near the O'rrh Sim
castle ruins—the Growth have it locked down
tighter than your aunt's purse on Christmas
Eve! ...I do not know what that means.

rows.label: TownInfo788_4
rows.name:
I can't believe the leader of Team Belisarda
was a traitor! There must have been lots of
signs, right? So how could BLADE HQ have
missed them all?

rows.label: TownInfo788_5
rows.name:
Now that the Central Life has been secured,
we'll be able to return to our real bodies.
Although I imagine it won't be easy to say
good-bye to my Blue Blood...

rows.label: TownInfo789_1
rows.name:
If you travel north of here, you'll find the
Emerian Battlegrounds. It's called
"battlegrounds," but it's actually quite a
lush spot—at least by Cauldros standards.

rows.label: TownInfo789_2
rows.name:
The Scholes Battlegrounds are to the west.
It's a deeply scarred land, but there's a
Nopon caravan there, so you can pass
through safely.

rows.label: TownInfo789_3
rows.name:
During the day, you can see a really fast
Seidr near the Growth hangar. The guy
behind the controls must be one of their ace
pilots.

rows.label: TownInfo789_4
rows.name:
In all of Cauldros, this is the area that's richest
in nature. At night, you can spot some really
rare indigens at the local watering holes.
You should take a look some time.

rows.label: TownInfo789_5
rows.name:
I was dive-bombed by bullet flies atop the
cliffs of the Scholes Battlegrounds, and
crashed because of it. Those things are almost
too small to see, but talk about annoying!

rows.label: TownInfo790_1
rows.name:
To the east lies the Great Reef Lake, a pool 
of lava formed when the ground collapsed.
Needless to say, if you fall into that,
you aren't coming out again.

rows.label: TownInfo790_2
rows.name:
We discovered a Lifepod south of Sunset Falls.
We tried to recover it, but the indigens gave
us so much trouble that we had to give up.

rows.label: TownInfo790_3
rows.name:
To reach the Growth headquarters,
pass through the Adder Byroad to the south.
I wish there was another shortcut,
but that's the best we've found so far.

rows.label: TownInfo790_4
rows.name:
We're entrusting the Central Life to all of
you. We'll do everything that we can here,
so please do what you must to make sure
it's secured.

rows.label: TownInfo790_5
rows.name:
There are four caves here in Cauldros,
but we don't have the manpower to survey
them thoroughly, what with Growth loyalists
still causing trouble.

rows.label: TownInfo791_1
rows.name:
There's an area farther south called the Titan's
Table. Heard of it? Anyway, there's another
camp there, so if you're headed for the
Nopon caravan, why not pay it a visit?

rows.label: TownInfo791_2
rows.name:
Our enemy seems to be surveying Mira just as
we BLADEs are. They explore on Dolls that
are stationed over yonder. ...What? Yonder?
Kids don't say "yonder" anymore?

rows.label: TownInfo791_3
rows.name:
Are you putting the research data probes to
use? You can use them to send an area's
visual data to NLA in exchange for cash.
It's the only way I'll be able to afford a Doll.

rows.label: TownInfo791_4
rows.name:
Did you know about the alien reliquary that
was found west of the Scholes Battlegrounds?
It requires a pretty high level of skill to be
properly investigated, if you're up for it.

rows.label: TownInfo791_5
rows.name:
The survey of Cauldros is complete, and I can't
get over what a strange planet Mira is. How
did such different civilizations develop on each
continent of the same world?

rows.label: TownInfo792_1
rows.name:
There's a shimmering pond on the rocky
mountain to the north. Our survey suggests the
water is poisonous to humans, and also found
traces of mining activity in the area.

rows.label: TownInfo792_2
rows.name:
Long ago, a war seems to have been fought
over the resources mined from White
Phosphor Lake. That's why this area still
bears the ravages of battle today.

rows.label: TownInfo792_3
rows.name:
The black Doll went towards the center of the
continent, where the Growth's headquarters
are. Flying there would be perilous, so I
suggest you take an overland route.

rows.label: TownInfo792_4
rows.name:
Why do you think Lao betrayed humanity like
that? He has to have a good reason, right?
Not like that would make it any less of a
tragedy...

rows.label: TownInfo792_5
rows.name:
The Central Life is safe! Now I'll finally be
able to reunite with my friends and family!
It would be so wonderful for us all to have
a meal together again...

rows.label: TownInfo793_1
rows.name:
If you head up this hill, you'll end up in a
meadow known as the Emerian Battlegrounds.
It's even safer over there than it is here,
so feel free to check it out.

rows.label: TownInfo793_2
rows.name:
There are some ruins to the east that include
a golden tower, but be careful if you go
nosing around—it seems the Growth have
set up their headquarters there.

rows.label: TownInfo793_3
rows.name:
We spotted wreckage from the White Whale
west of G'nahan Villa. I can't believe how far
afield that piece fell—the ship must have
completely disintegrated in midair.

rows.label: TownInfo793_4
rows.name:
Some indigens that live in lava hunt by pulling
their prey into the magma. Try to fight those
guys from a distance, unless you want to
become a human briquette.

rows.label: TownInfo793_5
rows.name:
Surveying this continent was among the most
dangerous missions a BLADE could get, and
I'm shocked I lived to see the end of it. Guess
the credit belongs to a certain someone, huh?

rows.label: TownInfo794_1
rows.name:
Don't think you're tough enough to walk
through magma. It's too much heat for even
our enhanced bodies to bear, and I don't
want to think about trying to rescue you!

rows.label: TownInfo794_2
rows.name:
You see those giant mining machines in the
sky? They're what caused the ground around
here to collapse and turned this continent into
the wasteland it's become.

rows.label: TownInfo794_3
rows.name:
There's a cave to the north that's blocked by
a barrier, so there's no way to get inside.
I suspect the Growth are using it as some
sort of base.

rows.label: TownInfo794_4
rows.name:
I just saw a Doll with octopus-like legs pass
through here on its way to the Emerian
Battlegrounds! I can't believe the Growth
still have weapons we haven't seen before...

rows.label: TownInfo794_5
rows.name:
Most of the Definians have been defeated,
right? Good. I heard they caused problems
for a lot of folks in NLA, but at least an
era of peace seems a little closer now.

rows.label: TownInfo795_1
rows.name:
Boxtrap Checkpoint is to the east, and it's
heavily populated with Growth troops.
Beyond that, a mountain trail seems to lead
into the volcano, but we can't be sure.

rows.label: TownInfo795_2
rows.name:
If you climb up the strata to the north, you'll
find the Growth's headquarters. It's heavily
guarded, but forcing your way in seems to be
the only option. I mean, it's their HQ, right?

rows.label: TownInfo795_3
rows.name:
A helicopter crashed near the T'phnom Shelf.
The pilot was maneuvering carefully, but was
suddenly shot down from out of nowhere.
It was our first fatality after arriving on Mira.

rows.label: TownInfo795_4
rows.name:
Have you heard about brambloo shoots?
They say you can harvest them around
Slavebird Isle. They look like inedible tusks
to me, but people sure seem to like them.

rows.label: TownInfo795_5
rows.name:
Have you heard about brambloo shoots?
They say you can harvest them around
Slavebird Isle. They look like inedible tusks
to me, but people sure seem to like them.

rows.label: TownInfo796_1
rows.name:
I saw a weird headless statue at the Bestial
Utopia. I wonder how old it is? We should
take it back to NLA for analysis.

rows.label: TownInfo796_2
rows.name:
If you head north, you'll reach the O'rrh Sim
castle ruins. We've never been able to get
close  because of all the enemies, so if
you go, keep both eyes peeled for trouble.

rows.label: TownInfo796_3
rows.name:
Ever seen what looks like a parked Growth
Doll? Well, some of them actually have pilots
inside. If you look really close, you should be
able to figure out which ones are manned.

rows.label: TownInfo796_4
rows.name:
Head south from here and you'll reach Kitsune
Stronghold—part of the Growth's front line
of defense. It's guarded strongly from the front,
but if you can approach from its flank...

rows.label: TownInfo796_5
rows.name:
The survey of Cauldros is finally finished, and
I've been thinking of going to a different
continent next time. It couldn't be any more
dangerous—or less fun—than this one!

rows.label: TownInfo801_1
rows.name:
It been long time since Nopon come here!
It kind of sticky and make beautiful Nopon
wings feel heavy, but otherwise not so bad!

rows.label: TownInfo801_2
rows.name:
Since when do human friends have camp in
Nightglow Forest? Beloved Nopon caravan no
longer look impressive!

rows.label: TownInfo801_3
rows.name:
All Nopon belong to caravan, so it very rare
to see one traveling by lonesome.
Guess Tatsu kind of weird guy, huh?

rows.label: TownInfo801_4
rows.name:
Remember broken human whirly-twirly machine
in the Divine Roost? Nopon all freak out
over that one!

rows.label: TownInfo801_5
rows.name:
It feel like crazy presence be in Vitriol
Cesspool! Too scared to get good look,
but pretty sure it not of this world.

rows.label: TownInfo802_1
rows.name:
Next time we see forfex near Everwhelm Falls,
smash to death! Then cook! Then eat!

rows.label: TownInfo802_2
rows.name:
Grampypon say Nopon be newcomers to
world. But if true, what about human friends?
They way more newcomery than Nopon!

rows.label: TownInfo802_3
rows.name:
It tradition—every year Nopon pick heropon
and send out on great adventure. Thought of
Tatsu being heropon one day fills eyes with
tears!

rows.label: TownInfo802_4
rows.name:
Friend should not try to climb the
Celestial Ascent. Even if friend have
splendid wings like Nopon, it probably
not possible.

rows.label: TownInfo802_5
rows.name:
Being member of Nopon caravan not make
one member of Commerce Guild. Nopon must
pass intense ordeal to become guild member!

rows.label: TownInfo803_1
rows.name:
This Dodonga Caravan! We be here for while,
so friend can go ahead and take time.

rows.label: TownInfo803_2
rows.name:
Drongo Caravan is in Cauldros. Friend can
scamper onto continent from western shore,
so best bet is to swim.

rows.label: TownInfo803_3
rows.name:
Friend can reach Cauldros from northwest
shore, too! But many Growth there,
so it not really such hot idea.

rows.label: TownInfo803_4
rows.name:
Friend should be careful in Dead Man's Gulch.
If leader be on foot and not in Doll,
they get gobbled right up!

rows.label: TownInfo803_5
rows.name:
Has friend met Ruler of Fates? He very
rude—like we Nopon too beneath him to even
look at! But maybe good thing, since he 
probably eat us for snack...

rows.label: TownInfo804_1
rows.name:
Did Wanderer Bobora get to Drongo
Caravan safely? Everyone say there lots
of scary things that way.

rows.label: TownInfo811_1
rows.name:
This Dorian Caravan, led by bosspon Mujiji.
If friend want to rest here for night,
friend must pay tiny sum of 50,000 credits.
So reasonable! Such deals!

rows.label: TownInfo811_2
rows.name:
Watch out for heat wave! It make melee
attacks be super useless like old noodle!
...Price for information 100,000 credits.

rows.label: TownInfo811_3
rows.name:
Friend can pick lots of myuena cactus near
Big Arch! ...Price for info 150,000 credits.

rows.label: TownInfo811_4
rows.name:
Human friends abandoned machine in south
part of Lake Basel. Stop leaving trash near
Nopon territory!

rows.label: TownInfo811_5
rows.name:
Once, sabula swallow friendpon whole. But
sabula also poop him out whole, so everything
come out all right in end. Hee hee! Get it?
...Price for joke 200,000 credits.

rows.label: TownInfo812_1
rows.name:
Bias are scary! If Nopon not kiss butts
all day, they get mad and eat us.
One day Nopon eat THEM for revenge!

rows.label: TownInfo812_2
rows.name:
Marnuck scary too. And smart! While ago,
friendpon try lying to one, but Marnuck see
right through it. Pluck out every last hair of
friendpon as punishment.

rows.label: TownInfo812_3
rows.name:
Nighttime is when cetos come out here.
They swallow you whole like grape!

rows.label: TownInfo812_4
rows.name:
Milsaadi really creepy! They hide in shadow
and glare at Nopon all day. And women
always grinning scary grins.

rows.label: TownInfo812_5
rows.name:
Human friends much better than Growth.
They not scary, they very easy to cheat,
and they buy anything. Hopefully Nopon
and humans stay friends forever!

rows.label: TownInfo813_1
rows.name:
It sure would be nice to visit floating island in
southern sky. There likely treasure everywhere!

rows.label: TownInfo813_2
rows.name:
Growth and human friends both run south 
in big hurry. Are they chasing treasure?
Nopon should have brought Dorian Caravan
down that way if so...

rows.label: TownInfo813_3
rows.name:
Did something important to human friends get
broken? That very sad for them. But not sad
enough to get Nopon down!

rows.label: TownInfo813_4
rows.name:
Did friend see big mountain-sized machine
in Sylvalum? It so big, we saw it from here!
Shame it got destroyed before bosspon had
chance to do anything.

rows.label: TownInfo813_5
rows.name:
Rumor has it Earth friends turning back into
real humans soon! So...what exactly that like?
Will they be handsome like Nopon?

rows.label: TownInfo821_1
rows.name:
Nopon friend saw Growth machine in
Hardheart Canyon that look different from
usual Growth machine. Hopefully they not
come this way...

rows.label: TownInfo821_2
rows.name:
Lots of Nopon leave caravan lately to search 
for new business opportunity in NLA!
It lonely with everyone gone...

rows.label: TownInfo821_3
rows.name:
Alien girl walk alone toward cave in southern
Delusian Mountain. Friendpons think about
stopping her, but it too late. She probably
okay, right?

rows.label: TownInfo821_4
rows.name:
Celica so nice! She bring gift as thanks for
showing way to Behemoth's Shadows! Nopon
always happy to help if it mean presents.

rows.label: TownInfo821_5
rows.name:
BLADE friends getting very lazy lately.
Just cause survey over, they think they can
relax all day. They need to learn lesson in
trying hard from Celica!

rows.label: TownInfo822_1
rows.name:
Human friend. So rare. So awesome.
...So scary! You go to Cauldros right now!
Go north, scary friend!

rows.label: TownInfo822_2
rows.name:
Lately Nopon get used to having human
friends around. BLADE humans die all the time,
so how scary can they be? Growth much
scarier in personal opinion.

rows.label: TownInfo822_3
rows.name:
Friend knows big turned-to-stone tree in
South Silent Sandsea? Nopon could make
tons of money selling it to humans!

rows.label: TownInfo822_4
rows.name:
Friendpon bought a keppo carrot from
legendary merchants. It quite special—shine
look completely different from all other keppo
carrot!

rows.label: TownInfo822_5
rows.name:
Clothes sold by Nana seem out of style for
NLA. She need newer stock!

rows.label: TownInfo823_1
rows.name:
Growth built bases in north and south part
of continent. Nopon here first, but did
Growth ask permissions? NO! Can friend
believe that?

rows.label: TownInfo823_2
rows.name:
Friendpon see arenatect in northeast
Lake Ciel. It suddenly start moving and
scare wits from poor friendpon!

rows.label: TownInfo823_3
rows.name:
Lake Ciel so big! That why we merchants all
rest our nopopotamus at shore near South
Sandsea. Friend should go pay visit sometime.

rows.label: TownInfo823_4
rows.name:
Both legendary merchants are here!
It so exciting. We all wish to be great Nopon
like them one day...

rows.label: TownInfo823_5
rows.name:
Does friend know about cave in cliffs behind
here? Want to explore, but it too high to
reach. Not fair!

rows.label: TownInfo824_1
rows.name:
Planet sure has gotten exciting lately!
Sure, risk of untimely death up,
but so are sales forecasts.

rows.label: TownInfo824_2
rows.name:
Friendpon saw nice big turned-to-stone tree
southwest of Lake Ciel, but had too much
cargo to haul it away. Maybe next time.

rows.label: TownInfo824_3
rows.name:
Nopon Commerce Guild has started dealing in
human weapons. Now Nopon spend all day
making them in tents!

rows.label: TownInfo824_4
rows.name:
Ra-ta-ta Series must be best of Nopon
Commerce Guild weapons. You can tell
they be strong just from name!

rows.label: TownInfo824_5
rows.name:
Has friend been using Nopon Commerce Guild
weapons in battle? New products not moving
so much lately. Are BLADEs all too strong
now? Too good for Nopon weaponry? Meh!

rows.label: TownInfo825_1
rows.name:
Welcome to Dopang Caravan! This is oasis
for heart and mind, so relax and enjoy!

rows.label: TownInfo825_2
rows.name:
Friend should stay off Sylvalum Searoad east
of Delusian Mountains. All but most highly
trained master of Nopon martial arts are in
for serious beating!

rows.label: TownInfo825_3
rows.name:
Friend can't climb Delusian Mountains from
here. But if friend goes north, friend can climb
up from west slope.

rows.label: TownInfo825_4
rows.name:
Friendpon found ruins of Growth Doll at
East Ciel Sandsea. As he laugh at
misfortune, Marnuck emerge from inside!
So awkward...er, for friendpon...

rows.label: TownInfo825_5
rows.name:
Can friends all fly? If so, there be all sorts of
places to go—places where no Nopon ever
sets foot! Friends are too lucky...

rows.label: TownInfo826_1
rows.name:
Wanderer Bobora has returned to Valley of Oblivion.
He was all excited, saying "it surely at
Beehive Rock!" ...Whatever that mean.

rows.label: TownInfo827_1
rows.name:
Oh, that right—Bobora went toward
northwest mountains. Maybe Bobora
witness what happen to Kuta.

rows.label: TownInfo831_1
rows.name:
Wow! Nopon not get many customers
here besides Growth! Welcome to
Drongo Caravan!

rows.label: TownInfo831_2
rows.name:
One of friends' whirly-twirly machines
crashed near Sunset Falls.
It not smart to fly around here!

rows.label: TownInfo831_3
rows.name:
Before Growth come, mining machines were
Nopon playland, but mean Growth take
them from us! Maybe human friends steal
them back so Nopon can play again?

rows.label: TownInfo831_4
rows.name:
Human friends need way to fly in order to 
reach Slavebird Isle. How sad friends not
have lovely wings like Nopon!

rows.label: TownInfo831_5
rows.name:
Human friends are done surveying Cauldros,
yes? But then why Growth still around?
Shouldn't friends continue survey until every
stinky Growth is dead?

rows.label: TownInfo832_1
rows.name:
Cauldros is full of lava, giving it unique but
harsh ecosystem! ...Nopon here are same
as everywhere else, though.

rows.label: TownInfo832_2
rows.name:
Friend can reach Cauldros from eastern shore
too! Maybe then friend can reach new areas?
If tip prove useful, remember to pay back
huge reward!

rows.label: TownInfo832_3
rows.name:
Friend can reach Cauldros from eastern shore
too! Maybe then friend can reach new areas?
If tip prove useful, remember to pay back
huge reward!

rows.label: TownInfo832_4
rows.name:
This top-secret information! There is Growth
supply crate over at Ternion Fork.
Friend should sneak back later to steal it!

rows.label: TownInfo832_5
rows.name:
There are two caves near Mount M'gando,
but most Nopon are cowards who not go
to such dangerous places.

rows.label: TownInfo833_1
rows.name:
Nopon must exist with Growth if we want
to keep living here. But that not mean we
hate our human friends!

rows.label: TownInfo833_2
rows.name:
Human friends that come here have look on
faces like they about to die. But it not so bad
once friends learn to get along with Growth!

rows.label: TownInfo833_3
rows.name:
Friend see that weird statue south of Forgotten
Mining Frigates? It was broken even before
Nopon get here, so stop blaming!

rows.label: TownInfo833_4
rows.name:
Black Doll go into Growth main base!
Before that, large thing that look like turtle fly
out from main base. Maybe they holding some
sort of festival?

rows.label: TownInfo833_5
TownInfo834_1
rows.name:
Does friend know if Wanderer Bobora
find what he search for? He said he go back
to Sylvalum one more time, so maybe not.

rows.label: TownInfo828_1
rows.name:
Big, strange turned-to-stone tree exist just south
of here. It full of treasure, right? It has to be!
Nopon should load up nopopotamus and
claim it!

rows.label: TownInfo383_1
rows.name:
I hear there's wreckage from a Growth war
machine in the residential district. Apparently
it crashed while trying to land during the
invasion. Want to go check it out?

rows.label: TownInfo786_5
rows.name:
I heard we've found signs of a Lifepod on the
Emerian Battlegrounds. Wouldn't it be great if
we recovered another crew member? We need
to get over there and check it out right away!

rows.label: TownInfo382_1
rows.name:
I saw that Larsian, Gi Zang, near the
maintenance center. He said he was preparing
for some sort of warrior's training pilgrimage,
so I just got out of his way.

rows.label: TownInfo530_1
rows.name:
I left some supplies near the probe placement
site in segment 314 on the FrontierNet maps.
If you ever run into trouble, feel free to use
them.

rows.label: TownInfo531_1
rows.name:
We were quick to rebuild after the invasion,
but wreckage from the battle remains. It seems
no one has bothered to clean up the debris
that crashed on the top of this crane yet.

rows.label: TownInfo722_5
rows.name:
I still can't believe that I lost my Doll in that
spore filiavent attack at the Ensanguined Font!
I really should go try to salvage what I can
from the wreckage one of these days...

rows.label: TownInfo900_1
rows.name:
Our mothership has been totally
revamped, hasn't it? You Earth aliens
are so so so full of surprises!

rows.label: TownInfo901_1
rows.name:
The raiding party will be heading out
in Dolls. Make sure you're ready for it!
